Reviews.Title: “Five Star Hotel which warrants its' rating.”
Reviews.Author: 186338Samuel
Reviews.Content: I,had my second stay,for one week,in April,2012. The room was immaculate,toiletries are first class,minibar well stocked and re-filled daily,without prompting. The full breakfast was priced at 19.50 euros,a more sensible price than the usual price of 25 euros. A side plate for bread would be appreciated. Clearing,the tables quicker,is a must. Staff,I must give 10/10,to are Ellen,in reception, Fermina in the bar/restaurant and Patrick an excellent concierge.The Wellness Centre is wonderful and the staff are excellent. Little things,like a mirror above desks and electric sockets near the main mirror are helpful if added. The stains on the sink cover,needs attention. Clients should take more care where they put glasses and cups,down!!! I, will return in July,2012 and this hotel is definitely worth staying in.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location!!”
Reviews.Author: holly n
Reviews.Content: This hotel was beautiful, the lobby was great, and so were the rooms - very modern and updated. The concierge was great they gave us awesome recommendations for restaurants that were not too touristy...dont spend the money on the breakfast go out in the city and try the food...great hotel!

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel, Great Location, Unique”
Reviews.Author: Ashridge
Reviews.Content: Real character with a great room (Deluxe, second floor), clean, great shower and bath, functional and a great place to stay and good location. Great Hotel with interesting architecture and decor. It would be great to have in the room a book with photos on the history of the hotel. This should include the conversion of the building to a hotel, as the orginal infrastructure and features are clearly visable. Friendly staff, good if not large spa (thankfully with a policy of no children after 18:00) and a decent breakfast menu. The only suggested improvement is the service at breakfast. In most other five star hotels, you are asked for tea or coffee when you are sitting at the table. Here you either have to ask, or serve yourself and have a waitress run over and insist on pouring the tea or coffee (you then convey the pot back to your table). The staff are very welcoming when you arrive, but a little slow at clearing tables, and will not necessarily clear items off your table once finished with, preferring to wait until you have left (and then at their own leisure, so you could be sitting next to a table of dirty plates and glasses if the other guests depart whilst your eating). To be fair, our stay could have coincided with staff being absent - but it was over four days. Despite this would stay again and would recommend others stay. Great mini-bar and expresso - this was all free on our stay.

Reviews.Title: “wonderful stay”
Reviews.Author: fj2012
Reviews.Content: The hotel had a lot of character and history. I had requested a four poster bed which was not available but instead we were upgraded free to a Junior suite. The room was luxurious and massive with high ceilings and large windows overlooking the city. The curtains were remote controlled with the only flaw of occassionally opening/ closing ?from neighbouring rooms. The beds were v comfortable but are 2 twin beds together rather than one. The free mini bar included a variety of drinks and snacks with were replaced daily. The pool/ spa facilities were peaceful.

Reviews.Title: “Hotel Amrath Amsterdam”
Reviews.Author: Julie M Posted by an Easytobook.com traveler
Reviews.Content: Had a lovely stay at the Grand Hotel Amrath,great location and easy walk to most attractions. Room was lovely and spacious. Was an expensive stay for us but you get what you pay for. Would reccommened this hotel to anyone.

Reviews.Title: “Fabulous place in Amsterdam”
Reviews.Author: Gosling
Reviews.Content: First time in Amsterdam and we are really glad to have chosen the Amarth. Fabulous location, near evrything, huge room, very clean with espresso maching, mini bar and nice pool. Staff extremely friendly and helpful. Recommended a great restaurant. A very classy place with tons of history. Completely enjoyed ourselves. Visit there when next in Amsterdam. Regards, MikeR

Reviews.Title: “Amazing Staff, Quiet Comfortable Stay”
Reviews.Author: ginnifers
Reviews.Content: Parents and I have had a comfortable 3-nights stay there. The hotel is away from the city centre, but still close to it - less than 10 mins walk from the Centraal station. The staff was amazingly friendly and helpful. They will provide you with free city map, post your postcards for you (postage charged to your room), book tours for you, and they are very keen and efficient in fixing problems. The facility in the room was superb: mini bar, bath robe, slippers, hair-dryer, good quality toiletries, Nespresso. There is a gym and spa and swimming pool as well, but we didn't use them, so cannot comment of it. The only thing that keep me from giving a full mark was that I thought the deco of the hotel (communal areas) can be updated. It's a shame that its interior doesn't match with the grandness of its exterior. But that's just me being very criticising! I will definitely recommend this hotel to my friends.

Reviews.Title: “Third Excellent stay”
Reviews.Author: redbridgej
Reviews.Content: I returned to the Amrath in March for 7 nightsfor my 3rd visit in a year, as usual the room was excellent and clean, the Mini-Bar and Coffee Machine were an added bonus along with the fabulous Bathroom, well stocked with toiletries. The Bar is a wonderful place for Coffee and Cake, the cheescake devine all served inpeccably by courteous efficient staff. The whole experience was relaxing and enjoyable, made better by a daily replenishing of the Mini-Bar, a well cleaned room and he fast free Wi-Fi. I can thorougly recommend this Hotel, all the staff are friendly and will assist in all requests. I have just booked a further stay for August. I have a friend who has just returned from a stay and informs me that the Breakfast is now below the 20 euro physcological price and that it is a most delightful way to start the day.

Reviews.Title: “Good service, but not so sure if it's for families.”
Reviews.Author: Mum_of_lill_rascals
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Grand Amrath over the Easter weekend this year (3 nights). We were travelling with our 2 young kids - 4 and 2 years old. Firstly, we took the junior suite. It was a big room and could fit in 2 extra single beds. That's a plus. But the bathroom was really small for a suite! There were no special amenities for the kids and breakfast is not included. If you book the night before, then you pay â‚¬19.50 for adults and â‚¬10 but if you don't then it's â‚¬25 and â‚¬12 on the morning. However, the minibar if free and this was helpful for us as we got our drinks to take along and the kids had juice etc... Upon arrival, the room was very clean but when housekeeping was suppose to clean the room, we found they did a shoddy job! My little one had chocolate finger-marks on his bedding and this was not changed. They left a couple of used towels on the room floor. The beds were not very well made and all in all the room lacked a freshly clean feel. this may sound fussy for some, but I was paying a full price for a suite! Yet, i didn't complain because i felt the service was really warm and welcoming. The staff are very helpful, the front desk, restaurant and concierge. The food at the hotel is superb! The hotel is in an excellent location and there are little places to eat nearby and to take the canal cruise etc. The deco is very Macintosh/Art Nouveau. You could feel like you stepped out of a 1920's Stephen King Horror film or if you're more optimistic then a Agatha Christie's Novel! I like a different look but found this hotel a bit too dark and faded. It's for the adventurous and those who like it a bit different! i would recommend the hotel, but for couples and groups of friends, rather than families with young children.

Reviews.Title: “4th visit and still great”
Reviews.Author: iris444
Reviews.Content: Stayed in double room on 4th floor facing the canal in March for 4 nights. Reception was friendly and no hassle.All our room requests was taken on board.There were lovely large flower arrangements throughout d ground floor during our stay. The room curtains did opened daily by itself at 0800hrs. We just shut them again with a press of the control and had a lie in.Might be annoying to other guests.Bed was large and comfortable.Everything was clean. We did not eat in as there were so many choices nearby. Oosterpark was only a 30mins walk via Waterlooplein.We had warm freaky weather and walked all over with plenty of cake n coffee stops. Took a half day trip (got up late) to Zaanse Schans by bus and definitely will return again as so much to see and do around this area.The restaurants and cafes in Zaandam across the bridge are quite reasonable compared to Amsterdam

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic”
Reviews.Author: lezconnecting
Reviews.Content: Its been a while since i went but this hotel deserves a review. We went for 4 nights, in feb a couple of years ago,i just never got round to writing a review. This hotel is fab. It is a master peice of art deco architecture. The room we had was great with a fantastic bathroom, and one of the best beds ive ever slept in. Full marks for this interesting hotel. I dont think we will be going again though as the prices seem to have trebled since we went.

Reviews.Title: “AG & MG's Review”
Reviews.Author: Agpower Posted by an Easytobook.com traveler
Reviews.Content: Reception Staff not all that good a little too pushy & clever at times. Bar & Restaurant Staff where 1st Class & gave good & helpful service, the restaurant food was excellent also. We had a city view room & I was glad we paid that little bit extra & did not end up on the noisy main road side. All in all we enjoyed our stay, but found it difficult to accept the Hotel was supposed to be 5 Star mixed with the old shipping theme. Found the lobby area a bit drab & nowhere really to sit & relax comfortably in this area apart from the Bar. Our room was also not 5 Star Quality & run down somewhat. Watch out for the Taxi Drivers that tried it on taking us the long way round the city on two occasions, check your city map.

Reviews.Title: “Annmarie, Northwich, Cheshire”
Reviews.Author: ANNMARIE J
Reviews.Content: We had an amazing time staying at the Grand Amrath in Amsterdam, me and my husband went for 3 nights, we arrived at 11 am and were taken straight to our rooms. My husband selected this hotel due to various reasons:- location, room, mini bar. The hotel was very luxurious and the bathroom was immaculate. We would definately stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent hotel- amazing value and beautiful location!”
Reviews.Author: Jessbeany
Reviews.Content: I had a brilliant time at the Grand Amrath hotel..My boyfriend and I went for to Amsterdam for 3 days, we selected this hotel for a few reasons: -It was excellent value for money. - It is close to the Centraal station which was important as we were travelling from Schipol airport to Amsterdam by train. -It has a well stocked, free mini bar. When we got there, we were shown our room- it was very luxorious, huge room with a very spacious bathroom and bathrooms/slippers for guests to use. The ceilings of the room were very high, so high infact that we had a remote control to open and shut the curtains! The room was extremely comfy, clean and the maids tidied up for us every day. The staff were very helpful and courteous. This kind of hotel is usually out of my price range so it was amazing to have a 5 star experience. I would love to return to this hotel, I cannot recommend it highly enough- the building itself is beautiful as well :)

Reviews.Title: “Excellent”
Reviews.Author: Kinlondon
Reviews.Content: Upsides: location, 5 mins to centraal stn and bars/restaurants on Zeedijk. Free mini-bar stocked with branded gin, vodka, whiskey, brandy, nuts and chocolate. Comfy beds but pillows too soft for us. large rooms with high ceilings, large bathroom with a bath big enough for two and powerful shower. Clean small pool area, good sauna. Many food options nearby but had room service once which was ok. Hotel encourages feedback and there is a strong emphasis on good service. Downsides: gym is is desperate need of updating, machinery is old and limited. For example, bike is missing straps on the pedals and the belt on the running machine slips. Machines need to be replaced and extra free-weights should be provided (smaller weights 1kg, 2kg 5kg etc). Charge for room service is E7.50 which almost doubled the cost of the salad I ordered.

Reviews.Title: “Lives up to the Reviews”
Reviews.Author: inecekvar
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Amrath for 5 nights. I chose this hotel because of the location, the free internet, the free minibar, and got a great rate through Hotels.com. The location was exceptional, a few minutes walk to the Centraal Station. A little too far to walk with luggage though. I walked all over from the hotel and only on the last two days started taking the trams. The free wi fi was excellent, never lost signal. and the free minibar was, yes, really free and it was replenished daily. 2 small coke bottles; 2 coke lite; 2 sprite, 2 tonic waters, 2 waters, 2 orange juices. Beer, as well as 1 each small bottle of gin, scotch, vodka, whiskey, cognac, and wine. Plus 2 snacks. Not bad for being free. One of the few 5 star hotels to offer free internet and free minibar. My room had a huge floor to ceiling window but no view other than a wall with windows. Didn't realise I had a reservation with no view so if you want a view of the canal make sure to pay for the room with a view. The single room itself was on the small side but it wasn't the size that was the problem. My room layout wasn't very well-designed. The corner where the desk is is not big enough for the desk and chair. There was hardly room to pull the chair out and then it hit the closet. The bed was the star of the room, it was without doubt the most comfortable bed I've slept in. The mattress together with the pillows and comforter make this a true 5 star sleeping experience. The staff was all-around helpful with good attitudes especially the concierges. Had an excellent massage by Jose in the wellness spa. The only glitches I encountered were mostly having to do with housekeeping and the bathroom. On one occasion they forgot to empty the trash. Another time they forgot to replenish some of the amenities in the bathroom. Another day I left at 9 A.m. and returned at 3:30 to find the room not cleaned yet. The shower/tub has a 3-piece glass panel that you close to take a shower. I don't knoow if it was my particular room, but the third panel kept closing during the shower and I finally had to jam a face cloth between the bottom of the panel and the top of the tub to keep it from moving. Also, the drain is directly below the shower and where you would stand and unless you are very aware of this you keep stepping on it and before you know it you're standing n a couple of inches of water. The lighting above the sink is poor also. I tried the buffet breakfast onemorning even though it was expensive. It was advertised as 25 euros but I was only charged 19.50 but still it's not worth it for the money. All in all an excellent hotel. I would stay here again if I get the rate I got this time of less than 200 euros. I would not pay over 400 euros a night that I have seen advertised at certain times. I didn't encounter the problem a lot of reviewers had with the automatic curtains opening or closing on their own. The property is very well maintained and it has a comfortable atmosphere.

Reviews.Title: “I felt Grand!”
Reviews.Author: Erue
Reviews.Content: What can I say besides if I could I would book this hotel again & again. The staff was friendly, knowledgeable and helpful. The room was modern, exceptionally clean, great views with opening window, plush pillows & bed! Lastly, this hotel is in a great location & just a stones throw away from Central train station. Enjoy your stay, I sure did!

Reviews.Title: “What a spectacular hotel!”
Reviews.Author: lanago2
Reviews.Content: It is hard to overstate how fabulous this property is. If you either have the money you want to spend on a great hotel overlooking a canal with some of the best service you will ever encounter, or if you happen to get the steal of a lifetime and get this property "blind" on Priceline, it is fantastic. I was so fortunate to get this hotel for 4 nights on Priceline for a wonderful price. Upon check in, I was upgraded to a junior suite, Room 203. 5 enormous windows overlooking a quite canal. Room with sofe, chair, desk, internet. The location is near the station (Centraal) and away from the noise. Free mininbar restocked daily--from wine, champagne and chocolates, waters, juice. Dangerous! Interesting bathroom configuration: separate toilet and sink on one end of the room, on the other end: big soaking tub, shower, double sinks in another room. Slippers and robes provided. Free internet in your room. With PL, breakfast isn't included. It's 25 euros, but they will give it to you for 19. I was always up too late (drinking champagne, eating chocolate and writing) so I didn't get to breakfast. The bar is small and there were a few people there. It didn't draw me in, but others seemed to enjoy it. The service is divine. Helpful at all turns. Concierge named Aco. Annarose(?) at the front desk along with the others--literally. I regretted having to check out. Every person who worked there was delightful. Such a unique experience.This defines 5 star hotels. The furnishings are older, but very comfortable. Unique architecture. Look up in the lobby---stained glass to the sky. Hand wrought iron deatilas throughout. I didn't use the indoor pool, but it is included, along with a small gym. Massage available for 66e hourly. 4 fantastic nights.

Reviews.Title: “Long weekend Stay in March”
Reviews.Author: Happy-Bod-Normally
Reviews.Content: Nice hotel and good location. We would go back. Rooms are a good size, and the beds are very comfortable; the free mini-bar may have helped. Room safe a good play to stash anything you do not drink the night before. :-)

Reviews.Title: “Best Hotel in Amsterdam”
Reviews.Author: Ken S
Reviews.Content: We stayed in the hotel for 3 nights in February and the building is very impressive, the rooms spacious and comfortable and the staff very helpful and courteous. Room service was of a high standard and the coffee machine and free mini bar were particular highlights. During our stay we suffered a medical emergency and the hotel and all of the staff were incredibly kind and helpful and provided a great source of comfort. I would wholly recommend this hotel to anybody visting Amsterdam.

Reviews.Title: “Anniversary trip”
Reviews.Author: Brian M
Reviews.Content: This hotel was a wonderful choice for us..a short walk to the Central Station and yet removed from very busy traffic, etc. We are walkers and found it easy to navigate into the old section or just stroll along the canals. We received an nice room upgrade on the canal side. The hotel staff is so friendly and welcoming. While there isn't a grand lobby, the hotel has wonderful architectural features from its prior life as a shipping company office building. It is a very unique hotel and absolutely worth 5 stars! Will stay there again...

Reviews.Title: “A great place to stay”
Reviews.Author: Angela S
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the hotel for 3 nights from the 23rd March, 2012. As a single traveller I found the room to be very spacious, in fact a great deal larger than most single rooms. The up-to-date expresso machine and plentyfull supply of coffee etc was welcome, in fact everything was provided, even down to a brolly for the rain. The bed was clean and comfy, as was the rest of the hotel. All the staff were helpful and friendly and the location was first rate, being only a 5 min walk from the station and a 10 min walk from most of the major sights, yet it was quiet and peaceful in the room. I would certainly recommend this hotel for any length of stay in Amsterdam and would not hesitate to stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Fascinating accomodation”
Reviews.Author: putnica12
Reviews.Content: Beautiful hotel in the fascinating old building, almost 100 years old. It was previously â€˜The shipping houseâ€™: the main headquarters of various shipping companies in Amsterdam and luckily there was an investor who has retained charms of this treasure and turned it into a luxury hotel, preserving the beauty of antique interiors and exteriors. If you enjoy modern hotels (which all look alike), then this is not the place for you! The hotel is in an excellent location, a few hundred meters from the Central train station, but close to the city center so several sights can be reached on foot. We booked a hotel through booking.com, where we had gotten 4 nights in Superior Deluxe room on a special discount. And as hotel management had found out that my husband and I are visiting Amsterdam on a special occasion, they gave us complimentary upgrade to a such room overlooking the canal and city, and that was a very nice surprise. Apart from the spacious bathroom with separate shower and a bath, there was really comfortable king-size bed. The room ceiling is quite high and dark curtains are electronically controlled. We had complimentary Nespresso coffee machine and well stocked mini-bar, which were both replenished daily. A wireless Internet is free of charge and usually fast, but slower when it is used by a larger number of guests. Buffet breakfast is really expensive, so if you usually donâ€™t eat your breakfast early in the morning, than supplied Nespresso and a beverage (like orange juice), might be sufficient to start a new, beautiful day in Amsterdam. There are always 1 or 2 concierges near entrance, who are extremely friendly and expeditious and will help you with all possible bookings and reservations. The other staff is also kind and strives to be not intrusive, but takes care that one doesnâ€™t miss anything. Our recommendations!

Reviews.AuthorLocation: East Northport, New York, United States
Reviews.Title: “Second stay in less than 6 months...”
Reviews.Author: Erinn B
Reviews.Content: Once again, the Grand Amrath was one of the top reasons our second stay in the lovely city of Amsterdam was such a wonderful experience. From the staff who was accommodating, professional with a personal touch to the spectacular room (by European standards), I cannot think of anywhere else I would like to be. We could have easily gone somewhere else for our trip but had such a fantastic and satisfying stay at the Amrath that we decided to go back and we are truly glad we did. One really nice thing is the hotel staff enabled us to get the same room, after they upgraded us, that we had in our prior visit which I requested. Our next stay we may try another room but after our second stay I wouldn't care where they put us, this hotel is that good. I recommend this hotel to anyone, you can't go wrong and other hotels would benefit greatly if they follow the Grand Amraths style.

Reviews.Title: “Exquisite!”
Reviews.Author: Lori P
Reviews.Content: Lovely hotel. Much bigger rooms and bathrooms than most European hotels. Located very close to train station and canal tours. Beautiful architecture and woodwork. I would definitely stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful converted gothic offices.”
Reviews.Author: lnstphns
Reviews.Content: Bedrooms are a great size, as are the bathrooms. Beds are lovely and comfy, as are the pillows. Superbly decorated throughout. Gym and Spa are great. The pool is a fantastic size, and there are three saunas. :) The location is excellent, walking distance to city centre and Centraal station. Great price on expedia. Highly recommended

Reviews.Title: “A great hotel in a good location”
Reviews.Author: Fallops
Reviews.Content: We booked four nights at this hotel in late Feb and paid about Â£100 per night. For a hotel in Amsterdam this was outstanding value for money! This is a genuine 5* hotel, with large, clean and comfortable rooms that have good facilities, large TV's, coffee machines etc. The hotel itself is a gorgeous art-deco building as you can see from some of the photos. The location is great, a five minute walk from the railway startion, near to tram stops but close enough to walk to most tourist attractions. It is worth noting that to get to many of the tourist stops the quickest walk takes you across three streets of the red light district, however to be honest it was so amusing that it actually added to the experience!! The red light district is not particularly seedy or intimidating as you might think. The staff all spoke great English and were always happy to help with our requests such as booking a table at a nearby restaurant or finding a vase for some tulips we have bought for our room! The leisure facilities are good with a pool, sauna etc and small cardio room that are all clean and tidy. Each room has a free mini bar, re-stocked every day which was great and good quality wi-fi. The only thing we didn't try was the restaurant as there were so many others nearby so we couldn't comment on that. We wouldn't hesitate to stay here again should we return to Amsterdam.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent medieval hotel”
Reviews.Author: Naguizz
Reviews.Content: It is by far the best hotel i have ever stayed in, we got a good deal through booking.com , and we stayed there 4 nights, the location is great next to the central station And 5 minutes away from the tram. It was freezing cold in amsterdam when we were there, but hotel temperature was ideal, we were away from all the noise on the street, and the hotel was on a highway and there was noise outside The nespresso machine is a treat when you wake up in the morning to have one very tasty cup of nespresso,what also helps the hotel's cause is the fact that you get a free mini bar, refilled daily and there is all sorts of stuff there. The hotel might be pricey but i tell you that it is worthwhile, it might be boring in terms of restaurants and bars , but it is never something i look for in a hotel, when you are in Amsterdam there are plenty of places to stay out, and who would wanna stay inside the hotel in the coolest city in Europe. I highly recommend this hotel if you wanna add a touch of luxury to your Amsterdam trip..

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic place to stay”
Reviews.Author: petrichor2011
Reviews.Content: Brilliant place to stay.The entrance doesnt do the place justice. But look from the outside and you know this place is unique.basement has gym, swimming pool, steam room, and the rest to boot. Which you find out is popular when you see the amount of people walking around in dressing gowns, through out the hotel. Rooms. stunning, and the height, excels itself, the remote control for the curtains is needed. The bar is, friendly, inviting. and overlooks the canals. The staff, were brilliant, with directions, and taking care of us in the freezing winter weather. All this and then they throw in a free mini bar. which at first you think. might just be one or two drinks.....this thing was full. infact. its a shame that amsterdam is an amazing, beautiful city. As could quite easily have spent days just in the hotel. Brilliant location 5 mins, from central station.righ on the canals, close to shops.great palces to eat. make sure you get a good look at the stairwell.roof

Reviews.Title: “Our short break”
Reviews.Author: Andrew_House_Cumbria
Reviews.Content: We were looking for a short break in Amsterdam to celebrate our 36th wedding anniversary and 60th birthday's. What a great find. The hotel was terrific, the staff were friendly and helpful, the room was spacious and immaculate and the leisure facilities were very good indeed. We were intrigued by the idea of a 'free bar' in the room and sure enough it was this is a really nice bonus and being able to have a drink before going out in the evening was a novel experience, we normally would not consider taking a drink from the bar in a hotel room!

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful Quiet Hotel”
Reviews.Author: joanne d
Reviews.Content: I stayed here with my boyfriend for 3 nights at the end of Febuary 2012 and fell in love with this hotel,it really is a beautiful Hotel with large rooms.free mini bar staff great leave you to get on and enjoy your stay but will be there to help if needed. just a five min walk from Central station and ten mins from all the main places in Amsterdam. if i was going back to Amsterdam i wouldnt stay anywhere else,check all websites for great deals on this hotel as you will find some fantastic offers.

Reviews.Title: “Amazing Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Ari K
Reviews.Content: My wife and i chose this hotel because well it was a 5 star and we got an insane deal some sort of flash sale online....i would have paid at least double for the experience that we had. we opted to have the hotels taxi service to pick us up.. they were extremely professional and very helpful in every way. also the car was a stretch s class mercedes with fresh fruit and refreshments inside for us we paid 140 euro for round trip airport transfer WORTH IT! we arrived in hote and ill admit this was the one disappointing moment. it was my fault in my head i figured i would get upgraded and it didnt pan out. we stayed in a supreme delux city view. room was amazing like 18 foot ceilings the bed was so so so comfortable everything was so clean. the shower didnt have a door that was very stupid as water got everywhere.. the open shower seemed like they were trying to hard but it was fine. the free mini bar was amazing its exactly what it sounds like free drinks alcoholoic and non alcoholic drinks for free!!!!! refilled EVERYDAY. The staff was so so helpful and sweet they took care of my every need and was always there for us. they were chilled and relax but always acting professionally. you cant beat the location PERIOD. no questions asked you must stay in this hotel. i should say i usually am hard to please but i simply just fell in love with the place.

Reviews.Title: “5 day stay in March 2012”
Reviews.Author: HardworkerEastCoast
Reviews.Content: Our family of 4 stayed in 2 rooms for 5 days in March, 2012 at the Grand Amrath. Very pleased-grand room with 30 foot high ceiling, updated furnishings, beautiful bath. The bed was really comfortable and the shower was terrific.Minibar is stocked every day and contents including wine, beer, soft drinks and snacks are free! Nice sauna and hot tub in basement. Beefs: As noted in other reviews, the motorized drapes may spontaneously open in the middle of the night due to picking up remote signals from other rooms! Also room was not ready at check in time, a real problem when we arrived exhausted from overnight flight. Also strange lack of hand towels. Location is about 3 blocks from Central Station, but still a nice residential area too. Overall, a great hotel and would definitely recommend.

Reviews.Title: “Charming”
Reviews.Author: TSOslo
Reviews.Content: What a charming hotel. Great location. Free minibar! will be back. Crazy price for breakfast though..

Reviews.Title: “great hotel”
Reviews.Author: ashley s
Reviews.Content: Stayed here lasy year in august, we were given a free upgrade to a deluxe room.We loved this hotel.Free mini bar was very good and restocked everyday.The room was lovely, with a luxury power shower and a massive bath.Worth every penny and a very big comfortable bed,never have i slept better than in my own bed.Location is very good just opposite the main train station (as you leave the station go left and then go over the bridge,cant miss the hotel its on the corner).Breakfast was nice, great selection not worth 15 euros unless you like contintental cold meats and pastries thou.

Reviews.Title: “Easy 5 out of 5”
Reviews.Author: snake11
Reviews.Content: Loved our stay at Grand Amrath. Having read recent reviews we were excited about our stay, but the hotel surpassed our expectations. We had pre-empted our stay with a room request, which was quickly granted. On arrival we changed our minds - no hassle for the always helpful staff. Loved the hotel's quirky character and beautiful designs. The room had huge windows overlooking a peaceful canal and high ceilings. It had everything you'd expect from a 5-star room, but it was the little touches that set the hotel apart. The complementary mini-bar was much appreciated (and used!), the shower had tremendous power, a beautiful deep bath, a UK power point, remote control curtains (that were great at blocking out light and noise), and the coffee in the room was the best I had in Amsterdam! On top of all this the hotel's located a convenient 5 minute walk from Central Station. If we return to Amsterdam we would definitely be staying here.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent hotel steeped in character”
Reviews.Author: widows_weeds
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed at this hotel for 4 nights and thoroughly enjoyed every minute of our time there. This hotel is in an old historic shipping building which exudes character and charm. Our room was large and spotlessly clean with a free mini bar thrown in. The staff are extremely professional and helpful. Make sure you avail of the concierge services which are excellent. There is also a nice atmospheric lounge and bar in the hotel which is to be applauded also. Overall I would definitely stay at the Amrath again and would have no qualms in recommending it to all. However, some small issues follow which I record only to provide the full picture: We had prepaid for our stay to include all taxes and charges but upon leaving, we were informed that an extra nightly tax still had to be paid. Tax is tax but it should really have been factored into the asking price and not recouped at the end. Most irritating. Although the food is very good in the hotel restaurant, the prices charged are, to my mind, excessive. There are lots of good restaurants within easy walking distance that are much better value for money. A tip: do not partake of the breakfast in the hotel restaurant for Eur 25.00 rather go into the hotel lounge bar and get a good breakfast there for half the price.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful boutique hotel with lots of history in Amsterdam”
Reviews.Author: Austinguytexas
Reviews.Content: Amazing hotel, truly enjoyed it! By far my favorite place to stay in Europe

Reviews.Title: “A Birthday Treat...”
Reviews.Author: Mal T
Reviews.Content: Stopped for three nights end of Feb with my Wife to celebrate a special birthday. It's the first time I have ever sat down to check in at a hotel! Excellent service, a superb home made birthday cake (free of charge) & a card for my wife from the Hotel to greet us in our room overlooking the Canal(also free upgrade). Lovely spacious room with Coffee machine, free mini bar etc. Superb location 10 mins from the Central station & only 5 mins walk into the centre of the action. 10/10 for sure, we will be back.

Reviews.Title: “Amrath Style”
Reviews.Author: BasingstokeTowers
Reviews.Content: This was a stylish grand hotel with good architecture. Free Mini Bar was good but this was probably buffeted within the cost of your stay as a good tactic to get customers in, although I am not complaining too much. The key card system didnt work 3 or 4 times and had to sort it with reception each time which was annoying for an alledged 5 star hotel. I would rate this hotel a good 4 star hotel, but it was quite expensive. Gym facilities were poor with hardly any machines for a 5 star hotel, the pool was small for a 5 star. The breakfast arrangement definitely met 5 star standard and was superb. The concierge was excellent and all staff spoke good english and were very helpful like most laid back liberal dutch people. The rooms were very nice but not proper 5 star standard in my opinion but still good. Close to canal and central station.

Reviews.Title: “An excelent choice”
Reviews.Author: ACROSANNA
Reviews.Content: We have been to this hotel for 4 nights and it was truly amazing. We were given two double rooms, with a connection as we were traveling with kids. The rooms were huge and very beautifully decorated. The free minibar and the Nespresso coffee machine are really useful when you are traveling with kids. The staff was very helpful and the breakfast, although very expensive, was excellent. The pool and the jacuzzi were opened until 11 pm and, after a long day walking the streets of Amsterdam, it was great for all of us to soak in their warm waters. The only negative points about the hotel are the non existent Lobby and the bedding. It would be nice to have some sheets instead of only duvets on the beds.

Reviews.Title: “Location, Great Service, and Comfort”
Reviews.Author: iscreenwriter
Reviews.Content: At first sight I was a little nervous as I walked into the odd looking lobby. Check in was in another room that resembled a board room. Was told I was upgraded and then told it was on first level facing street. Great offer but thought that was odd as well. Not sure why but I was then put into a room with no view and not much room to move around. One of the smallest rooms I have ever been in before. Aside from the size the bed was extremely comfortable and the bathroom was superb. Very large with both shower and bath. Following day the hotel told me I could move across the hall to a larger room. Now this was amazing. Same amenities but 5x the size. Now this is what I expected when booking! Aside from the small room I had on my first night I have to say I was very pleased with this hotel. Service is top notch and the rooms were all top of the line. Location is also amazing. Stayed at the Marriott a few years back and this location was much better. Just a 5 minute walk to the action and still far enough away for some peace and quiet in this mecca of hedonism. If I can get the same room I will 100% make this my home in Amsterdam. I will not give out the room number to keep it to myself thoughâ€¦.

Reviews.Title: “Comfort & style”
Reviews.Author: ask_a_local
Reviews.Content: The Amrath was not built as a hotel and it shows but only in agood way. The hwole place is full of amazing art deco detail all lovingly restored and really quite amazing. Our room was really comfortable, huge bed, coffee maker, free minibar, really deep bathtub and separate shower. Everything you would expecet from a luxury hotel. Our booking included breakfast which was varied and of a high quality although I might have thought twice about paying â‚¬25 each for it. All of the staff we encountered were helpful and a really good advert for the hotel. They too seemed to take a great pride in the amazing place in which they worked. We stayed in a 4th floor superior room with views over the adjacent canal. We booked direct with the htoel and this seemed to get a better deal than our usual hotel booking sites. The hotel is an easy walk from Centraal Station even with luggage.

Reviews.Title: “Nice room, great bed, interesting building and architecture.”
Reviews.Author: passionfortravel3
Reviews.Content: Stayed at Amrath, Amsterdam end of January, early February 2012. Easy walk from train station even with luggage and in light snow! The building and architecture are beautiful, inside, not what one would expect to see as a hotel. But, one must remember the history of this building, as it was once a great shipping house! Staff were great, the breakfast room a little chilly, so bring your scarf or sweater. Room so very comfortable with free mini bar stocked day and night. Concierge very accomodating and will supply you with printed history of building, which I found very enlightening. Make sure you get a room overlooking the canal! Great prices and location.

Reviews.Title: “Hard to fault”
Reviews.Author: PneumaticKumquat
Reviews.Content: Stayed three nights in early 2012. Location is excellent, in the city centre with all the major attractions within a reasonable walk. Also situated just a couple of hundred yards from Centraal station, easy walking distance with a suitcase. The hotel itself features as a city sight in the Lonely Planet guide, the nautical detailing to the exterior is matched by the elegance inside of the public areas. Check out the intricate glazing detail at the top of the main staircase and the myriad heads and brick/railing detail on the external elevations. The room was a reasonable size for a city centre hotel, with a decent bathroom, inclusive minibar and remote control curtains! Staff were friendly and courteous (didnâ€™t even get an opportunity to use any Dutch as their English was so good) and service was swift. All in all, hard to fault.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic Place - would definitely return.”
Reviews.Author: Venetiar
Reviews.Content: My boyfriend and I stayed at the Grand Hotel Amrath for 3 nights in February. I had found a very good deal for a Superior Deluxe Double through Hotels4you. We opted for the room only option which I would say is the best value for money as Amsterdam hotels are renowned for overcharging on their breakfasts. Plus its rather nice to leave the hotel before the city starts to fill up with the other tourists, there are plenty of lovely cafeâ€™s with waffles, pancakes everything you could possibly want nearby. The hotel itself is very impressive, you feel like you are walking onto a movie set with an impressive marble entrance hall and staircase and beautiful ironmongery everywhere, specifically tridents as I believe the hotel use to serve the sailors a long time ago! The room: I have stayed many times in Amsterdam (9x) and have experienced a variety of lodgings, but the floor space you get in the Amrath was the best by far. I had done some research on their website before we visited and I saw that there were a few 4 poster superior doubles. So just in case one might be available I emailed the hotel directly to ask if it was possible, weâ€™d very much appreciate one of the four posters. It canâ€™t hurt to ask right! And it didnâ€™t hurt at all! The staff were very charming on arrival and we were indeed issued with a four poster room â€“ the most incredibly comfortable bed, which made it very hard to get up in the morning. The room came with a large en-suite bathroom â€“ to be more specific the bath was enormous â€“ to put it in prospective, my boyfriend is 6â€™10â€� and it was the first time I have ever seen him be able to stretch out his legs in a bath tub! â€“ glorious for a long soak after trudging around the city. Not only did the bathroom have a huge deep bath it also had a fantastic power shower and double basin. The Amrath also provides a complimentary minibar in the room. This is a fantastic perk, it is well stocked with soft drinks and wine and beer and is replenished every day. The Staff: I must just mention the concierge guys, they were so helpful and charming. All the staff in the hotel are multi lingual it seems and couldnâ€™t be more helpful. There is a lovely bar on the ground floor where afternoon tea is served on Sundays, it is quite popular, so make sure you book. Location: We arrived by train from London and walked only 10 minutes max to get to the hotel â€“ so easy! Even though you are not right in the centre of town the perks of the Amrath location is that you donâ€™t suffer from the noise from the late night life all around you in the centre. The hotel is well placed for the trams which take you everywhere or even walking, which we did allot of, it really wasnâ€™t far from all the main attractions. Now it does sound too good to be true going from my comments above, but nowhere is perfect.... so I have to mention only one thing that annoyed me. The flat screen TV in the room was fixed on a bracket against the wall but could not be angled so you could watch from the bed. And the remote control itself was AWOL for the first 2 nights as the maid had made the bed over it from the previous tenants. But this certainly no reason not to stay here â€“ we had no time to really watch TV with all the exploring of the city! All in all a fantastic trip to the Dam, the best hotel Iâ€™ve stayed in there to date. If any travellers want to ask me any specific questions on the hotel do get in touch.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel”
Reviews.Author: cheshirekid
Reviews.Content: Just returned from a 3 night stay here and can't recommend it highly enough.We got a deluxe superior room with city view for a bargain Â£115 per night ( have paid nearly Â£100 per night on last 2 trips for 2/3 starred places that were quite frankly cess pits ). Upon arrival we were greeted by friendly smiles and cheerful staff and we were taken aback by how much they went out of their way to help us with anything.Free mini bar in room which is restocked every day was a big bonus for us and the bathroom was the best i have ever encountered ( shower was huge and luxurious )...Girlfriend loved it!! You can get a good look at them on google images. Like another reviewer said the huge floor to ceiling curtains are electronic and no one had told us,We were lying in bed at 1am after just getting back when all of a sudden the curtains started to open which freaked the pair of us out and for a second or 2 we thought someone was in the room with us before we realised they were electronic ( this also happened a couple of other times so can only assume that someone else opening/closing their curtains had activated ours as well ). There was 1 minor issue we had,we stayed in room 200 and we had problems with the lock from day 1,our porter who took our bags to our room thought it was just his card playing up when we first arrived but after 2 days of having our key cards replaced due to not being able to access our room it was finally found to be the locking device on the room that was not working properly.they did offer to get it fixed immediately after realising it was a lock problem but as we were leaving the next day we decided it wasn't worth it as it would have meant disruption in the room if we were in there. Overall - nicest hotel i have ever stayed in and friendliest staff...will be staying here again on next trip!!

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic Hotel”
Reviews.Author: LizCheshireUK
Reviews.Content: The Hotel was fantastic. Right across from Central Station, far enough away for peace and quiet but close enough to do lots of exploring around the streets of Amsterdam. Got upgraded to Junior Suite and mini bar is well worth the stay. The barman Justin was great making us a Manchester Mojita so check it out if you go!!! The only thing I will advise is that they ask for 100 euro deposit per night on arrival so be prepared. Otherwise fabulous ... Amterdam is great

Reviews.Title: “Nice swimming pool”
Reviews.Author: Ben K
Reviews.Content: The entry is a bit strange, without service to carry bags up the stairs, but inside thing are better. The booking seems a bit chaos, as all requests seemed to be lost, for us, but also for all other guests in the reception. No problem - upgradfe for all! The superior rooms are nice. Free internet and free minibar. Coffee and tea facilities. Great swimming pool with hammam, saunas, wirlpool etc. Breakfast is the normal standard. Service is typically Amsterdam style - friendly but very direct. Excellent for families for a winter break.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel nice staff”
Reviews.Author: Margaretvest
Reviews.Content: Ok. I usually don't write reviews but for my last vacation I really valued the reviews. The Amrath is a beautiful hotel. The staff was very very helpful. We had booked a deluxe city view room and got upgraded to a junior suite. It was nice The bathroom was very spacious. Loved the tub. The mini bar was GREAT and refilled daily. We had a bad experience with the 25 euro breakfast. The waitstaff were rude and we had to ask 3 different people before we finally got some coffee. It was decent food but not worth the money. I don't mind spending on food but this just wasn't worth it. The only other thing was the location. I thought it was a little far from the places I like to go. It was a longer walk then we liked. Although the taxi ride was never over 10 euro. Just to review our stay was overall nice.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful stay, a few minor issues”
Reviews.Author: faraday0
Reviews.Content: The hotel provided exactly what me and my travel companion were looking for: a local feel, location walking distance from most of the tourist districts, spacious room and common space to relax. The location was nearly ideal for a tourist vacation -- assuming a short walk does not bother you. The Amrath is not a long distance from many of the city's highlights, but far enough away to provide a respite from the center of town. I recommend the hotel, especially if you are able to find an excellent deal (which is what drew me to the hotel at first). A few minor issues: -The remote-controlled shades opened on more than one occasion when (I assume) someone in a neighboring room opened theirs -The fitness room leaves something to be desired - the machines are outdated and not in the best repair -One day we did not put up the "Please Clean Room" sign and our room went uncleaned (and we did not have a "Please Do Not Disturb" sign up) and it took 3 calls downstairs and until 10pm to have the room cleaned Despite these setbacks, the hotel was a nice compliment to a lovely vacation.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Keith S
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this hotel for 3 nights last week. Our room was upgraded free of charge to a junior suite which was fantastic, the free mini bar was a great bonus. The full breakfast buffet was good although expensive at 25 Euro each.They also do a continental breakfast at the bar for half the price which was very good. The staff were all very friendly and helpful and all spoke english. The pool was good and fairly quiet for an evening swim. The location is a short walk from centraal station and about 20 mins to DAM square and a lot of the tourist attractions.

Reviews.Title: “Not a bad hotel, lacks a buzz in the bar and public areas.”
Reviews.Author: BigJohnDeere
Reviews.Content: Stayed with my wife for 3 nights. Easy check in etc. but the place was dead! Good grief we are in Amsterdam, but you would think you were out in the countryside. The bar lacked any buzz and the public areas were dead. We met more people in the lifts than in the bar! If you want quiet and i mean real quiet then this is your spot. This was not for me, there is a certain amount of life needed to make it feel homely and it was not here. Normally we would round off the evening in the bar for a nightcap, but we went to bed at 10-00 every night. Lovely hotel rooms adequate and warm. Free mini bar, if you are sad enough to want to sit in your room and drink. Ticks nearly all the boxes. It must be its location which is fine but theres no passing trade.

Reviews.Title: “Outstanding Hotel!!!!”
Reviews.Author: TEDF81
Reviews.Content: The Grand Amrath was an excellent choice - I took my time when selecting a hotel for my Amsterdam stay and I am so glad I chose the Amrath. On arrival we were greeted by friendly staff and everyone was very helpful. The hotel is very well maintained and has a warm and welcoming feel about it. Our room was amazing, the free minibar does make a difference together with the Nespresso machine in the room - this sets this hotel apart from other 5 star hotels I have stayed in . The pool and spa area was clean and spacious. Overall this is an excellent hotel - I would highly recommend it! Only thing I would say which needs to be slightly better is the breakfast selection.

Reviews.Title: “great stay”
Reviews.Author: ITA_And_RE_a
Reviews.Content: Beautiful hotel located close to Amsterdam Central train station. Architecture is magnificent. The details in the wood work, marble, and glass is amazing opulence. The staff was helpful and provided good recommendations for food and drink

Reviews.Title: “Nice Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Hearts1874
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for 1 night in January. Hotel is situated in a very quiet location far enough away from the hustle and bustle but still close enough to most sights. Staff very helpful and friendly. Spacious rooms. Free mini bar Atmospheric building will a lot of character. Large comfy bed. Very nice experience for something different. Got a good deal which made this hotel excellent value. Would have been disappointed though if paying full price. Billed as a 5 star hotel but there are small things missing that you would question if paying top price. Not as much a criticism but more an observation. Would like to stay again if price was right to fully experience all facilities.

Reviews.Title: “perfect for a mini-break”
Reviews.Author: GemReview
Reviews.Content: Fascinating hotel with superb facilities - the housekeeping is excellent with the inclusive mini bar, they replenished it daily and brought up extra coffee & milk as we went through quite a few - it was delicious coffee! We didn't book breakfast or dinner either in the hotel but there is no need as there are many cafes and restaurants within walking distance - the hotel restaurant & room service rates are also quite expensive. The wellness area is a credit to the hotel - lovely and clean, warm and relaxing - didn't seem to be overcrowded too but we could have just been lucky. Comprising a lovely pool, 3 saunas, a steam room and jacuzzi; there are plenty of options - and stacks of fresh towels dotted about - it is a nicely well kept area, and perfect to spend an hour or two. This is a five star hotel for sure - the only reason I marked it down is because we did seem to spend on several occasions quite a long time hanging around in the foyer waiting for reception and concierge staff. However I would definitely book this hotel again if I were to go back to Amsterdam. Oh and just to add that the beds in this hotel are the most comfortable we have ever slept in - mostly you can't wait to get back to your own bed after a holiday but we are missing our holiday bed already!

Reviews.Title: “Really good hotel”
Reviews.Author: Jonally
Reviews.Content: Trust the reviews, this is is really great hotel. Beautiful and unique building, far removed from bland chain hotels. And very friendly staff. We stayed for 3 days to celebrate our 25th anniversay and 25 years since visiting Amsterdam. We got a great deal through Octopus including breakfast (very expensive if not included in rate) and the hotel gave us a free upgrade to superior city view room. They also left a card and small gift in the room which was a very nice touch, Rooms are huge and well equipped with free wifi, nespresso machine with free minibar (and they do refill every day). There is a small fitness area, and also a pool with hot tub, steam room and sauna. A nice way to relax and rest your feet after walking miles round the city.

Reviews.Title: “Edwards trip”
Reviews.Author: Lesley R
Reviews.Content: Lovely building and very central and easy to walk to from the station. All the staff spoke excellent English and were extremely helpful and friendly. The rooms were spacious and the mini bar very generous. The pool and jacuzzi were great to relax in after a day of sightseeing. The beds are large and very comfortable. A coffee machine and a kettle are provided to make your own hot drinks. The dressing gown, slippers large towels and tv all made for a luxurious stay. we would certainly recommend it to anyone and would stay there again without hesitation,

Reviews.Title: “Would definitely go back.”
Reviews.Author: Jennie29_11
Reviews.Content: Everything you want from a hotel - lovely staff, free minibar, amazing rooms, lovely food, great spa, small but good gym and in all in amazing surroundings. The staff were so nice, they went the extra mile to source a gift for Valentines and were prompt and helpful with all our requests. We were in Amsterdam for four days and spend one just in the hotel it was so lovely. Definitely recommended.

Reviews.Title: “Very good experience in an beautifully restored building”
Reviews.Author: Pngster
Reviews.Content: Stayed at this pretty unique hotel, decor and architecture-wise, at an execellent price through a "Deal of the Day" booking on Bookings.com. I personally like Art Deco style and snapped the most number of photos of the location for my entire holiday in Amsterdam! It was off-peak, and we got a room on the quieter side, not facing the main Prins Hendrikkade road. The room was very spacious, and clean with a huge, nicely refurbished bathroom, and the high ceilings helped add space. Check-in was not at the usual counter, but seated decently at a desk - very much like meeting with your consultant or whoever at an office - for that is what the reception room was converted from. The check-in staff was efficient, intelligent and courteous. We found the lounge staff very cheerful and helpful too. The hotel had a spa, sauna and fitness centre, Used only the fitness centre, which was pretty minimal but ok because there was no one else using it. What was strange was the entrance to the hotel, which was rather small (compared to the scale of it), and had no ramp for luggage or handicap access. Guests with heavy luggage may have difficulties getting their bags in and out of the hotel. Also, more hooks in the bathroom would be good.

Reviews.Title: “Great experience overall !!”
Reviews.Author: MCSORLEYPORTADOWN
Reviews.Content: My husband and I have just returned from a weekend stay at the Grand Amrath hotel. As it was my husbands 50th birthday I wanted to make it special and upgraded to a superior deluxe room with city view to include breakfast and asked for a bottle of champagne in our room on arrival. As soon as we arrived at the hotel the staff were very friendly and professional, my husband was congratulated on his bithday and then they suprised us by giving us our upgrade free.The rooms were fantastic with an incredible bed, which was so comfortable it was hard to get out of in the morning but then we had that marvelous bathroom with a fantastic shower to use. The room had a free minibar and coffee machine and a kettle for tea. A good choose at breakfast and you good ask for a freshly cooked omlete or eggs.We also visited the hotel restaurant the food was excellent (Try the beef main and the chocolate soufle mmmmmmmm!!) The fitness centre was spotless and had a good range of equipment. The hotel interior was so interesting to look at and had most of the original features.What else can I say the staff from housekeeping, bar, restaurant , concereige ,reception to management very friendly,professional and well groomed. We had the most enjoyable, relaxing weekend and would like to thank all members of staff for that.

Reviews.Title: “Art Deco”
Reviews.Author: minto123
Reviews.Content: Wow. If your into Art Deco this hotel is a must. Its like a set from Poirot. Amazing to find a building that externally and internally has retained so much of its original charm, absolutely beautiful. Bedrooms well equipped, if a little small. Beds and bathrooms to die for. Free mini bar in room, restocked each day. Cotton sheets and great towels. Rituals bath products. Definate 5 star. Service levels very good, concierge service excellant. Appears to have excellant health facilities, although did not use them personally. Breakfast very good, but pricey, as is Amsterdam in general. Did not dine in restaurant in evening, menu looked good, but dining room empty. Great central location, close to station, but not noisy at all. Well worth, a try.

Reviews.Title: “Great experience”
Reviews.Author: jennymclaughlin1
Reviews.Content: Fantastic hotel full of history ,character and charm.We were made welcome throughout our stay and found the staff warm and helpful.As it was my husband's birthday we were given an upgrade which really helped make the occasion special ,not to mention the card and chocolates, a really nice gesture!!! The room was large and comfortable with great views of the canal.Breakfast was extensive and choices varied.This was our first time in Amsterdam and the hotel enhanced our experience.We would thoroughly recommend it and look forward to returning.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful building and staff”
Reviews.Author: DazKim
Reviews.Content: Return trip after proposing to my beautiful wife, the hotel never fails to amaze in stunning architecture, attentitiveness of staff and convenient location. A true Jewel amongst amsterdams rich diamond heritage !

Reviews.Title: “Brilliant Again.”
Reviews.Author: AmsterDaz
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed at this fabulous hotel in January 2011 and have just paid a return visit. Amsterdam, as ever, was brilliant; cold and snowy but plenty of different places to shelter. We had booked a Superior Deluxe Room, without needing to ask we were upgraded to a Junior Suite which was fantastic. Because of the cold weather and despite the slow service we had in the restaurant last year, we ate in the Hotel's restaurant. We were not surprised by the quality of food, as it was up to its usual standard, neither we were surprised about the service, which has never been as good as it could be. Last year we had some very long sittings due to the slow service. This year the service was quicker but silly, small mistakes let down the overall experience; issues like waiters getting in the way, pouring drinks et cetera, whilst eating and getting a roll at random times throughout the meal. As I said last year; if you can put up with these annoyances (a couple of days training would sort these issues - Amrath) the restaurant is well worth a visit. Some reviewers have questioned the 5* status of the Grand Amrath. I wouldn't. This rates up with the best hotels in Amsterdam.

Reviews.Title: “Exellent old facion hotel”
Reviews.Author: jormaa
Reviews.Content: Amtath is great old time facion hotel with new style services.Great sauna and pool facilities.Fantastic consignee service. Very good breakfast. Super big junior suite.A pit expensive, but...

Reviews.Title: “Great Amsterdam hotel”
Reviews.Author: john3690
Reviews.Content: Grand Hotel AmrÃ¢th. The location of the AmrÃ¢th is superb very close to central station. On arrival at Amsterdam Schiphol airport we took the train into Amsterdam city centre, the station is easily found by following the overhead signs. The station is situated under the airport, buying tickets is easy via machines or at the booth, just prior to heading for your platform. It took about 15 mins to travel to central station and the AmrÃ¢th is a further 5 minute walk. Just check out its location on google maps, but it's just a left turn from the main station concourse and that 5 min walk. The AmrÃ¢th looks stunning as you arrive, the check in service is friendly and quick. Our room was large with a huge bath and walk in shower. Mini bar is free and is full of well known brand names. Rooms are also fitted with Espresso coffee machines. Wifi is easy to connect and is also free, you are given a username and password on check in. Room ceilings are very high, so curtains are electrically powered via a remote. Rooms are clean and well maintained. We were on the third floor and Â it was extremely quiet, no outside noise and we never heard any other guests, not surprising when you look at the construction of the building. My wife thought the rooms are a little dark with the curtains closed, for dressing and makeup. There is also no power connection near a mirror. All the employees are very friendly, taking time to chat etc. I would not hesitate to recommend this hotel, and I am sure I will stay there again myself, hopefully in the not to distant future.

Reviews.Title: “Grand with good people”
Reviews.Author: Sannieswirl
Reviews.Content: Hotel Amrath takes your breath away. Everywhere you look, you see something gorgeous in marble and wood. But what we liked the most was the staff. Very professional, very friendly and very helpful. We got an upgrade (superior room with city view) without asking and free use of the minibar. The staff in the cafe was very friendly as well. Before we went to dinner, we took a shower. After dinner we noticed that the bathroom was cleaned as well as the hotel room. Some pointers to improve are: the shoe moulds in our room could be renewed here and there as well as some of the wallpaper, but the grandness of the room makes everything more than ok. To be repeated!

Reviews.Title: “awful high tea”
Reviews.Author: K M
Reviews.Content: This afternoon me and my wife thought High Tea at the beautiful Amrath 5 star hotel would be a nice idea. Unfortunately the beauty and splendour of this art deco building is not matched by the poor standards for high tea. List of disappointments: 1 In hind sight, after seeing the high tea "shipping room" we should have just turned around. The elegant architecture is ruined by the awful bar area with pink and green neon highlighting the liquor cabinet. Nothing like the pictures...we should have known 2 the prosecco. Ok. 2 We were promised a selection of tea. Instead we got the most awful blend of green tea imaginable. Tasted like water with trace amounts of 'something'. not brewed long enough or just really bad. The selection never came. Having said that, maybe they expected us to wait longer than 30 minutes. at that point, the quality proved to be so poor we decided to leave. 3 After the prosecco we were given a special treat: the chefs special fish soup served with a semi burnt kroket of shrimp. The latter was so salty, the shrimp could not be detected. Mine was vert oily. I'm not sure how this was going to complement the scones and clotted cream that were to come next. The 'special' fish soup was special indeed. It tasted of mushroom soup with an overwhelming flowery texture. The presentation in a cognac glass did not help either. A pathetic attempt at 'contemporary' cuisine. 4 The high tea. Served on very ugly tray. The finger sandwiches: The bread was a bit of a shock. It tasted of ( and I have feeling it actually was ) spongy processed factory baking. The cheese was not worthy of a country with such nice cheese. Again, low quality. The presentation is never the same as the pictures, that's life. But here, there wasn't even a trace of an effort to mimic the advertising pictures. Ugly and boring. The scones were fine. Two of them at least. Although they were both too sweat for my taste. They amrath chef had decided to put bits of chocolate in the dough. This might work sometimes, this time it didnt. Fruit salad. Just fruit salad, the fruit was not even cut up properly. Again, low quality ingredients. Tasteless fruit. Looks like something I would prepare and that's not a bad thing. again, cognac glasses, attempt at a new trend..?? 5 Bonbons, biscuits and odd bits of chunky pastry. I raelise I might sound overdramatic, but even this wasn't done right. OR should I say espescially this. The beautiful little tartles, mouse or loveyly cream filled little things were missing. Instead we were given prefab biscuits and bonbons that were crusty and cracked. 6 The price: â‚¬65 euros for 2. Not worth it. I would like to save anyone I can from wasting their money on this disappointing 'high tea'. The best thing was that are complaints were taken on board and we did not have to pay. I certainly hope things get better at the Amrath amsterdam. A unique building like this deserves cuisine that is far better.

Reviews.Title: “This hotel made me forget I was there for business!”
Reviews.Author: TashaPuppy
Reviews.Content: Note: This is for travel in August 2007! After staying one night in a dreadful hotel, 1 mile away, my business colleagues and I decided to venture out and find something better. We walked to other hotels and viewed sample rooms to ensure we knew what to expect. We were SO fortunate to find the Amrath. Of the 12 other hotels we viewed, this was miles above any other. From the moment we walked in the door, we were greeted by a friendly gentlemen who answered all our questions. He was happy to give us a small tour and show us a sample room. The hotel boasts class from another era (if I remember correctly it used to be a steam ship office.) It was beautiful, welcoming and a comfort for being on business. It makes you want to explore the hotel as if it were its own attraction. An old moving loft of some sort, marble, glass... Room: Myself and two colleagues were extremely fortunate to stay in the lower rooms, adjacent to each other. They 10+ feet high windows, a private bath and plenty of room. There was plenty of light during the day and the decor was cozy and dark (which I like). It was secluded away from the main rooms so it felt like our own 3 room suite. They offered complimentary spirits once a day from the mini-bar and all the tea you could need. The pool and steam room: It was like being in your own, blue and sparkly indoor pool because you're very wealthy. The ceiling above the pool has little LED lights which twinkle like stars. The sauna's were clean and hot - relaxing the bones. There was no odor which one might think of, being indoors. Staff: Exceptional Cleanliness: CLEAN, CLEAN Convenience: Walking distance to lovely parts of the city / major train station 5-10 minute walk. Overall feel: Comforting; did not want to leave; will 150% stay here again both for business or pleasure.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful Hotel!”
Reviews.Author: Amanda_B_12London
Reviews.Content: We stay at this hotel often on business and I like that the service is efficient and friendly without being too involved in your stuff (if you are on business it needs to be functional). The views are great from the upper floors and both sides of the hotel are nice, but I like the city facing view. Ask ahead as the hotel should know if this is planned. A great stay and the hotel does not feel like it is part of a chain of hotels for some reason. Everything was very clean, the staff was very helpful and the hotel was near the subway station. I would definately recommend it.

Reviews.Title: “AMAZING AMRATH AMSTERDAM!!”
Reviews.Author: sarah p
Reviews.Content: We have just returned form a three night stay in the Grand Hotel Amrath in Amsterdam. I have never left a review about anything before but felt I had to do so for the Amrath. It really is a wonderful experience from start to fininsh. Easy to walk to from Central Station, just bear left until you sea the Chinese Sea Palace resturant all lit up and its there opposite. It took our breath away from looking up to it outside, the gothic arcitecture, its like something from Gotham city! We had a free upgrade to a beautiful city view room, as we were celebrating my boyfriends 40th birthday. The four poster bed was decorated with bright buntings, with champagne and chocolates laid out on the bed. What a bed it was, by far the most comfy we had ever experienced! The room was spotless, the service was excellent. Fresh bedding, linen, toiletries and tea/coffee and mini bar stock ed every day sometimes twice if needed. We opted for breakfast to be brought to our room each morning for a 7.50 euro surcharge. This was delicious and would be enough for lunch too. The bathroom was amazing, the heated slate floor was a pleasant bonus. The HUGE shower and HUGE bath were very enjoyable and we took advantage of having quite a few a day! The wellness centre was a true gem, the amazing starlit ceiling pool and jaccuzzi where heaven after a night in the Amsterdam bars! We were always the only ones down there so it felt like our own private domain! We indulged in a massage which was fantastic. Ian surely knows his stuff! The bar was quite pricey but so was the rest of the bars in Amsterdam. Fausto was very friendly and welcoming, and we loved the complimentary spicy nuts! The attention to detail and the artwork made this hotel one of the best we have stayed in and was the icing on the cake for our weekend away. Everything was clean and kept to a high level of excellence. From the toilets to the lifts. The staff were very polite and helpful and we would never stay anywhere else when returning to this amazing city. We look forward to the next trip!! Thank-you Amrath!

Reviews.Title: “Grand hotel in great location”
Reviews.Author: MelissaP536
Reviews.Content: We travelled across Europe July 2011 and stayed here, its a great base for seeing the sites of Amsterdam as everything is walking distance, Room was a large size, had free mini bar, great big comfortable bed and coffee machine which was lovely. The building itself is beautiful and historic. Nice pool area downstairs too. Only downside was valet was a bit pricy.

Reviews.Title: “A pleasure”
Reviews.Author: Nederbelg
Reviews.Content: I had the opportunity to stay at the Grand Hotel Amrath Amsterdam mid January. It was a true pleasure staying in such a monumental building where so much attention has been given towards keeping the authenticity of this building in tact. High ceiling bedrooms (so high you need a remote controll to open curtains), the staircases, the old office counters, the lift, the wine cellar. If I have to stay in Amsterdam again I know what my choice of hotel will be;

Reviews.Title: “Great central location!!”
Reviews.Author: Neale1976
Reviews.Content: We stayed here mid-Jan 2012 for 6 nights in Amsterdam as my partner was working in Utrecht. We are so glad we chose the Grand Hotel Amrath Amsterdam! It's got an excellent quiet location only 5-10 minutes easy walk from Central Station, and only 5 mins from lots of restaurants and bars in the Red Light District and 10 mins from Dam Square etc. We stayed in a Deluxe room which had free wifi and Mini-Bar and Nespresso machine. Breakfast wasnt included and it was expensive at â‚¬25 each so we just grabbed something in the local cafes each morning for less than â‚¬5. Room was very comfy with hign ceilings and an electric curtain with remote. The bed was VERY comfortable with a big mattress topper on top of the already comfy mattess so we slept well. Our room didnt have much of a view but it was extremely quiet and sleep was no problem!! The mini bar gets stocked TWICE a day with branded mini-vodka, gin, whisky, white rum and brandy plus two beers,cokes, fresh orange juice and sprite - plus wine n red wine and still/sparkling water. We had the orange juice every morning when we got up and the vodka every night when we got in (great idea!). I used the swimming pool, jacuzzi and sauna on 2 occasions and everything was sparkling clean and very enjoyable. The hotel is a converted merchant shipping building so dont expect an ultra-modern interior.....the lift was really quirky with wood panelling and old style buttons etc but I think that added character. We had collegues staying in more modern central hotels and they complained about the noise outside! We had no such problems!! Would recommend the hotel as a base for travel from Central Station or for sightseeing as most places are walkable around Amsterdam......great hotel and would go back!

Reviews.Title: “Great 5 Star Hotel: Great Location with FREE mini-bar & FREE WiFi”
Reviews.Author: CarlosDGreat
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed here mid-Jan 2012 for a long weekend in Amsterdam for our 1st Wedding Anniversary and we are so glad we chose the Grand Hotel Amrath Amsterdam! It's got an excellent quiet location only 5-10 minutes easy walk from Central Station, and likewise 5 minutes from the lively bustling Red Light District with its numerous bars, restaurants and coffee shops and about 10 minutes canal side walk from Dam Square. We received a very warm and courteous welcome upon arrival, all staff & concierge are very friendly and welcoming - excellent service. Plus we received a free upgrade to a city view room overlooking the beautiful canal (it'd be worth paying the extra for). Room is to an excellent standard, spacious, clean and VERY comfortable bed, a Nespresso (capsules supplied) coffee machine and a FREE mini-bar that gets topped up everyday - yes for free!!! Contains a selection of branded mini-vodka, gin, whisky, white rum and brandy plus two beers, sodas, cokes, orange juice and sprite - plus wine n red wine (a fantastic idea for in-room relaxation - wish other hotels would do this!). There's also a good wellness centre and swimming pool - but we were too busy exploring Amsterdam or using the free mini-bar to try that out. Will definately come back and stay here as this 5 star hotel ticks all the right boxes!!!

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful hotel”
Reviews.Author: sonnybella
Reviews.Content: Beautiful hotel, unique and classy. The rooms were huge, the complimentary mini bar was a great add, the beds were very comfortable and the room beautifully decorated. The bathrooms were clean, but kind of lacked privacy (only because of the style of bathroom doors, they were frosted/cloudy glass). The location is great and within steps of everything. Internet was fast, the room service was delicious and our stay was overall great.

Reviews.Title: “A beautiful hotel - like stepping back in time!”
Reviews.Author: worldtravellassie
Reviews.Content: We booked this hotel through Priceline bidding booking system so we didn't know what we were getting but we were more than pleasantly surprised to experience this! Checked us in early...beautiful room with lots of space. Bath tub deep as the ocean - wonderful! Husband LOVED the complimentary mini bar. Scones in the lounge were yummy and spa was beautiful, if a little difficult to find! A gorgeous and very much under-rated art deco hotel...enjoy!

Reviews.Title: “Great location and Architcture”
Reviews.Author: lateharvestgirl
Reviews.Content: The staff were friendly and very helpful, and location is excellent. Pay extra and choose a city view room - otherwise you will be looking into other hotel rooms. Free minibar was a nice extra.

Reviews.Title: “Good but not five star cleaning”
Reviews.Author: Danilo_SR
Reviews.Content: Comfortable, central, easy to reach from Central Station. Huge room but with some problems in case of wind (strong drafts and noise). Free mini bar restocked daily; Nespresso machine for coffee and tea machine , free wireless and wellness included in the price (heated pool, sauna, turkish bath, idro-massage). Pre credit of $ 300 on credit card as a deposit, Staff very friendly and helpful. If I were the director I would do some spot check in the rooms. I certainly would find situations of widespread lack of cleanliness that are not suitable for a 5-star (the bathroom of our room was not cleaned for three days, only change of towles; cups used for breakfast only rinsed, and not very well; widespread dust...).

Reviews.Title: “Top Notch Hotel in Amsterdam”
Reviews.Author: MJM1234
Reviews.Content: This hotel was a great way to spend a few days in Amsterdam in December. We arrived around 7 am in the morning mid-week. We requested early arrival upon making the reservation and surprisingly they were expecting us had a room ready for us. The room was large and beautiful - very comfortable, high ceilings, great view of the canal/city and the in-room amenities were great - nespresso machine and the free mini bar. Room service didn't refill the mini bar automatically, just make sure to call and ask. The bathroom was beautiful and was disappointed that we didn't have the time to enjoy the beautiful spa.
