They really did a great job with this place, it feels sort of like a maze getting to the elevator and your room but that adds to the charm and comfortable/private feeling of the hotel rather than feeling like your in a massive overrun hotel. The hotel is also nice because it is out of the hustle and bustle of being right in the city center ( I was amazed at how quiet it was sleeping there, even with a window open) but still close enough to get to main tourist points on foot. The concierge gave us good restaurant recommendations and were friendly. The bar/lounge is comfortable and had good service. I will definitely stay here next time in Amsterdam and highly recommend it.

Reviews.Title: “WONDERFUL hotel. AMAZING service!”
Reviews.Author: coren p
Reviews.Content: This Hotel is high-end, but worth it. The rooms were spacious and the shower in the bathroom was pure Heaven. You are within walking distance to the train station, canal buses and about a 8 minute walk to Dam square. A short Taxi ride will take you to the Anne Frank museum and Heiniken Brewery. After a long day of touring, you WILL appreciate the beds and the huge/deep bathtubs to soak in. The mini bar is stocked each day with water, juice and alcohol, its complimentary. Definately recommend this hotel for your stay in Amsterdaum.

Reviews.Title: “Not cheap, but well located and good service”
Reviews.Author: wing han l
Reviews.Content: We had a nice room, the staff was very helpful, the hotel is well located.. close to the central station and also not that far from the real center (5 minutes walking distance). The breakfast was fine, the room was clean, so all in all a good experience for us.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely stay. But Room needs more light.”
Reviews.Author: baps-123
Reviews.Content: Had a lovely weekend at Grand Amrath. Good rooms, great beds, super modern bathroom with huge bath, nice toiletries, complementary mini bar a great extra, Especially with prices in Amsterdam, plus an nespresso coffee machine, only drawback we found was poor lighting in Hotel room. Would recommend, and will stay here next time in Amsterdam.

Reviews.Title: “Christmas week 2011”
Reviews.Author: Stewie M
Reviews.Content: We just spent a week here rather than my usual stop in the Kras. The old favourite in Dam Square is looking a little tired in places, particularly some of the rooms. The Amrath doesn't have the buzz and social whirl around Reception but the building is pristine, the architecture is amazing and the rooms are excellent. Great coffee machine. Free mini bar. Outstanding beds. If, like us, you will be dining out and just need a base in a perfect location, I recommend it.

Reviews.Title: “Again a wonderful experience”
Reviews.Author: redbridgej
Reviews.Content: I had my second visit to this delightful Hotel on the 9th December, the room was again excellent. Well furnished, delightful bed wih an abundance of pillows. A wonderful Bahroom with Tub and Shower, plenty of Towels and Terry Robe and Slippers, The free WiFi was fast and reliable and the complimentary MiniBar was a welcome highly appreciated extra, I can only again express my satisfaction with this Hotel. The Staff were friendly and efficient and he room was always well cleaned and the Bathroom and MiniBar well stocked.

Reviews.Title: “Very nice hotel”
Reviews.Author: k8kjn
Reviews.Content: Very comfortable hotel in a convenient location for the train station. The room had all the conveniences you could wish for including tea, coffee, bathrobe and a powerful hairdryer. The mini bar was free, which unfortunately I did not realise until half way through my stay. The ceilings are very high but the room still managed to feel cosy. The only thing that I found a little strange is that the remote control curtains started to open on their own about 4am which was a bit shock and took some getting used to. I cannot rate the breakfast as I did not try it and the gym/pool area in the basement also looked nice. All in all I would stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “A nice experience & we would stay again”
Reviews.Author: NYArtistGirl
Reviews.Content: We arrived at Centraal Station & the walk to the hotel was just a few minutes. Each & every staff member encountered was very pleasant, helpful, & nice. The hotel itself, like a charming, old time, grand luxury ship with narrow wood hallways & a maritime decor in the stained glass ceiling at the top of the main stairwell. The room was clean & the bed was comfortable. Because of the odd shape to the room, the bed was a little too close to one wall, but nothing to complain about. Remote control curtains, convenient master light switches in the headboard, free wi-fi throughout the hotel, & free mini-bar re-stocked daily were appreciated features. The concierge was always right there or just steps away & offered insightful help. He really listened to what we were asking & was knowledgeable & pleasant. The bathroom was clean & overall it was fine. The fold out glass shower doors wouldn't stay put & resulted in a bit of a mini-flood on the floor ...but was taken care of with two towels, (there were extras so it wasn't a huge issue) Amsterdam is a small city so I can't imagine an inconvenient location, but I found this location to be good. It took 5 minutes to walk to Centraal Station, about 5-7 minutes to walk to Nieuwmarkt, about 10 minutes to the Rembrandt House, & about 20 minutes to walk to the Rijksmuseum (if that helps to get bearings while looking at a map) We will certainly be staying here again.

Reviews.Title: “a bit of luxury”
Reviews.Author: JonGam
Reviews.Content: I was promised a superior room and I was not disappointed. Bath robes and slippers, free drinks in the mini bar, a selection of tea and coffee and a comfortable bed- all in amazing surroundings. The health spa was nice but the jacuzzi was not warm enough, neither was the swimming pool. The service was very friendly and helpful, although I was charged city tax even though I had already paid in with the booking.

Reviews.Title: “Epitome of brilliance”
Reviews.Author: qleyo
Reviews.Content: Fantastic hotel. Beautiful gothic looking building - apparently was used by Gestapos...adds the extra thrill to it. It really left me breathless each time. I stayed two nights at the Grand Amrath. Hotel is right next to Amsterdam's central station so it was a short hop and skip over with my suitcase. It is also a stone throw from the red light district but removed enough to keep that all important serenity. The hotel concierge and staff were extremely friend, with great tips and lots of smiles. The bed...oh those pillows were divine, bathroom was nice and large. And the free mini-bar (which was topped up twice in one day)! Can never go wrong with that. The complimentary Nespresso machine, the lush decor (yes it is intentionally dark) and being able to open my curtains without having to get up in the morning - priceless. Loved it all round. Don't think just book it. I would not advice eating at the hotel as a friend who has stayed there many times said the food was as good as your usual hotel food. Go out and explore amsterdam! Checkout the Thai Snackbar Bird which the concierge confessed that he ate at alot of the time. Have breakfast at Pancake! on Berenstraat and have dinner at the amazing Balthazaar on Elandsgracht.

Reviews.Title: “This is where you want to stay . . .”
Reviews.Author: mrfreeze922
Reviews.Content: Booking on-line is never easy . . . but if traveling to Amsterdam, this is where we would stay again and again. Ideal location for exploring the city with everything within walking distance and every day an "adventure". Excellent concierge service - everyone was so helpful, warm, and welcoming. No matter what the event - anniversary, birthday, or a much needed vacation, you're just one mouse click away from an unforgettable experience. Worth every penny!

Reviews.Title: “Perfect and magical!!!!”
Reviews.Author: IHJ
Reviews.Content: Missing this place like crazy. The hotel was beautiful and stunning. Big clean rooms fit for kings and queens. Prime location. Excellent hospitality and service. Luxury at its best!!!!!!!!!! Many thanks!!!!!!!

Reviews.Title: “Art Nouveau bliss”
Reviews.Content: If you love art nouveau this historic place is a must, it's absolutely gorgeous. The staff are very helpful, our room was spacious and extremely comfortable you sink into the mattress on an enormous bed, high ceiling room with views out over the canals and city beyond. The spa is very welcoming relaxing haven at the end of the day. Only saw Restaurant used at breakfast, dinner menu rather expensive. Free mini bar a bonus.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely central hotel with bags of character”
Reviews.Author: SonofLamacha
Reviews.Content: Really enjoyed staying at this hotel on business. Stylish and impeccable service. Free minibar, wifi, business services. Overall great service - helpful and discreet. Walking distance from everything.

Reviews.Title: “Gothic splendour of the Grand Hotel Amrath Amsterdam-the difference is welcome in the midst of uniformity”
Reviews.Author: MALYSL
Reviews.Content: Having stayed in the Grand Hotel Amrath Amsterdam at the beginning of December 2011 we appreciated the warm, courteous and professional manner in which my wife and I were treated. The location is central for sightseeing and its proximity to the train staion is a distinct advantage. The staff are friendly, attentive but not familiar. The quality of the breakfasts are to commended as are the housekeeping staff.

Reviews.Title: “chilled out”
Reviews.Author: liz w
Reviews.Content: Great hotel, art deco, huge bedroom, huge bed, very comfy, loved the mini bar.

Reviews.Title: “An perfect choice for a chilled out romantic weekend.”
Reviews.Author: Sherbertlemon
Reviews.Content: Just got back from a 4 day trip staying here and we were very impressed. The staff were responsive, friendly and very helpful. The rooms are massive, stylish and the beds are amazing. Free minibar went down well, we also borrowed a DVD player from reception - they couldn't do enough for us. The spa is lovely - small but perfectly formed and the saunas, pool and hot tub were welcome after walking all day. The location is right on the edge of the lively red light district, but quiet enough to allow a good sleep when you need it! We stayed in room 309 which we recommend.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location.. Service is good but could be great.”
Reviews.Author: MsNy
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Grand Amrath this past August and overall I enjoyed my time there. It's in a really convenient location that's not far from the train station and the red light district (but not too close to a make anyone comfortable!) Basically, a lot of things are within walking distance and as single female traveler, that was important. The building is a beautiful old shipping building. It's a little spooky and it's definitely easy to get lost inside it but the art deco style of the place is truly unique. One thing to note, getting in and out of the hotel may be difficult as it didn't appear very handicap accessible as the entrance has a lot of stairs. The room itself was beautiful and they upgraded me to a Junior Suite which was larger then some NYC apts! I also loved the complimentary mini bar which I definitely used after a long day of sight seeing! While the service was generally helpful and courteous, I think they could have gone the extra mile to be truly considered a 5 star hotel. For example, I called several times about the air conditioning, which never seemed to get really cool. That should have been fixed immediately. All in all, I was happy with my stay and if I returned to Amsterdam, I would definitely consider Amrath BUT, it didn't blow me away where I wouldn't consider trying another 5 star hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel, Amazing Service”
Reviews.Author: Gregory M
Reviews.Content: As someone who has traveled the world and stayed in countless, this is, by far, my favorite hotel. The hotel itself is incredibly ornate as it was originally a high end office building for shipping offices in the 1600-1700s. The decor and subtle nuaces make this building unique. From the exterior to the intricate designs inside, the decor cannot be matched anywhere. The location of the hotel, across from Central Station, cannot be beat. It is located within walking distance to anything in the center of the city. The service provided by the hotel staff is second to none. The rooms are exceptionally clean and very spacious. The ample free mini bar, which included, beer, wine, various liquor, juice, soda, water etc. was just an added bonus and was refilled each day. I highly recommend this hotel to anyone who plans to travel to Amsterdam. Definitely the best value and highest service I have experienced in my three trips to Amsterdam

Reviews.Title: “LEAKAGE OF SEWAGE IN AMRATHâ€� HOTEL,AMSTERDAM”
Reviews.Author: Oguz D
Reviews.Content: I stayed in Grand Hotel Amrath/AMSTERDAM on the 18'th of November. Unfortunately, there was a leakage of sewage in our super deluxe room!!!! As a result of this, my laptop computer's bag and passport, some papers in this bag was damaged(I gave my laptop bag to responsible manager) . When i turned back hometown, i realized that my laptop's screen has breaken down too.Now I bought a new passport, a new laptop bag and gave my laptop to service for mending........ The responsible manager said that "we are very sorry and we will contact to you.we will compansate.Don't worry.............."and after then i gave my adress/e-mail/telephone etc. to him.Nobody contact to me in 15 days.And then one day an e-mail: Dear Mr. Durusu, First of all I would like to apologize for my late response and I hope I haven't caused you any inconvenience because of it.Other than that I am sorry to report to you that Grand Hotel AmrÃ¢th Amsterdam is not inclined to offer you compensation for the damaged goods mentioned in our conversation and the e-mail you've sent us.The reason for this is that after you had vacated the room our staff thoroughly inspected the sewage leakage mentioned by you that morning and found out that no such thing took place in room #031 either before, during or after your stay with us. Instead they found that a great amount of soda was spilt on the carpet in the room. After cleaning this soda stain no sign of sewage leakage has presented itself.Once again I would like to offer my sincere apologies for my late response and the unfortunate situation you've been in while staying at Grand Hotel AmrÃ¢th Amsterdam. If you have any further queries please don't hesitate to contact me directly. Kindest regards, GRAND HOTEL AMRÃ‚TH AMSTERDAM THEIR LATE RESPONSE AND ANSWER IS REALLY AMAZING. I STAYED ONLY ONE NIGHT AND I WAS OUT ALL DAY. I CAME BACK MY ROOM AT MIDNIGHT TO SLEEP. SO SOMEBODY ENTERED MY ROOM AND SPILT A HUGE AMOUNT OF SODA. BECAUSE THERE WERE TWO BOTTLES OF SODA IN THE ROOM'S REFRIGERATOR.ALSO NOBODY(IF NOT MENTALLY DEFECTIVE) DAMAGE HIS OWN BELONGINGS.( ESPECIALLY IMPRORTANT THINGS LIKE LAPTOP(CONTAINS IMPORTANT FILES), PASSPORT ETC.) I HAVE NEVER SEEN THAT KIND OF THING. FROM NOW ON, I AM VERY SORRY FOR THE THINGS THAT I WILL DO(LEGALLY SPEAKING) FOR TAKING MY RIGHTS. I RECOMMEND YOU THAT PLEASE SHARE THIS REVIEW WITH EVERYONE AND DON'T STAY IN THAT TERRIBLE HOTEL.

Reviews.Title: “Loved every single thing about this hotel.”
Reviews.Author: FOB1968
Reviews.Content: The staff at the hotel was polite, welcoming and friendly. They helped us with everything we needed and helped us to get to an appointment in time. The hotel is located in a very beautiful building with the original Art Nouveau style. The wellness facilities were very nice and in working order. We will surely stay there next time we're in Amsterdam.

Reviews.Title: “Location location location”
Reviews.Author: Hend14
Reviews.Content: Attractive older building. Really close to train station. Good location for the coffee shops, red light district and bars. Room service was a disappointment, rude and took ages. Free mini bar which was stocked daily.

Reviews.Title: “funky room but very cool”
Reviews.Author: michaeledwards7
Reviews.Content: We only stayed on night. It was small with no AC but we were there when it was cool at night. The room was very odd shaped but had super high ceilings which offset the smallness. Overall it was a great experience and would definitely stay again. The location was awesome! The building had very interesting history and was definitely a 'do-over'.

Reviews.Title: “3 or4 star?”
Reviews.Author: anne w
Reviews.Content: Claims to be 5 star, have stayed there before and enjoyed its central location plus its very near the centraal station. this was a special trip to celebrate a significant birthday. We asked for a canal side room but additional e mails to confirm all this were bounced back. I am not a person inclined to make a fuss but our room , on 1st floor, was small, an odd shape and quite claustrophobic so I asked for an alternative and was offered a 3rd floor room which was much better, but at a cost of 30 euros a night extra, plus tax of course! Staff were civil and quite pleasant but a genuine smile would have been nice. room was not serviced until 4pm on 2 days but staff came round at 9pm to see if we required more toilet paper or towels! Reading this I sound like a really moany person but we were really quite disappointed, but the last time we were there, as I recall, the hotel had just opened. Building is beautifull next to a canal, not far from the red light distrct, st niclas church, 5 mins walk away has beautiful choir services in the evening.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect location, wonderful accommodations!”
Reviews.Author: travelingcouple28
Reviews.Content: This was our second stay at the Grand Hotel Amrath in Amsterdam and once again it was spectacular! It is the perfect location (near the train station) and the hotel is gorgeous! The rooms have floor to ceiling windows (which open and that is very important since the rooms are typically warmer than most would like). The bathrooms are clean, spacious and have tubs that are large enough for a couple to relax in after a full-day of sight-seeing. It is a wonderful hotel that I would certainly recommend and if and when we return to Amsterdam we will definitely stay here again!

Reviews.Title: “I will picture that room in my dreams...always!”
Reviews.Author: VTFOODIE555
Reviews.Content: I cant say enough! The rooms are breathtaking with 20ft ceilings, sweeping quaint city views from grand windows that open to the lively night air. All of my discretionary spending will go into making this a yearly destination.

Reviews.Title: “2nd Stay and Just as good as first”
Reviews.Author: ShelldonR
Reviews.Content: Excellent hotel, lovely rooms and service always clean. Location is perfect whether first or tenth trip to Amsterdam great transport links Not much needed to say if you can stay here!

Reviews.Title: “Great location, staff and stunning Art Deco Building”
Reviews.Author: leonlion
Reviews.Content: Great location near the central railway station, ideal just 5 mins walk around the corner. Great access to all of Amsterdam via the pleasant side streets and canals behind the hotel. Hotel itself is stunning huge Art Deco and all rooms are large and ornate. Stayed over Valentines this year, staff were very friendly, despite some other reviews they couldn't do enough to help us. Another plus point ... free, well stocked Mini Bar & Nespresso machine. I will book here again next time I go to Amsterdam.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Shiny714
Reviews.Content: It was a challenge at first. Nobody showed me to my room, so I didn't know you had to insert the key card into the wall to get any power. It was freezing in the room and I called for help. A staff member came up and showed me the heaters and the power solution. After that, it was all a wonderful stay. The bed, bathroom and room service were all good. I slept wonderfully and the inclusive mini bar was well used and restocked. The food was great. I loved the Bittenballin'. Check out was easy, and I was greeted appropriately daily.

Reviews.Title: “Lots of plus points but falls short of it's 5 star rating”
Reviews.Author: Jenny R
Reviews.Content: Pros: Close to Central Station, imposing bedroom and bathroom with high ceilings, fixtures and fittings. excellent bed and bedding, 3 pin UK socket, free mini-bar (loved the nougat), quiet, very friendly and helpful concierges. Cons: Reception staff not very welcoming or friendly, location for city centre, no bedroom drawers, faults with the bathroom such as dim lighting, shower not very formidable and screen leaked water onto the floor, no magnifying mirror or shaver socket. Recommendation: if you don't have breakfast at the hotel try the Cafe Waterloo, good food, excellent service, reasonably priced.

Reviews.Title: “Quirky but cool hotel”
Reviews.Author: mattperk
Reviews.Content: Not your normal Hotel but a beatiful old building. The location isn't in the center of the city, but close enough to walk to everything. Also, it is in a quiet section, if there is such a thing in Amsterdam. We rented the 'junior suite', which had a great bay window overlooking the river and on into the city. The staff was often busy and we waited on them often to help us out. However, they gave us great reccomendations for dinner and local events. A great place for couples getting away to see the city.....but a bit pricey....

Reviews.Title: “Not Great, but nice if you want to stay near Central Station.”
Reviews.Author: Vic7272
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Amrath Hotel in Amsterdam for 7 nights for a business trip. The good - 1. It's very close to the central station, and lots of restaurants, but it's not actually IN the red light district, so you avoid all most of the really loud crowds. It's also on a fairly major street, so getting a taxi to get where you are going was really easy. 2. The Nepresso machine in the room was good, and it was refilled 2 times a day. Since I used it quite a bit we were happy with the quality. However, I had to filch milk from the office I was working in because I never saw the people who refilled and they only left 2 a day. 3. Free Mini bar and WiFi. Very nice for a working a working trip. And the mini bar is filled 1 time a day every day, not just 1 time during your visit. Lovely. 4. The room was a bit small, but well decorated, and the separate tub shower was really nice. Lots of counter space for everything, and a REAL hairdryer! The okay - 1. This hotel is right at the edge of the Red Light district, so to get anything to eat you have to walk into the coffee shops etc. If you are there are play this might be fun, but for a single person, the after a busy night was not too pleasant, and you are a hike from any shops that aren't absolutely geared for tourists. 2. The picture of the spa area looks fantastic. In reality it's quite small, and the workout room is small as well. I had to wait 20 minutes to get on a bike. Luckily it was nice enough most of my visit to just walk outside. 3. Breakfast is 30 Euros for the buffet, and you can't order off a separate menu, except through room service. However the buffet is nice, includes good latte's, and you can order your eggs how you like them, so no dry scrambled from the chafing dishes. The bad - 1. I got the cheapest room they had, which is interior to a court yard. The building is an odd triangle shape so there are windows onto a "courtyard". The thermostat was set to heat, and I could not make it cool down, and the room had 1 window that opened about 1 inch, and since the window wasn't outside there was 0 fresh air. The room ended up being REALLY stuffy. The last night the room was so hot it was almost unsleepable. If you stay here, make SURE you get a room on the exterior of the building. 2. My husband meet me for 2 nights on the way to work in Austria himself. He spent one afternoon in the bar, where he reported the food was bland and the service was slow. However, the beer was good. 3. The "wardrobe" is a joke. It has 2 tiny little sides to hang things with a few drawers. Barely enough for me, must less 2 of us. Basically this is a interesting old hotel. Don't bother if you can't upgrade to a nicer room. And if you are on business, or with a family this is not the area of Amsterdam you want to be in, look elsewhere.

Reviews.Title: “stunning interior,wonderful room and stay in great location”
Reviews.Author: tag1984_11
Reviews.Content: this wonderful building and hotel made the weekend for us (couple on weekend break) - super comfy beds - free upgrade - lovely friendly staff - free mini-bar (that was topped up during our weekend stay) - free beautiful sauna, steam room, pool and jacuzzi downstairs - free wifi - super shower and bathroom with dressing area joining bathroom and bedroom (room 322) great location, only a short stroll to red light district and centre of things, but just far enough away that you can appreciate views of canal or city (depending on your room). hotel interior is absolutely stunning! Other reviews comment about the prices of the breakfast - however, from research prior to trip, this seems to be a common theme in Amsterdam hotels, so it's recommended to get your breakfast out and about rather than paying the hotel prices. Even though this hotel made our weekend, we got this on a special offer via a third party website.. not sure if I'd be enticed enough to pay the full room price!

Reviews.Title: “Not worth the money”
Reviews.Author: tulpen
Reviews.Content: I chose Grand Hotel Amrath for the location and it's uniqueness but apart from that I was not impressed. I found pubic hairs in the bathtub, a moldy shower, scarred countertops, and smelly , dark corridors. The "business center" was a small room with a few computers, a printer, and very bad lighting. Not what I consider a real business center.

Reviews.Title: “clarify breakfast status”
Reviews.Author: judy j
Reviews.Content: Hotel was great, staff friendly and helpful. BUT, We thought breakfast was included. The first morning in the dining room, they said it was not. We had breakfast that morning. The rest of the week stay we ate elsewhere or brought something in. While I do not mind paying for quality, $50.00 for two did not seem like a good value. We also checked with the desk clerk and were told it was not included. When we checked out the clerk saw the one day breakfast charge on the bill and removed it as it was supposed to be included. Our room was next to an old elevator bank that just went up and down creaking and grinding all day. Our view was of a parking lot. The mini bar liquor was not replaced for three days as it was a weekend and holiday and they ran out. This is a very nice perk which you come to expect. The electric curtains open and shut of their own volition. Not so great if you are trying to sleep in. I would stay again, the staff including housekeeping were great. The room was large, attractive and comfortable. I would definitely clarify details on breakfast and views.

Reviews.Title: “Is any body there?”
Reviews.Author: robert b
Reviews.Content: stayed at the Amrath last week for 3 nites.. when we arrived at 5 pm there was only one person at the desk he was laughing on his cell phone for approx 5 minutes while my friend and I waited to check in... This older man did not even look up to acknowledge that we were there. When he hung up he pointed to a room across the hall where we sat down at a table to register...The staff is very un interested in their guests... this is a long shot from a 5 star Hotel...travelers beware. stay at the Marriott, its around the corner...however the beds are excellent

Reviews.Title: “Quirky, friendly with some lovely touches. 4 not 5 star.”
Reviews.Author: ianjindal
Reviews.Content: This is an impressive building - a 30s/gothic 'wedge' across from the central station, with a major road on the one side, the quiet canals on the other, with the red light district a few blocks away and large offices in the other direction. Up close you're struck by the quality of the build - interesting bricks/tiles and lovingly-burnished wooden fittings. The staff are immensely friendly from outside the door, via reception to, well, just everyone. The interior layout is quirky - it feels like an interior from 1984 or Brazil that's been refurb'd, leaving the underlying inflexible oddness of the building untouched. As a result the room are utterly weirdly shaped. Mine (407) was a 'dog-leg' shape with a small bedroom area (large by Parisian standards ;) ) then a seating area then an immense and lovely bathroom. Odd, but charming. I really liked it. Some excellent touches deserve special credit: 1) free, good-quality wi-fi throughout. Bravo! 2) free mini-bar. Everything in the mini-bar is included within the room rate and it's replenished every day. Lovely touch, instead of being gouged â‚¬10 for water etc. So - wonderful so far. My only caveat is that this is not a 5-star hotel. It's a characterful, friendly 4-star in a memorable building. It's therefore at least 20% overpriced if you're paying rack rate. With a good price/deal I would love to stay here again. Without that there are other interesting hotels in Amsterdam I'd prefer. Tip therefore is to watch out for deals :)

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful hotel”
Reviews.Author: carobrooB-W
Reviews.Content: We had a fabulous time in Amsterdam. We had two rooms and they were both extremely comfortable. We all loved having the free minibar and Nespresso machine. The staff could not have been more helpful. The hotel is very close to the station and the tram. The staff at the hotel will help you to find great restaurants, hire bicycles and sell you tickets to the museums so that you do not need to queue.

Reviews.Title: “a good hotel, but I did not like the design”
Reviews.Author: ciciuzza
Reviews.Content: Amrath is a good hotel, maybe not a 5 stars hotel. the building is an ancient one so, I would say it is a little bit spectral with its hall and architecture. rooms are a little bit spectral as well, a very dark design, not my style I have to say. Services are very good. the bed with lot of pillows is wonderful, as well as the free use of coffee machine, tea maker and the room bar free of charges. I appreciated Wifi free everywhere and the little business center with Pc and printer always available. Location is very good, close by the central station in Amsterdam and also to Dam square.

Reviews.Title: “Amsterdam Holiday 2011”
Reviews.Author: LionessSue
Reviews.Content: The holiday unfortunately got off to a bad start when my partner's passport + some money were stolen from a bag right outside Amsterdam's Centraal station just as soon as we arrived. However, after reporting this to the local police we went to the hotel. It is in a stunning building and is in a perfect location, just round the corner from all the shops cafes attractions and transport links to other parts of Amsterdam. However, we had an upsetting experience there on check in as they could not find our booking. I showed them the confirmation from Lastminute.com of booking and full payment in advance, 4+ half months previously. They admitted that but asked us to wait in the bar while they sorted it out and told us we would be given a free drink to make up for the inconvenience. We were waiting 25 minutes and nobody from the bar came to us or knew about the free drink. My partner asked them again and they said that they had "found us a room" but did not appear to have found our original booking. I made sure this "replacement" room was the same grade as what we had already paid for. That was confirmed. However what we found most upsetting was the fact that they asked us for credit card details in order to pay for any extras we may spend at hotel as we were there on a room only basis. However we only have debit cards and they then said that they would not just take a "print" of the card + bill us at the end of our stay but would take out immediately EU400 ( about Â£350 ) and refund any unspent money at check out. We thought that was very cheeky and unfair as if we were being penalised for "only" having debit cards. None of this was mentioned in any of the booking information or on the hotel's own website. Especially after the theft of the money that afternoon this was a "double whammy" and upset us both. However, the rest of the stay there was lovely. The staff were polite and helpful. The room was in a nice quiet area and had a free mini bar. They even provided a beautiful cake and bottel of champagne for my partner's 50th Birthday in the middle of our 1 week stay.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful views, high ceilings, and luxury.”
Reviews.Author: KimMarch
Reviews.Content: The hotel was a fabulous old merchant shipping/banking building with lots of history and a good location. Despite being in the middle of the city it was quiet and the views of the canals are fabulous. The only slight complaint was that my room didn't have a bath only a shower and I like to sit and soak after all the travel.

Reviews.Title: “Amazing building and room marred by dire service”
Reviews.Author: heleneinlondon
Reviews.Content: The Grand Hotel Amrath is a stunning art deco building with gorgeous rooms and some brilliant additional perks like a free minibar, Nespresso machine and free wifi. Unfortunately, we were left hanging around in reception for 25 minutes while waiting to check in. During this period I counted that no fewer than six uniformed members of staff utterly ignored us, without even a "sorry to keep you waiting, we'll be with you shortly". The staff seemed lacking in warmth and this made an expensive experience seem less than luxurious.

Reviews.Title: “Would stay there again”
Reviews.Author: bos6116
Reviews.Content: Stayed there for four nights in October. The hotel has three advantages. First, the location is great: across from Centraal Station, within ten minutes from the Dam, and a few minutes from the Nieuwmarkt area. Second, the rooms are great, bed and beddings are very comfy. Third, the staff was very accommodating. When we checked in, we realized that they had given us a room with one king-size bed, instead of two twin beds. In addition, the room was on the first floor with "city view," i.e., facing the road. As such, it was very loud. We requested a change, and were accommodated immediately, this time in a room facing the canal. The new room still had a king-size bed, but the staff brought in an additional single bed. The room was very large by European standards. Would stay there again, except for the noisy, "city view" rooms.

Reviews.Title: “We loved this hotel!”
Reviews.Author: Cindyfromvirginia
Reviews.Content: First time visitors to Amsterdam. The Amrath is located well, has an impressive lobby and accomodating staff. Willem the concierge was particularly helpful in arranging tours and transportation. Central Station and Dam Square are close by, about three blocks. Good central location. Most comfortable hotel bed we've ever slept in with incredible linens. The mini-bar is a fantastic touch. It was refilled daily and the selection of beverages is extensive. The food in the restaurant and lounge is tasty. The staff are very helpful and pleasant also. In particular, the breakfast buffet is wonderful with lots of options.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely stay in Sunny Amsterdam”
Reviews.Author: Durdanny
Reviews.Content: I stayed here for 4 nights in October and was blessed with lovely sunny weather for my stay. The welcome at the Amrath was efficient and businesslike if not warm which is to be expected. The room and facilities were excellent I especially liked the fact that the internet connection worked well on all devices. The late afternoon call to see if any more tea or coffee was needed was also much appreciated. All the staff I encountered were courteous and eager to help when asked. I didn't try the breakfasts as at 25E each this was simply too expensive but they did look lovely. The location of the hotel was fine being close to the station but the best part of the whole experience was the wonderful architecture and features of this landmark art deco building.

Reviews.Title: “Location location location!”
Reviews.Author: alwaysonvacation_35
Reviews.Content: The Amrath is directly across from Centraal Station and the Hop On Hop Off bus stop is at the front door. The Amrath is an old trade market and some of the old architecture is still in place. Simply beautiful - grand hotel. The rooms are very comfortable and the staff is friendly. The food was not exceptionally great but the hotel was in close proximity to restaurants and other food outlets.

Reviews.Title: “Not a five star, but pretty good”
Reviews.Author: Larry S
Reviews.Content: Very cool old building (a shipping company) renovated as a hotel. It has everything it needs to be a five star hotel, except the one key ingredient....service! hey are still fairly new, so maybe it will come in time, but it's definitely not there yet. Check-in is really chaotic, restaurant and bell staff seem to be too busy to help the guests.

Reviews.Title: “Some good, some bad”
Reviews.Author: Alanheg
Reviews.Content: Lovely room to start with, as had requested quiet room, and confirmed this on check-in. Staff very helpful. Builders on our balcony walking by our window and working from early, despite requests for quiet room. This happened two mornings in a row. Moved room to another lovely room, bar the lack of a slower or shower curtain in the bath, so bathroom got destroyed with each shower.....after a morning of cycling we returned to hotel to use the spa and relax. We were greeted with loud techno music on entry, we persisted, and got in the jacuzzi. We discovered numerous beer can s throughout the spa. A Gang of lads had taken over spa. I raised this with the two spa attendants sitting having a chat, and I was interrupting them. Upon checkout I raised our various issues, and it didn't seem like the hotel were too bothered. It was a shame because witha little tweaking hotel could be top notch.

Reviews.Title: “More than perfect!”
Reviews.Author: Titamxnl
Reviews.Content: Good location near Amsterdam centraal. Friendly, helpful and polite staff Amazing room. I stayed in a superior deluxe. Free minibar. Loved the bed for two persons. Comfy Nice decoration. Fast roomservice and delicious food. Quick check in check out. Lovely structure. Nice spa. Totally worth it.

Reviews.Title: “First Class Accomodations”
Reviews.Author: ahbaggins
Reviews.Content: The hotel is in a great location, close to central station. The King size bed was extreamely comfortable, huge soaker tub and free mini bar. The pool, hot tub and saunaâ€™s were very nice. Robes and slippers in the room were a nice touch. My only issue is that they had a gigantic bouquet of lilies in the lobby and I am very allergic. So I was not able to visit any amenities on the first floor (bar or restaurant) as I had to run to the elevator so I could breath. I would recommend this hotel to anyone and would definitely stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Serious OMG territory”
Reviews.Author: jmaison
Reviews.Content: The building is truly beautiful, built in 1912 when architectural excess was still the rage - my only complaint was there weren't enough photos of what it looked like as a shipping office. All the details of the hotel are original (or reconstructed) from the 1912 building, and it would have been so interesting to see what it looked like then, how the architects figured out how to turn it into a hotel, etc. I didn't know about the beauty of the building when I booked, other than the picture showed a beautiful building. I was blown away with the reality of the place, though. I booked because I was in love with the stars; I wanted to stay in a 5-star hotel and I think this one delivered. What sold me was the free wi-fi and free minibar, replenished every day. I think that is a great selling point, since other places charge for those. Yes, it was expensive, though I think I got a deal through booking.com, and it wasn't any worse and many times better than other 5 stars in Amsterdam (why are hotels so expensive there?). The hotel upgraded us and our room was beautiful, with its deep dormer window it was like being in an artist's garret, though with more space. Our breakfast table and chairs were elevated on a little stage under the window and it was wonderful to sit there and drink the free wine from the minibar in the evening before figuring out dinner or going to the spa. We were on the canal view side. The bathroom was huge, with a huge, deep bathtub and very nice shower; two sinks. The bed linens were divine and the towels were big enough to dry yourself three times over. The bed was so very comfy I didn't even care about going outside. and I loved the free wi-fi and, most of all, the free minibar. The wellness center was very nice. Though the hot tub is not hot (wonder what that's about?), the pool under the starry lit ceiling, the steam room and saunas were great. Had a great massage at a really great price. The staff was cheerfully helpful; everyone trying to make sure we had a great stay. We did, and we recommend it highly.

Reviews.Title: “Great Stay!”
Reviews.Author: Dan B
Reviews.Content: We stayed for three nights in early October. The room (deluxe/city view) was great! It had a king sized bed, free mini bar (restocked daily), the bathroom seemed to be brand new, and there was great view of the canal. The one drawback was that the room smelled like BO. Personally, I am pretty sensitive to smells so it may have impacted me more than others. Despite the smell I would still stay at this hotel again. The location is very convenient to public transportation, if you don't want to walk to one of the man y attractions in the city, it is very easy to get a tram. The concierge was very helpful. He reccomended a fantastic Indonesian restaurant and booked a reservation for us. We did not eat at the hotel as the prices seemed a little high, but we prefer dining out anyway. And the bed was SUPER comfortable. If we had more time there I may have just stayed in bed a whole day. We visited the spa and it was clean and well equipped. I especially enjoyed the steam room. Oh, and one last thing. I read a lot of reviews about hotels in Amsterdam being generally noisy. We did not hear a single person the whole time we were in our room. Almost as if we had the whole place to ourselves. Overall, I would highly reccomend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Unique Property, Super Close to Train Station, Great Deal from Orbitz”
Reviews.Author: tortugas2x
Reviews.Content: Stayed for one week in October. Lucked out with an air/hotel package on Orbitz. As a single traveller I got a nice, big room with a king size bed, sitting area, big bathroom with HUGE soaking tub, robe, slippers and nice toiletries. WOW! (this has never happened to me in Europe before!!!) Many reviews say they are generous with upgrades, but I asked for canal view and was denied. Asked again next day, offered to upgrade for 30E a night. :-( But, as we were checking out, someone checking in had the same request and they said yes. So try your luck! Anyway, loved the location, very close to train/trams. As other reviewers have noted, breakfast at 25E is CRAZY expensive. But, there is free in-room coffee and minibar, so go buy yourself a bag of stroopwaffels or get some croissants from AE and you can at least get out the door in the morning. I didn't find any decent bfast places for a "sit down" bfast nearby. Without exception I found hotel staff to be friendly and helpful, nice people. I did not dine at the restaurants but did hit the hotel bar a few times for an evening drink, and it has a great view of the canal and a nice, low key vibe. Prices in here were reasonable. I also managed to hit the sauna area and that was nice as well. Steam didn't seem to be working, but 2 levels of dry saunas were roasting hot, and body temp pool was nice. Oh and internet worked great, signal very strong/fast and I was on the fourth floor. One nit-pick, they do something with the mattresses when people checkout, not sure what? But lots of times you will see mattresses stacked in the hall for most of the day. Maybe they are checking or preventing bedbugs? Dunno, but it was blocking doors a couple times = fire hazard. Just keep in mind that 5star in Europe is NOT 5star in the states, but this place was really nice, and i would stay again anytime.

Reviews.Title: “Great if you are on a deal”
Reviews.Author: SomersetAmber
Reviews.Content: My partner and I stayed for three nights at the Grand Hotel Amrath on a room only basis (we booked a relatively last minute flight and hotel deal online). The hotel has been converted from an early 20th century shipping office and has a unique character, which as an architect, I really enjoyed. It is a short walk from the Central Station and so very easy to get to, but if I were to stay in Amsterdam again, I might choose to stay on the other side of the city, as we found that most of the bars and restaurants that we wanted to go to were on the other side and we had to walk through busy shopping areas and the red light district to get to them! Amsterdam city centre is not very big and it felt pretty safe so it was not such a big deal for us. Even though it is a 5 star hotel, the concierge staff were refreshingly relaxed and cheerful, and also polite and very helpful with directions and recommendations. We did not use the restaurant, which seemed empty most of the time. However, we did make use of the Wellness Centre in the basement, which has a small pool, 4 person jacuzzi, large sauna and steam room (lacking hot steam). We had the facilities virtually to ourselves, but had there been more than a dozen people there, it could have felt busy. We had a standard double room on the fourth floor on the canal side - you could not really say that it had a canal view as it was so high up that it overlooked the building site on the other side of the canal. Nevertheless it suited us, as it was very quiet. I would not have considered paying the quoted room rate, but it seemed very good value for the deal we were on. We were pleasantly surprised that the mini-bar in our room was all-inclusive and was refreshed every day. Also, the room had a little coffee machine in it, which provided reasonable coffee. All in all, it was a great hotel for a short city break and I would not hesitate to recommend it.

Reviews.Title: “Best bathroom encountered in Europe but service was questionable”
Reviews.Author: peter49_10
Reviews.Content: The best things about this hotel were both its close location to the train station and the bathroom which was very welcome to a North American with two sinks and a shower stall as well as a separate tub and the shower stall had lots of water pressure. Other than that we were very disappointed. There are about 6 entry steps to the hotel - we noticed the staff at the door made themselves scarce as we approached with our luggage. The bellhop of course reappeared to take our luggage to the room and get the tip and now being alert to this we looked when checking out and again the bellhops scattered when we went to go down the stairs with the luggage and so we did it ourselves. We were in room 35 which is on the ground level and is very noisy with both vehicular and pedestrian traffic from 6 AM to 2AM. After the first night we advised the front desk that the coffee maker did not work, the toilet was leaking and one sink was not draining. Returning later that day we smelt cigarette smoke in our non-smoking room and then noticed there was a partially drank cup of coffee with ashes on the saucer - the person who had come to fix the coffee maker had enjoyed a smoke and coffee - the coffee maker if fixed made the worst coffee ever and of course the sink and toilet were not fixed. Lastly I went to use a towel and upon opening it there was a piece of dried excrement in it. We had to ask to have the room cleaned on two days as it had not been done. We did not eat at the hotel or use any of the other hotel services. For such a highly rated hotel we were very disappointed with the staff - the hotel is very nice, the room was well furnished, comfortable and a good size.

Reviews.Title: “Amazing Amrath”
Reviews.Author: 255sarah
Reviews.Content: I was really glad to come on here to see that other travellers had given such great reviews. This hotel is absolutely amazing!! We arrived at the hotel at 8:30 following an early flight and they were so accomodating, telling us that they would send up a maid immediately to clean our room. For the whole trip, we had amazing service and we felt like the staff really wanted to make sure we had a great vacation. The rooms are specatcular, the spa facilities lovely and the location is ideal (about a 10 minute walk from the station).

Reviews.Title: “Grand as the name implies”
Reviews.Author: 9Jeanette
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Grand for 3 nights before our river cruise. The location of this hotel was perfect if arriving by train from the airport and also for going to the river cruise as both are walking distance, depending on luggage, but only 6 Euros if you don't want to walk. The reception when we arrived was most professional and our room was ready immediately and was the most luxurious and unusual we have been in. The building is a heritage listed converted shipping warehouse, beautifully restored and full of character with all the special touches one would expect from a 5 star hotel. The room and bathroom were fitted out to a very high standard and the free mini bar a welcome treat. The wellness centre was also included and comprised of all the expected steam and sauna rooms as well as an indoor pool and gym. The concierge needs a special mention as he was most helpful in explaining maps, organising taxis and ensuring the dock of the river boat was accurate. Overall this hotel was perfect for us, as it was so close to all the main attractions and restaurants as well. I would definitely stay here again and highly recommend it.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful hotel, lovely historic building!”
Reviews.Author: SuzyfromSoFlo
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Grand Hotel Amrath during our recent Europe vacation. It was the prelude to our Rhine River cruise. Loved this hotel, the building is beautiful, inside and out. It has the most amazing art deco windows and fixtures throughout! The "check-in" desk in kind of a wierd space, no "real" lobby but thats not a big deal really. We stayed in a 4th floor room with what they said were 2 twin beds (but the beds were pushed together so it actually seemed like a queen bed :) had a nice view of the canal and the city! There was a large bath with robes and slippers included, nice touch. The soaker tub felt especially nice after walking around the city all day, it was nice and long for my tall frame and extra deep, super! The Nespresso machine was enjoyed by me and my husband loved the free mini bar. The only complaint I have is the light bulbs were rather dim making the room dark and the light switches were confusing. We didn't eat here as there are so many great options nearby, around the corner we found a breakfast buffet at another restaurant (which was under another hotel) for around 9 euro's pp. It included coffee, tea and juices so it was a bargain. All in all this is a great hotel in a very walkable location, near the train station, the port, shopping and historic sites. Nice stay!

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful old hotel”
Reviews.Author: Richard57
Reviews.Content: remodelled but keeps the charm. 18ft high ceilings in the bedroom. quaint bar with great food. Staff are pleasant and helpful. The spa is very nice and Jose gives an excellent sports massage. I also recommend a private boat tours. Ask the concierge. Only problems are need to reboot your computer to get the internet connection bar when it disconnects you for inactivity. Need to haul your bags up about 7 steps to get to reception.

Reviews.Title: “ok but not the best”
Reviews.Author: Kobuck1369
Reviews.Content: This is an interesting hotel that is in a former shipping business building. It has some very interesting architecture in the lobby, hallways, and rooms that looks and is mostly likely original. The rooms have very high ceilings, which gives the room a spacious and luxurious feelings and the bathrooms are "want-a-be" high-end bathrooms. The mini-bar in the room is free and restocked every day, which is nice. The bed is comfortable. There is a safe on the rooms. The room does have english speaking TV -- which is nice. I paid for the city view -- beware of what this means. City View is simply defined as a room with a view that is not of the interior. As such our "city view" looked out over the city -- but the city bus station. In fact if your room is on a particular side they will all look out over the bus station. The other side looks out over a canal and has an excellent view. After the first night we asked to be changed and they did move us, to a slightly smaller room, but with a decent view. I could give up a little space for the canal view -- and you should too. Its worth it. The staff is helpful, but not "out of your way helpful." They have helpful suggestions, but if you are an active traveler then you can easily find your way. It should be noted that upon arrival they charge $400 to your credit card as a "deposit" -- which they said they would credit back after we left if we did not have a bill. Also every day they continued to charge $100. So be aware of this and have plenty of "space" on your credit card for these charges. The only disaster was the suggestion by the hotel to go on a day excursion out of the city. Do not do this. It was a horrible experience. The buses are jammed with people, seats are way too small, my ear phone did not work and so I could not understand a word on the trip. Do NOT do the excursions. It is a waste of your money -- or as I like to think of it a creative way to steal your money. The wellness center -- pool etc. area is excellent. The water in the hot tub was a bit cold for me, but the pool is VERY nice. The steam room and sauna is large, spacious, and relaxing. It was not over crowded when we were there. The hotel is located near central station, which is helpful if you took the train from the airport, but we found we never went back again. In hind sight, I wished we had gotten a hotel in the middle of the city so we did not have to walk so much. However, if you like a hotel a little apart from the craziness of the inner city then you might like this one. The Red Light district is literally 2 blocks away -- so everything in the northern part of Amsterdam is very accessible. Was this room worth $300-350 US dollars? NO not at all. Maybe worth $200-250 a night if that. When I was at the hotel I saw a CNN report that said Amsterdam hotels are some of the most expensive in Europe. So there you go! All in all, a good time, the hotel is not shabby by no means, just not high class.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely building and location but not 5 star”
Reviews.Author: Sheila F
Reviews.Content: I originally reviewed this hotel unfavourably following our stay there in August 2011. The main issue was that our room was unbearably hot and uncomfortable due to lack of ventilation/a climate control system that didn't work. We complained and the situation was somewhat alleviated following maintenance people cleaning the filters. However, we received no follow up contact regarding that and our pointing out that there was dirty cutlery littering the floor outside our room and we considered the general attitude of staff was disinterested. I was pleased to receive "sincere apologies" for our experience from a representative of the hotel and that our feedback would be shared in all teams. I was also told that, to replace our trust in the company, following any alteration to my Trip Advisor review, we would be offered a two night complimentary stay at the hotel. My partner and I are pleased with the apology offered but wish to put the experience behind us and will not be taking up the kind offer.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic Hotel - Fantastic Location”
Reviews.Author: JulieBirdie
Reviews.Content: Location: 5 mins from train station - out of main entrance, turn left, cross the road and you will see this very imposing building. Hotel entrance & reception: strange no real lobby area to sit around and relax - receptionist very efficient and polite. Room: Ask for Room 200 it a WOW! Large 4 poster bed and very very comfortable, huge windows with electric curtains, flat screen tv and all the extra's robe, slippers, etc etc. Including a excellent complimentary mini bar - replenshed every day. Bathroom amazing - glass box in this large room with huge bath, walk-in shower, double sinks. Breakfast - loads of choice and very good - although not sure I would pay â‚¬25.00 if it wasn't included in the room rate. Spa was lovely too - nice start to the day. Overall would recommend this hotel - but you have to appreciate the building to enjoy your stay.

Reviews.Title: “Not 5 star”
Reviews.Author: ralphine1
Reviews.Content: I did not have a good experience at this hotel. I arrived and my booking was not there despite booking it on the hotels own website. Fortunately I had the confirmation on my phone but the receptionist seemed angry that I was right and did not apologise. My room was fine but with inadequate toiletries for a business stay in a 5 star hotel. Body wash and body lotion only and no face washer or sponge. I rang and booked for dinner in the restaurant. I arrived on time and the restaurant was closed. The woman who took the booking told me she thought I wouldn't mind having the set menu in the bar. I then asked for directions to a restauant near by and was given the wrond directions and wandered around for some time trying to find a place to eat that wasn't booked out at 8pm on a Saturday. When I returned and explained what had happened I was told that I least I found something. Again no apology. It was extremely disappointing. I had come from the Amrath in Maastricht where the staff were very friendly and helpful so I feel this is not good enough and not 5 star.

Reviews.Title: “I loved staying at this hotel”
Reviews.Author: deegirl46
Reviews.Content: The room was great ..the free mini bar was awsome ..the beds so comphy..I'm defanitly going back...had a great stay. Thanks amrath

Reviews.Title: “Nice property, but...”
Reviews.Author: SDtraveler25
Reviews.Content: The rooms are large and nice however the staff is not very friendly. Upon our arrival we were put on the first floor on a major street. Needless to say the bus stop and pedestrians walking by all night were not conducive to sleep. After several calls over two days to staff and management and then trip advisor the hotel finally moved us to a higher floor.

Reviews.Title: “Very unique, Great location”
Reviews.Author: before13
Reviews.Content: Loved everything about this hotel. Picked it for it's gorgeous Artdeco design and walking distance to the city center. Beautifully decorated suite, big comfortable bed, large bathroom w/ free internet and mini bar. The staff was very helpful and friendly. Looking forward to staying there again.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely but serious flaws”
Reviews.Author: Hiro W
Reviews.Content: The hotel is beautiful and the rooms are spacious and well-decorated (I stayed in a Deluxe City View room for three nights), but this is by no means a 5-star hotel. From the start, there were some inconveniences (it took them 20 minutes to find my reservation; the electronic key system was broken), but the staff was friendly so it wasn't a big deal. I was happy with the room at first, but there were issues that got worse and worse: 1. The glass door to the shower was broken. 2. The fan in the bathroom was very loud and could not be turned off. 3. The water pressure in the shower was poor, so I decided to take a bath, but the hot water ran out before the tub was filled. 4. The television was possessedâ€”it would turn itself on and off in the night, so I had to unplug it. 5. The electronic curtains were also possessedâ€”they closed themselves several times for no reason. 6. There were no hand towels or wash cloths in the room (only bath towels), and when I used up the bath gel and cotton swabs, they were not replenished. 7. I notified reception of some of these issues. They were friendly and notified the engineer, but the problems were never fixed and no attempt at any compensation was ever made. 8. Some of the pricing is pretty outrageousâ€”35 euro for breakfast for 1 person? Seriously? 9. There is free wifi, but the service kicks you off frequently. I had to re-enter the tedious username and password over 20 times in three days. I don't mean to be entirely negative, because there are some very nice things about the hotelâ€”it's a well-restored building with beautiful architecture, the staff was polite, the room was well-designed and equipped with a free minibar and Nespresso, the view was great and the location was convenientâ€”but it is not a 5-star establishment based on my experience.

Reviews.Title: “Not very friendly”
Reviews.Author: Lex_LutherBelfast
Reviews.Content: Arrived at Grand Amrath on 17/09/11 - checked in all was going well until they wanted to charge a credit card â‚¬100 for each night I was staying, â‚¬300 in total. I was unaware of this and didn't bring any credit cards, only had my debit card. The problem with this is that they couldn't refund back onto card only give me cash when I checked out which is no use at all. Reluctantly I agreed to this, but despite entering the correct pin twice it failed. They wanted to try it again I refused otherwise my card would have been blocked resulting in no access to cash. The hotel said I could pat a â‚¬50 despoit but would not be able to charge anything to my room ( room service, bar, spa treatments) they even cut off the phone line in my room so if I had a question or problem I had to walk down to reception. We had every intention of spending â‚¬200 each on treatments but decided against this, we even refused to pay for a beer W'e would rather spend our money else where due to the embarrassment of the whole check in procedure. Nice building, handy location just a pity the staff don't seem to care about their guests and this is supposed to be 5 star?

Reviews.Title: “Amazing building. Free bar, gym and internet. Good location.”
Reviews.Author: FayeJ42
Reviews.Content: If you do not stay here, you must pop in and see the building - inside and out. Ask the concierge for a handout about its history and walk up the main stairs all the way to the top - peek in at each floor and LOOK UP at the ceiling. (The main stairs only go to the third floor, so it's not a big climb). Explore! Out hotel room was a standard American size. I looked at the room map and the room sizes were quite variable with ours being the smallest. Standard amenities for a hotel of this calliber. Clean. The mini bar was free and well stocked with drinks and a few snacks. Free, fast internet. Friendly hotel staff. Located near the Cenral Station with all major attractions within a 30 minute walk or short TRAM ride. The gym was tiny (one treadmill, one eliptical, one bike) and HOT (next to the sauna), but adequate. The pool was too small for a serious work out but fine for fun. There is a nice hot tub and steamroom. A few very minor issues: 1. No clock in the room. 2. One tiny drawer and one tiny closet. There was plenty of room for a dresser to be added. 3. One tiny hook in the bathroom and no towel racks. 4. The gym was too hot.

Reviews.Title: “Haarlem not Amsterdam”
Reviews.Author: DeniseLock
Reviews.Content: Really comfortable hotel but not in Amsterdam in next city Haarlem which is very old and very interesting in it's own right

Reviews.Title: “1st class”
Reviews.Author: dollydosh
Reviews.Content: My husband and i stayed in this hotel for 2 night pre cruise and were very pleased with everything we would definately stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Fascinating architecture & close to cruise docks”
Reviews.Author: WhippetsRule
Reviews.Content: Rooms: Extremely large with fantastic linens and bedding. All the liquor, sodas, water, etc. in the refrigerator are free including the snacks and chocolate. This is a historic hotel but the windows in the room do open. Air conditioning will not give you any "chill effect" in your room but will provide ventilation. Restaurant: This room is dimly lit yet very elegant. The breakfast is very pricey, so if you are on a budget or wanting to save money just walk out the front door of the hotel and to the left you will find many options for dutch waffles and bakery items at local eateries. Bar: Now this is the place to be. Well lit and roomy with meals served along with high tea. Bellmen and Conceirge: My 17 year old niece could not keep her eyes off these extremely handsome dutch high school and college grads. They were very eager to help you in every way with your traveling needs with big dutch smiles. Local contact info: Prins Hendrikkade 108 1011 AK Amsterdam, The Netherlands info@amrathamsterdam.com www.amrathamsterdam.com

Reviews.Title: “Different type of stay- but very pleasant”
Reviews.Author: Lillyindy
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Grand Amrath and had a very enjoyable stay. My highest points of satisfaction were the comfort of the room, the assistance of the staff, and the location. My room was small and rather ornately but old-fashionedly furnished- high ceilings with heavy drapes and big furniture made it seem a bit smaller but the bedding and pillows were very comfortable. I also give it an A+ for the complimentary mini-bar that included a few alcoholic beverages as well. The staff was very helpful in addressing my questions and needs. The location is very near central station and major tour areas and short walk to the red-light district. My main complaint was the cost of the food, especially in the restaurant. The food was good but not worth the price and the restaurant is mostly empty because of this so I would not recommend eating there. Also very small elevator and steps to get into the hotel if walking is an issue.

Reviews.Title: “Very interesting”
Reviews.Author: sandra c
Reviews.Content: Amazing hotel in old shipping company building. Huge room beautifully appointed, although Americans think the aircon is not effective enough. Nice bar, lovely breakfast area. Staff very efficient and helpful. Lifts inside, but steep steps up to the front door. Lovely views over canal.

Reviews.Title: “Really Nice Hotel, Central to Everything”
Reviews.Author: MarciaTop
Reviews.Content: I stayed here with a friend over Labor Day weekend. We chose it because it was central to everything but not too expensive, and we were really pleased with our choice. Our room was very quiet (although we did face the interior, so I can't say whether facing the street is noisier) and looked like it had been newly renovated. It was small for two people (as many hotel rooms in Europe are) but nice, with a really pretty bathroom. There were two sinks, a shower with two shower heads and a separate bath. My friend said the pool was nice, but I didn't go see it for myself. We didn't eat in the restaurant (because it was pretty expensive) but it looked nice too.) There's also free wifi and a business center to print boarding passes, along with free newspapers at reception. Aside from that, the location is great. It's close (walking distance) to the redlight district, Chinatown, Dam Square, etc. Oh, and it's close to Central Station, so you can (and we did) just take the train from the airport. There are a lot of restaurants and bars around, and of course coffee shops and sex shops. We never ended up taking the trams because everything we wanted to see was within walking distance. If I were in Amsterdam again I would certainly stay here.

Reviews.Title: “Problems after cancellation solved by hotel after reading my review on TripAdvisor”
Reviews.Author: johoroosendaal
Reviews.Content: After the hotel read my bad review the contacted me several times to ask me to change my review. They also paid back the original fee they charged us. The problem got solved thanks to my review on TripAdvisor.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely, but......nice mice.”
Reviews.Author: Gacstar
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Amrath two years ago and loved it so much that when we returned to Europe this year we made a point to stay there again. We stayed three nights in a larger room this time in which the bathroom is enclosed with glass in the middle of the next room. It is unusual and unique. The bedroom is beautiful with quality furniture, wood floors and heavy wood french doors covering the windows with beautiful lacy curtains hanging from the 14' (or more) ceiling. The solid wooden lacquered doors that lead to the room give you the feeling of a romantic European film or espionage novel. The ambiance is outstanding throughout the hotel. It's just SO beautiful and fine until..........you go into the hotel bar. We went into the bar briefly, three nights and three nights we saw mice. The first night one, then two and then three! They were scampering on the floor, sneaking from table to table! What really got me was that when we mentioned this to the staff they were unbelievably nonchalant about it! They just said "oh yeah, the mice. We try to control them" with a laugh. We were glad we did not eat in their attached restaurant this time. (We did not have this experience the first time.) There probably are issues with rodents due to the proximity of the canal to the hotel but at least the staff could pretend they care that their guests are offended (grossed out, actually) by the rodents and are serious about doing something with the mice or at least apologize! American guests do not like mice in there high priced 5 star hotels. The other issues we had were related to the room. Our phone did not work, the a/c wasn't working and there was no bar soap. We wanted to watch the US Open tennis tournament and the television didn't work. It appears the management philosophy is to do maintenance only when there are complaints. The issues took a day to resolve but the a/c issue never was. (The manager told us: "You can't hear it, you can't see it move the curtains where the vents are, you can't feel the air on you......but it's working.")?? Uh huh. Since our phone was not working we reported the TV problem directly to the desk when we went out. When we returned 5 hours later we went into the office again to inquire about our issues and were told the TV had been fixed. We tried the TV and found that it was still not working. We fiddled with it for a while and then discovered it was unplugged!!! Obviously it was never looked at and they lied about it. When we asked the front desk for bar soap for our room we were told that they were out!! (There was shampoo, bath gel and the like.) Later in our stay they brought us a box of Lanvin products which included a two inch bar of soap. We thought that perhaps the hotel would offer some gratuity for all of our trouble, but no. To top it off, when we were reviewing our bill we found a suspicious charge which we questioned. The "computer" charged us double for an item we were told. The COMPUTER charged us twice? Uh huh. Besides all of this, the concierge staff was absolutely outstanding. They were helpful beyond call, friendly, professional, knowledgeable, smartly dressed, and efficient. It was impressive that they remembered our name from our previous trip but unfortunately not impressive enough to overcome the issues and attitude we experienced with the rest of the hotel staff.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful Art Deco Hotel in a Landmark Building”
Reviews.Author: AlpinePro
Reviews.Content: This hotel was created in the Shipping House, which is an amazing historical building decorated in the Art Deco style. The renovation was done in a very respectful way that preserves many of the original features; stained glass windows, wrought iron fixtures, detailed brickwork . The location is a short walk from the central train station. The lobby is not large due to the shape of the building but was not too crowded during our stay. The reception area is located in a room adjacent to the lobby and check-in involves sitting across a large desk from the receptionist. The process was efficient and the staff were helpful. We booked two rooms for our family and both were great; spacious and very clean. The mini bars are complementary and each room has a Nespresso coffee machine, both of which were a big hit with our kids. The bathroom was well appointed and spotless. Good linens on the bed and room furniture was thoughtfully selected to complement the hotel design. Service was very good, from recommendations for restaurants to purchasing tickets for museums and galleries. We spent a very enjoyable rainy afternoon in the restaurant bar enjoying good food and drinks while watching the canal views. A very enjoyable stay in a unique hotel. Perhaps not quite a 5 star rating due to certain constraints of the building, but I would happily stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “A unique hotel with exceptional service.”
Reviews.Author: tomdelux
Reviews.Content: Everything about the hotel is exceptional from the service to the amenities. We thoroughly enjoyed our five night stay. Less than a 10 minute walk to the central train station. The staff is kind, bright and beautiful. Our room was large with every amenity that you would expect in a five star hotel; much thought was given to the furniture and finishes. We loved the complimentary mini bar. The bathroom was luxurious with a wonderful soaking tub and separate shower complete with Hans Grohe Axor hardware. Nice queen size bed with luxurious linens. The basement spa, gym and pool are wonderful and attractive too. We liked the restaurant bar with the canal view and dozens of white orchids and of course great food. What an exceptional architectural landmark built originally as a shipping company headquarters--exceptional brickwork on the exterior, incredible wrought iron light fixtures, lalique like glass, stain glass too many examples of awesome craftsmanship to mention. Best of all is the service. The bellmen, cleaning staff, front desk and management went out of their way to make us happy. We are especially grateful to Cristel for going to the trouble to mail my camera home to the States thaI I absent mindedly left behind. Thank you Cristel and everyone for making our stay in Amsterdam a total pleasure.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely hotel if you pay the right price, not quite 5 star”
Reviews.Author: burroontour
Reviews.Content: I booked through priceline and got a really good price for this usually expensive hotel. I travelled with my husband and we were allocated a room on the 4th floor with a wonderful view. We've been to Amsterdam many times and usually stay at the NH Centre near Leidesplein so I was interested to see if we enjoyed this area as much. The hotel is in a really impressive building, the service is excellent and staff very friendly. The room was nice and the free wifi, mini bar and coffee maker were great touches, we could have an apÃ©ritif whilst enjoying the view. We never heard a peep from other guests or cleaners etc, you can hear a bit of traffic noise but nothing problematic. The spa was really nice and we spent an hour here by ourselves, very relaxing. The location was fine, we hired bikes which enabled us to explore the city. Alternatively the trams are close by. On foot you are very close to central station (5 mins) and near china town and the red light district but you can easily get to the quieter parts. Amsterdam is a small city so everywhere is easily accessible. The room wasn't perfect, the glass shower curtain leaked and there was no hand soap provided. We had a great time though and would return at the right price.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful Hotel”
Reviews.Author: thomas v
Reviews.Content: My niece and I stayed here last month for her graduation trip. Amrath is centrally located and very close to train station. We had car service, but if I had known, I would of taken train from airport.

Reviews.Title: “Wow Windows that Open and a FREE Mini Bar”
Reviews.Author: fyinorthyork
Reviews.Content:
Beautiful room, fabulous high ceilings and windows that actually opened for fresh air! Great views of one of the canals, really close to the train station yet a very quiet location and walking distance to everything, as long as you're ok to walk. We didn't mind the walking at all. The Palace and Flower Market are about a 20-minute walk, half an hour to Anne Frank House . The Red Light District is 5 minutes away, you can walk through it to get where you're going throughout the day and evening if you want, there are other ways to and from the hotel from restaurants, shopping etc. but we found it was the quickest. My first thought was 'well my husband is going to definitely enjoy this location'. But honestly, the Red Light DIstrict is no big deal. It seems well managed, clean, and no one is accosting you as you're walking through. So the fact that the hotel is so close is no issue. (After awhile it's like walking past Future Shop, part of the scenery). It's a 20-minute walk to the closest 'elaborate' shopping street, 30-40 min. to the Rijksmuseum. There's so much to see on the way to your destinations, that the time just flies on your walks, the hotel's location suited us fine in order to check out everything we were hoping to take in.

The rooms are immaculate, quiet, loads of drawers and cupboards for clothes. A free mini bar--who has a free mini bar these days!?!? And it's actually cold in that fridge. The bed was incredibly comfortable with fabulous pillows and really neat night lights. It's the little things with me :) Even the tiling in the bathroom was interesting with its unique designs on the walls as opposed to just around the tub. Smart counter space engineering so there was enough room for both of us to lay out our 'stuff'.

We did not dine in any of the main restaurants in the hotel, other than the hotel bar. We had a quick lunch there, it was tasty with big portions. We also went to the hotel bar for a nightcap, that was one good Spanish Coffee where the drink was actually hot, and you even received a little 'cookie' with it complimentary (again...love the extras).

The front entrance/lobby was a bit dark and austere, and wondered while waiting to check in, if this was a good choice, but turned out better than expected. The check-in process was a little weird, in that they took only two guests at a time in their 'check-in room'. But, they were friendly and attentive and check- in goes smoothly although you may have to wait a bit if a number of guests arrive at the same time, but it is worth it. The wait may be an issue at check out if you're in a hurry to catch a plane or train, so leave plenty of time. I read in other reviews to avoid the basement rooms. I requested no basement when booking, and was given room 307 which was ideal.

Reviews.Title: “My sister and I went on a city break weekend, we wouldn't stay anywhere else in Amsterdam”
Reviews.Author: loraine p
Reviews.Content: The hotel is in walking distance of most tourist attraction,s e.g. Ann Frank House,Dam Square,Nine Streets, various restaurant's.
