The hotel cafe and restaurant is very good.The rooms are very well furnished,comfortable,the mini-bar is well stocked as is the coffee machine. They have a very inviting indoor pool and two sauna's unfortunately we did not have time to experience any of the beauty treatment's. Last but not least the staff are very friendly,helpful and very efficient.I would recommend this hotel100% I

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful”
Reviews.Author: VaBo9
Reviews.Content: I stayed in the Grand Hotel Amrath with my girlfriend in the beginning of August. It was for a special occasion and we spent a wonderful moment. We have been upgraded and everything was really good... huge and comfortable suite, friendly people, good service, nice view... We ate at the lounge. Good fresh and tasty food. This is very closed to the station and the spa is an asset (we walked all day long). I really recommend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Fun, helpful staff, different but well worth it”
Reviews.Author: victorwhiteside w
Reviews.Content: Second time in Amsterdam and first in this hotel. Don't expect large reception area but if you want an amazing historical building which guide books suggest you go and see then this is the place. Building is fabulous and transformation has manged to keep many of the original features. Rooms were great, didn't try breakfast due to the price, Seriously rooms were lovely, spacious and very, very clean. We had four poster bed and although difficult to find any thing negative, however, it was quite difficult to get out of bed due to the frame being above mattress. Only other negative is that the hotel want to take 100 euros per night from your credit/debit card. Now to the real points, this trip was a surprise birthday trip for family member's 90th birthday. We had four rooms and the the other members of the group could not have afforded to have the money taken from their account. The hotel agreed to only take 500 euros from one card for the whole group. Thank you - it would have been their spending money, Also hotel offer to lend us a wheel chair for the 90 year old and after a couple of days we were struggling with one of the wheels catching on the frame. We didn't ask but next day another wheel chair appeared which was perfect. Don't know if this was a coincidence but if it wasn't thankyou to who ever noticed us outside the hotel trying to repair the original chair. In summary, staff were great, helpful and very friendly. Never tried food but mini bar is amazing. I was expecting a few soft drinks but you have vast selection of alcoholic and soft drinks and snacks which are all free. Room was lovely, clean, very very comfortable, spacious, and one of the nicest I have stayed in and I have stayed in many around the world. Would i stay here again - most defiantly. Interestingly, the hotel actively seek feedback from guests on trip adviser which is a first for me. One last thing, the curtains are controlled by remote control in your room. I don't know if hotel can override this but curtains would periodically open during the night and then close again. If this is not a computer control glitch then I think we had someone else in our room and given the history and age of the hotel maybe something spooky was taking place. All I can say is it added to the fun and laughter. of a fab trip at a fantastic hotel and fantastic staff. 90 year old had a blast and the rest of her family loved the place. victor.whiteside@gov.im if you want more feedback

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful Hotel”
Reviews.Author: AmsterDaz
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed at the Grand Hotel Amrath for our annual pilgrimage to Amsterdam. Over the years we have stayed at many of the city's five star hotels including The Grand Kraznalpolski, The Grand Sofitel and The Renaissance. This ranks up there with the best. On arrival we were upgraded to a fabulous room with a giant four-poster bad and luxurious bathroom. The building itself used to be the offices of a shipping comany and, if you look closely, it shows. The building is shaped like the bow of a ship. At the front are the rooms that used to be the director's offices. These have the very best views to 'port' and 'starboard'. Our room was a secretary's office. Take the time to have a look outside at the detailing atound the bottom of the building; you'll see how the sea is reflected in the colour of the brick and the shape of the railings. There's a lot of other detail, such as fish and even cannons. The restaurant served wonderful food but very, very slowly. I actually fell asleep whilst waiting for my starters. We waited about half an hour for our first drink. At a later visit, in June, we had mach quicker service although it was a little strange due to the fact we were the only people in the restaurant - veryone else was eating in the bar area. Stay at the Grand Amrath and, if you want a very leasurely meal, eat there too. We had a wonderful time.

Reviews.Title: “Good but not that good”
Reviews.Author: philfromliverpool
Reviews.Content: Based my decision to stay at this hotel as ther were a lot of very positive reviews. I agree that the price I got for 5* accomodation was cheap but this was not a 5* hotel in my opinion. Reception was fine if a bit embarassing in that I did not quite have 100 euros a day for them to take of my card, even thought the room was pre-paid for (this is an increasingly frustrating habbit especially as you cannot get hold of your own money till weeks after). The room on first impression was fine but the amount of wardrobe space was minimal and for our 4 day stay we had to dress out of our suitcase (room 210) definately not 5 *. The room was not cleaned thourougly and dust was on the units and stains in the bathroom. We had a mid day meal in the bar service was slow with at first only one member of staff on duty. She took our order wrong we had a further wait which to be fair was compensated by a free drink. For me 5* is to do with staff/guest ratois and is usually over the top this hotel is in the more modest category.

Reviews.Title: “One of the best and will definately return”
Reviews.Author: Ashley C
Reviews.Content: From check-in to check-out service was excellent and the concierge staff were very helpful from helping make arrangements for bike tours to recommending the must sees of Amsterdam. Although somewhat spendy the Seven Seas restaurant has very good food thats was worth what we paid. The spa downstairs was very nice and relaxing with excellent massages to choose from. We had a city view room that over looked the canal and had great views of the surrounding area and the canal. Room was very clean and spacious with beds that were very comfortable. The free mini-bar and remote control curtains were excellent additions to an already perfect room. Located close to Central station and canal tour dock that makes it very easy to get from one part of the city to another. It also is close enough to the 3 squares in town that you can walk or bike. Overall, experience at Amrath was very good and definatly worth it. I would recommend this hotel to anyone and look forward to staying again anytime I'm in the city.

Reviews.Title: “Funky & Staid”
Reviews.Author: gbn
Reviews.Content: In a building built to last, this has very solid walls, floors, doors, etc. Nice wall coverings and carpeting. The hotel layout is very weird, and it's easy to get lost (even between reception and the elevator). There is a lovely spa area but it's just (warm) pool, saunas, steam, and jacuzzi, all unisex and open 7a-11p. Unisex changing area, not much spa menu (they have a massage room). The attached gym is very anemic, with a few poor machines and a minimalist weight tower. They really need to spend a few $ on better gym equipment. Room furnishings are very nice, with a very modern bathroom, but classic hotel room decor. A large and well-furnished room, by European standards. It's around 1/2 mile along the road the Central Station is on, so not that close for people with lots of luggage. Check-in was one of those sit-down affairs, filling out forms with information they already have via the online reservation. Similarly, check-out, which is when the required city tax is paid, requires another trip to the front desk. This process could have been faster, and more automated. There is no self-service laundry, but they will send items out on a per-item cost for laundering or dry cleaning. Overall, a very nice stay, and I would try this hotel again on a future trip.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel”
Reviews.Author: redbridgej
Reviews.Content: I spent 8 nights at the Amrath, was initially worried by he bad reviews on TripAdvisor. I can only say that the negative ones must be from some pretentious, picky people. The Hotel was superb, all the staff were friendly and helpful. I can only assume that most of the bad reviews are from folks who really feel thay are VIP's though that could mean Virtually Insignificant People. Would recommend this hotel and look forward to my next visit soon. John

Reviews.Title: “the best of the best”
Reviews.Author: lyndairene
Reviews.Content: this hotel excceeded our expectations by far...starting from the limo trip from the airport to the hotel......... all the staff we came in contact with were the most gracious accomodating people ever. the hotel was magnificent!! the beds, the rooms, the bar, the breakfast, everything was superb!!! we even had the high tea...after coming in from a rain storm! soaking wet and driping the hostess still made us feel oh so special! :-) if i ever have the chance to go back to amsterdam the grand amrath is where i will stay!! i can not say enough "good" things about it! my hats off to all at the grand amrath hotel!! good job! lynda from washington state

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel - until you encounter staff!”
Reviews.Author: Brashbroad
Reviews.Content: The hotel room is gorgeous- REALLY nice. I booked a room with an occupancy of 3 on the site because we have 3 in our party. The site never said anything about a mandatory bed at â‚¬75 per night. I think if you rent a room and are willing to sleep 3 in a king sized bed or on the floor or whatever it should be none of their business. As long as you dint exceed the maximum occupancy. Hana gave me a hard time about this at check in.. When I didn't agree, she said we could try it, in kind if a disapproving tone. We went for a walk and when we came back the room had been entered and a cot was placed inside. I think to advertise a room capable of occupying 3 people and then trying to charge them a huge amount after the fact amounts to something akin to bate and switch or extortion. I asked for the manager, who happened to be standing next to hana... She was pretty rude again. They said it wasn't allowed anywhere in Amsterdam. Funny I stayed at the marriott a few blocks away with 3 people and they were awesome! I have felt very unwelcome at this hotel. It has been very unpleasant so far.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Traveller61
Reviews.Content: I booked this hotel for myself and my husband as a weekend break while visiting Amsterdam gay pride.After reading some of the reviews on tripadvisor I was a little apprahensive about the hotel,because of comments about rude staff .On checkin we were informed that our room was not ready but we were very early and they told housekeeping we had arrived and asked us to come back in an hour. when we came back our room was ready and the concierge showed us to our room. I visit Amsterdam at least twice a year and this hotel is by far the best I have ever stayed in. The rooms are, large clean, with every possible facility provided for your comfort. The complimentary mini bar is filled on a daily basis with a selection of wine, beer, spirits, mixers, fruit juice,water, mixers and soft drinks. It also has a selection of chocolate and nuts. The mini bar is so well stocked my husband and myself although we tried our best we could not keep up with it, they just kept refilling it! The bathroom was wonderful with both a bath and a shower cubicle which in my experience you usually get one or the other. All toiletries are provided except for toothpaste and this is also replenished twice a day. They also provde a good espresso machine and also a kettle if you prefer tea. I also liked the little extras like dressing gowns, sewing kit, umberellas and a trouser press. The widescreen tv provides a good choice of channels and the rooms have air conitioning. The housekeeping team also provde a turn down service if you require it. We had a fantastic view over the river and could see the boats from the canal parade from the room. The hotel is in a good position just to the left of centraal station and directly opposite Nemo and the floating chinese restraunt. It is 5 minutes walk to the red light area and china town and also close to some of the gay bars. If you prefer the other side of Amsterdam like Anne Franks house and Rembrants square it is a good 25mins walk from there. I would thouroughly recommend staying here the hotel architecture is amazing and the staff are very heplful. Now the bad points..... Not very much just a couple of little gripes, the hotel puts a charge of 100 euroes per night on your credit card for extras, I did not use any but do be prepared to be asked for this. I am hoping I do not have any problems having the charge removed. If you don't own a credit card you will be asked for the cash. Also the city tax is not included in the price you pay. This is not unusual in Amsterdam but you are usually informed of this at booking. We were charged 16 euroes for 3 nights. Breakfast was not included in our booking but I was told by another guest that it is wonderful, but at a cost of 25 euroes per person for a continetal breakfast and 27 euroes each for an english breakfast we chose to eat at one of the many other eating places in Amsterdam. Also we did not use the spa but it did look very good and a wide range of facials and massages are available.

Reviews.Title: “Grand Hotel, Grand Location”
Reviews.Author: snayyar
Reviews.Content: Stay here if you are a couple looking for a 4.5-star hotel and want to enjoy the city center with easy access to Central Station. This hotel is in an old shipping building. It is charming, and has European appeal. The rooms are spacious, but awkwardly designed (prob because of existing structures) and will be in need of an update soon. The staff are well-trained and friendly. Like other 'dam hotels, if you need something, you will need to ask for it. The beds are comfortable and fairly new, but a bit firm. The mini bar is included in the room-rate which is a nice perk! The location is a 5 minute walk from Central Station, 5-10 minutes to Dam Square/RLD. We took a few train trips, so this location was ideal. Also, if you take the train from Schipol to Central, your entire airport transfer will cost you 7 euro (r/t!). There is much to eat, but the center of amsterdam is mostly filled with tourist food aka great drinking grub (Broodjes, fried everything, FEBO, pizza...etc). Make sure you look outside of city center for finer dining (De Kas does wonders). The pool is located in the lower level and is a nice perk after a long day. The pool was well maintained, and not busy at all. I found the hotel overall to not be filled to capacity and there were few young children around. The hotel is overall quiet, and you will not bump into too many other guests. The corridors are small and can get confusing - chalk it up again to the older building design. Remember to ask for directions to the Pool! Enjoy the 'dam!

Reviews.Title: “Birthday break in Amsterdam”
Reviews.Author: Ms_Travelalot
Reviews.Content: The Amrath Amsterdam is a simply stunning building. It used to be the headquarters for several shipping companies and is mainly of art deco design. It is a bit of a warren but once you've been back and forth to your room a few times you can crack it! The room was gorgeous - high, high ceiling, plenty of floorspace, beautiful furniture, view over the canal. Ultra modern refurbishment, especially of the bathroom. Shame we didn't have a bath, but to be honest we hadn't asked for one and it wasn't really an issue. Bathrobes and slippers were included, there was free wi-fi, and there was also a free minibar - to the astonishment of one American guest who asked at reception - "Even the liquor??" There was also a Nespresso machine in the room - fast, delicious coffee at the touch of a button. The minibar had 2 x Cokes, 2 x Diet Cokes, 2 x Sprites, 2 x Tonic Waters, 2 x Orange Juices, and an assortment of miniatures, vodka, whisky etc, plus a free chocolate bar and peanuts. This was fully replenished every day. The staff were extremely polite, smiley and helpful - both reception and the concierge. Housekeeping was excellent - especially considering we had the Do Not Disturb sign up most mornings! Some hotels won't make up your room if you've slept in, but the Amrath staff just come back later. There's also a turn-down service in the evenings. We didn't bother with the breakfast, although the restaurant did look nice - we wanted to get our day started right in the city. We also didn't try out the spa, which was a shame but we were having such a great time in the city we basically forgot about it! I had a look round on our last day, it seemed pretty luxurious and welcoming. The Amrath is a quick 5 minute walk (with rolling suitcases) from Central Station, unless you've got very heavy luggage you really DON'T need a taxi. The canal boat stops are also handy - just near the station. You can walk right down to the Rijksmuseum in about 30-40 minutes, or catch a tram. Beware - the trams are NOT cheap, about 2.5 euros for a short ride, we paid 26 euros for a 24-hour canal boat ticket instead. If you buy the 24-hour option rather than the 'all day' option, it's 24 full hours from when you first board, and so you can hop on/hop off as much as you like. So we walked to the Rijksmuseum first, then bought a ticket, and didn't board till nearly 6pm for the ride home - so essentially we got 2 days' use out of it.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel overall”
Reviews.Author: seateacher
Reviews.Content: Beautiful Hotel in a perfect location. When we were there, the mini bar items were both plentiful and FREE. Free beer, wine, candy, nuts, you name it, it was free. Espresso machines in the room, great dining room and nice staff. No A/C though, the room was hot most of the visit. They have this odd fan system, really doesn't work. Just hope you aren't there for much warm weather.

Reviews.Title: “briljant”
Reviews.Author: halloa30
Reviews.Content: Great hotel, with a lot of historical places. We enjoyed the swimmingpool in the heart of the city. It's a bit expensive but the money worth it

Reviews.Title: “Excellent location . Beautiful heifh art deco ceilings.”
Reviews.Author: Dublineye
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for 4 nights and found the staff to be helpful and we were very grateful of the umbrella which the hotel provided ! The room was not the largest. It is a converted art deco building so what the room lacked in storage made up in the beautiful high ceilings. Any more than a few days for 2 people and you would be very squashed . The toiletries were very good and the replenished free mini bar lovely. As the bathroom door is an opaque heavy screen if you are sharing a room you would need to be close friends !- We got a good price online about 115 a night and would recommend the hotel but not at the rrp of 250 a night.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel. Great location”
Reviews.Author: Mack1z
Reviews.Content: We went to Amsterdam and the Grand hotel Amrath for a part of our honeymoon. We knew the hotel from a previous stay and knew this was the perfect hotel for us in Amsterdam. Get a superiorroom, they are really great. We`ll be back.

Reviews.Title: “Historic charm”
Reviews.Author: 2SunnyBeaches
Reviews.Content: I stayed here in June for two nights with my two college age children. We had two rooms. They were fairly nice. Bathrooms were clean. Hotel staff was friendly. I did see a large mouse run through the bar area. Probably hard to keep them out around all of that water. We did not care for Amsterdam. The city should be beautiful with its unique buildings and canals, but the there is trash piled around on every street. People let their dogs do their business, and just leave it. Beware where you step. We did enjoy the Van Gogh and Rijksmuseum. Will probably never return. If you do plan to visit, this hotel is a nice option.

Reviews.Title: “I loved it and I will return!!”
Reviews.Author: 186338Samuel
Reviews.Content: I had a lovely 8 night stay,recently in July,2011. The room was spacious,had a canal view,quiet and on the same floor as the Wellness Centre. The facilities in the room and leisure centre were excellent. The free minibar was stocked with a good variety of alcoholic and non-alcoholic drinks. Some potato chips,should be added to the snack choice. All the staff,I met were friendly,helpful and courteous. There was one exception and she soon realised not to be too clever and not to talk down to me,in the bar. We all have bad days ,so I took her mood as being part of a bad day,for her. A great five star hotel,in a good location and excellent value for money.

Reviews.Title: “Luxury all the way!”
Reviews.Author: ruth7748
Reviews.Content: We booked to stay here for a belated wedding anniversary and practically the first words out of the mouth of the receptionist on arrival was to notify us that they had upgraded us to a superior deluxe room with canal view! The room was beautiful - high ceilings, windows opening out over the canal on a very quiet street, free mini bar (re-stocked daily) luxury bathcare products, widescreen TV with about 200 channels and electric curtains. The concierge was super helpful, providing us with maps and brochures for tourist activities and taxi booking plus giving us the benefit of his experience to recommend places to go. We ate in the bar one night - food was great and service was polite and unobtrusive. Overall, a lovely stay which was made even better by our free upgrade.

Reviews.Title: “Overall, a very nice hotel”
Reviews.Author: Davey1800
Reviews.Content: I stayed in this hotel for four nights in July 2011. I stayed on the 1st floor in room 112. The room was very fancy and certainly worthy of 5* status. However, the bed was very soft.. it had a matress topper on it that made sleep uncomfortable. I still have a sore back a few weeks later. I never tried the swimming pool or other facilities, but overall the hotel looked fabulous. I'd recommend it at a cheap price. I paid Â£110 per night. Breakfast was not included. That was great value considering a basic 2* hotel can cost the same price (although much lower if booked way in advance of course). My usual 2* hotel costs me Â£80 per night, so overall I got a great deal.

Reviews.Title: “Great, Clean with friendly staff”
Reviews.Author: McEwan1987
Reviews.Content: Very good hotel, Great location and friendly staff. The room was clean and had a nice view, the free mini bar was an added bonus, we got a deal with breakfast included which was ideal for us. The price for it if you don't get a deal is extremely expensive. The breakfast had a nice selection, ideal if you wanted to fill up for a long day. The only slight problem was our electric curtains that had a mind of its own at certain times during the night! They would open and shut serveral times very late night early/early hours of morning! Overall a nice hotel which I would recommend if you can get a top deal!

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel but the maids come too early and often”
Reviews.Author: makila10
Reviews.Content: Very nice! Love the tall windows and free mini bar. The toiletry items smell really good also. Another is the coffee maker is in the room wiith really good coffee. Really cool swim area! The negative: there are a lot closer hotels to the city center but it has many things near it. It is hard to remember where ur room is because the hotel is large. the maids drive you nuts knocking in the morning. A repair guy came at 10:00 in the morning to change a light bulb that was not requested by us and that was strange. But i would still stay here again!

Reviews.Title: “Great complementary minibar and nice spa”
Reviews.Author: fourdollared
Reviews.Content: This hotel is becoming overpriced, I remember when it opened I paid only $220 per night for a regular room, now it's more than $350. The hotel itself is great, rooms are big and location is very good, close to the train station, historic red district, and the Dam. Their free minibar is well stocked and the spa is very nice and relaxing. Nieumarkt is close which is a great place to buy fresh cheeses and breads. If the price is right, you can not go wrong with this hotel. We spent nice 10 days there. In addition to the usual travel info about Amsterdam you can find on any travel site, here are a couple of my favorite experiences: (1) "Oriental City" Chinese restaurant is not far and is great for dim sum. (2) Albert Cuyp market on Albert Cuyp street is awesome, there is a guy there who sells the the best "new" herring (late spring, early summer is the best time). (3) Flower market on Singel street is lovely to get some fresh flowers for your room.

Reviews.Title: “Gorgeous Historic Building / Hotel”
Reviews.Author: marinanyfedd
Reviews.Content: It was amazing! The hotel is stunning! Super high ceilings, huge rooms, gorgeous decor. Amazing spa and pool! Concierge service is spectacular! We had an amazing time there and truly enjoyed our stay. Hotel located a few minutes walk across from the main train station, and super close walking distance to everything else. Would stay there again!

Reviews.Title: “fab hotel, great location”
Reviews.Author: Groomie
Reviews.Content: selected via BA holidays for our wedding anniversary - my first time to Amsterdam. husband had been several times. Lovely hotel, 5 mins walk from station and great location for central Amsterdam about 10 mins from Dam square and 30 mins walk from the museum district. Lovely room, great service, minibar and wifi included in room price. Breakfast was great, takes some special to make us set an alarm for breakfast but we didn't miss a single one! Would definitely go back again.

Reviews.Title: “Not 5 Star”
Reviews.Author: BillS176
Reviews.Content: My wife and I just spent 3 nights in the Amrath Grand. Check in was efficient but the trainee said she'd take us to our room - not so - she took us to the concierge - who of course wanted a tip. I only had a 10 Euro bill, so said "If you give me 5, I'll give you 10". He said he didn't have any cash on him - the very first concierge in the world who doesn't have tips in his pockets. Needless to say he got nothing !!! The room was on the 1st floor, right beside the main street with cars etc whizzing past. When we entered the room, the windows were open. That seemed strange. later on we found out why. The "air conditioner" wasn't working so we had to leave the windows open - of course the traffic noise was horrible. The room was stifling. We called for assistance. One guy shows up, says he'll go see the maintenance people and be back in 5 minutes - he didn't come back. We called again and he said "it should be working now". I said it wasn't, so send up the manager. Guess who shows up...? He took a very high-handed attitude. I said that we demanded an upgraded room the next morning. He quickly agreed and said he'd get us a fan - within 30 seconds (I kid you not) he appeared with a fan - that told us that they had had this problem before. They moved us to an upgraded room on 4th floor - better, with views over the canal. They said they'd move our luggage into the new room - not so - they took it downstairs, then insisted that the concierge brings it up - remember him...? So, here was another ploy to trick us for a tip. It was not the nicest hotel we've stayed in - perhaps an average 4 star. For the price, you expect better.

Reviews.Title: “Our favourite hotel in Amsterdam”
Reviews.Author: Hotel-Guru-Kat
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for 6 nights at New Year and it was our 3rd stay at the hotel. The hotel is handy for Central Station and although it's about 5 - 10 mins walk to the busier red light area its worth the walk. Each time we've stayed our room has been a totally different shape and layout but they have all been good! The rooms are a good size, classic but moderns touches to the decor and nice spacious modern bathrooms. The free mini bar is handy and we would top it up with our own drinks as well. The hotel itself is really interesting and still has lots of its original features, we got lost once trying to find the business room! On New Year's Eve the hotel had tickets to go up to the rooftop at 11.30 pm to watch all the fireworks, toast the new year and have a few pastries. I think it was 25 Euro each but we had a few glasses of champagne and the view of the fireworks was fantastic so it was really worth it. Amsterdam is crazy at New Year and I was glad to stay away this time from people lighting off firecrackers everywhere! We have stayed in 6 different hotels in Amsterdam and this one is definitely our favourite.

Reviews.Title: “Superb Stay”
Reviews.Author: weazil60
Reviews.Content: The Grand Hotel Amrath in Amsterdam was an absolute pleasure. The service, right from our arrival was impeccable. All the staff, from concierge to cleaners were extremely courteous, friendly and helpful. The room was large with cavernous ceilings and a splendid view over Amsterdam. The room was cleaned regularly and the mini bar re-stocked daily. The Nespresso machine, I thought, was not working, however I did not realise that there is a tank at the back of the machine which needs filled with cold water when it runs dry. The bathroom was superb with a huge shower and an equally huge separate bath. To obtain really hot water there is a small button on the temperature tap which you have to press in, then you can rotate the tap further giving you (very) hot water. No matter what time of the day or night the water was scalding. There is a Well Being Centre in the basement which consists of two dry saunas (one at 70 Degrees C and one at 90 Degrees C), a wet sauna a Jacuzzi and a small swimming pool. The swimming pool has no depth markers on it so take care! All the facilities were available to use without charge and they were sometimes essential to allow you to recover from the battle that was - walking through the streets. The TV had a limited number of English Speaking channels; however we did not visit Amsterdam for its television. WiFi is free in the hotel. You are given a username and a password when you arrive. When you try and access the internet you have to first log on using this username and password. This takes you to an Amrath Hotel Home Page. A problem with the WiFi or the system used at the hotel was that it was very erratic. Sometime you could start your browser, enter a search and you would be taken to the Home Page, other times you were presented with a â€œthe page you are looking for could not be foundâ€� error. A city tax is charged on top of the payment you make for the hotel. You have to leave a deposit of 400 euros charged against a credit or debit card. The total amount of the city tax is deducted from the 400 euros at the end of your stay. If you pay by debit card ensure that you check that it has been reimbursed. I had to phone the Hotel from the UK to find out why the payment had not been refunded. It was then refunded with apologies. The location of the hotel was perfect. It was about five minutesâ€™ walk from Central Station (make sure you come out of the front of the station and not the back as we did)! It is very easy to walk to any of the tourist attractions in the city and the walk itself is enjoyable, giving you a chance to see the locals and tourists alike. The biggest problem we had was trying to cross the road â€“ cars, cyclists and scooters appeared to have no qualms about trying to run you over (although I am sure that there is some logic to it, however alien it is to us). Be careful crossing the road and look in all directions before you step off the pavement! I would say that Amsterdam is probably not the place to bring your children, as the red light district and the tourist souvenirs may be offensive to some. In the larger areas of the city there are people who dress up in costumes, they then try and entice either you or your children to stand beside them to get their photographs taken. Once the child is beside the person they wrap an arm around them and are reluctant to part with the child until you have given them money for the photograph. There is a wide variety of restaurants and eating places in Amsterdam. Examples are Chinese, Mexican, Argentinian, Italian, burger bars etc. The food in the Chinese restaurants is not the same as the Chinese restaurants in the UK, this took some getting used to. This is a purely personal preference. Wherever you go there is a wide choice of eating available. There is a multiplicity of sights for the tourists to see. One of the most relaxing excursions that we had was the canal tour â€“ this was very informative and calming after battling your way through the crowds of Amsterdam. To sum up, the hotel was excellent, the people were friendly and welcoming and the city had plenty to see and do in a period of one week.

Reviews.Title: “Love the hotel's architecture.”
Reviews.Author: Sandeeeca
Reviews.Content: Beautiful hotel. Very helpful concierge. Staff was very pleasant. It's in a historic building making the rooms unique and interesting. The beds were lovely as was a giant tub and a steam shower. Wish I had a hotel like this in every city I go to!

Reviews.Title: “Amazing, we loved it!”
Reviews.Author: Jersey_Alice
Reviews.Content: We found the hotel to be in a wonderful position, it is a 5 min walk from the Central Station and a 10/15 min wander down to Dam Square. This meant that it was really close to town at the same time as being a little out of the way so not too busy. The building the hotel is situated in is spectacular, a walk up all the stairs to see the glass roof is a must. This trip was to celebrate our anniversary so i did book a bigger room, we stayed in a Superior Deluxe with a city view, which was well worth the money. The room was spectacular and the views were beautiful. The room had a four poster bed (comfiest ever), which i had requested via e-mail at no extra cost and was the most special room we have ever stayed in, very romantic. We found the staff to be incredibly helpful, the concierge really know their stuff and are always happy to help you find a place to eat or give directions. The only thing I would say is that when we arrived check in was slow, they only had two of the three reception desks open so we had to wait some time before we were seen. We only ate breakfast in the restaurant on our last morning as a treat and because they were doing a special discount for the month of July. It had a standard selection but is definitely not worth the normal cost of 25 Euros, not when there are so many lovely little places to stop in close by. The swimming pool is a little hard to find, we got a bit lost in corridors, but once you find it it is well worth a dip. Not a huge pool but big enough for us to bob about and have a bit of a swim. The ceiling is covered in little lights that make it look like starts, really nice touch.

Reviews.Title: “The hotel to stay at.”
Reviews.Author: barbarajane14
Reviews.Content: Excellent service. Room and bathroom spacious and up to date. An old hotel with modern features. Convenient yet off the main streets.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel but personnel needs training: The service was not 5-star level”
Reviews.Author: cantstoptravelingusa
Reviews.Content: The hotel itself is very interesting as it was the headquarter of a shipping company until 3 or 5 years ago. The architecture is unique, the rooms are nice but the personnel is not up to par at all starting with the check-in.

Reviews.Title: “Loved it!”
Reviews.Author: lori7149
Reviews.Content: Rooms are very LARGE and well decorated. The spa is amazing. Staff was great, very helpful. Food was excellent. Architecture was very interesting and special! Can't wait to return. Well worth the money! A great place to stay. (Only downfall is that there isn't much of a lobby, but this didn't affect us)

Reviews.Title: “Unkempt hotel, annoying staff, dirty rooms”
Reviews.Author: arikcz
Reviews.Content: I chose this hotel on tripadvisor, and our experience led me to write this first review ever.. all in all it was a bad experience and I'm definitely NOT recommending this hotel. the (few) pros: location is OK - its a 10 min walk from the train station, and 15min walk from dam square. but it's a long walk back. rooms are large. the building is old and interesting free minibar & wifi cons: the hotel and the rooms are dirty. there was garbage in the closets, the bathrooms had stain marks and one day our room wasn't cleaned. in the first room we had there was a terrible stink. only on the second day when the staff changed we got a new one. in the new room there was a water leak in the carpet near the bath. cityview - on the room we got and paid extra for - cityview meant you have a view. in our case the view of the highway behind the hotel. not the nice city view you'd expect from the title. apparently the non cityview rooms have a view into a wall. staff - were pretty rude. they didn't agree to extend our checkout after 1pm without paying a full rate.. made mistakes with our bill, and locked us by accident outside our room. there is no LOBBY in the hotel. just 2 chairs near the cold and windy reception. the breakfast is outrageously at 25 EUR.. so to summarize, go elsewhere.

Reviews.Title: “Interesting Art Deco building”
Reviews.Author: BalhamBlonde
Reviews.Content: A five minute walk from the train station (with its high speed link to the airport), easy walk to the main tourist attractions. We had a lovely room overlooking the canal (not too tricky in Amsterdam it has to be said). Check in was a little overlong, there was a tiny bit of confusion over whether the room was ready or not, so we left our bags and went straight out to join a walking tour of the City. When we eventually got back, we collected bags and found the room, which proved to be a little hard, there are lots of long winding corridors - you can see where it used to be a Shipping House. Do check out the main staircase, you could easily be back in the roaring '20's. Decent sized room, with very high ceilings. Comfortable bed, good bath and separate shower. Went to the bar for a quick drink, it's next to the breakfast room. Nobody else there, lacking soul. Breakfast wasn't brilliant, the room had no windows and felt a bit dark and forbidding for me. The staff were all lovely and very helpful. It's a magnificent building, forms part of some of the city tours. Overall I would recommend the place.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel in Amsterdam”
Reviews.Author: KRSTWO
Reviews.Content: This hotel was quite nice. They certainly took their 5* rating seriously and one felt that many elegant touches went into the place. The location, while ideal for access to Central Station, can be a bit far from many of the more touristy destinations around Museumplein and Vondelpark. That said, it is certainly in the centrum and is a fine choice or grab on Priceline. The restaurant was really the only source of annoyance for us. Figuring us captive, a reasonable breakfast was not available. I expected this to some extent, but upon seeing the room service menu and seeing quite reasonable prices for items, I thought I had scored a coup. In the fine print, of course, was a 7.50 per item service charge. These items didn't exist anywhere else, so the price for everything was reasonable plus 7.50. I found this attempt at trickery to be extremely disengenious, and downright rude. Everything else at the establishment was quite nice. The pool, workout facilities are nice, I did not make use of the spa. Much of place seems built in anticipation of being a world beater, the overpriced restaurant, wine bar in the basement, spa, night club in the basement. Most of this was closed or barely used when I was there. Weird vibe about this.

Reviews.Title: “An architectural adventure and a fabulously comfortable stay”
Reviews.Author: julietago
Reviews.Content: A newly refurbished old shipping house with a lofty working history, this hotel is stylish but not at all like the usual stuffy 5 star experience. We were upgraded to a junior suite -it looks boring in photos but it was stunning, roomy and wonderfully equipped with everything you could need. Staff were all helpful, ambience really memorable -I think a little like staying with a Transylvanian count!! Don't miss it, particualrly if you are interested in architecture.

Reviews.Title: “Charming Hotel”
Reviews.Author: FeatStick
Reviews.Content: I stayed few days at the Grand AmrÃ¢th and have to say that when I entered in the lobby I was a bit surprised by how old fashioned it looked. Nonetheless I was warmly welcomed and invited to proceed to the check-in in a stylish wooden style room. The staff was nice and professional, it took a bit of time (5-10 min) to check in as it was the first day for the receptionist who was in charge of my case, but she was assisted by her colleagues and all of them were kind so it was no hassle. The hotel itself is decorated with warm colour which make you feel like being welcomed from home. At first, it might seem to be like a labyrinth but you quickly get used to the long curved corridors. There are a night club, a swimming-pool, a fitness center and a spa in the basement of the building. I only made use of the fitness center, I should rather say fitness room as there were only 5 or 6 training machines but I never saw anybody else than me using them during the few hours I was there (~2 hours a day) so I didn't feel constrained at all. There are also a bar and a restaurant on the ground floor but I didn't try any of them. Now, about the room itself, I stayed in a deluxe room on the 4th floor. It had very high ceiling and was of decent size (~25m2), with two armchairs a very big bed (210cm length) and all the usual features that an hotel of this category provides (a shower and a separate tub, nespresso machine, slippers, safety deposit box, umbrella, trouser press...) but one point important to mention is the mini bar which is already included in the room rate (refilled once a day). The room was really quiet, the mattress extremely comfortable, and the tub large enough to indulge yourself with a relaxing bath without feeling tight like in many other hotels I have been to. Compared to the Hilton and Marriott hotels in Amsterdam, I would say that the Grand AmrÃ¢th is the most convenient one if you need to get to the airport of the train station and its architecture is far more charming than the others. Nonetheless it lacks the modernism of the Marriott (inside not the facade of the Marriott which seems like a council estate) and the luxurious facilities of the Hilton (lobby, private pier, bar with outside seats and garden, but not the rooms which I personally think would need some refurbishment, the AmrÃ¢th ones have higher standards) . Then it is a question of what are your priorities. If you like authenticity, old-fashioned style, and want to be 5min walk away from the train station, the Grand AmrÃ¢th is the hotel I would suggest you to pick up! It is not a small hotel but you feel like being in a boutique hotel and the staff is really very attentive, it was a pleasure to chat with the one I met.

Reviews.Title: “Stylish, attention to detail and free mini bar!”
Reviews.Author: joelarias
Reviews.Content: Stylish, attention to detail and free mini bar! This place was great! I had a complimentary espresso machine with coffee pods by Nespresso. The dÃ©cor was magnificent and the pool area in the basement with the simulated stars was really nice! The location is near the train station, so coming and going was easy from the airport. Just a quick walk across the street and that was it!

Reviews.Title: “The best stay ever!”
Reviews.Author: Arina_11
Reviews.Content: Loved it! Loved the beautiful building! Location is perfect! Right by gorgeaous Train Station, by canal, a few steps away from Damrack. I liked my huge, very large, brand new room, huge bathroom, great king size bed with 6 pillows. FREE internet (HIlton and Krasnopolsky charged me for that!) FREE bar (bunch of drinks from beer, to whisky, all free). Honestly, when I will come back, that's where I will stay! I liked my room so much better than in Krasnopolsky and Hilton. It was soo large, such a high cellings, just the best! Place to stay and enjoy Amsterdam for sure!

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful hotel, great location...”
Reviews.Author: jtimson
Reviews.Content: This is an impressive property. A former Mercantile building, the hotel retained many of the charming details that made it an impressive building in its day. You should definitely stroll around, it's worth it. The room was very comfortable and nicely decorated. The minibar was complimentary, which is always nice. We ate in the dining room on the last night and found the food to be very good.

Reviews.Title: “We loved it! Perfect place to stay in Amsterdam!”
Reviews.Author: honestgal_10
Reviews.Content: We stayed in the Amrath recently when visiting Amsterdam. What a fabulous hotel, we were not disappointed! The reception staff were more than friendly. The spa is so relaxing to come back to after a long day shopping! The rooms are very modern with everything you need. There is a big difference between the standard rooms and the superior rooms, they are much bigger. The bathrooms are modern with powerful showers and big baths. We would definitely return!

Reviews.Title: “Couldn't be better!”
Reviews.Author: Howard112
Reviews.Content: Our room was spacious and very clean. Staff was friendly and helpful. We couldn't have asked for a better experience in Amsterdam. Nice location, close to the Central Station. Good restaurants within walking distance. The conscierge definitely gets two thumbs up for all the attention and recommendations on how to maximize our time. All arrangements through that desk were flawless. We spent 3 nights and wished it were longer. Great pool and hot tub in the spa area. Free mini bar isn't bad either!

Reviews.Title: “weird”
Reviews.Author: Dingster010154
Reviews.Content: check in was spooky room was scary -you walk in and then have to turn sideways past a strange wardrobe although has grown on me no visible staff anyway in corridors breakfast was 25 euro even for coffee and croissants -bit much very unsmiling waitresses yesterday annoyed with me as asked for cold milk not the yellowing cream on table for coffee GOOD BELOW mini bar had complimentary soft drinks location good as very close to Central Station

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful Amrath”
Reviews.Author: alberto29152 Posted by a Worldhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: A very nice experience,an enormous and nice room overlloking a canal and the historic Amsterdam, with super comfortable beds and a grand bathroom with Lanvin toiletries.You can go almost everywhere in Ams by foot or take all tours,canals trips,public transport at the Central railways station,jst a few hundreds meters away.It was a sumptous office building used by navigation companies in modernist style builted at the beginning of the XX century , so the hotel lacks completely of a grand lobby typical in 5 stars hotels.Also the building, of course, was not purpose built for an Hotel.But this is clearly explained in the hotel site.This is an hotel where you have to go not for "grandeur" or opulent luxury but to find the true luxury of a warm and friendly atmosphere ,an airy room with high ceilings where you'll feel at home (and, like at home, you don't pay for your coffee Nespresso machine nor for minibar, all is included) and,last but not least, a splendid indoor swimming pool,whirlpool,turkish bath,sauna.All,again,included in room rate.I recommend it in a city where most hotel rooms, even 5 stars, are...on the small scale !

Reviews.Title: “NICE SCARY HOTEL”
Reviews.Author: diamond_6irl
Reviews.Content: My bf and I had to get the Amrath dued Intercontinental Amstel wasn't available. However, it was an interesting option. Hotel is located a few steps from Centraal Station and in front of the famous chinese restaurant Sea Palace, known as the largest chinese floating restaurant in Europe (the food is really good btw). And a few blocks from the Red Light District and Dam Square where you will find tour bus & canal ticket stations plus lots of shopping stores, restaurants, pubs and the famous coffe shops. Is also located next to a canal with great views. AmrathÂ is very old, it looks like an old haunted castle with creepy corridors :) I wasn't brave enough to research what it was before being a hotel, but I can tell we heard noises at night and read on here some previous guests did the same. Not sure what it was but my bf and I used to joke about it at night before getting to the hotel. It made me feel like i was at Disney's Hollywood Studios getting ready to ride Tower of Terror! For those who are into decor, let me tell you itÂ looks dated. In my opinion needs to remodel basic stuff even though I read got some upgrades a couple years ago. Our room was spacious and clean. Bed was super comfy, had the best sleep in this hotel in my entire stay in several cities in Europe. Room service was good, such a shame I found out too much eggshell in my omelette! But other than that food was really good, just be aware of the 7.50â‚¬ they charge for room service (Come on guys is supposed to be free!) Service in general was really good. Staff is friendly and always ready to help. That makes the difference between a 4 and 5 star hotel. Don't think this is a 5 star hotel, but is for sure we had a good time here.

Reviews.Title: “One of the finest hotels”
Reviews.Author: jlkahn
Reviews.Content: I waited 6 weeks to write this review because I was sure that I would remember some flaw in this hotel. However, I can not. It is one of the finest hotels that I have ever stayed in, and I have stayed in many fine hotels in Europe, Asia, as well as the US. The location is amazingly convenient: almost directly across the street from Central Station. The side walk in front of Central Station goes directly to the hotel. Basically this hotel is near everything in Amsterdam. My wife and I walked everywhere. The hotel provided a very accurate and detailed pocket map. It is difficult to describe the beauty of the hotel. My wife and I should have taken the hotel tour to really experience all the architectural details this hotel has to offer. Check-in was easy and fast even though they were sold out and we arrived early in the day. The hotel staff could not be friendlier or more helpful. We were always addressed by our name. The concierge was helpful and knowledgable and arranged rental car delivery to the door. The food in the hotel restaurant and bar was so good that my wife and I were reluctant to eat at any other restaurants in the city which we found ordinary. Laundry service was used(we pack very light). Our hotel room was enormous. The ceiling must have been 20 feet high. The refrig was stocked daily--included in the room price. The bathroom and shower were just perfect. The bed was clean and like new and very comfortable. Even the view out the windows (with remote controlled curtains) was not bad. I was impressed. We had a great stay and walked our feet off.

Reviews.Title: “Faultless Hotel & Service A*”
Reviews.Author: Raycle
Reviews.Content: Stayed At Amrath for my Partners Birthday on the 15 May. Upon Arrive was Warmly welcomed in Amrath. We Was Also Given an Upgrade to a Superior Deluxe Room With City View Floor to Ceiling Windows, Super Comfy Bed, Amazing Rain Shower. Had a Fantastic Stay. We will be Back!!

Reviews.Title: “Feels like the hotel is out of a Tim Burton film!”
Reviews.Author: shsh7
Reviews.Content: When we arrived inside the lobby our hearts sank - it looks more like a 2 or 3 star lobby - small, dark with the oddest grey and white marble we have ever seen. It feels creepy and smells like a church. Seriously needs an update big time. Walking through the tunnel like corridors was also a gothic experience - dark, creepy! But once we got to our rooms on the 4th floor we were really surprised - modern, big, clean and stylish with a huge luxurious bathroom, no complaints - infact very pleased. Great view outisde. Free mini bar and free wifi are an added bonus. Service throughout our stay was very pleasant and we were very happy with that. Good location - 10 minute walk to Dam square.

Reviews.Title: “I would definitely stay there again”
Reviews.Author: abertraveller71
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Amrath in March 2011 and cannot recommend them enough. They come to your room twice a day, free mini bar which is topped up daily, friendly staff will stay there again. I was wary at first because of some of the reviews but ignore them this hotel is great

Reviews.Title: “Major Disappointment”
Reviews.Author: rickg2007
Reviews.Content: I, regrettably, listened to the mostly positive reviews on tripadvisor.com for the Hotel Amrath when booking a 4-night stay and was incredibly disappointed. The four of us (two rooms) were completely underwhelmed by the entire hotel experience that I felt it my duty to report back to other ill-advised hotel shoppers. First of all, this is NOT a luxury hotel. From the small dismal lobby, to the primitive, carpet-stained halls, to the creepy mis-matched furniture and decor....the place had an eerie/gloomy vibe and was thoroughly depressing. After several hours waiting for check-in time, we were finally shown to our tiny room on the 4th floor. It was smelly and dark...you had to stand on a platform to see out the small window. The hotel room was quickly monikered, "prison cell". Most of the service staff was pleasant, and we appreciated the efforts of the hotel manager, but this was ineffectual where it mattered; Our rooms were inexplicably unmade on 2 of the 4 days and we had an uncomfortable incident in the restaurant when our server was unwelcoming and abrasive. We were appalled at her behavior. It was unfortunate that the hotel overshadowed our first experience in Amsterdam. Each time we returned from outings about town, we were instantly depressed to make our way back to the Amrath. I am baffled and suspicious at the reviews of this hotel. I can understand that a certain type of clientele appreciate the close proximity to the seedy bars and red-light district, but this hotel can not be mistaken for a 5-star luxury hotel. I have stayed in dozens of European hotels, all 4- or 5-star, and this was indisputably the worst! Be warned!

Reviews.Title: “The best hotel ever”
Reviews.Author: Rosa1
Reviews.Content: It is a great hotel, close to everything, walking distance to central station, the rooms are great, we received an upgrade to a Superior room, they have complimentary mini bar and nesspresson machine. It is also great to enjoy their SPA after a full day of walking in the city The best thing about this hotel is the service, from the front desk, the restaurants and everybody at the hotel.

Reviews.Title: “We were happy guests of the Amrath hotel”
Reviews.Author: gramreda
Reviews.Content: I visited Amsterdam with my daughter and nearly 10 year old grandson from April 26-May2. We were very pleased that we were made to feel so welcome at this beautiful hotel. Our original room was too small for the three of us and we were provided with a larger room upon request that was very comfortable. The hotel staff was helpful, gracious and very friendly. The complimentary mini bar is a very nice feature. In addition, the hotel is well located and getting around the city was quite easy. Our vacation was wonderful and we were very happy that we stayed at this lovely hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Fairly standard 'boutique offering' with two exceptions”
Reviews.Author: other1
Reviews.Content: It's a fairly standard 'boutique offering' with two exceptions:architecture and mini-bar. The building still feels very much much like the former offices that it was. I'm usual all for preserving fascinating architectural features that give character and charm, but this did neither for me. It felt slightly depressing, plodding along the bureaucratic-feeling dingy corridors, and this carried on into the many rooms that face into a tiny interior courtyard. Dim on even the sunniest of days, despite the very high ceilings. The room itself conforms to 'boutique norms': thick velvet curtains, good linen, nespresso machine, etc.. The bathroom was narrow and uncomfortable. The only departure from the norm was the "free" mini-bar. Not being a heavy drinker I don't value this highly, but it is welcome not to have an obscene itemised charge for orange juice - although of course it's not really "free", because it's priced into room rate. The pool and steam room were nice with only me in them (can imagine it's full with say 4-6 guests) and I dislike hotels that make you walk from your room in your swimming stuff because there aren't any changing rooms in the spa/pool area. Like many Amsterdam hotels, bikes and vespas are available. Perhaps I should have used these because the only test I put to the service team was to get me a taxi which was delayed by 15 then another 20 mins - annoying since I could have walked 5 minutes to the station and picked up a taxi easily if they had just been more honest/used better judgement.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel, fantastic location for touring the City.”
Reviews.Author: Hgrieves
Reviews.Content: Couldn't ask for more from a hotel for a weekend break in Amsterdam. Well proportioned rooms with free(!) minibar included in the rate. Staff were extremely friendly and helpful too.

Reviews.Title: “Amazing! Definitely worth a visit”
Reviews.Author: welly17
Reviews.Content: We actually stayed here in August 2009 for a long weekend, but the date of stay that you can choose on this doesn't go back that far. This hotel was top notch. We were given a free upgrade on arrival as they were not fully booked and the room we were given was gorgeous and had a great view. The mini bar got topped up for free every day which was great as it meant that we didn't have to worry about buying any drinks. The pool area was beautiful and we went regularly for a swim at the later times as it wasn't so busy (the pool opened until 10pm). The location of the hotel is ideal, as it is just a short stroll to where everything was going on. The staff were friendly and they remembered your name so they could greet you every time they saw you. Everything was just classy with this place, from the stunning architecture that makes up the building to the quality of rooms and service. We would definitely stay at this hotel again!

Reviews.Title: “Quirky interesting hotel let down by bad service”
Reviews.Author: deeboy
Reviews.Content: Building: An interesting and quirky building with a few rough edges but makes a nice change from a standard corporate hotel. Bedroom: Pleasant if not outstanding room, rather smallish and dark but with very comfortable bed. Free minibar a nice touch. Large comfortable bathroom but with broken bathtap so had to use shower. Facilities: Nice leisure area with small pool and saunas/ steam room. Location: Handy for station and also for bars and restaurants. Staff/ service: The check in and check out process was pretty much ruined by one unhelpful, rude member of staff. I don't expect, especially on arriving mid-morning, to be told that there are no twin rooms left and then contradictoraly and brusquely told to stump up an extra â‚¬30 if I wanted one - which I declined to do. The same staff member was disinterested and rude on check out the following day. The booking process was also unsatisfactory - I had to chase a confirmation arrival which did not arrive within the two days stated, and then the booking information was wrong and I had to email back and forth to change it Definitely not the service I expect at a 5-star hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Stunning Art Deco Features”
Reviews.Author: Fussy_People
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for an extended spring break and felt very pampered. The hotel is very near central station, which makes it convenient, if in a very busy and noisy area. We chose to pay a supplement to have a very large room overlooking the canal; one side of the hotel borders a busy main road. The hotel was originally built in the early 20th century as the headquarters for the six Dutch shipping companies, and it is well worth exploring up the stairs to look at the stunning marble, stained glass, ironwork and board room. It is now a luxurious place to stay with complimentary mini bar replenished each day, excellent housekeeping and other service. However we chose not to eat breakfast or dinner here as it was very expensive.

Reviews.Title: “Loved our stay at the Grand Amrath”
Reviews.Author: MaryM054
Reviews.Content: Near the train station, this was the perfect hotel to haul our jet-;lagged bodies, heavy suit cases is tow, the morning we arrived in Europe. Sumptiously elegant and stylish, awash with art nouveau details, accomdating staff, and awesome beds and bath. Complimentary mini-bar was a favorite of the kids. Conveniently located near the Centraal Library where we dined(!) both nights we were there. A+

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic hotel, great location”
Reviews.Author: hanna8577
Reviews.Content: Me and my partner had an absolutely perfect stay here. Staff was very helpful and attentive, spa was great and suprprisingy quiet, the room was beautiful and the free minibar (replenished daily) was a nice bonus. The architecture and design of the place is absolutely stunning. The not-lockable frosted glass door to the bathroom might not be to everyone's taste but to us it wasn't a problem. We loved the location as well, quiet but really close to the central station and just on the edge of where all the action is. Comfy beds, impeccable cleaning. We opted for cheaper breakfast than the hotel one, there are plenty of other great places close by.

Reviews.Title: “Ignore the negatives this hotel is worthy of its 5*”
Reviews.Author: VolvoC30
Reviews.Content: Perfect location near the railway staion gives the Amrath the edge over its rivals. The room we had was on the second floor; it was huge! Decor was traditional for this type of hotel. Despite the wintry chill the room was beautifully warm. I would certainly stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Outstanding all the way”
Reviews.Author: JoPro-UK
Reviews.Content: Just spent the easter week-end in Amsterdam, glorious weather... I had booked more than 5 months in advance as a x-mas present for my girlfriend.. first we have been upgraded we have been given one of the 2 'presidential' huge suite in the hotel for 3 nights: it was really fantastic: the decor was out of 1001 nights stories, very cosy, with a roof top terrace of about (no kidding) 300 m2 just for the two of us and panoramic view over the whole of amsterdam, we couldn't have dreamt for more! we just wished we had some more friends to party with us (for one night only;-)!! the Amrath staff has grand from the start: genuinely happy to help. We haven't hate there so can't comment, but the mini-bar was always full, and the expesso machine was also free of use: perfect to wake after. Thanks guys for a perfect stay which will be very very very hard to top!

Reviews.Title: “Luxurious”
Reviews.Author: Hardright
Reviews.Content: Had a large (Europe standard) room overlooking a canal and just a few steps from the Central Station. Nice amenities, great spa, quiet, clean with a very helpful staff. Could not ask for more. Would very likely stay again on business or pleasure.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel pity about the spa”
Reviews.Author: CowesElephant
Reviews.Content: This 5 star hotel has a spa in the basement which is equipped with machines that are both dated,poorly serviced and potentially dangerous. The steam room stank of cigarette smoke and a raised poor fitting central valley gutter cover resulted in a badly stubbed toe. My partner had a facial which left her with sore and dry skin as the therapist was obviously inadequately trained. Complaints to the hotel management were not taken seriously and regrettably I cannot recommend this hotel which is in a beautiful building with pleasant rooms with nice views over the city.

Reviews.Title: “A 5 star building housing a 3 star hotel”
Reviews.Author: cdnmojo
Reviews.Content: I've just returned from a 3 night stay here and came away disappointed. The exterior of the building is beautiful and has some beautiful public areas. The interior architecture is odd, likely due to it's history as an office building, leading to disjointed spaces and poor room layout (e.g. TV unwatchable from either the bed or seating area). The one benefit is very high ceilings and large windows which lead to a light, spacious feeling. The rooms are generally comfortable with nice beds and furniture. I thought the towels felt cheap and threadbare, which is unacceptable for a five star property. Luxury should be the name of the game. The toiletries were Lanvin and were of a nice quality. The service is poor overall. The entrance is up a long flight of stairs thus you'd expect, especially in a 5 star hotel, a bellman positioned at the bottom of the stairs. Not the case here so I got to lug our bags and kids up the stairs and into the lobby. Of all our trips in and out of the hotel during our four day stay, only once were we offered help up or down the stairs. There just don't seem to be enough bellmen on duty. Not five star service by any stretch of the imagination. The housekeeping is atrocious. The first day our room was not made up at all. We returned to the hotel at 8pm, tired after a day of sightseeing and the room looked just as we left it. No clean dishes, no coffee for the morning, no clean towels, etc. I went to see the manager and they sent up housekeeping. Not much of a solution for a five star hotel. Other chains I've stayed with that do have true five star hotels would have been mortified. The second day the room was made up but there were no clean dishes left for us, so again, I had to call down to have fresh cups, etc delivered. Disappointing. I called down to the concierge on the 2nd morning to try to arrange tickets to Keukenhof via the package advertised on their website, due to the timing flexibility it offered. I was told that couldn't be done and I'd have to go with the company that the hotel used (and wait 2 hrs for the next departure). I just went to the business centre and booked it myself. I can't think of a time when I'd been told by a concierge I had to use a particular service for anything, anywhere. Sure a concierge will often recommend something but they've always got some flexibility if you desire another service. Not at the Amrath! Loctionwise, the hotel is very handy to Central Station. If you are looking to visit things to the west side of the centre (Anne Frank house for example) it's a bit of a walk and if you are offended by the Red Light District you'll have to be alert to circumnavigate that. For my situation, I'd look to stay a little more central next time to cut down walking a bit. We wandered into The Grand Sofitel while out exploring and it looks to be much more to my taste. A fountain in their entrance courtyard caught the eye of my toddler so we went over to look and a bellman came to greet us and he told us that they had a nice garden and maybe we'd like to have lunch there tomorrow so our child could play after we ate. That is how five star hotels are run, with attentive people who go out of their way to attend to your obvious needs, even if you are not resident at their property (next time we will be, thanks Sofitel). I will not return to this hotel nor would I recommend it to others. There are better options for you money in Amsterdam.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent conversion; interesting building; some aspects more 4* than 5”
Reviews.Author: the-ladies-who-dine
Reviews.Content: An excellent conversion of a landmark building. Rooms large (high ceilings too) & airy; well equipped (eg Nespresso machine, mini bar, robes & sllippers). PLenty of space to sit & relax in between sightseeing. Staff excellent - all very helpful. Location is close to station, so not the most beautiful area, but accessible from/to airport & very convenient for trams to all parts of city (though everywhere is wlking distance really). Our superior city view room was very quiet & had a view over the canal, old houses & spires. The free mini bar was an added bonus! Restaurant & bar - both good food, quality & service. Wellness centre was excellent - gym & spa facilities well maintained & quiet. Would recommend this hotel, but it isn't right in the heart of things (that's probably a good thing!).

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel - small location problem”
Reviews.Author: Yoram2HerzliaIsrael
Reviews.Content: Stayed 4 days and enjoyed the room and hotel amenities - spa, complementary room bar, excellent bathroom. Hotel staff very helpful - especially Aso the concierge who catered to our every need and gave very useful recommandations. The hotel is located on the edge of the city center (very close to the central station) so walking to the center may be a problem if you are not in good shape. We did not eat at the hotel and the price of breakfast - 25 Euro each - seemed a little high to us.

Reviews.Title: “Enjoyed my stay”
Reviews.Author: PeterDCanada
Reviews.Content: Great staff, really nice room with 14 foot ceiling and big windows to match. I got my room through Priceline bidding for E99/night - excellent value for money.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic”
Reviews.Author: Gox55
Reviews.Content: Second stay at this hotel in 2 years and both times have been fantastic. Highly recommend for business and leisure. Great location, near central station and close to most things you want to be close to. Fantastic rooms, amenities and service.

Reviews.Title: “five star hotel with three stars standards”
Reviews.Author: iwonab
Reviews.Content: I have stayed in the hotel over the weekend to celebrate my partners birthday. That was suppose to be a nice surrprise thats why I hosen five star hotel with the central location. Unfortunately our room was very small, cold most of the time with the tv placed in the position impossible to watch, remote control didnt work. Room was dark and had a view over the busy street. Spacious and comfortable bathroom , the warmest place in the room. We enjoyed spa area which was small but lovely unfortunately not cleaned very often, next to the swimming pool you could find empty glass bottles day after day. And breakfast, not included but so overpriced for what it was!!

Reviews.Title: “Lovely hotel, individual and grand!”
Reviews.Author: Smashers999
Reviews.Content: We were very happy with our stay here, we were going to book The Victoria plaza but after reading reviews of it being infested we decided to stay here instead! Glad we did. The building itself is very grand and different from what you'd usually expect from a large hotel, beautiful architecture. The pool is medium sized and lovely to swim in, nice sauna and steam room facilities. The sauna and jacuzzi could have been hotter, though. Staff were attentive and friendly and I felt comfortable staying here. Room service was quick and the food delicious, enjoyed the free daily replenished mini bar! The room decor could be updated, but the bed was super comfy and massive and the bathroom lovely. The water was a bit cold for the bath, though, don't know if this is a safety feature or something? We had a beautiful view, we were on the 4th floor, room 410 and it was really quiet. We did pay 20euro for the upgrade. Hotel is very close to central station, so a great location. Overall a lovely stay, would recommend!

Reviews.Title: “Hotel for antique lovers”
Reviews.Author: mluv2travel
Reviews.Content: The hotel exterior looks beautiful from the pictures, staff was very nice and accomodating, nice pool, sauna, and fitness center. Complimentary wi-fi and mini bar which is nice. I purchased the superior deluxe room that is 2 step above the very basic one and then the one with the view, then my room. So the room is on the larger size but without view which i think does not make any sense. The cheaper room is smaller but with view, mine is bigger and more expensive but no view, extra euro for view. So when i open the curtain, im facing another window from another room, thts why i kept it closed most of the time. To my opinion this hotel is probably perfect for antique lovers, and definitely not for me. I wasnt sure when i bought it since it was a last minute thing, and this hotel was on sale, had good reviews surprisingly and they were smart enough to throw in complimentary wifi and mini bar. I think the pictures looked better than the reality. When i first walked into the lobby, i felt like walking into those old churches and museums in Rome. I know those Rome churches is much older but i felt like walking into a hundreds of years old of building, literally. The wood trims that has been painted over and over again, old fashioned red carpet, old wooden bedroom doors, ancient looking lobby, and suddenly you walk into this one modern elevator, or the swimming pool and fitness center. I think thats kinda odd. My room in my opinion made me feel claustrophobic. First of all, no view so i have to close the blue busy print looking curtain the whole time pretty much, red busy print carpet, red wall paper with some golden leave print or something, topped with dark color furniture everywhere. Claustrophobic and misty feeling. And the room was hot too. Its about 35F outside but hot inside the room. I cranked up the AC to high fan with the lowest tempatature it had, i was still sweating every night. Bed wasnt too bad though. Bathroom was not bad, shower pressure was nice, toiletries was Lanvin - very nice. Location is across the central station to left. 10 minutes walking to red light district and chinatown, about 15-20 mins to Dam Square/city center. Its definitely not in the center. I would not go back to this hotel and would not recommend to friends either, unless they are Titanic lovers then this must be the one.

Reviews.Title: “Absolutely wonderful”
Reviews.Author: Muppetmum Posted by an OctopusTravel traveler
Reviews.Content: A wonderful hotel with exceptional staff, we thoroughly enjoyed our stay at the Amrath. Well appointed accommodation, the staff made the atmosphere one of calm friendliness where nothing was too much trouble. Near enough to the tourist attractions to be easily walked, it was just far enough away to be out of the hustle and bustle.

Reviews.Title: “Good hotel with great location”
Reviews.Author: BushFreak
Reviews.Content: Located close to the main station and trams makes travelling and exploiring the city very easy. The hotel itself has friendly service and good rooms, with great food in the restaurant and a cozy bar area.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel !”
Reviews.Author: Derbli
Reviews.Content: Excellent hotel very clean and confortable. A peculiarity of the hotel is that the freezer itens are included. I was there on an honeymoon and me and my wife really enjoyed. But the hotel breakfast bufft is very expensive (something like 25 euros - person).

Reviews.Title: “Never again. Highly overrated.”
Reviews.Author: Travellingchaos
Reviews.Content: My room was in the basement and uncomfortably warm. There was no way to cool the room and no way to open the window. When I asked if I could change rooms to at least have one with an opening window I was offered a new room...for an additional 40 euros! I also made the mistake of eating in the restaurant. It was actually one of the worst meals I've had at any restaurant. Pasta swimming in brown oil and bread pudding that couldn't be cut with a knife. I've never written an online review before but this hotel was so overrated and disappointing that I had to speak up.

Reviews.Title: “Grand Art Deco Building with poor room design”
Reviews.Author: AntonLF
Reviews.Content: The building is great, and have been beautifully restored. Inside its a maze with long corridors lacking room directions. Many historic elements are nicely preserved. Most of the rooms however are poorly designed. I dont think anyone would like a room with bright red carpet and walls, and with green blue jellyfish pictures. One room however (number 133) was nicely designed with four poster bed and calm colors. The wardrobe though is so small, its seems to be a joke. The location is central, but the shortest way to Dam square is via the red light district. The service is good, no problems. The breakfast is fine as well.

Reviews.Title: “I would like the room i paid for.”
Reviews.Author: ikins36
Reviews.Content: I stayed here from 4th-8th March 2011 with my husband. It was a much anticipated trip without the kids in a five star hotel. As with most city hotels, it is not cheap but it was a special occasion We booked a superior deluxe city view room, with king size bed and a bath on a high floor.The room was booked with Booking.Com and pre-paid. On arrival at 7.30pm we were told that there were none of these rooms available and we would have to have a lesser room. We were taken miles down to a basement room then another room with separate beds. We got a room eventually on the second floor with no bath. The manager apologised and promised to move us on Sunday to a better room. Got moved to a smaller one on Sunday. The hassle over the rooms put a massive damper on the week-end and after a while you have to just get on with it or ruin the trip. I think when things go wrong at the beginning you find flaws with everything.and there were flaws! We are not people who complain but we just wanted the room we had booked and paid for. I think if you book through one of the many online sites you have to be very careful that you get the room you paid for. I think there are certain rooms they try and put you in.ie. the basement and the back because they can sell your room for a higher rate on the day. Not very impressed. We stayed at the Marriott last summer with the kids across town.If you judge a hotel on whether you would return then the Marriott would be a big yes and The Amrath would be a no.

Reviews.Title: “Astounding Surroundings”
Reviews.Author: Jart_7
Reviews.Content: Booking a room with full wheelchair access can be tricky and often the hotel has an incomplete idea of what a fully accessable room acctually is. Not so with the Amrath. Having booked via Expedia, I telephoned the Hotel and they confirmed the booking, with each of our requests guarenteed. Simple and efficient - thank you. On arrival we were awe struck by the exterior of the building, Dutch but extravagant and other-worldly, a delight. The entrance lobby is a grand confection with every space full of original features and subtle referrences to the history of this great building. The wheelchair user in our party was shown to the accessable entrance (right by the taxi pull up) and we checked in with no glitches.
