A smiling porter took us to our rooms and we were more than happy with the allocation. The accessable room was super large, a small suite with a hard wood floor, and two chair users could share this space with ease and comfort. The bathroom was, again, exceptionally large with both wet room style shower (including chair) and a luxurious bath. Full marks. Our room was a little smaller but equally well appointed. Good sized TVs (two in the accessable room), coffee maker and free minibar added to the comfort zone, and the bed was one of the most comfortable I have ever slept in. Our rooms were next to each other and on the ground floor so no breathtaking views, but to have the confidence in our friend's ability to manage for himself in his room it was well worth the trade off. One small criticism, the towels. A five star hotel should be providing the fluffiest top quality towels, not thread bare with ragged edges. Come on, sort this out Amrath. Breakfast is not our meal but we dinned in the hotel mid week, impressed by the small contemporary menu. The tasting menu was fine and they managed to cater for a shellfish and pork free guest, so full marks there. The wine was ok, if a little unadventurous. However, they really need to improve the knowledge of their waiting staff. The young woman serving us was surprisingly inarticulate and didn't seem to know much about the food or wine, simply quoting what was on the menu. Not good enough for a 5 star experience and easily rectified. Room service provided us with late night burgers, good quality served piping hot in 20 minutes, and the bread and butter pudding with bannana and chocolate hit the spot. Bar staff, concierge, porters, receptionists were super efficient, smiles galore and courteous at all times. Be aware, this is not a modern hotel, no massive glass and steel lobby with branded gift shops or extravagant art. But none the less, a beautiful historical space full of the original marble, wood and stained glass from another age, detailing the history, oppulence and might of the great Dutch shipping company that built it. Breathtakingly beautiful. Saddly, one event did annoy me and it's worth knowing: We wanted to weigh up taking a cab v's public transport back to the airport. The concierge quoted us a "hotel agreed rate" of E45 and on refelction we chose that option. We went back and asked for a car to be arranged, only this time it was the porter at the desk who said it would be E50, for a bigger vehicle to manage the wheelchair and cases - fair enough. Except that when we got to the airport the driver wanted E58 - "for a larger vehicle"... poor and cheap. If there is an agreed rate for this journey it should be adhered to. Needless to say, the driver lost any tip they might have deseved for loading and unloading the luggage and chair.

Reviews.Title: “Great stay, perfect location.”
Reviews.Author: Jossick
Reviews.Content: Had a great stay at the Amrath for 4 nights. We stayed in one of their deluxe (i.e. standard) rooms - it wasn't massive but was well laid out, had a big comfy bed and a nice seating area. The free mini-bar was a nice bonus. The building itself is beautiful, and the location was excellent. Dam Square is about 15 mins walk away, which puts this a bit outside the absolute centre of town, but the location worked really well for us. One of the nicest places to hang out in the evening was Nieuwmarkt square about 5 minutes from the hotel (full of lovely bars and a few nice restaurants), plus Amsterdam is small enough that everything is in easy walking distance. Would definitely go back to the Amrath if in Amsterdam again.

Reviews.Title: “Grand Hotel AmrÃ¢th Amsterdam an unmatchable experience â€¦.”
Reviews.Author: Tjeerd-Jan
Reviews.Content: Grand Hotel AmrÃ¢th Amsterdam an unmatchable experience â€¦. Recently, my wife and I spent a weekend in this hotel that is located in the vaccinated building of the former Royal Steamer Society. After a warm and hospitable welcome, where the car by an employee is parked on the closed parking, we are guided to our suite. A beautiful suite which consists of a living/work room, bedroom and a bathroom. Breathe history while the rooms are equipped with all the facilities that makes a stay as more pleasant, ranging from two flat screens, a true four-poster bed to electrically controlled curtains. Recommend a guided tour of one of the hospitable but not intrusive staff. They have provided us with all sorts of things about this building full of beautiful details and grandeur that if a warm blanket to feel. The proximity to the shopping area, museums and entertainment centre is almost perfect, everything is within walking distance and the routes are located in a safe area. After an afternoon of shopping and culture sniffing is to relax in the extensive spa, which is equipped with fine saunas and a swimming pool. In a completely relaxed state we have enjoyed a glass of fine wine in the hotel bar before us fully swear to all the goodies that is provided in the on-site restaurant. The next day begins with a generous breakfast buffet which we have chosen for the English variant supplemented with all kinds of fresh fruit and vegetable drinks. We can recommend everyone this and want to fill out the staff and management to thank for this unforgettable experience. With compliments, Fam. Nijboer (Leeuwarden, Holland)

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful canal view upgrade”
Reviews.Author: ozzy2011
Reviews.Content: Ok, so this was my second time staying at the Grand Amrath Hotel. We had two bookings ( the first a very cheap Standard Room with breakfast via agoda ) for 3 nights, then another booking for 7 nights ( Superior Room City View via expedia) after a weekend trip to Berlin. We arrived at the hotel about 10.30 am from a long flight and were able to checkin early. I mentioned that I was celebrating my birthday and had two bookings. I was immediately offered an upgrade for my first stay and also the opportunity to have same room for our return. Room 107. ( smoking) It was an excellent choice for us as the room over looked the canal and was at the back of the hotel, VERY quiet. After some great shopping in Amsterdam we were able to leave one very full suitcase at the hotel while we were in Berlin. On return we were given the same room as promised. We experienced only one problem while staying the second time. Some very noisy guests in the room next door arrived on the Friday evening ( our quiet sanctuary had been disturbed). It became clear that these people were up for a big weekend which would have meant an end to our enjoyment of the room. I complained to the concierge who immediately dealt with the situation in a very robust manner which we were very grateful for. We had no further disturbances. As I have now stayed at this hotel multiple times here is my general review. The Staff are friendly, discreet and efficient. The rooms are fabulous with high ceilings and the most comfortable beds I have ever slept in. Large baths with plenty of room for two. There are differing reviews on whether this is a 5 star hotel. If you are after large pretentious foyers with giant chandeliers and staff the fuss over you like your royalty stay somewhere else. If however, like me, you book a hotel for its convenience, location and quality of rooms/beds there is no better in Amsterdam. The amrath has a unique style with welcoming unpretentious staff. It is the perfect room to get over jet lag. We ate breakfast at the hotel when it was included in the room rate and chose to eat elsewhere when it was not included as there is plenty of choice nearby. I will definitely stay again.

Reviews.Title: “a great hotel with a special athmosphere”
Reviews.Author: manywhere
Reviews.Content: I was there for a 1-night stop in Amsterdam with my family. This hotel is just great: it features a very high standard of comfort and service, with something that makes the difference: due to the historical building, this hotel has a "soul" = it is much different from other top end chain hotels. Our room was pleasant: very large, with an impression high celling and a nice art-deco touch. Last but not least, the hotel is less than 10-minute walk from the central station and other places of interest while visiting Amsterdam, but remains in a quite area. I will definitively go back to Amrath Amsterdam... if I get an affordable rate!

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic Hotel, great location, poor breakfast”
Reviews.Author: pstevens
Reviews.Content: Just stayed one night but was really impressed by the hotel. The building is fantastic, you must spend some time exploring the staircases, landings and other public areas. The rooms are well appointed with great beds. Free mini bar too! The location is a few hundred meters easy walk from the Central Station and convenient to all Amsterdam attractions. Just one negative though. The breakfast was C25 Euro each and definitely not worth it. Skip breakfast in the hotel and go to one of the nearby cafes.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic Location, Fantastic Hotel”
Reviews.Author: MrsBfromYork
Reviews.Content: My husband and I have just returned from a 3 night stay at the Grand Hotel Amrath, Amsterdam - it is great and we both really enjoyed staying there. The hotel is fantastic, the staff are very helpful, the rooms are clean and spacious and the location is superb. It is very unusual for me to be so complimentary about a hotel as I usually find something to complain about......... but on this occasion I couldn't! I am still in shock that the mini bar in the hotel room is re-filled every day - free of charge! The location is superb it is easy to access the main sites and attractions and the hotel is only 7-10 minutes walk from Amsterdam Central Train station - get the train from the airport its really easy and the taxi's are very expensive; 45 euro by taxi each way 8 euro return train ticket (per person).. Don't be put off by the outside of the hotel building, when you first arrive I was a bit worried as it is rather gothic looking from the outside but inside it is really really nice. Only thing to be aware of - it is a 5* and you do pay 5* prices in the hotel bar, but then my husband and I found eating and drinking in Amsterdam expensive. If you want a good meal while you are there I can certainly reccommend the Me Naam Naam Thai resturant and the Aneka Rasa Indonesian resturant - both serve excellent food and drink the service is fantastic!

Reviews.Title: “Comfortable , Spacious rooms and helpful staff”
Reviews.Author: the_white_leroy
Reviews.Content: Me and my girlfriend recently stayed at the Grand Amrath for two nights the reason for the choice of hotel was the star rating against the price, We payed under 300(sterling) for 2 nights in a deluxe room without the city view , Which i actually preferred because it faced an inward courtyard type place with plenty of privacy. Also the hotel lived up its name " Grand" Because all the high sealing and lovely art added to the comfortable stay we had, it seemed like we were the only people on our corridor sometimes which added to the privacy. Another reason for the booking of the hotel on my part was the "free mini bar" Which was daily topped up , Only point i will make is that the brand of local beer was not to my taste but the hotel had no problem with you stocking up on your own choice of beer from the supermarket a 1 minute walk away. Again we could not argue with the service provided by this hotel. The Location was a perfect only a ten minute walk from both central station and the lively red light district . Would recommend this hotel to any other couples planning a trip to the fantastic city of Amsterdam. Yours sincerely The_white_leroy

Reviews.Title: “Perfect”
Reviews.Author: manchester3
Reviews.Content: I stayed here with my boyfriend for my birthday . We got the train from Central Station and walked to the hotel (about 10 mins walk) . As soon as we arrived at the hotel there was a lovely man who came running up to us to take out luggage from us as he must have been able to see i was struggling wuth my ridiculously large suitcase i took for 3 days ! Check in was simple, they informed us that they had given us a free upgrade with a canal view which was a nice surprise. Our room was on the top floor (4th) the room was long and narrow , the bed was lovely and big with lots of pillows and cushions. The bathroom was perfect with a lovely deep bath. The best thing about this hotel is the free mini bar which is re stocked daily , red wine , white wine minature bottles of vodka , whisky , Barcardi etc and bottles of beer which my boyfriend enjoyed. The Nespresso machine is fantasic. The breakfast which is also included in the price was amazing , the best scrambled eggs and mushrooms and as much freshly squeezed juices as you want ! The spa is also lovely with a small swimming pool with stars above you , a jacuzzi , saunas and a steam room with lots of comfu beds and chairs you can sit in and relax, we managed to enjoy this with nobody else there which was a bonus! The location is good , right near the red light district with all the bars and restaurants close by but far away enough so you can't hear any noise at all and close to central station and the trams so you can get around easy enough. This staff at this hotel are so freindly and can't do enough for you, they even put some gorgeous chocolates in my room one night with a card saying happy birthday from all the staff .My mum and dad are also now booking to to stay here in the summer . It really is worth spending a bit more money to stay here , with the breakfasts , free mini bar , nespresso machine and the spa and the lovely staff it would be daft to stay anywhere else!

Reviews.Title: “Horrible People”
Reviews.Author: davidh96
Reviews.Content: After my girlfriend was taken seriously ill whilst on holiday, they tried to charge â‚¬160 for a 5 hour late check out. Forcing her to go and sit in the airport. That is pretty poor service and even worse morals. Avoid this place.

Reviews.Title: “amazing hotel”
Reviews.Author: sara892010
Reviews.Content: stayed for 4 nights in the amrath early feb 2011 hotel was nice and quiet loved the room very high celing, spacious bathroom with shower and bath. bed was amazingly comfortable, free mini bar topped up every day was an added bonus. staff helpful and friendly definitely will be staying here again

Reviews.Title: “classy hotel in a top position”
Reviews.Author: dontshootimjoking
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the amrath in october for a night whilst there for a football match. Check in went smoothly, left our bags at reception and went for a walk around. Came back an hour later and were taken to our spacious room. The room was a little dark, but fine, with free internet and minibar !!. sadly i didn't make as much use of the minibar as i should, too busy enjoying myself !. The bathroom was a decent size and clean. The location was ideal, close to central station and to all the nightlife, but far enough away to get a good sleep. Would go again in a heartbeat.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful”
Reviews.Author: paulsail
Reviews.Content: A wonderfully located and appointed hotel in a uniquely converted building. Customer service on front desk was not perfect but not that bad. Beds were superbly comfortable and room was nice and big with high ceilings. Had only booked standard deluxe suite so was pleasantly surprised.

Reviews.Title: “Fabulous building”
Reviews.Author: ArnoldSurrey
Reviews.Content: We stayed for a weekend and found the building to be amazing! Lots of marble and dark woods and our room was of a reasonable size probably quite large by usual european standards. Very clean and a lovely bathroom. Shame that the TV didn't work properly but then we weren't there to watch TV (luckily). We ate in the restaurant and enjoyed a terrific 7 course chefs tasting menu at a very reasonable price. The waiting staff were a delight and we spent 3 pleasurable hours in their care. A surprisingly small reception area but probably constructed to fit around the existing architecture. Very convenient location and we would recommend this to all travellers. Cannot comment on pool or spa as we didn't have time to use it. Given the high representation of other Amsterdam hotels on the "Bad" list we are so glad we used trip advisor reviews and spent the extra money on a decent hotel!!

Reviews.Title: “Stay here for a Special Times”
Reviews.Author: DonTrader
Reviews.Content: Having read all the recent reports they are amazingly ascurate. We sgtayed for 3 nights early February for the wife's 50th birthdsy and really enjoyed our stay. Minus points weree the courtyard view and quirky shape of the bedroom. Plus points were the coffee maker, free mini bar, breakfast & location.

Reviews.Title: “fantastic hotel”
Reviews.Author: michelle874
Reviews.Content: this hotel was lovely the staff were very helpful from reception, also front desk staff and house keeping we stayed here for our 25th wedding annervisary because it was a special occasion they gave us a free upgrade, the room was fantastic and the superior rooms have free mini bars if you want to stay some where upmarket i would reccomend this place, walking distance from every were you want to go, we have been 16 times to amsterdam and this was the best, thank you to all the staff from rob & michelle

Reviews.Title: “6 out of 10”
Reviews.Author: mtlfamily4
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for an annual conference...rooms were ok, bathrooms was amazing bedroom portion was ok at best...dark and smelled a little funky...staff overall were friendly, spa and pool were very good...food was good as well. Location is OK but a little far from shopping and had to cross the red light if you wanted to go anywere really. I would only stay at this hotel is all other 4 and 5 star places were booked!

Reviews.Title: “Grand Art Deco”
Reviews.Author: AJMBournemouth
Reviews.Content: We chose this hotel for its external Art Deco features - which are oustanding. The staff were friendly and helpful. Our room (number 232) faced an internal couryard and so was very quiet but it was a little smaller than we expected however it was very comfortable with all the features such as trouser press, coffee machine, free internet access and deep bath etc and a huge plus - A FREE MINI BAR ! which is refilled daily. Minus points - the wardrobe was so small and difficult to open due to the bedside table. Plus points - the room was very clean, I could find no dust or stray hairs in the bathroom. The air conditioning was quiet and effecient too. We did not try breakfast as we were too full from the Seven Seas Restaurant the night before. We found the quality of food excellent and the prices very reasonable especially considering it is a 5 star hotel. In fact we ate in both nights as we thought is was so good. It is difficult to find anything significant for us to moan about at this hotel, although the remote control curtains in our room seemed to have a mind of their own and opened & closed several times on their own during the night - a ghost maybe ? hehehe It is close to Central Station but a few mins walk to Dam Square and the flower market area. You could always take a tram.

Reviews.Title: “Loved the art deco architecture”
Reviews.Author: DeltaOrionis7
Reviews.Content: This is a top hotel in a top location in Amsterdam. We stayed here for a couple of nights during a weekend trip last year. The fact that we got a huge discount made booking this place possible for us. You will love the Amrath. Excellent service in classy surroundings. If you are an architecture fan you will love this place even more. They have hardly changed this former merchants' building when they converted it into a hotel. All the interior details are fascinating. Only minus was the size of the room. There was a huge (comfortable!) bed and a table and chairs, but there wasn't much space to walk around. But this definitely would not deter me from staying there again. This is a big budget hotel, but look out for discounts on hotel booking sites and this bit of luxury will be yours (did I mention the free mini bar?)!!

Reviews.Title: “Unique hotel and very comfortable”
Reviews.Author: MidwestFamilyTvl
Reviews.Content: Beautiful and unique building. I stayed here for 4 nights and felt comfortable the entire time. Friendly, but slow staff. That is ok. Very large and luxurious bathrooms for Amsterdam. Nice rooms with good beds. The bar is great and serves good, light fare like sandwiches and salads, just when you are getting sick of seafood and cheese. Building is secure and safe. The snack bar is truly free and is a nice touch. Limited selection, but great in the morning for orange juice and at night for wine and water. Location is good, right by Centraal Station and the Red Light District with plenty of eating and entertainment choices. I might think twice about staying here with my children, as one has to walk through the District to go nearly anywhere unless you want to walk around it.

Reviews.Title: “Worth the money - stay here”
Reviews.Author: lc1113
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for 3 nights in Sept 2010. The rooms are very large and spacious. They are truly modern and very new. The bathrooms are exquisite and include the finest toiletries provided (Lavin products). The beds are so comfortable, I slept SO well those 3 nights. The location to the Central train station is spectacular - even with having to roll our heavy luggage over there, it was about a 10 min walk. Everything feels very close in Amsterdam, so we were able to walk to all the major attractions from our spot here. Only reason we took the tram was to go to the Heinken Brewery and we just walked over to the train station where all the trams (buses) come in and out of. Very very good location. The hotel staff was amazing as well. So friendly and helpful. Huge plus to the conceirge that arranged our day trips out of the city and provided us very helpful suggestions for where to eat and go at nights. This was just one leg of our European tour, but I can tell you the other hotels we stayed in where not nearly as amazing as the Grand Amrath. Definitely stay here! It is completely worth the money.

Reviews.Title: “Certainly not 5*”
Reviews.Author: BearLobster
Reviews.Content: My comments below in bullet point form: - Hotel lacking atmosphere (in everything but exterior architecture). - Room dirty upon arrival (surfaces not clean, nespresso area dirty, mould on surfaces in bedroom and in bathroom, rubbish in cupboard). - Room was damp and cold (demonstrated by bubbling wallpaper and aforementioned mould on ceiling). Despite having a "deluxe room with city view" the room was so small you had to squeeze past the foot of the bed to get to the far side of the room. - Heating was unreliable, and room temperature was extremely uncomfortable at times - Hotel was noisy - there is an old wooden lift system in the hotel which cannot be used for safety resons but for some reason was run all night on a few nights - clattering and clanking away and keeping us awake. - Service was appalling and staff unhelpful - when reporting cold room temperature to reception they did the bare minimum to help and the problem was ultimately not solved. Despite a refreshed-daily "free" minibar being included in our package the hotel on numerous occasions failed to replenish the minibar. On one day when I actually called reception to ask for the minibar to be filled, at c.8pm (we wanted to have some drinks in our room before heading out for dinner) they said they would not be able to help as "the drinks were locked away and nobody has the key". To conclude it is a shame that a building with such potential to be a great hotel is being run in such an appalling way. A 5* hotel should never put guests in a dirty, cold room - and nothing should be impossible - especially when the request is as simple as a few beers at 8pm!

Reviews.Title: “check the bill”
Reviews.Author: beoordeling188590
Reviews.Content: Booked on their internet websit for 2 rooms. On the last day, we paid our bill with VISA and straingly enough we couldn't buy anything with our VISA card any more in other shops. After contacting our bank, The amrath took 1330 euro reserve on booking and another 950 euro I have paied for the rooms. Meaning the limit of 2500 euro on my card was nearly reached. With lak of money we had no ther choise than to return home. A few days later the banc account was arranged and the 1330 euro provision was given free. Although it did ruin our last "shopping" day in Amsterdam. Further they charged us 80 euro vallet parking, Since we came by train, this was cancelled, nevertheless, a nice try. Rooms were quite spacious and pool area very clean. Dispite our negative financial eperience, hotel is well worth its 5 stars.

Reviews.Title: “Conveient to train station,large rooms,”
Reviews.Author: MCZAR1
Reviews.Content: This is my second stay at this hotel. It is located about a 10 minute walk from central station in Amsterdam so you can walk to it unless you have a lot of luggage. The check in process went without trouble. The check in staff are professional but could be more friendly and welcoming. The building is fantastic and the rooms are quite large especially for European hotels. The mini bar is included in the room rate. The room was clean and there were no problems with anything in the room. Breakfast in the dinning room was good although not sure worth the cost. We did have a few drinks in the bar/lounge and the bartender seem somewhat inexperienced. The conceirge was excellent, attentive, helpful and friendly and was probably the best of the staff in the hotel. Internet access was also free which was quite nice .We had no negatives but just do not get the welcoming feeling we have received from other hotels in Europe. I would rate the hotel as more a 4 star than 5 star.

Reviews.Title: “WoW! What a treat”
Reviews.Author: alburston
Reviews.Content: We stayed in Oct. 2010. The place is very near the train station and is very beautiful. Interior is in 1920 art deco motif. Lovely art, fabrics and colors. The staff is attentive to every issue with fast service. Linens and beds are very comfy and bathrooms are wonderful. Everything has been newly upgraded and decorated. But best of all after a long day of sightseeing.... was the spa and the free mini bar in the room. We would go back in a heartbeat. We felt like royalty!

Reviews.Title: “Somewhere just beyond perfect”
Reviews.Author: JoziMatt
Reviews.Content: This hotel is amazing. My expectations were high, and they were substantially exceeded. I just cannot say how much we enjoyed our stay at the Amrath Amsterdam. The hotel, which is in a historic building which previously housed the offices of a shipping company, is beautiful - the old wood panelling, the stained glass, the polished brass - its all still there. We were able to check in very early and were put in a junior suite. Lovely high ceilings and beautifully appointed room. The bathroom was the highlight was a big, deep bath tub that we made full use of. The staff went out of their way to help and provide directions, and the hotel is very convenient to the Centraal Station and the old part of Amsterdam. Why on earth would we stay anywhere else in Amsterdam?

Reviews.Title: “Excellent hotel with character”
Reviews.Author: PatrickxOxfordshire
Reviews.Content: We stayed for 4 nights on a short break to Amsterdam in Novermber 2010. Having searched for a suitable hotel, we were glad we chose the Grand Hotel Amrath. First of all, the location is great - being on the waterfront, close to Central Station and all the tram services, as well as ideal for exploring the canals. From here you can walk to a lot of the sights like the Royal Palace, Dam Square, Anne Frank house, etc. The Van Gogh Museum and Rijksmuseum are further afield - walkable for the keen and able, but better to take the short tram ride across the city. The hotel has a good ambience and, being the former Shipping House, is full of character and original art-deco features. We chose a Superior Deluxe Room, which was on the 3rd floor and a good size with an enormous bath/wetroom. The room was very quiet and the bed was one of the best that we have ever slept in (maybe the best!) for comfort. The minibar was free and re-stocked each day (though they did run out of white wine). However, this has to be offset against the cost of breakfast - good though it was, a bit steep at 25 euro each! Only negatives with the room, were a lightbulb that needed replacing (swiftly replaced after reporting) and the drainage from the shower was a bit slow. We ate out every night so cant comment on the restaurant (other than breakfast), but the staff were really friendly so suspect they would take good care of you for a meal. All in all, a great hotel for a short break to Amsterdam... and we felt we were staying somewhere with a bit of history and character, which added to the atmosphere of the whole trip.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent hotel with great service”
Reviews.Author: JDCC2006
Reviews.Content: We've stayed in a few of the good hotels in Amsterdam, but I have to say overall this is now our new favourite. It is very convenient for the station and the historic building is beautiful. We went for the superior deluxe room, with extra high ceilings and huge bathroom and every amenity you could need. The free mini-bar was a welcome treat. Very cosy room and extremely comfortable bed. All the staff were excellent, especially the very helpful, friendly and cheerful concierge who was a relief to see and to take our bags immediately as we stepped in the door, no doubt looking bedraggled and exhausted from our snow-bound epic train journey from Germany! We decided to try the restaurant in the hotel on the first night and it was excellent. It was so reasonably priced we certainly didn't expect the standard of food that we got. I ordered several courses too many but it was difficult to choose. I would say the highlights were the scallops, the lentil soup with sweetbread, and the beef. My husband enjoyed the veal with sweetbreads, the ravioli and the sea bream. The service was also excellent with the very friendly and helpful restaurant manager. The bar area is also good for snacks, with again very efficient and friendly service. Room service also good and reasonably priced. The pool and the sauna area was the great bonus for me though. It was a very relaxing setting and I think that and the staff sets this apart from most of the other hotels that charge similar prices but don't have these facilities. We look forward to returning.

Reviews.Title: “Brilliant stay”
Reviews.Author: iris444
Reviews.Content: Our second visit to this hotel after two years. Had a last minutel 4 nights deal. The staff were much approachable and friendlier compared to the last visit. The wellness center was a bonus after a long day walking in the snow and doing side trips from Amsterdam by train. The small computer room with free access and printer was extremely useful when our flights were cancelled due to weather conditions in UK. We did not eat in at all but took some of our meals and enjoyed the beer at Cafe Kobalt, Singel 2A.

Reviews.Title: “Good hotel with character; don't get too excited”
Reviews.Author: max_umami
Reviews.Content: I have stayed at the hotel twice - each for about two days. The hotel has a lot of character and is in a good location, walking distance to Amsterdam Central train station and to popular tourist areas. Despite the dozens, if not hundreds, of hotels in town, Amsterdam sets a low bar for hotel quality. The Grand Hotel Amrath is one of the better ones, though you won't find many high end hotels around to compete. If you're looking for a high-end Four Seasons-quality, this is not your town (unless they build something after this writing). I fully admit I can be very picky so don't let that outweigh general decent experience at the Amrath. Overall, it was clean, convenient and the service was excellent. One thing that stuck out on both trips - there was musty/offensive smell in bathroom (wasn't me) making me wonder if the sewers or water drains allow some odor to backup. It was not a show-stopper.

Reviews.Title: “Wish we could have stayed longer”
Reviews.Author: squeeks72
Reviews.Content: I booked 2 nights away for my wife and I as an early birthday present....and No kids!!!! I chose this hotel after reading reviews however was a little scared as there were a few bad reviews which had been posted as well. I needn't have worried...This hotel has so much character and charm and all the staff are very pleasant and helpful and there to make your stay a most enjoyable one. The reception staff were friendly and efficient and the Concierge was able to give us some great advice on areas to visit on our stay. The maid comes round your room around 6pm to tidy up, top up coffee, give you fresh towels etc. The spa is fantastic and my wife and i were the only ones in there one evening. Just a shame i never had time to have one of their treatments however the pool and sauna and gym are all great and again very clean., We never ate in the hotel as we chose to venture out and eat in the main squares so cannot comment on the food, that said, it must be good as the restaurants were always busy. We had a Superior room with a view of the station. The rooms are fantastic with comfy beds, high ceilings,luxurious bathrooms and electric curtaibs :-) I stay in hotels every week with my work and this has to be one of the most charming and friendly and value for money i have ever stayed in. We will most definitely be back...hopefully for longer next time.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful location, beautiful hotel, not great service upstairs”
Reviews.Author: greenwayplanner
Reviews.Content: This was my second stay at the Hotel Amrath this year. When I arrived the hotel was very busy, and I was given a small but tidy room in the hotel. The front desk and concierge were excellent and very helpful. There are no large lobby rooms in the Hotel Amrath, so the condition of the hotel room becomes very important. During this stay I found a complete inconsistency on how the room was cleaned and how the minibar was handled. There is a free minibar in each room, and I found that the bar was not checked and replenished each day in a consistent way. The last day I gave up and did not call down to the front desk to have the water replaced in the minibar. I do not know if my experience was compounded by being a solo traveller. There was definitely a change in how the rooms were serviced, and an electrical issue left from a previous guest was never fixed, despite my repeated tipping and requests. Wonderful location, great staff on the main floor, but not sure on the changes upstairs.

Reviews.Title: “Great Stay”
Reviews.Author: MurliEma
Reviews.Content: Its a 5 Star Hotel with a very warm and friendly touch. The building itself is awe inspiring. Rooms are spacious and clean. Bathrooms too were spacious unlike teh small cubicles that you find in some hotels. Top it all, the Mini Bar contents are covered in your room rates and are replenished FOC every day. Just 2 mins walk to the happening area of Amsterdam

Reviews.Title: “The best bed I've ever slept in”
Reviews.Author: Markus645
Reviews.Content: This hotel is incredible and if you find a good deal like I think we did, stay. The beds are huge and so comfortable. The rooms have high ceilings and are oppulently decored. It's in a reasonable walking distance to the train station and all the main tourist spots (I did it on a broken ankle). The concierge was fantastic and arranged any trips we wanted which could be paid through the hotel (such as the water taxi). The mini bar was free which was an incredible bonus and this hotels pool and spa is top notch. Few hotels in Amsterdam have a pool and it was so nice to be able to have a dip in the afternoon after a day out in the cold. It also has a starry ceiling which is really cool. We loved this hotel and will try and get back for a longer stay soon. The only negative I can think of is the restaurant was a bit pricey but there are do many other nearby places to eat it's not a problem.

Reviews.Title: “WAY overpriced! Dissapointing room”
Reviews.Author: jlo102159
Reviews.Content: We paid 400Euro per night for a room in the basment! Listed as a "Deluxe Room." WAY overpriced. The desk staff was not overly friendly or helpful either, but the concierge(s) were very helpful. Great location if you want to be near the train station, tram connections, canal rides, and the hotel is unique. But the rooms, service and interior are unexceptional, especially for the price. We stayed in another hotel on our return to Amsterdam, on the Singelgracht (canal), which was much nicer and more reasonable.

Reviews.Title: “A mecca!!!”
Reviews.Author: yayangie
Reviews.Content: After a bad experience at in Paris and on the train, my friend and I showed up to this hotel absolutely cranky, tired and wanting to go home. As soon as we checked in, all those feelings melted away. The staff was so friendly, helpful and accommodating, we were blown away. Our room was absolutely beautiful and the bed was very comfortable. We slept really well. Our bathroom was immaculate with a soaking tub. The hotel has a wonderful spa with affordable massage prices and a fantastic steam room. The food was delicious and I have never had service this good at any other hotel. We almost cried when we had to leave. I will definitely go back to this hotel when I return to Amsterdam. I highly recommend!!

Reviews.Title: “VERY DISAPPOINTING VISIT”
Reviews.Author: YorkshireFellow
Reviews.Content: My wife and I, after reading reviews on Tripadvisor decided to stay at this hotel. We regret our choice.I have stayed in many 5 star hotels and this I would rate at less than 4 stars. Our suite had an canal view and was of a reasonable size. Unfortunately there was something wrong with the plumbing. Soon after we arrived I tried to have a shower. The channels where the water should have gone were blocked and the bathroom was flooded. The water started coming into the bedroom. We called reception and after half an hour had to go down myself to reception. Two people then arrived and removed the blockage. However the stench we smelt when first going in the room was still present and got worse as the day went on. No-one tidied up the mess and the wet footprints of hotel staff were plain to see for the next two days. We had hoped to be offered another room but we were not. We put up with the smell for two nights. During our short stay some newly purchased hair straighteners of my wife "disappeared" from the room. We compained to the management but after an investigation by them they have been unable to find them. We were offer a free nights stay in the future but we declined this as we could not stay in any hotel where theft was treated so casually. Would not recommend this hotel to anyone. Two plus points to the stay were the quietness in the room when the remote controlled curtains were closed. The second plus was the pillows were possibly the most comfortable pillows i have ever slept on. However, this does make for the dissatisfaction we feel.

Reviews.Title: “I loved it.”
Reviews.Author: NancyLee1969
Reviews.Content: The hotel is beautiful, An old ship company in art decor style. Alot of interresting ornaments inside and outside of this historic building. It is beautiful when the building in lighted up at nite in the evening.After a long day walking around the city, a swim in the indoor pool, saunas, jaccuzi really helped with my tired legs and body. There are also massage and treatments in the spa for a reasonable hotel price. There is not so many hotels has a spa and a pool in Amsterdam.So for me, it is a perfect place to stay for the facilities and for the value of money. The hotel service is good, food is good . Rooms are nice. Apart from the breakfast buffet for 25 euro, there is another option for just a more simple french breakfast for 13,50 euro in the Bar/Lounge which is think is a nice details. I recommended this hotle.

Reviews.Title: “Interesting Hotel”
Reviews.Author: beenaroundtheworld00
Reviews.Content: My husband and I made our first trip to Amsterdam in September 2010 and did a 5 star / first class trip in several countries in Europe for his 40th birthday. This in not a 5 star hotel by any means. The hotel had a weird entrance and hallways and seemed very dark but it is a great location. Staff gave us mis-information about places to eat but we figured it out ourselves. The bed was very comfortable but parts of the hotel felt dirty. I would probably stay at another location if we went back.

Reviews.Title: “Five star??? No way”
Reviews.Author: prada777
Reviews.Content: This property is not even close to a 5 star hotel and they can thank the rude and curt women at reception as well as whatever the scam is to have a porter bring even the smallest bag to your room. Room assignment is clearly linked to the booking site-despite having paid extra for a deluxe room with a view, I was "upgraded" to a superior room with a view of an exterior wall ladder and the other side of the building. ( I will say that there was a lovely bird's nest on the ladder to replace my paid for deluxe room with a view). When I queried about the lack of a view...the truly snippy lady in reception informed me that I had been upgraded so nothing they could do...I would have traded the few extra feet for a view that I paid for! Rooms are average in scope and furnishings so nothing special. I have had better personal service at 2 star properties...only book here if your get a very cheap rate...not worth any more unless you crave rude check-in and curt responses to any request for help.

Reviews.Title: “A Really Good Experience At Grand Amrath”
Reviews.Author: Gracieva
Reviews.Content: There are so many bad reviews of the Amrath that I felt I should give the other side of the coin - a great experience. I had booked the Amrath through an internet booking site at a significant savings; it was accepted (and this was months in advance). I then received an email from the company that said "sorry, the hotel would not accept your reservation! " What? Apparently there was a large IT conference taking place and they knew they could sell the room much higher than I was paying. So I got proactive and after speaking to the horrible rep at the booking company (cannot remember the name) I wrote to the President of all the Amraths, not expecting to hear a word for little ole me . But I had to release my anger and I was seething. To my surprise he wrote me the next day apologizing and agreeing it was not the way for a 5* property to act. He reinstated my reservation and had the manager at the Amrath write in addition- with an apology and confirmation. After reading all the bad reviews, I was constantly worrying about our stay, however, went ahead knowing it was for only a short time. When we arrived, two young men were being checked in and this was at 7:30am...they were told their "jr suites " would not be available until 3 or 4pm. I am thinking,oh no we have to sleepwalk through Amsterdam! So we sit down to a desk with 2 young ladies and I am dreading this....tired; long flight from U.S. etc. and I give her the note from the GM with our "superior deluxe" res. & to my surprise a man comes out - apparently a mgr. sort and thanks us for coming; speaks to the young women very quietly and all of a sudden we are in the most beautiful deluxe suite we've seen in years! Clean, very contemporary with a 4 poster all in black. Beautiful layout and an unbelievable view of the canal. Surprised, but VERY happy. We had been travellng since 12noon the day before and the room gave me enough" endorphin happy feelings" to enjoy Amsterdam's beautiful sites w/o a nap. I wish we had stayed longer. The staff and concierge were very approachable and friendly as we strolled around looking at the amazing architecture - the very reason we chose the Amrath. Very good dinner in the bar area; friendly bartender. SO...if you have complaints I would take the time to write to the company; giving a bad review is helpful for prospective guests but taking it to the top of the company just might change some of the problems the Amrath faces. It is sad to read the bad reviews when I know there opportunities for an excellent stay as we experienced. I tried to upload a pic of the gorgeous room but it did not work...I am sure there are pics somewhere - it is called the 4 Poster Room - very romantic.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent need I say more?”
Reviews.Author: Clive100000
Reviews.Content: Very good accomodation close to centre, central station and trams. Quiet rooms with free minibar! Srayed in room 202 overlooking canal and city centre - thank you.

Reviews.Title: “Really enjoyed”
Reviews.Author: JackTheTraveller
Reviews.Content: Excellent location, wonderful rooms, great free mini bar and nespresso machine in the room. Didn't try the breakfast at 25 Euros a person. The only problem is the reception desk. It is staffed by inefficient very young people that have no idea what and who. They struggled checking us in and the check out was a pain. Fitness center is not up to par but anyway after walking for hours in Amsterdam, it would have been hard to take advantage of it.

Reviews.Title: “Nightmare stay and TOTALLY overpriced!”
Reviews.Author: GabyTraveler
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Amrath and though it is well located, I cannot find anything good to say about this hotel. We were staying in a superior deluxe room which was tiny and on the ground floor and so noisy- we could barely sleep. Probably the worst service in a 4-star hotel I've had in years. Internet didn't work and supposedly reception is the ones who are to help (they were clueless). Had to call housekeeping for a towel 3 times- and it took 45 minutes. The concierge was very nice, everyone else was relatively unpleasant. And it was expensive too!

Reviews.Title: “Classy old Art Deco Building, oozes class!.....”
Reviews.Author: matt_le_cock
Reviews.Content: ...Spent last December here at Xmas, loved the Art deco feel of a former shipping companies, worth an explore to see quirky bits of architecture, check in was a bit slow because of them loosing the online booking form, which stressed me a bit, but apart form that, lovely boutique type of room, staff were smart and on the whole was a good expereince, spa was clean and I loved the old style lift, room was quiet and afforede us a view over the harbour, on the whole a good weeknd, would i spend Â£200 euros, prob not, got a cheap deal on the net!

Reviews.Title: “Not a five star”
Reviews.Author: rrlondon500
Reviews.Content: Was rather disappointed with this hotel. The staff took ages to check me in- and then spent about 10 minutes arguing as to who was going to take me to my room. I would have been happy to go myself- and thought it was quite rude. I suppose they did not realise that i speak Dutch. Although the building is spectacular- the conversion of the office it used to be is rather cold. Very dark and cold. Just felt like you were staying in offices with a few beds thrown in! But on plus side rooms are massive.

Reviews.Title: “A bit let down”
Reviews.Author: Han30
Reviews.Content: i booked this hotel for myself and my partner to celebrate his birthday, so i thought it would be good to have a relaxing weekend in amsterdam. i was shocked at check in when they asked for 300 euros as security as they needed 1oo euro for each night we were staying there. i was not told about this before and i had read the small print which stated i would be charged 5% service charge and i assumed that would be it. they had problems with both my debit and credit card and i started to feel embarrased as i knew i had money in my account but felt like i was made to feel that i shouldnt have been there. i informed the staff that i only had GBP on me and i was happy to leave some cash as backative but i had insisted that i leave 50 euros a night as i was not told of this. they accepted my offer and asked me to change my money as they can only accept euros so i had to go out and look for a money exchange just so that we can get into the room. other then that the hotel was ok. i dont think it should be a 5 star hotel as i have stayed in better places before which were graded lower. i have also stayed in other 5 star places which lived up to their 5 star reputation, this i feel they didnt. i was upset to go down to the wellness centre that myself and partner were looking forward to and was told that the steam room was out of order and that they were still waiting for a specialist to repair so that was a bit of a downer. we did however make use of the sauna, jacuzzi, and swimming pool. the breakfast was ok they served a lot of pig which was no good to either myself or my partner as we are muslims. we did ask them if they had a veg option e.g veg sausages etc and they didnt. the only good thing i would say about this hotel is its locality as you are fairly central and the free minibar which was good as we stocked up on the soft drinks. i wouldnt say i had a bad service, but it wasnt 5 star either. i wouldnt come back to this hotel as its not worth the money Â£750 for 3 nights and i would definently not recommend the breakfast which we paid 35 euros a day as it just was not worth it.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Hotel”
Reviews.Author: bessiebell
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for 2 nights for my husband's birthday. The hotel is in a great location and the room we had was amazing. I think they upgraded us as I had contacted them in advance and told them it was a special occassion. I would definitely stay here again - lovely hotel with great staff.

Reviews.Title: “Not worth your $...not very clean and they make promises they retract later.”
Reviews.Author: aleakatan
Reviews.Content: I booked this hotel because it was supposed to be a 5 star hotel near the train station. The price for the room was fairly expensive but I was willing to pay a price for a nice hotel. My travel agent booked our room for our family requesting a rollaway bed for our 2 yr old. Upon arrival they stated that there was a charge for the rollaway bed. I told them i did not want the rollaway bed if they were going to charge me. They then spoke amongst each other and offered us an upgrade and free rollaway bed. When we go to the room it was fine. The decor was nice and there was a window that opened all the way. But the room was not cleaned properly before our arrival. There were opened bottles of wine and water with the mini bar, dirty cups, and hair in the bathroom. In my opinion, for a 5 star hotel, it should be much cleaner than that. The concierge was very unhelpful. He could make no recommendations on restaurants in the area which seemed strange to me. Upon check out we were charged 50 euros a night for the rollaway bed. When I spoke to a manager to remove the charges they refused saying our reservation stated it was only for 2 adults and that we made no mention of a child as part of the reservation. It did not matter that I was told otherwise at check in. I DO NOT LIKE SURPRISE CHARGES!! I thought their demeanor over the situation was unprofessional. I would not recommend this hotel to anyone who is looking for 5-star service! The only good thing about this hotel is the pool. However, the area is not maintained throughout the day. Dirty towels left on chairs for several hours and water cups left around pool area. Again, not a 5-star hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel and really nice staff”
Reviews.Author: MrandMrsSmith2009
Reviews.Content: We booked this hotel as part of a secretsales web-site promotion. Although when booking we upgraded the room to Deluxe. We arrived on Friday early evening and upon checking in the receptionist gave us a free upgrade to Junior suite without us even having to ask! The room was MASSIVE and came with a free minibar filled with soft and alcoholic drinks. The cleaner even put a small bottle of champagne in there on Saturday which was a nice touch. The Spa facilities were very good (jacuzzi/steam/sauna/etc) and well maintained, although I could imagine at the height of season you may be pushed to find a spot to sit or a bit of a squeeze in the pool! We didn't use the main restaurant but did use the bar for evening food and breakfast, both well priced and decent enough food. The Concierge was excellent, a really nice guy and recommended places to visit and a restaurant to visit on Sunday (Indrapura - fab!) The hotel is well positioned away from the red light district and if you walk south you wouldn't know the Damrak was even there.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent location, Great accommodations”
Reviews.Author: fortissimos
Reviews.Content: We did extensive research prior to selecting a hotel for our first time stay in Amsterdam and could not have been happier with Grand Hotel Amrath. We were initially concerned since the hotel looked to be a little farther out from the city center on a map but since it was within walking distance to Grand Central station, we thought it would still be an ideal location. It absolutely was the best location. We were close enough to walk into the city center and also so close to the train station that we could get to anywhere in Amsterdam with no problems. Additionally, since it was a little farther out from the center of the city, we were shielded from a lot of the noise coming from the partying in the streets. We happened to be there during their Queen's Day celebration so people were out and about in the streets around the clock. The location of the hotel sells it on its own but the accommodations were also top notch. We got a room right next to one of the canals so the view was spectacular. We had their buffet breakfast every morning and it was by far one of the best we had during our trip around Europe. We never had time to use the spa facilities but I did walk around and it was definitely worth it, if time permitted. One of the BEST things about the hotel room was the unlimited and FREE drinks in the room's mini-bar. They restocked it every day and it had mini liquor bottles, beer, juice soda, and soda water. Plus they had an excellent cappaccino machine with a variety of flavors. All of this was included in our hotel stay, which was amazing. The room was just the perfect size for two travelers with a queen sized bed, sitting area, desk, bar, and gorgeous jetted tub and marble shower. We would absolutely reccommend this hotel to anyone that is looking to be close to Amsterdam's city center but far enough away that you can get some rest without the noise. It was a great hotel in an awesome location with superb amentities and perks.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Stay”
Reviews.Author: Soyamada
Reviews.Content: Great hotel in an excellent location. Walking distance to everything. The room was spacious and had great canal view. The bathroom was very modern. The only recommendation I have is more closet space or drawers to store your luggage.

Reviews.Title: “Not quiet”
Reviews.Author: eater1Vienna_VA
Reviews.Content: Very helpful staff and nice rooms. We were upgraded to a "quiet room" (room 12) BUT there was NO QUIET. The staff, at all hours of the day and night used the corridor for work purposes: moving bags of bottles, carts, talking on the cell phone, etc: and each noise was heard easily in our room. If this was just during the day, fine; but it went on during the night into the morning. Very irritating. The so-called fitness room is terrible.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic Art Deco hotel, great location”
Reviews.Author: geekyGirl73
Reviews.Content: My partner and I have now stayed at the Hotel Amrath twice and immensely enjoyed both stays. Formerly the HQ of a shipping insurance company, the amazing Art Deco building has been sensitively converted to a hotel. The staff are polite and helpful and the rooms and facilities are what you would expect from a 5 star hotel. The only disappointment was the breakfast - the choice wasnâ€™t as extensive as it should have been for the price of â‚¬25 per person. The location is perfect - a short walk from Centraal Station and very close to the oldest (and prettiest) part of the city.

Reviews.Title: “Best Hotel Experience I've Ever Had”
Reviews.Author: Unforth
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Grand Hotel Amrath last fall with my mother, brother, sister-in-law, and wheel-chair-bound grandfather. We selected this hotel primarily because it had handicapped access and a room with a handicap bathroom. I'm not sorry we did! The entire experience, from start to finish, was excellent. The staff were uniformly delightful, the hotel was amazing and filled with personality, our rooms (we had three) were large and comfortable, the amenities were great, I could go on and on. The only negatives were that it was expensive, and it doesn't have a prime location. However, if I could afford to, I would stay there again in a heart beat. The place was so lovely I even treated IT as a tourist spot, wandering the building and taking photos of it's beautiful early 20th century art and architecture. Highly recommended!!

Reviews.Title: “Grand Amrath Hotel- PRAISE!”
Reviews.Author: Charmanestar
Reviews.Content: Customer service (email) is superb: weeks before checking in, I had a few special requests and questions for the hotel, in which the staff usually responded within 24 hours with detailed and answers to my questions. Very professional, highly trained, and sweet people. Upon arriving, the check-in staff, bellman were very helpful with smiles and energy all around. The requests I made through email, were still held true when I arrived to the hotel. They managed to keep all the notes and communications until the day of my arrival. The room I had was a superior deluxe I believe (one step above standard basic). The room was clean, with a big LCD TV, free mini bar included stocked with beer, soda, orange juice, water (still and bubbly), chocolate nougat bar, tonics, and a few small shots of vodka, gin, cognac. Also had free bath robes, slippers, nespresso machine with three kinds of espresso pods, english;chai; and another tea, sugar and cream. On a side note, there was a very cute and charming young lady named Lindsay who helped me to check in, she was great as a trainee. Overall, I would come back in a heart beat. Throughout my stay, every single interaction with the staff was great and I am all about customer service. They exceeded my expectations by a long shot. I miss my hotel stay already... I forgot FREE wifi too! As many laptops as you want.

Reviews.Title: “Grand Amrath was the Best!”
Reviews.Author: Travelmonster420
Reviews.Content: Right next to the train station, red light, coffee shops, and great shopping! It is the best place i have stayed in Amsterdam. The free mini bar is a huge plus since in most hotels a soda is 7-9 euros it can really save you some money! My girlfreind and I had a blast walking around this huge hotel and great city. Can't wait to go back!

Reviews.Title: “expensive but worth every penny!”
Reviews.Author: diannejordan
Reviews.Content: We stayed in the grand amrath on the 18th sept 2010 for 2 nights-3 days. i wish we could have stayed longer as it was beautiful, im quite picky about where i stay and search around as much as i can. This hotel is central to everything you need in Amsterdam, everything is not too much of a walk but your also not in the thick of it. warm welcome and spotless room, also the mini-bar was always well stocked up and included in ur room, reminded me a liitle of the Mal Maisons only not as dark inside, it also has a old feel to it so i guess they have kept so many of the origional features whilst also keepin it upto date for the 20th century. The evening meal was very nice although a bit pricey it was extremely posh haha, the drinks are expensive but you expect that in a 5*. We cant wait to go back to Amsterdam and will deff be staying in the Amrath again as i see it as 1 of lifes little pleasures we all deserve now and then! Have stayed in many hotels and this one is right up there with my top 3, loved it and dont think about booking if your going to Amsterdam just do it as it will make the few days you have there the cherry on the cake!!

Reviews.Title: “5 star everything!”
Reviews.Author: stimpy30
Reviews.Content: We spent our wedding anniversary here. We jumped straight on a train at the airport to central station which was a stones throw from the hotel. It cost us â‚¬8.40 by train and was told by a very kind passport checker that taxi would be â‚¬50. We had a 4 day 3 night stay and it was perfect! Admittedly the check in/reception area was abit unusual but we were met by friendly staff who were very helpful and checked us in early and upgraded our room. The room was lovely and overlooked the canal. Mini bar was topped up everyday, only replacing what we had used. Nespresso was topped up several times a day which was handy as the bar was quite expensive for a small coffee. Everything was within walking distance or you can jump on the canal bus or tram. We loved everything about Amsterdam and the Amrath was the icing on the cake. It certainly deserves its five stars!

Reviews.Title: “Very comfortable”
Reviews.Author: Vacationqueen84
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for 3 nights recently and enjoyed our stay. The rooms were big and the bed very comnfortable. The concierge was very good at recommending and reserving good places to eat. Breakfast was the typical buffet; nothing outstanding. The only real complaint was that they locked us out of our room twice. The first morning we went for breakfast and returned to our room to find we were locked out. No problem getting it reactivated that time. However, on our last morning after learning that check out was 12 noon we went for a walk, returned at 10.30, and had a taxi picking us up in 15 minutes. Could not, once again, get into our room. The girl on reception insisted on checking us out even though it was only 10.35 and we could not get through to her that we needed to get into our room to get our bags. In the end, we had to ask the concierge to assist us, which he did. It was pretty stressful and it made us feel as if they could not wait for us to leave. However, despite this, we would return, as overall our stay was excellent.

Reviews.Title: “Unique property - but not a 5-star hotel”
Reviews.Author: JustVisiting1
Reviews.Content: We spent six nights at the Amsterdam Amrath. Here are our pros and cons: +We were upgraded to a junior suite. It was very spacious - tall ceilings and windows. The room overlooked the canal. +The hotel is within view of the Central Station. Easy walk. Taxis will not take you from the train station to the hotel. -No hotel lobby. -Staff was pleasant but not friendly. We found this to be true all over Amsterdam. -Bathrooms were very awkward and lacked privacy. -We expected more from a 5-star property.

Reviews.Title: “A Good Choice!”
Reviews.Author: Invernesstraveller
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed here for 4 nights at the time of the world cup finals when Amsterdam was very much alive and extremely orange! We arrived late in the evening and were warmly welcomed by the receptionist and shown to our room by a very helpful porter who took trouble to explain all its feaures. Our room was spacious and well-furnished with a well-appointed bathroom. Prior to our arrival, we had thought that the free mini-bar was probably a bit of a gimmick but got quite used to having a selection of refreshments on tap. The building itself is quite extraordinary and we did take a few wrong turnings. I used the pool and jacuuzzi and we ate in the bar as we watched the world cup final. The food and service were both excellent. We booked room-only and had no difficulty in finding breakfasts nearby or in one of the museums/art galleries. The hotel is well-situated for the railway station so very easily accessed from the airport. Should I be returning to Amsterdam, I will certainly look to stay at the Grand Amrath again!!

Reviews.Title: “Good choice”
Reviews.Author: Renee B
Reviews.Content: We are staying at the Amrath and enjoying the stay. The rooms are large enough for 2 of us ladies to share, the bathroom is large, shower and large soaking tub, 2 sinks and good towels. Large bathrobes and the mini bar is free, they have a good espresso maker in room. The only draw back is lack of hanging space and drawers to stick things in. The bar in the lobby is very good and their food is so nice for a snack. Good location and great value for anyone visiting Amsterdam.

Reviews.Title: “the amrath at amsterdam”
Reviews.Author: jorgecapirone
Reviews.Content: Having not being at Amsterdam before, it was quite a challenge choosing a hotel in this town. The Amrath was quite a pleasant surprise, exceeding what I had expected. Very friendly staff at Reception and Restaurant, very nice rooms and a nice spa all of it in a historic building restored to nowadays standards of comfort made me feel quite at home. By the way, skip the Concierge (quite an attitude ... unexpected flaw in the service) By any means, choose this hotel as your option in Amsterdam.

Reviews.Title: “A Gem in Amsterdam”
Reviews.Author: John_S23455
Reviews.Content: What a gem in Amsterdam. Not your typical five star hotel as far as the lobby goes, but everything else is first rate. A large, comfortable room, with working AC and free internet is only made better by the FREE mini bar! The location is an easy walk from Central Station even with luggage.

Reviews.Title: “nice”
Reviews.Author: titchntall
Reviews.Content: I took my husband here for a couple of nights for he's birthday treatÂ  last year, the hotel is beautiful, and was only a short walk from the centre.I did get rather frustrated by the attitude of the girl who checked us in on reception, slightly rude, but i have experienced worse! The rest of the hotel and staff more than made up for this, the room and bathroom was decorated and furnished to a high standard, breakfast was an additional Â£25 each - Expensive - well so we thought untill we had one - worth every penny, it was lovely, you could have anything and as much as you wanted of it.We did go to use the pool and spa but they were cold, the heaters were broken and not heating them, we did not mind, we went to get changed and went back to the cafe! on the way out of the spa we mentioned to a couple of people that the pool, and areas were a bit cold, only go if brave!!! but they were not fellow guests, they turned out to be managers!Â  We said we didnt mind, we were going back out now, but that evening we returned to find that they had put 2 breakfast vouchers under our door with a written apology. How lovely, we were most impressed with the way it was dealt with. we didnt even know we were complaining!!! We liked it enough to plan to return towards the end of this year. WELL DONE GRAND AMRATH - JUST SORT YOUR RECEPTIONIST AND YOU WILL HAVE PERFECTION!!!

Reviews.Title: “Poor Check in and no AC”
Reviews.Author: Travelingdale
Reviews.Content: We did not find the Amrath to have a friendly check in staff. In fact we had to wait 20 minutes to even talk to someone. When we were escorted to our room, we carried our own luggage as the only individual that could take us was a small, young woman. Our room was on the 1st floor, very hot and the windows did not open!! After two different complaints we were finally moved to a nicer suite with windows that did open. The concierge was very helpful but the remaining staff did not display any sense of care or concern. We were disappointed.

Reviews.Title: “Art Deco Gem with amazing rooms and comps”
Reviews.Author: PickyTraveler44881
Reviews.Content: We loved the room so much that we actually stayed in on a day with drizzly weather. The bathtubs are one of the best I've seen, even better than the Ritz. The rain shower and separate shower head are a nice touch too. the Lanvin products are high quality and include a bath fizzy each day. Of course, the complimentary wet bar makes you feel you are in a not-so-pretentious 5-star property. The architecture is well preserved with truly modern upgrades. The only downside is it's proximity to nightlife and Central compared to the other 5-stars in Amsterdam. You are in a neighborhood instead of the heart of the city.

Reviews.Title: “Five stars is pushing it”
Reviews.Author: Andiboy17
Reviews.Content: This is not a five star hotel, i would rate it about a three on a good day. There were good things [most of the staff [xcept the miserable girl who checked me in, never saw her smile once-especially when she was welcoming me!] The hotel position is good too. And impressive architecture. The toiletries are fab, as is the free mini bar, and the bathrooms are beautiful with olympic size baths that you could stay all day in- however there are bad things you should be aware of..- no air conditioning in a five star hotel? Over 20euros for room service of a burger and nine french fries????? Was shocked when i realised they charge you and extra 7.50 euros on top of the outrageous meal charges... The towels weren't that soft. The slippers were for women, and not for mens feet. The room i was allocated [421] was meant to be a nice room [according to the miserable receptionist], it was at the back of the hotel, views of a car park, and felt small and cramped [wall at end of the bed felt like room was closing in on you] the shower was ok , but the soap dish prevented you from standing right under the shower head, i kept wanting to tilt the head towards me. And do not book this hotel for the gym, i wasted my time taking my gym kit as of the six or seven machines, two were broke and remained out of order throughout my stay, one machine was so complicated to use taht it took three members of staff to try and show me how to operate it, and still it was useless, felt very cramped and a last minute addition to the hotel, the spa area was slightly better, if you like warm water from the drinks cooler, and could have done with being kept tidier more frequently. Was also not well signed when you got to the basement, and i needed showing where it was once i was down there... The staff here were charming however. The business centre? Dont make me laught, the cupboard with a couple of ancient laptops and a basic printer does not account for a business centre in my eyes. The tv in the room did not offer movies on command, many channels failed to get a signal, and the volume kept playing up, again, if you want to chill infront of the telly before heading out, dont book this hotel. Not enough wardrobe hanging space either.- one of the most disappointing have ever come across. And the windows in the rooms do not open, so if you like air, forget it. Would only stay here again if they paid me to. Disappointing by about two stars

Reviews.Title: “Relaxing luxury in a beautiful, historic building in a great location!!”
Reviews.Author: BobetteOxfordshire
Reviews.Content: Just perfect!! The staff were all friendly and couldn't do enough. The room was wonderful. All luxurious bedding in the most comfortable king size ever, 2 sinks, deep, huge bath, larg shower wit hoice of heads. Wonderful. Lovely pool and spa centre. Free mini bar - replenished free every day!! Room tidied every time we went out! Take your own tea bags if you are a tea drinker( dutch tea is foul!) and get breakfast just a few doors down from a snack bar because breakfast was separate and 23 euros each. Having said that there was a reasonably priced snack bar in hotel too. Best hotel ever!

Reviews.Title: “A very GRAND Hotel!”
Reviews.Author: speedymcqueen
Reviews.Content: Just returned from a long weekend at this hotel. Booked it via Lastminute.com after reading the reviews on this site. Not the cheapest by a long way and probably not everyone's cup of tea but I really liked it. Hotel loooks grand from the outside and lives up to this inside. Decor and quality of fittings is first class. On checking in we received a free upgrade and got room 417 on the top floor, Reception staff and concierge were polite and efficient throughout and were keen to ensure that all was well. The room was very spacious,high ceilings,neat furnishings and a lovely bathroom,with quality Lanvin products. The free mini bar and nexpresso machine were used daily and very welcome.The beds were super comfortable with excellent pillows.Our room was on the fourth floor and we did not experience any street noise. We were lead by previous reviews and did not eat at the hotel. We used the pool/spa area each morning and had it to ourselves. The hotel is only a short distance from some of the main attractions and everything is within walking distance,with plenty of places to eat/drink etc. We used the train from the airport to central station. It costs a fraction of the cost of a taxi and on exiting the train station you turn left and the hotel is less than 5 minutes walk away. To sum up,this hotel fully deserves it 5 star rating so if cost is not a consideration this the place to stay.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic architecture, good location but expensive”
Reviews.Author: yvonnetredath
Reviews.Content: Clean spacious bedroom and lovely bathroom. Bed was very comfortable but didnt sleep much as the air conditioning didnt work. Other guests also complained about the air conditioning. Luckily our window would open but then the traffic noise was very loud! Room service was expensive - one pot of tea to the room cost 34.00 Euro!!! Needed a brandy to get over that! In a nutshell - nice hotel but wouldnt stay again - better choice and attractions in London! Keep your money in Britain!!!

Reviews.Title: “Lovely hotel but no AC!”
Reviews.Author: fatbob24
Reviews.Content: Delightful Art Deco hotel built by shipping companies as their headquarters. Friendly staff. Marble everywhere in the reception. My room was on the fourth floor (414) facing the quad in the rear, so it was quiet. Room a good size with a lot of toys ie electric blinds! Bathroom large with a bath, separate shower and two sinks. Only problem is no air conditioning. There is air circulation, but it is not climate controlled. It was 34 degrees outside all the time i was there, so it would have been great to have it. It is centrally located (turn left out of the train station and walk 100 yards and you're there. Easy walk to red light area, the Bokk, and main shopping area. trams are near by for the museum quarter (Van Gogh museum was fantastic, but the Rikjsmuseum is still shut for rennovation after 4 years!!) Certainly a very pleasant stay, if slightly muggy.

Reviews.Title: “If you're looking for air-conditioning, look elsewhere”
Reviews.Author: donfwiseman
Reviews.Content: This is a well-located hotel. Since old Amsterdam is so small, one can walk everywhere from here or jump on a tram or the CanalBus. The building is a former old office building, making the floor plan very quirky and access less than the best. The restaurant has an unusual and not particularly interesting menu for dinner, although the breakfast is quite good. The bar food menu is limited but good. Our particular gripe is that the rooms are not air-conditioned and the three nights we spent there ranged from warm to almost stifling. Most of he windows cannot be opened and there are an insufficient number of fans. We'll try somewhere else next time

Reviews.Title: “Totally Relaxed and Chilled”
Reviews.Author: DuplicateScreenName
Reviews.Content: My Wife and I have just returned from an excellent mid-week break in AmsterDamage, and we thought we should remark on the excellent 5 Star Hotel that we stayed in. I have stayed in the Royal Hotel Amrath once before with another friend. I was so impressed at the originality/history of the building, and the quality of the staff, service and comfort levels, that I booked for my partner and I, to see if she shared my feelings about the place. The hotel is a short walk away from Centraal Station, and easily accessible. It provides easy access to the trendy Neiumarket area (10 mins stroll), China Town (10 mins stroll), Waterlooplein (20 mins stroll), and of course, no visit would be complete without at least a quick walk through the Red Light area (10 mins stroll). The trendy Jordaan area is a little further away (20/25 mins stroll). Liedseplein, Vondellpark and the Museumplien are walkable with a couple of 'Heineken' stops on the way. For the more adventurous, trams are available to every area from Centraal Station (5 mins). We found that during our stay, the hotel was ideally situated for what we wanted to do. We were given a beautiful room in the Old Director's Office area of the hotel on the second floor. The bedroom was delightful with traditional high Dutch windows letting in loads of natural light, and the view of the adjacent canal and houses was very picturesque. A 32" flat screen TV was provided for entertainment, with internet based radio stations for music. A four poster king sized bed with crisp sheets ensured that we slept or relaxed comfortably. A complementary chilled minibar is also provided with some great glasses and Amrath placemats, so we took our turns at being the best bar staff in Amsterdam. I must say that my Wife serves a great Vodka and fresh orange! A Nespresso machine provided us with really tasty coffee or espresso shots. The bathroom was nothing short of both amusing and spectacular. It was built in a glass surround, inside the fabric of the room itself (the building is listed, so they couldn't alter some of the structure of it), so you could actually walk all the way around the outside of it! It has to be seen really to be fully appreciated. The bathroom had lovely backlit mirrors, a two person sunken bath, and a wet room with a rainforest shower head, and several side shower heads. The views from the bathroom were simply wonderful - we were watching the sun go down over Amsterdam, with our minibar drinks, sitting on the side of the bath soaking our feet after some serious exploring! The staff were attentive and efficient, always stopping to say hello or good morning/afternoon. Our decision is already made for our accommodation when we return to Holland again. We didn't quite figure out the air-conditioning situation, and it was really humid when we stayed. We slept with the window open on the last night and got mosquitoed - first time ever in Amsterdam, and I have been to Amsterdam over a dozen times! This is no reflection on the Hotel though! I would just say that if you are visiting Amsterdam in August/September - bring Mozzie repellent.

Reviews.Title: “Love it but it's not a 5 star”
Reviews.Author: kdet
Reviews.Content: We frequently do weekend trips to Amsterdam and I'd see this place and just had to stay there for the Dutch/Art deco architecture. We did get good internet rates on our rooms and they were lovely and spacious. The kids loved the free mini bar and the nice, warm pool. But it is not a 5 star hotel. The front desk staff are really not good enough, probably because they are all under 25. They have an attitude and don't understand customer service. They made a few annoying mistakes that a real 5 star hotel would definitely not have made. The unfortunate thing is that the mistakes would have been totally forgivable - they would have actually apologized! That being said, the porters were excellent!
