Do not let the inexperienced/undertrained front desk staff keep you away from this fantastic hotel! Location is perfect and it's one of Amsterdam's most beautiful old buildings.

Reviews.Title: “Batman will come and get you”
Reviews.Author: plantage13
Reviews.Content: The Amrath looks like it was taken from the set of Batman Returns. The building is quite big and at times a bit confusing... I tried to open somebody else's room after I got confused with the signs on my floor. The room itself is quite fine. Mine was not too big, but I had enough space. It was nice to have the coffee machine in the room... Overall the staff was not very friendly but I guess this is part of Amsterdam's charm. Oh, and the breakfast was nothing special, expected more from a 5* hotel.

Reviews.Title: “greatest honeymoon ever”
Reviews.Author: whenisthenexttrip1
Reviews.Content: i was overjoyed with our honeymoon stay at the grand hotel amrath. we chose amsterdam because we both never been, it was a direct flight from new york, and got a great rate for air and this hotel on orbitz, so i was just excited to go. the room (and service) was remarkable! really big, clean, lovely. our first floor room overlooked a canal, we were so pleased. the bed was amazing and i still dream about the bathroom shower, one of the greatest hotel bathrooms! how can you beat the location a mere 2 blocks from centraal station? everything (dining, shopping) was within a few minutes walk. (or better yet, bike ride!)

Reviews.Title: “Luxury Unprecedented for Us”
Reviews.Author: silentsgirl
Reviews.Content: My husband and I wanted a quick getaway to celebrate my birthday, and we chose my favourite hotel in Amsterdam, the Amrath. We stayed here once before in June 2009 and had a marvelous experience. The Amrath is an easy five-minute walk from Centraal Station, or you can hop on any one of three buses that leave from in front of the Station and be deposited right outside the front door. It is an historic building that has been retrofitted, so it isn't a cookie cutter chain. The rooms have been fitted to suit the building, rather than the other way around. When we arrived, we were immediately greeted by friendly staff, and advised that we had been upgraded to the Oriental Suite. When we were shown the space, we couldn't believe our eyes! This suite is larger than my last apartment, and included a rooftop terrace with amazing views of the city. The free mini-bar was wonderfully stocked with cold drinks, and it included champagne, perfect for ringing in my birthday celebrations at midnight. The spa facilities are luxurious and restful. The swimming pool is modern and has a lane where you can swim against the current in order to get your exercise. Unfortunately, the jacuzzi ladder was not in operation and we aren't spry enough to climb in over the side, but since there was a large jacuzzi in the suite we weren't overly fussed about this. We did not use the massage or wellness services, so we cannot comment on those. The bed at the Amrath is like sleeping on a cloud. Since my last visit, I had been looking forward to that soft, decadent bed again, and was not disappointed. Air conditioning was minimal, as could be expected in a modernised building, but our room was comfortable and cool enough for a good night's sleep. It was also, just like last time, super-quiet, so much so that the only thing that woke me the next morning was when my husband turned on the television in the living area of the suite. My one quibble with the suite is that the toilet area of the bathroom is only separated by a marble partition, and is completely open on the sides. When "enthroned," one can see into the seating area of the bedroom (which means one can also be seen). A simple retractable screen would eliminate this difficulty, and would not harm the look of the space. It's not such a big deal when traveling with your partner, as I was, but offering privacy is never a bad idea. I cannot comment on the restaurants, the wi-fi or the concierge services, as we didn't use any of these. Whenever my husband asks if I wish to take a mini-break in Amsterdam, I reply "only if we can stay at the Amrath." This trip only entrenched my opinion of the stellar accommodations provided by this truly unique hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Comfortable hotel but avoid breakfast”
Reviews.Author: maryGalway_Ireland
Reviews.Content: We stayed in his hotel from 23/7 to 26/7/2010. It is about 7 mins from Central Station. There are road works along the way which make the walk to the hotel uncomfortable. However , the hotel itself is in a beautiful location. iI was not impressed by the attitude of the Reception staff .....I felt they were a little too full of self importance but the porters were lovely. The breakfast was very disappointing. It was not included in the price but for anyone who likes an English breakfast stay away from the dining room. It cost us â‚¬50 for burnt rashers and cold scrambled eggs. . For â‚¬7.50 pp you can get a beautiful breakfast 2mins walk away. The room was nice and good value with a free mini bar but on our last night they seemed to have run out of some items! The Spa area is nice b ut could not use hot tub as ladder up to it was loose and the sauna and steam room are not activated .before 11am . I dont feel that the standard is 5 star but is ok if you get a good internet deal. We did not use the restaurat except for that unfortunate breafast encounter.

Reviews.Title: “One of the finest hotels ever.”
Reviews.Author: unclelouiechi
Reviews.Content: Located a few short blocks from Central Station on a canal. This is truly a five star hotel. Everything was first class. Free mini-bar, in room coffee espresso maker, fine dinning, one of the most luxurious inside spa/pools anywhere. The room was whisper quite (even during the World Cup Finals) ask for anything and they provide it. Custom everything from the wall paper to the rooms. Even if you can not stay here go see this place and try the restaurants. If you want the Best this is it.

Reviews.Title: “Good hotel if it's not hot out!!”
Reviews.Author: glasgowgirl67
Reviews.Content: I am actually a fan of this hotel. I have stayed here before and really liked it. I personally like the location and the free mini bar and fitness center with pool and steam room is very nice. Stayed this time for a few nights in July and it was very hot. No air conditioning in the rooms and the front desk was not able to locate a fan for us. I nearly went out and bought one myself. I didn't realise that a hotel with 4 or 5 stars would not have air conditioning. Very dissapointing. It was so humid, everyone in my family was having cool showers a couple times a day to cool off. Yuck! The room was great, gorgeous views, comfortable beds ect. Please Amrath is you read this, get air conditioning in your hotel so I can come back there. Otherwise I will only stay in cooler seasons. Everything else about the hotel I really like. P.S. The bacon cheeseburgers are really good at the hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Amazing Views”
Reviews.Author: WrldTrvlGrl
Reviews.Content: I booked this hotel wusing hotwire for $120USD per night plus taxes. For that price it is well worth it. When we arrived at 2:30pm our room wasn't ready. It took another 1.5hrs which was annoying seeing as we were tired from the flight, but I can't complain too much since they were upgrading us from a city view room to a canal view for free. The hotel was located less than 1km away from Central Station so we were able to walk to the hotel pulling our luggage. Good thing too because taxis seem to be hard to come by there. The hotel room was clean and spacious. It had 16ft high ceilings with beautiful big windows to see the canal. The bed was very comfortable to sleep in and quite large given normal european standards. The bathroom had a rain shower and seperate soaker tub. There were also two sinks in the bathroom. The mini bar was restocked every morning and completely free. It had bottles of coke, diet coke, sprite, orange juice, water, wine, beer, and small shot bottles of rye, rum, vodka, gin, and something else. The cleaning service clean the room in the morning and then come back at night for turn down service and to tidy up whatever mess you've made during the day. Other than maybe the Von Gogh Museum and surrounding area the hotel is within a 15 minute walking distance to pretty much everything you could want to see. I would stay at this hotel again in Amsterdam but not for the advertised rate of $250USD per night. I just don't think any hotel is worth that per night.

Reviews.Title: “Glad we chose this hotel!”
Reviews.Author: Pixie_0
Reviews.Content: Although it was a little tricky to get to the hotel as there are roardworks at the moment (July 2010) when we did get to the front of it, the architecture is quite something else. Tall gothic building with gargoil statues on the side, next to beautiful tree-lined canal. Its quite close to centraal station and there is a direct route over a bridge to the gorgeous NieweMarkt area. Anyway, going up the red carpet into the hotel you find the concierge desk surrounded by marble walls. A quick check in with an upgrade from a deluxe to a superior room and through the maze of corridors we went. The room was lovely. I'll summerise for easy reading * Big Room * Soft White comfy bed * huge windows * Desk and seperate table and chairs * Modern Marble bathroom with seperate walkin shower with a rain shower head * Nespresso Machine with as many pods as you wish * Free minibar (but bring your own bottleopener or you will have to buy one like we did) * Free wireless internet * contemporary stylish decor * adjustable air conditioning * quiet The staff were lovely and always willing to explain anything or just simply chat. Room service menu isnt very varied and there is not really an ala carte option. Room service incurs a EUR 7.50 charge. Hence we didnt order because you can't order individual items. We didnt get to use the spa area as we forgot our costumes, but other guests seemed to think it was fantastic. While this does fit into my previous experience of 5* Hotels in europe, i honestly feel that 5 stars are given too freely in europe in comparison with what you get in the US and South Africa at a 5* establishment. I would rate this hotel as an upper 4*, but still great. A few tips. - dont forget the bottle opener - seriously! - Trams are easy, get an Iamsterdam card and you can hop on the number 2 that leaves from centraal station right the way through the Dam, Leidseplein to vondelpark. - hire a canal pedal bike (25% discount with iamasterdam) its awesome! - stock up on your own snacks for those times of need ;) - sit in the park and bicycle watch! Amsterdam is a really beautiful clean city and so navigable by foot, bike, tram or boat. The Hotel Grand Amrath was a lovely place to come back to each day and we would definitely return.

Reviews.Title: “Not that big a fan . . .”
Reviews.Author: Scotlady
Reviews.Content: Husband, daughter and I stayed here for two nights mid-June. I got a good rate off of Hotwire ($129 + tax for double room, $105 + tax for single room, per night). This rate was only available for weeknights, not weekends. I was really looking forward to staying here, based on the reviews. I guess, though, that I'm just not that big a fan of the architecture. Interesting building from the outside and in the lobby, bar and restaurant areas, but once you get into the hallways and the rooms themselves, nothing special. I personally thought the hallways looked a little depressing. Hard to find your way around, also. Rooms were average size for european hotels. Very nice bathrooms, except for the fact that there's not a real door between the room & bathroom, just a frosted glass panel, and no separate door for the toilet area. Not much on privacy :) Beds were o.k., but not great (not a "heavenly" mattress, if you know what i mean, but o.k.). I wasn't that impressed with the free mini-bar either. There were one or two bottles each of small wine, beer and water bottles. As far as snacks, forget it. They provide one bag of stale peanuts (really stale!), and one very hard nougat bar. They really shouldn't advertise that they offer snacks in the mini-bar, with a selection like that. Free internet, but complicated system to get it. We had to call the front desk, and for some reason, they wouldn't give us a code over the phone - we had to wait for someone to show up with the code in writing. Which they didn't do for a half hour - which was too long for it to be useful in looking up where we were going that evening. The bar area was nice and cozy. Expensive of course, and the drinks weren't very good (gin & tonics). We didn't eat at the restaurant, so can't comment. I will say, it was nice and quiet, so that was greatly appreciated. The staff was competent but not what I would call friendly (not unfriendly, either, just disinterested.) As far as location, it's only five minutes from the train station, but being off to the east, it makes for a few minutes longer walk to central amsterdam attractions than some of the other central hotels. I would say this is a very nice hotel to be able to get for under $150 a night, but I certainly wouldn't pay the regular rate for it, compared to other choices near by. (We stayed at the Marriott Renaissance one night, and really liked it much better). I suppose all the other factors (bed, amenities, service) are more important to me than the architecture, and this hotel just wasn't that outstanding in any of those categories.

Reviews.Title: “Nicely refurbished historic hotel”
Reviews.Author: BeachinTraveler
Reviews.Content: Great location near cruise dock if you are going or returning from a ship, quiet and away from the bustle of downtown but within easy walking distance to all the main areas. 20 min walk to museum area in the SW. If you are there in the summer, be aware that there is no air conditioning in the hotel and would recommend a higher floor so you can have a window open at night. The rooms are spacious, comfortable bed and all minibar items are included in your room rate. Great shower and deep bathtub in the modern looking bathroom. The cab to the airport is around 50Euro and takes around 30 minutes, so plan ahead. The concierge is very friendly, handing us a map of the city and pointing out best places to visit. He also sells museum tickets so you skip the 30 min wait in line at the museum.

Reviews.Title: “Stunning hotel - particularly when upgraded!”
Reviews.Author: PeteandMichelle
Reviews.Content: My wife and I booked a two night break at the Grand Amrath as we wanted to splash out a bit, it's not often our young boys are looked after and we wanted to make the most of it. Got a really good deal on hotels.com, though check a few sites. We seemed to be the luckiest people ever and were upgraded on arrival to the Tower Suite, an upgrade worth around Â£1700 a night! What a result. We can't really say much about the room we should have had, but the one (or rooms) we had was simply spectacular. Whilst trying not to take all of this into account, it will certainly alter our view quite positively. The hotel itself is very convenient, close to everything including Central station. It's quite gothic, and obviously all newly decorated. The lobby is a bit confusing, but when you get used to it, it makes a change from the usual boring hotel entrances. Staff were unfailingly polite, and the standard of cleanliness was excellent - we have both spent a lot of nights in hotels on holiday and business - this really was an experience we would like to repeat. If you can afford to stay in the Tower suite then do so! It was by far the best hotel experience we have ever had. The views form the four (!) bathroom balconys were out of this world, the bed was incredible and the free mini bar is more than what you would expect. Oh, and do use the wellness centre, very relaxing and worth the effort. Finally, you can tell the hotel takes customer service seriously by their active promotion of Trip Adviser, even providing a free guide on how to leave feedback. Not something we have ever seen before, and a credit to the owners.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic Hotel”
Reviews.Author: chrissiemitch
Reviews.Content: My Mum and I stayed at the Amrath and booked a Deluxe room with free mini bar. When we arrived we were surprised to be upgraded to a lovely suite. It was an exceptionally hot weekend so the free mini bar was an added welcome.It isn't much to add the extra for the free mini bar and we really did make the most of it- the Champagne was certainly drunk! This hotel is fabulous. The style and design is really wonderful and I probably took as many pictures of the hotel as I did of Amsterdam itself! Its has a reaL Art Deco/Nouveau feel and everywhere you turn there is something beautiful, like the marble walls in the reception area an the old doors and lights. I hate staying in large corporate/chain hotels and usually prefer to stay in smaller boutique hotels but on this occasion the Amrath caught my eye when booking and I wasn't disappointed. The Amrath has so much character. It is a 5 star hotel and maybe isn't the level that some people with high expectations who usually stay in the likes of Hilton,Radisson but the staff are very attentivethe concierge really helpful and the rooms are huge with lovely bathrooms! I was really impressed.The only thing was that breakfast is a tad pricey but we just ate there one morning and found a fantastic bakery on the Woermostraat. I really recommend this hotel for people who like hotels with something different to offer.My Mum and I had a lovely time!

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Hotel with Great Amenties”
Reviews.Author: SoCalTeacher951
Reviews.Content: This hotel is located almost directly across the street from the train station, though make sure you know which direction you are headed or you will go the wrong way as we did. Lovely room; clean, average size, comfy bed, free mini bar, decent sized-bathroom, and quiet. Nothing amazing about the room, but it was fine. We stayed for three days at the hotel and found the employees to be helpful and pleasent. The pool was very nice, but the jacuzzi was not working when we were there. We would stay here again and found the price to be well worth the stay.

Reviews.Title: “Luxury & Location can't be beat.”
Reviews.Author: blondyblu
Reviews.Content: This hotel is absolutely beautiful! It is historic and as such cannot provide air conditioning should this be a problem. We were there during a heat wave and had a fan delivered to the room and we were very comfortable. The staff and service are both friendly and quickly efficient. The location is just across the street from the Central Station so it's a quick jaunt to anywhere in Amersterdam and the rest of the Netherlands. They have a wonderful bar and the pool/spa area is a sight to behold. We were there during the World Cup finals and with all of the partying in the streets, our room was very quiet. Although the hotel is spotless, our room had a couple of spots on the carpeting that were sticky. This is my only negative comment.

Reviews.Title: “Great for the price!”
Reviews.Author: Gitaly
Reviews.Content: Overall a great experience. When we arrived, we were surprised to find no lobby/sitting area; just a large area with maybe two chairs. The Amrath was recently converted to a hotel, so don't expect a hotel-like atmosphere upon check-in. Also, there are lots of long hallways and corridors so it's easy to get confused. Check-in sent us to a room around 11am. They made a mix-up because when we walked in the room, there was still luggage in there; the guest did not check out yet and luckily we didn't run into anyone. We told them about the mix-up and waited for the next room. It was a great size, with two twin beds pushed together and a huge bathroom with tub and separate room for toilet. Wifi and mini-bar were included. Drinks, nuts, etc. Room was superclean, bed was comfy, and we had a view of the canals so it was quiet. We rented a moped for the day right from the hotel. I liked that the hotel was close to all areas, like central station but far enough away to avoid some of the craziness of staying too close to the action. We didn't eat at the hotel, nor did we rely on the concierge since we are pretty independent travelers, so I can't comment on those things. Overall for $205 euro a night, it was a good deal. I would go back.

Reviews.Title: “Delightful Experience”
Reviews.Author: Semass777
Reviews.Content: Hotel is in an old converted historic office building. The exterior is classic in appearance, and the interior is very unusual but charming. Rooms are extremely comfortable, bathrooms very modern and attractive. Free minibar service is included with the room. Staff are very friendly and accommodating. Only downside is a very expensive (40 euros per person) breakfast, but it is excellent. There are several nearby cafes where one can dine less expensively. Well located near main railway station and principal stops for the canal ferries.

Reviews.Title: “Quirky but definately worth returning to”
Reviews.Author: BizHolTravel
Reviews.Content: Travelled to Amsterdam for wedding anniversary. Booked into the Grand Hotel Amrath following other reviews on this site. Have to admit my first impression on arriving at the hotel was muted. There is no formal lobby, reception in a side office and no seats (as a result of the fact that the hotel used to be a shipping company's office and the building is beautifully preserved). However, first impressions were quickly dispelled after meeting with staff and the room we were provided (an upgrade) was fantastic with views over the canal. Bed was very comfortable; facilities in the room generally very good - although storage space could have been better; lots of space in the room with a separate seating area, the bathroom (with separate shower and upmarket branded products) was perfectly suitable. The hotel also provided free WIFI to all guests and to top it off, a mini-bar (restocked daily withalcoholic and non-alcoholic drinks) and free to use. Room cleaniness and service was more than acceptable and the staff always helpful. Spa facilities were adequate, if not spectacular, with one of the Sauna rooms out of use. Only reservations I have is 1) the lack of any open areas for guest seating, meaning that if we did want tostep outside our rooms, we had to take ourselves out of the hotel. However, the hotel is within easy walking or sailing distance of many tourist spots. 2) The hotel's dining restaurant is over priced for the quality of the meal (although this seems to be a common theme in Amsterdam). Overall, I would concider staying at the Amrath again for both business and leasure, although I do vierw the hotel as leaning mopre towards business (and it does seem to have some exellent business facilities that I did not avail myself of)

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic atmosphere, huge rooms”
Reviews.Author: Skib99
Reviews.Content: My daughter and I just loved this hotel: original gothic-y atmosphere, huge rooms and incredibly convenient location. Very nice service too.

Reviews.Title: “Interesting Hotel”
Reviews.Author: MSacauskis
Reviews.Content: The best way to describe the Amrath is as "interesting". It's in an old art-deco building. The hallways and corridors are a bit confusing. They are also a bit dark and the carpet was a bit worn. The room was very nice and the free mini-bar was great. It's near the Amsterdam Central Station. I took a taxi when I arrived and it was 15 euros flat fee. I walked to the station when I left. It was bit warm the nights I was there, unfortunately there is no air-conditioning. It was a decent hotel with good service, but I wouldn't rate it a 5 start hotel.

Reviews.Title: “We will be back again”
Reviews.Author: Liz130
Reviews.Content: This was our second extensive stay at this hotel. It is by far the best hotel in Amsterdam. We were welcomed home this year by many of the staff that we became acquainted with during our prior visit. What a lovely personal touch. The service is top notch as are the rooms. You may pay a bit more - but it is worth every penny. Special recognition to Renee (hotel manager) Ben, Aco,Roland and Minedirt - who made our stay exceptional. We will be back next year.

Reviews.Title: “Upscale Rooms in a Great Location”
Reviews.Author: Auggie721
Reviews.Content: We recently had a wonderful stay at the Grand Hotel Amrath. The location is very convenient just a few minutes walk from the Centraal train station and a great home base to explore Amsterdam. The hotel itself is a historical site, which is a bonus if you like that sort of thing. The rooms are enormous compared to other European hotels and have very comfortable beds and a nice LCD TV. The bathroom actually had 2 sinks and bathtub in addition to the shower. The free minibar was a nice surprise! It came stocked with water, soda, beer and wine. The WiFi internet worked flawlessly but there is also a free business center with computers and a printer in case you need to print tickets etc. There is also a spa/massage place at the hotel but we didn't try it. Service at the check in desk and from the concierge was outstanding. They stowed our bags when we arrived early and were able to provide us with tickets to local attractions so we could skip the lines. Rack prices can be high for this hotel, but look around and you will find deals. This is a great hotel, I would definitely stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic rooms”
Reviews.Author: lubies
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed there for 2 nights, one before our cruise and one after our cruise. We were upgraded the first night to a junior suite which was enormous. We had booked the hotel on Hotwire for a very low rate and were surprised with the upgrade. The rooms we had were spotlessly clean and the bathrooms are great. On our return, we arrived at the hotel at 9 am after our cruise and were pleasantly surprised to have a room available for us to check into. We both appreciated the free minibar and free wireless internet. Great location near the train station. Would definitely recommend this lovely and eclectic hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Loved the large rooms in the Amrath!”
Reviews.Author: nanasnest
Reviews.Content: We spent 2 nights pre-cruise at the Amrath. We got a very good rate on Hotwire and were very pleased with our stay. We had a large room with a very high ceiling which looked out on the centre of the hotel. We did not have a view but did not expect one for the rate we paid. The hotel is beautiful and historic. We found the staff to be very helpful. We did not eat breakfast there but went to one of the cafes nearby. Location was great for us near Centraal Station so we could pick up a tram to anywhere in the city. We did have sinks that plugged up in the bathroom but that was the only negative. The hotel has a business centre with 2 computers on the 3rd floor and it was working pretty well when I used it. Just be careful not to let it save your information or other people can log into your account. Loved Amsterdam and could have stayed here for a week!

Reviews.Title: “excellent Experience”
Reviews.Author: DGG2009
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Amrath prior o a 12-day Baltic tour. The hotel is approximately 200 meters from Cenetal Station. It is near many of the major attractions of Amsterdam. The lobby area is quite small and oldhowever the romms are superb. The mini bar contents are free. I highly recommend it.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic hotel, friendly staff, great location - stay here!”
Reviews.Author: mrsmonkey2010
Reviews.Content: We stayed in this hotel for a long weekend in Amsterdam and had a superb stay. We stayed in the second floor and given a huge room. The bedroom had plenty of wardrobe space, remote control curtains, air conditioning, windows that actually open, a large tv and best of all a mini-bar that was restocked free of charge every day!! Our bed was enormous and we had several very good nights sleep. The bathroom was very new with seperate deep bath tub and shower unit. It was spotlessy clean with lovely shampoo, soap and shower gels. The hotel is art nouveau in style (including the original lifts!) and this is continued into the bedrooms. Don't expect a boring modern corporate hotel here - this hotel has character as well as excellent facilities. The staff were very friendly and helpful. The spa, sauna, steam room and pool are very clean with robes, slippers and towels provided. We had a fab time in relaxing surroundings. The location of the hotel is excellent if you are new to Amsterdam as it is round the corner of Centraal station - no need to shell out for a taxi. It is easy to walk around the city from the hotel and the tram system is easy to use too. We would definitely stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Great Stay at the Grand Hotel Amrath”
Reviews.Author: Larrygg
Reviews.Content: We spent 6 nights at the Grand Hotel Amrath and had a fantastic time. It is a very historic building and has some great features and is well appointed. I booked the hotel through Expedia and got a very good rate and we were in a room without a view but the room was plenty nice and large with a nice tub and seperate shower. The bed was very comfortable and the linens and pillows were high quality. The mini bar is also included with sodas, wines, beers and liquor which is a nice feature and they also have a Nespresso coffee maker which we liked. They restock the minibar daily. The only issue we had with the room was the ventilation system which did not seem to work all that well however we had the hotel staff open one of the large windows and that was all we needed. The hotel is in a good location next to the central train station and the surface trolleys which was convenient. We went to the morning breakfast on the second day and the selection of breads, meats and cereals is very good but the price for two was 50 Euro and way too much in my opinion. You are much better off going to one of the many local cafes in the area where you can get a good breakfast for 10 to 15 Euros for two. The hotel staff was very helpfull arranging museum tickets and airport transport and overall directions and advice. Overall we loved the hotel and would go back anytime. The city of Amsterdam is fabulous and beautiful and although alot is made of the "Red Light" District and coffeeshops, the city offers so much more with great museums, parks and many more sights to see. Definately one of the great places in all of Europe to visit and see.

Reviews.Title: “Best Pick! Beautifull - Loved It”
Reviews.Author: Bobijntje
Reviews.Content: The Grand Hotel Amrath is not only beautifull it is also perfect for a city or business trip. This is the first hotel I have ever been where the mini bar in your hotel is for free (!!). Besides of the very well equiped room the hotel has a marvelous (but small) swimming pool, and SPA. Do not forget to go to the roof top, you'll have a great view over the city of Amsterdam. I can fully reccomend this hotel!

Reviews.Title: “Art Nouveau Lovely”
Reviews.Author: FWTravelor
Reviews.Content: The Grand Hotel Amrath is an impressive hotel with an ideal location. While many multi-star hotels can really only boast of a dazzling lobby and exterior but provide cramped, limited rooms, the Amrath's room was fantastic. The gorgeous art nouveau theme was also very well done IN the room. The free minibar is a dream. A red wine, a white wine, two beers, a candy bar, nuts, orange juice, hard liquor, espresso machine. Wow! And restocked every day. A very comfortable, truly clean room. I had a beautiful view of a canal from my room's window. Central Station is a 5 minute walk. Too see Amsterdam, all you need is a one, two or three day public transit pass. The tram is the perfect way to go - I paid 15.50 euro for a three day pass. I used the tram with the assistance of the map the hotel provided. The service at the Amrath was wonderful. I found the Amrath via Hotwire and am so pleased with it. One of my all time favorite hotels. I highly recommend the Amrath.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderfull hotel, but......”
Reviews.Author: cindy028
Reviews.Content: A very good hotel in an excellent location within easy walking distance of the city center. Staff very friendly. Rooms vary in size, but very clean and nicely furnished. Our only fault was with the restaurant , the food being not up to the expected standard, considering the price....best avoid.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful Hotel”
Reviews.Author: JeannieColaSC
Reviews.Content: This really is a beautiful hotel in a great location. We had a beautiful view. The bed and linens were very comfortable. We did not have a laptop computer with us so we really enjoyed the business center with a printer attached. I needed to print boarding passes for our ryanair flight. It was more expensive than the hotels we normally book. It was Queen's Day and most hotels were booked. We really enjoyed our stay here though.

Reviews.Title: “Amazing hotel - Best service!”
Reviews.Author: carmelisima
Reviews.Content: We are dutch and we came to the hotel for a get away from the normal family life. I read the reviews but when we got there I was even more than happy we came. First of all I recomend to call the hotel directly for prices since it seemed like if you go via the websites you dont allways get a free room. We were greeted so nicely by a concierge by the name of Ben whom gave us an honest opinion on the restaurants in the area. (By the way we recomend the sea palace chinese restaurant oposite the hotel, you might have to wait for your food n it is noisy but it was the best chinese I had in Holland and big portions for the main courses), The receptionist Romy was very kind and attentive. The room decore was beautifull, the drinks were for free, a cofee maching in the room with my favorite tea (which the cleaning girl was happy to give us extra) and the bed,,,,what can I say - more comfortable than this you cant get. The spa is great - a swimming pool jacuzzi and 3 saunas (The steam room was not hot enough) In the evening and the morning we consulted the concierges again (sorry but dont remember the names) What can I say, It looks and feels the employees there love their job! and they love giving service with a smile - WE WILL SURELY COME AGAIN!!! Thanks for making this a night to remember!

Reviews.Title: “Luxury in the heart of Amsterdam... for a bargain!”
Reviews.Author: jt93traveller
Reviews.Content: All the staff was very helpful... check-in, baggage and guiding us around the hotel was great, as was the concierge in recommending and booking us an exquisite dinner at a nearby Italian restaurant. The Gothic architecture inside was beautiful; candle-lit breakfast was something different, with the buffet having a huge array of fresh and gourmet hot & cold food!!! The rooms were spacious and very new and well maintained. The unlimited free minibar was one of the best things after a tiresome day of touring. The wellness centre was spotless, the rooms & hotel were exceptionally clean. Service was so good... we woke up early from excitement of our trip, and the staff opened the wellness centre for us extra early at 3am, when it usually opens at 7am!!! Now that's service. We couldn't say anything better and we must thank the hotel for a wonderful, good value stay in luxury!!! P.S. I would come to Amsterdam just for the hotel, so flying KLM is a good excuse!

Reviews.Title: “Hotel lacks 5 star service”
Reviews.Author: rohas
Reviews.Content: this is my second review of this hotel as my first was removed, why I don't know I only told the truth of my experience at this hotel. On arrival no doorman to assist with luggage and slow check in. The room was ok with high ceilings and a comfortable bed, the building is unique and oozes history from its previous use as a shipping office. Asked for room service one evening and was told no one was avaliable due to staff cut backs, you do not expect this in a 5 star hotel that says 24 hr room service if you want a 5 star service look elsewhere

Reviews.Title: “Spectacular”
Reviews.Author: bhhandel
Reviews.Content: I stayed at this hotel, having read some favourable reviews, and I was far from disappointed. The hotel is situated just minutes away from the central station, and was very easily accssible. The building itself is incredible, the former head office of a Duct shipping company, and it's done in a very ornate art deco style, and all over there are little reminders of the building's past, from the amazing lead glass dome in the stairway to the intact ticket counters in the hallways. We were greeted by very friendly and helpful staff upon arrival, and shown to our room, which had an amazingly high ceiling, and was decorated in a very opulent style, with silk wallpapers, dark wood and black stone. Being well above average height, I really appreciated the extra-long beds, which were probably the most comfortable hotel beds I've ever slept in. Other room amenities included remote-controlled curtains, a Nespresso machine, a complimentary and well-stocked minibar, and the bathroom featured an actual, well-functioning hairdryer and Lanvin toiletries. We were there for the Queen's birthday weekend, but there was no noise from the crowds whatsoever, which was quite impressive. The hotel has a spa- complimentary for all guests, with an exercise room (with a very limited selection, however), a swimming pool, jacuzzi, three saunas and a steam bath, very nice after a long day of walking. The restaurant served high-quality food at an astonishingly low price, the only thing I was less than impressed about, was the breakfast buffet. The food was fine, but I have seen far better slections at simpler hotels, and also at lower prices. If breakfast wasn't included in the rate, I probably would have gone some other place for it. All in all, the stay was extremely enjoyable, and I would stay there again any time!

Reviews.Title: “Should be #1 in Amsterdam”
Reviews.Author: fishpicturesbybob
Reviews.Content: The hotel is in a great location, beds are as comfortable as any hotel I have visited. We used the trams to visit both the Rijks and the VanGough museums and the next day walked the areas between the museums and the hotel. The Concierge caught us before we left the hotel and advised us to buy the museum tickets from him for the same price as the museum - this allowed us to bypass long lines of folks waiting in the rain to purchase tickets. (Very good service) We ate at Seasons resaurant which is rated #1 by Trip Advisor and found it to be as good as it is represented. We also ate at the Sea Palace and found it acceptable but would rather go back to Seasons this evening. I would recomend that you skip the hotel breakfast it is very expensive and you can get breakfast at many street cafes for 1/4 the price. I used the hotel wireless internet the entire trip and found it very fast and easy to connect. All of the staff we have interacted with have been extremely helpful and there is no doubt that when we return to Amsterdam we wlll stay at this hotel. Bob

Reviews.Title: “A neutral stay”
Reviews.Author: Hawaii_son
Reviews.Content: 4 nights Hotwire Jan 2010 Location: Very good. A short walk from Central Station, RLD, Nemo etc. Check In: No wait. Confirmed room and tax prepaid. CC for incidentals. Was escorted to room by concierge regaling me with historical detail of the building. The building is architecturally unique. I won't go into detail. There are many descriptions from others. The room was an inside unit overlooking the central courtyard. Nicely appointed but small and cramped. Having arrived late, I just went to bed. Day two I asked for a larger room w/city view....generally these rooms are at the side or rear of the property overlooking the canals and RLD. Nice enough but again, too small and the presence of cigarette ash on the window ledge required I move again next day. Very poor housekeeping. 2/10 This time I was more forceful and specific in my requests...I asked for an upgraded high(er) floor, larger room. I asked for 2 choices, and went to look prior to moving my bags in. Bingo - room 3 was a nice largish room and a much larger bathroom. The rooms are furnished in a modern old fashioned way....textiles and funky wallpaper give an almost period feel. It's ok and comfortable enough but I prefer modern. The coffee machines are temperamental and I had issues with all of them. The first one leaked water everywhere, and the other two would work intermittently. However, the ability to make coffee in the room is a bonus these days, and I tracked down the provisioner on my floor, and obtained more of the single serve coffee pods the machines use. 7/10 Inclusive minibar - a nice feature for the alcohol drinkers, I was very happy with the 4 bottles of water and two soft drinks. Also there is room to stash your own fridge swag, rolls, cheese, Coffeemelk, fruit etc. I dined in. 7/10 Wifi: Free but somewhat unstable. The third room I was in worked fine. Kudos 7/10 Other amenities: Spa / Pool: Available but did not use. Bathroom: Modern, clean lines, nice large tube, very good rain shower, good personal care products towels etc. 8/10 Bedding: Comfortable king bed, quality pillows, sheets duvet etc. Actually managed some good sleep. 8/10 What's close by: Easy access to everything AMS has to offer. The excellent tram system terminal is right at the Central Station. Some of the best art and architecture in Europe. A delight indeed. Safety: Big city awareness required, but the central area is very safe. Tourists are targeted of course, but generally the worst that happens is you are overcharged. Conclusion: Overall an OK stay. I don't think they have any bad rooms, but politely asking for an upgraded location, or larger bathroom would probably bring a positive result. You never know what a polite request will bring. I have had good upgrade results in AMS. The location was quiet, and the staff were pleasant enough. Stay again? Maybe but rate dependent. AMS Hotel prices fluctuate..one week the NH chain is the better value, sometimes not. This property maybe an acquired taste and overall I prefer the 4* Movenpick. US Rating: 4 star Customer service: 7/10 Value: 7/10

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful Building shame about the Bathroom”
Reviews.Author: C0rnish_Maid
Reviews.Content: Stayed for four nights just after the volcano debacle. The room (130) was 'deluxe standard' and had no view and limited storage. The bed was comfortable but I was less happy with the pillows. Bathroom was adequate apart from the shower screen which was a disgrace - either flooding the bathroom or swinging in on you whilst showering. Mini bar - good selectiom, free and restocked daily. Swimming pool was smaller than expected and spa pool was not working during stay. Didn't bother with the restaurant so can't comment. Concierge exceedingly helpful. Would only recommend this hotel if you can get it for a discounted rate.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel”
Reviews.Author: Fred111
Reviews.Content: We stayed in the Amrath before embarking on a river cruise. We wanted a good hotel near the boat and were not disappointed. The Amrath is in a prime location, easily accessable from the central station, trams, RLD, and the rest of town. The hotel is absolutely amazing. Rooms are large, airy, and spotlessly clean. THe staff is friendly and attentive. We arrived in Amsterdam early and our room was ready for check in. We will stay at this hotel again.

Reviews.Title: “Good value, not exciting”
Reviews.Author: noblige
Reviews.Content: Stayed for 3 nights in deluxe room (canal view). Overall impression was good, nice interior, good sized and clean room, bathroom includes both bathtub and a shower, and also Lanvin toiletries - a plus. Minibar is included in a rate and consist of couple bottles of beer, soft-drinks, soda and small bottles of whisky, rum, vodka and cognac - nice touch. Biggest surprise (on a good side) was discovery of spa center, which included swimming pool, jacuzzi and four different kinds of saunas, all of which were good. And best of all, on all three nights we went there, place was completely deserted, that's probably attributed to rather inconvenient and confusing way to actually get to the spa from hotel rooms. Buffet breakfast costs 25â‚¬ per person and is rather paltry and unimpressive: yes, all basics are present, but not something to write home about. On the down side - extremely unstable internet (although free). Also, we were traveling with a small child and rather bulky stroller, to our inconvenience main entrance to the hotel (which is some old historic building) requires to climb about ten steps up the staircase (all that carrying baby and a stroller) - not something you would like to do several times per day. Granted, there was back entrance to the hotel, that had elevator for disabled, but that entrance was closed all the time, making option of going to the main entrance, asking porter to open back door, going to back door and taking elevator equally unpleasant. But in overall - good hotel, would recommend.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful boutique type hotel-best stay ever!”
Reviews.Author: greenwayplanner
Reviews.Content: I was working in the Hague and spent four wonderful nights at the Hotel Amrath. This hotel is situated in an old marvellous shipping company building, and is a wonderful example of Art Deco. The rooms are well appointed, quiet, high ceilings, wonderfully equipped bathrooms, clean, and of course with the free mini-bars. I found the staff helpful, and the bar and restaurant areas wonderful for lingering. The indoor pool, whirlpool and saunas are a wonderful respite after a day of sight seeing. It indeed deserves the great title as one of the top small European hotels in the world. Do not be misled by the people commenting about the hotel not honouring their "deposits". These folks have paid in full for their rooms in advance through a provider such as priceline, and their dispute with the volcano should be with the internet provider, not the hotel. Come and enjoy this pearl in Amsterdam. I will be back there this Fall!

Reviews.Title: “Shambolic Customer Service”
Reviews.Author: jambohud
Reviews.Content: As the partner of lisa_superjambo I am voicing my disgust at the inconsiderate and heartless treatment we have received from the Grand Amrath Hotel. As the volcanic issue in Iceland caused mayhem throughout Europe for Air travel we enquired the day before we were due to leave as to our options as it looked more likely our flight would be cancelled giving us no hope of getting to Amsterdam. We were then told the hotel would not entertain any notion of re-imbursing us, even for the 2nd day of our intended stay despite us contacting them more than 24 hours in advance or what we hoped giving us a 2 week window etc to make alternative travel options to get to amsterdam so we could still honour our booking. The customer service has been nothing short of shocking, 3 emails have been sent and as of this morning we have not even had the courtesy of an automatic email confirming our emails will be responded too. As a young couple who had worked and saved hard to afford the Â£400 fee it cost us to book at this so called 5* hotel the customer service has been of 0* standard.

Reviews.Title: “BRITS DO NOT BOOK THIS HOTEL!”
Reviews.Author: Weesaski
Reviews.Content: Really disgusted with this hotels staff attitude, booked back in January but due to the recent volcano crisis could not get there got in touch with the hotel to see if we could arrange another trip but was told no, i even offered to pay a little more rather than loose all our money Â£400 they where not interested and very unsympathetic to say the least ! Hope the management of this so called 5 star hotel enjoy there night out with the money they have stolen from us. We worked hard to pay for this SHAME ON YOU!!!!!!!

Reviews.Title: “The building is the star”
Reviews.Author: newkstar
Reviews.Content: I stayed 4 nights at the Amrath with a friend. We had a standard double room which was fully pre-paid (no refund, not something I normally do) and it cost approximately E180 a night, so not cheap. The hotel is well located, about a 7 minute walk from the main railway station and close to many of the bars and restaurants on the east side of the City. Amsterdam is a small city with excellent transport, so nothing is really too far away. Check in was pretty slow. The reception is in a tiny separate office off the small lobby and it was a bit like waiting to see the school principal in getting served - it was very quiet when I checked in, so I don't know how they would cater with a crowd. There is no doubt that the building is the star as others have commented. It really is wonderful and one of the few hotels I have actually spent time wandering around just to look at the architecture. The layout is like a rabbit warren and it is very easy to get lost. I went to use the business centre on one evening and got completely lost - there are no signs to it at all - and had to go ask the concierge for directions (it is actually hidden in the former walk in safe). The hotel room was very nice, with high ceilings, comfy beds and a very nice bathroom, with great shower and bath. We didn't eat in the hotel, although the restaurant looked quite pleasant it was very expensive and there are too many other options for eating nearby. The bar was pleasant and we did have a few drinks there! The staff were uniformly friendly and, being Amsterdam, everyone speaks very good English. The indoor pool was a bonus in the cold February weather. Overall, this place is worth the expense, although having been there once, I would probably stay somewhere cheaper next time. This was my third visit to Amsterdam and it remains one of my favourite cities. It is very laid back, very pretty and great to get around. It is one of the few places outside Australia that I could live in. If you have not visited, do it :)

Reviews.Title: “unhelpful and uncompromising customer service”
Reviews.Author: lisa_superjambo
Reviews.Content: in light of the volcano disruption that engulfed Europe my partner and i were unable to travel to amsterdam and stay at the amrath hotel. the hotel did not respond to 2 emails i sent enquiring about how i could rearrange a date for my visit , when i finally phoned them they where unwilling to help me out in anyway. they would not even refund the 2nd night i had booked even though they were given 36 hours notice. the 2 members of staff i spoke to very unfriendly and unsympathetic and i was greatly disappointed at the customer service of this so called 5* hotel...

Reviews.Title: “Mixed feelings”
Reviews.Author: ab75
Reviews.Content: I will not return to this location despite the beutefull room (four posters room type). Service is like not existing... Do not expect anything from the staff...Not to open door, not to solve any of your complains... So disapointing! For 420 Euro per night I think Amsterdam should offer a little bit more! If in Amsterdam, visiting Yamazato Restaurant (Okura hotel) is a must. Advanced online reservation is required!

Reviews.Title: “Great Stay at Art Deco Gem”
Reviews.Author: Yardena
Reviews.Content: My husband and I booked a room here after reading Trip Advisor reviews, which were (as usual) right on. We were in town as tourists for the weekend - it was my first visit to this lovely and exciting city, and he hadn't been in ages. We walked to the hotel from the Central Station (10 minutes as we were tired and loaded down with luggage), and were immediately greeted warmly by a very helpful receptionist who told us a bit about the history of the hotel, which started life around World War I as a shipping office (you can still see where people would go to buy tickets). The room renovation was fabulous-bathroom is very modern, ceilings are high, the bed was reminiscent of the Westin's heavenly beds. We had a problem with the Wi-Fi access but they sent up a manager and somehow it got resolved. The concierge helped us find a restaurant that served rijstaffel and gave us a map showing us how to either walk or take a tram (get the one-day tram ticket if you're going to sightsee, it's well worth it). The concierge also was honest about the fact that renting bikes from the hotel cost a lot more than renting from the company a block away that provisions them. I wouldn't get breakfast there -- it's pretty pricey, and you'll do better to walk into town and find a bakery. The restaurant in general looked expensive so we only went to their bar for a cup of tea before we left (also expensive, but the setting was very elegant). But I'm a big believer in modern, comfortable hotel rooms and I found the charges well in line for the accomjodations. Would recommend in a heartbeat.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Hotel, with friendly staff and close to the station”
Reviews.Author: thesteils
Reviews.Content: We were delighted with our choice of the Grand Hotel Amrath Amsterdam. It's close to the station (turn left when you come out of the main doors, walk about 200 meters and you'll see it on the right with the row of flags on the roof). This makes it really convenient for getting about on the trams. Everyone in the hotel was really friendly and helpful. We paid for the mini bar upgrade which based on their price list was worth it. Having the spa after a long day sight seeing was a joy. The room and bathroom were a good size although a little hot so they could save on the heating bills. We didn't use the hotel for meal instead opting for cafe's, Mexican (Los Pilones) and Noodles (Walk to Wok). We would happily stay at the Grand Hotel Amrath Amsterdam again.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel,even better location”
Reviews.Author: foodnyc
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Grand Amrath for 1 week with my husband. The hotel is a few minutes from the station and since Amsterdam is a walking city and I live in Manhattan,it was perfect for us to get around with out cabs. The room was clean and for us the mini bar was a major plus,since the coffee was great and anyone who travels knows how much hotels can charge for good coffee. And That is without taking the dollar/euro into account...Plus the soft drinks and alcohol is such a nice touch. The bed , bath and entire room was clean , comfortable and checked 2 x a day. To address the other reviewers negatives......Yes, there is not lobby and when we arrived at 8AM with no sleep and no room to be had it was a little uncomfortable, but that is what happens when your flight arrives before check in. Other than that the lack of a lobby does not really matter to us as we are either out touring or in our room. The only negative for us was.....The concierge....really, I think I know more about the restaurants and attractions then they did...and they kept recommending these 2 or so restaurants that were so middle of the road and overpriced......so we just did not take their advice.....and with the location there is no need to eat breakfast inside the hotel because there are breakfast cafes within a short walk.....

Reviews.Title: “Good location, free minibar, free wireless”
Reviews.Author: dixintex
Reviews.Content: I stayed at this hotel for 5 days in March, 2010 with a friend. There is free wirelesss, although it was a little slow. The minibar is FREE and we were instructed to empty it out each day so it could be refilled. We don't drink gin, bourbon, or scotch, but did manage to drink all the wine, beer, sodas, waters and rum. Don' expect ice machines in the hotel...not a European thing. The hotel is very central to everything and the cab ride from Centraal station was a 10 Euro fare and took about 5 minutes. The red light district is only about 5 or 6 blocks away and it was very convenient. they also rent scooters and bikes if you feel daring! The staf was very helpful and spoke great English. The rooms have lofted 10-12 foot ceilings and the baths are all marble. We had a separate shower and tub. Not too much closet space, which is also very European. The king bed was actually 2 wide singles pushed together. We could not cuddle unless one of us slept on the 'crack' between the beds. Other than that, the beds were the most comfortable we had on our Euro excursion. Definitely recommend, but not sure why it was 5 star. Should have bee 4 or 4.5 stars. Also, very quiet hotel. One other thing....we found that there are 2 porn channels....both free. Interesting....

Reviews.Title: “Awesome room and friendly staff”
Reviews.Author: Moericke
Reviews.Content: This was definitely the largest room I have ever stayed in while travelling in Europe, with a grand view of the city, an excellent hotel staff, free minibar, and the most comfortable bed I have ever had in a hotel. The halls of this hotel can be a bit confusing as the building wasn't built as a hotel originally, but it is definitely a cool experience every time you venture through the halls...something you can't say about the walk to your room at a regular modern hotel. Internet service was spotty and slow, but that wasn't too important for us. This place was a bit pricey, but definitely worth it for a special occasion.

Reviews.Title: “Great service, unique hotel, the most comfortable bed”
Reviews.Author: suz320
Reviews.Content: This hotel has a great location, close to the Central Station, Canal Tours, across 2 short bridges to Chinatown and fairly close to the red-light district, but far enough away not to notice. Not that the red-light district is at all dangerous..quite the opposite. After a breezy, cool day of walking around I found it wonderful to enjoy the beautiful pool, jacuzzi and sauna. I was pleasantly surprised by all the attention and help the concierge staff gave. Aso was particularly attentive, burning his finger slightly fixing a bulb in my room so I could get to sleep. The next day the maintenance staff fixed it right away. I will definitely go back here because when you're traveling alone or far away it is so nice to be able to rely on the staff to help you with restaurants and arranging travel. They went above and beyond."

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel, only let down by very poor bar service”
Reviews.Author: OCScene
Reviews.Content: Great hotel, with spotless clean rooms. Great conversion to a hotel from a former shipping office quarters with much of the orginal decor left intact. The service from the all the staff was great and friendly but the sevice in the Bar was appauling. The bartender seemed more intrested in talking to 'mates' and collegues than serving drinks. he would often dissappear for 10 minutes at a time leaving a long wait to get a drink. We ended up going out and found a cracking bar further down the road.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent hotel”
Reviews.Author: ozzy70
Reviews.Content: Arrived at the hotel at 7am after a long haul flight from Australia. We were able to check immediately . Our room was 2nd floor on the main street side with large windows that opened. No noise problems . It was really nice to have a long hot bath ( with partner) after the flight. Breakfast was great ( included in rate). Free minibar was topped up daily. I have stayed in several hotels in Amsterdam previously which have always been small. The room was a good size with seating area. I will definately stay at the Grand Amrath again.

Reviews.Title: “Definitely A Hotel to go (Lady) GaGa Over...”
Reviews.Author: JaseMe516
Reviews.Content: My boyfriend and I took the train in to Amsterdam from Paris and did a late check-in on Sunday night (March 13, 2010). The hotel is slightly hidden from view from Amsterdam Central Station, so if you're leaving the station, you want to head left out of the station. When we arrived, the reception host was so lovely and kind and she surprised us with a room upgrade! We were upgraded from a "Superior Deluxe Room - City View" to a "Four Poster Room - City View" with a huge bed, a huge bathroom, two leather couches, and an amazing view of the canal. The gentleman who showed us around the hotel was very professional and gave us a great tour of the hotel and a great tour of our roomâ€¦yes, it was that big (try getting it! Room 300). The bathroom was amazing. The standing shower was basically the size of a walk-in closet and had 4 shower heads. Separate from the shower was a large bathtub with fizzy bubble bath soap provided. The two sinks were modern-looking and we were provided with nice soaps and lotions. The FREE mini bar was stocked with sodas, orange juice, water, wine, hard liquor, and chocolate. There was a Nespresso machine that made gourmet espresso drinks comparable to a fancy cafe. (I've never heard of a Nespresso in the US and I was so impressed with this machine that I may buy one this weekend!) The four post bed was so comfortable and was piled on with large, fluffy pillows. The wellness center was by far the BEST wellness center I've ever been to at a hotel. The heated pool was a decent size and the jacuzzi seated four. There were three separate saunas and showers to rinse. The actual gym had a few machines, but you do so much walking in Amsterdam that you don't need to do any cardio when you go to visit the city! Our check out was fast and easy and they held our luggage while my boyfriend and I wandered around Amsterdam during the afternoon. The hotel is really close to the Red Light District but far enough from it to where there is really no rowdy noise. It's also conveniently located a couple blocks away from Amsterdam Central and the main tram stop. Overall, I have to say that the Grand Amrath is the best hotel I've ever stayed in and I would highly recommend this place to anyone.

Reviews.Title: “Oh Dear!!”
Reviews.Author: feedee61
Reviews.Content: What can I say? This hotel left me empty. It is totally atmosphereless and one feels totally alone. Walking through the entrance I felt I had mistakenly arrived at the service entrance. It was a bit of a shock as I am used to staying in 5 star hotels and this certainly was way below my expectation. The staff were friendly but very matter of fact. Didn't have much contact with them during our 4 day stay. What can I say about the massive, utterly appalling interior decoration, room? It was dark and dingy and seriously lacked any sense of luxury. Scruffy bathrobes but no slippers, a trouser press that didn't work, wine but no wine glasses, six hangers for two people and the list goes on. The bathroom was modern and the shower was excellent. The bed was very comfortable. The Nespresso machine and minibar were a good touch to an otherwise depressing room. The spa...definitely not in the 5 star category. Perhaps a "coffee Shop" was used during the rating of the hotel! In my opinion the Amrath should not be 5 Star anything.

Reviews.Title: “5 Star Service...Excellent Location...Great Place to Stay”
Reviews.Author: Gavin_Clark
Reviews.Content: I'm going to keep this brief, as no-one reads the good reviews. We stayed at the Amrath for my birthday and it was superb. Constant attention to the mini bar and in-room coffee supplies, helpful staff and excellent accommodation, all 5 minutes walk form the train station, makes this an excellent venue for a trip to Amsterdam! We would definitely stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Amazing hotel”
Reviews.Author: MRRHouston
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed at the Grand Amrath for a one-night visit in February which we wish had been much longer. This is truly an exceptional hotel that lives up to its 5-star rating. It is an historic building converted from the offices of giant shipping companies in Holland that reigned in the late 19th century and early 20th century. So, at every turn, the building is replete with more mahogany, marble, and etched glass than one can really imagine. The rooms are very large and have enormous ceilings with tall windows looking out to the canals on one side and the ship channel on the other. The rooms also come equipped with a complementary mini-bar and your own personal espresso machine, both innovations that one can only hope will hit the States soon. The staff was very friendly and attentive. The hotel is located about a 5 minute walk from the Central Train Station, so it is perfectly situated to hop on a tram and head out to explore the city. A lavish buffet breakfast is also included in the price of the room. If you want to stay here, you need to really keep you eye on the various price specials on the main travel websites. I got a great deal on a room but could not find a similar price on our return to Amsterdam a week and one-half later. But, if you can find a good deal, go.

Reviews.Title: “I am a hotel JAP and this was the best ever”
Reviews.Author: hotelfussbudger
Reviews.Content: This hotel was perfect in every way. The rooms were beautiful and spotlesslessly clean, the pillows were of several types and hypoallergenic ones were available. The bathroom was luxurious by any standard, the staff helpful but not overbearing. The spa is amazing. The only downside is that food in the hotel is very expensive and portions are tiny. That aside, it is a perfect experience we will be returning again. They are sweet to well behaved kids and make staying their special for them.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful Hotel”
Reviews.Author: michelle_moo
Reviews.Content: This is a fine example of an older hotel that manages to still feel luxurious, well maintained and clean! We arrived in Amsterdam via train and walked with our suitcases from the station. It was both a quick walk and easy to find. It's close to the central tourist areas, a very good location. During check-in we couldn't fault the service, although we were a little confused at first as there is a concierge desk but you check-in in a Reception office, so that was a little bit unusual compared to other hotels. We were taken to our room by a member of staff who thoroughly explained all the details of the room. The room itself was immaculate - beautiful wallpaper, curtains and furnishings, and a spotless modern bathroom with a heated mirror. The bed was extremely comfortable. The rooms seemed to be serviced twice daily - once in the morning, and then again in the afternoon/evening. I believe this is called a turndown service? We hadn't stayed in a hotel that offered this is as a standard part of their rate before, so it might be something to be aware of. The hotel has a business centre that offers free high-speed internet. The only complaint I would have is the noise of the flagpoles! We had a room in the centre of the hotel, and you could hear the ropes that attach the flags to the flagpoles, banging against the flagpoles constantly. It wasn't a really big deal but I think the hotel would be absolutely flawless if they could find a way to stop that noise during the night. We've stayed in some very nice hotels over the years and this is one of the best.

Reviews.Title: “Unique, Gothic Hotel”
Reviews.Author: KristaInLondon
Reviews.Content: I've stayed at the Amrath twice now and really love it and always recommend it to my friends. It's a really unique place with much more soul than the big chains. Let me do my pros and cons: Pros: Awesome marble stair case in the foyer with lots of wrought iron. I love this. The building was an old shipping company and it's just really cool and unique. Free wireless (although I couldn't get it to work last time I was there) Free minibar. Not kidding. How cool is that? Nespresso machine with assortment of capsules Lanvan bath products Great robes, slippers BIG rooms. These people who say the rooms are small? I don't understand them. The two rooms I've had have been pretty generously sized. (And I'm American.) Great little brown bar on the ground floor Very close to Central Station. (this is good for me because my office is out by the Arena and there are no hotels there.) High ceilings Good black-out curtains that are elecontronically controlled. Cons Dusty. Both times I've stayed, at times, I've been overwhelmed by the smell of dust. No one else seems to mention this, so take it for what it is. Restaurant always empty whenever I've been there Funny You WILL get lost here. Now I understand why they walk you to your room. In short, this is a great place. I don't know why I'm not giving it five stars. Maybe because there's no butler service. Butler service would put it over the edge for me!

Reviews.Title: “Good Room, Fantastic Service”
Reviews.Author: Brain_m
Reviews.Content: Stayed for nights at the end of February. The staff at this hotel couldnt have been nicer. Everyone seemed to genuinely care not only about what we thought of the hotel, but were willing to do anything in thier power to make our stay in Amsterdam more enjoyable. Had price fix dinner in hotel one night which was delicious, but a bit pricey. The room was large by European standards and had very high ceilings, enhancing the spaciousness. The architecture of the hotel was very unique and has been better described by other reviewers. Night staff had to point us in the direction of the right elevator for several nights, but this was more our fault than anything else lol. One day we did notice that the bed had been made without sheets which was immediately resolved with one call to the front desk.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful Staff, really nice stay”
Reviews.Author: totemotemot
Reviews.Content: My buddy and I stayed here for some R & R after a business trip to Berlin. Great location, wonderful and helpful staff and the room was comfortable with nice amenities - good assortment of coffees, bath robe/slippers (even though I didn't use these). The spa at the hotel and swimming pool, dry and steam sauna, lounge area (yes in Amsterdam!) was great and relaxing - I will stay here whenever I go to Amsterdam again. The building's architecture is gorgeous too.

Reviews.Title: “Have traveled all over the world and one of the best we've stayed in.”
Reviews.Author: JMB100
Reviews.Content: We booked this hotel through a group hotel planner. We traveled with my parents, brother and children - so 5 rooms altogether,. Didn't know what to expect initially as it was booked online after reviewing trip advisor. Was very pleasantly surprised. Beautiful hotel, great location and all of the staff we dealt with (concierge, manager, and all others) were wonderful, polite and genuinely friendly. The rooms were amazing. Building used to be a shipping company, so each room is slightly different in shape and size (as opposed to the McRooms you get in a big hotel chain) and all are very well appointed, with every modern convenience you'd want and beautiful bathrooms. Having stayed in just about every continent and many 5 star hotels (Ritz Carlton, Georges V, etc) I would rank the Amarath right up there with all of them and would gladly stay there again. While you might think I'm going out on a limb here with my ranking - I would say that the Amrath is a great reflection of Holland itself - sensible, beautiful and unpretentious.

Reviews.Title: “One of the best hotels I've stayed in.”
Reviews.Author: girlacross
Reviews.Content: This is hands down one of the best hotels I've stayed in. I mention this because I'm surprised that anyone would rate this less than four stars baring some glaring oversight on the part of the hotel staff. I've stayed in places from a Ritz Carltons to a hostel with shared rooms, so I have a pretty wide perspective here. First, a note to my fellow American travelers. Yes, you may find the rooms at the Grand Amrath a little small, but do realize that this is typical for Europe. Ergo, I recommend suspending some expectations that your stay in beautiful Amsterdam at the Grand Amrath will be just as it would be at a comparable hotel in America. I especially would like to point out the irony of a previous commenter from New York City complaining that the closets are too small. You cannot fault a hotel for being representative of a culture on the whole. Just . . . relax. So again I would like to say that this is one of the best hotels I've stayed in. The staff were friendly and helpful, especially the concierge. My stay was in August, which I learned during my stay was the month that the majority of Amsterdam closes up shop and goes on holiday. Therefore the hotel therefore was very quiet. But no bother, my partner and I went with the flow and adjusted our plans according and still managed to have a wonderful time. My partner and I stayed on the ground floor just next to the bar and we had a view of the canal. Again, it was a quiet room. The heavy curtains, when pulled closed, blocked out any sunlight -- so well that in the absence of any sun, we accidentally slept in to 11 am. No worries, we were on vacation after all. The free minibar was a welcomed bonus and was restocked daily. Two other highlights were the bed and the shower. The first was incredibly plush and we had three relaxing nights worth of sleep. The second, the shower, was one of those rain shower heads, which is liken to taking a shower in a waterfall. Since Europe is not known for its showers with heavy water pressure, this was an unexpected extra frill. I went to bar one night for an after dinner drink, which was lovely, but did not eat any of the food at the Grand Amrath, so I cannot speak for that. But I should point out that if anyone would find fault with the food, do keep in mind that one doesn't usually go to a hotel for the food. And while I ate well in Amsterdam, it's a city that's not know for its cuisine either. I wouldn't hesitate to recommend this hotel to other travelers.

Reviews.Title: “Amrath - 5 stars in a great location”
Reviews.Author: rob1881
Reviews.Content: stayed 2 nights in Feb 2010 for the first time, and certainly made a good choice. check in staff very friendly and such a beautiful building kept true to its heritage. we were given an upgrade which made our valentines trip even more special. room could not have been better, my request for flowers in room was met, much appreciation for that. well stocked free minibar replenished daily and Nespresso machine also, very nice touches. some reviews do not consider this hotel to be 5 star, but they must not understand the definition, this hotel certainly meets all 5 star criteria. and if it is your thing the wellness centre with good size pool, saunas, steam room and jacuzzi plus lounging area is especially welcoming during a winter stay in this city. facilities were all first class. one small thing for me, the extract above shower was quite loud/noticable in room, staff inspected and were happy to move us should we wished, but for such a short stay we kept our otherwise perfect first floor room. look forward to returning to this hotel in the future, highly recommend.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic break, hotel standard excelent and deserves it's 5 stars.”
Reviews.Author: barbaraf1962
Reviews.Content: My husband and I have just returned from a Valentines weekend away in Amsterdam having stayed at the Grand Amrath. It was absolutely fabulous, the staff were all amazing and nothing, absolutely nothing was to much trouble. Our complimentary mini bar was a very much appreciated touch and definately added to the whole experience and is well worth booking should you have the option. The spa is to die for and all the facilities definately deserve the 5 star rating. If you have booked this hotel you will not be disappointed. My husband and I have and always do stay at 5 star and above hotels and this certailnly met the standards we have. You absolutely get what you pay for with this hotel, and it is definately worth every penny we payed and we will have no hesitation, booking this hotel again not if but when we visit amsterdam again.

Reviews.Title: “Very nice hotel with some shortfalls”
Reviews.Author: Nord1
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the Amrath for an extended weekend and all in all found it to be a very nice hotel. It's location is excellent - it literaly takes 5 minutes to walk there from Central Station and you are so centrally located that it's hard to find anything better. At the same time it's in a fairly quiet part of the city. The hotel architecture is fantastic and a sight in itself. The reception service was definitely 5 star, however the concierge was never around when needed. Breakfast was at EUR 25 pretty standard and boring and the service there somewhat less than what could be expected. The room was 5 star eqiuipped (complementary minibar - to be recommended!) all though somewhat on the small side. All in all I was satisfied with my stay and would surely stay there again next time I visit Amsterdam - provided I can get a good deal on the room as I did this time!

Reviews.Title: “You wont be disappointed with this hotel. Your eyes just need to get accustomed to it.”
Reviews.Author: REHAN07860
Reviews.Content: Having been to many 5*hotels in my life, my instant impression of the Grand Hotel Amrath was not one that made me smile, in fact I felt a bit lost. I was looking for bright lights and a grand reception with a sumptuous marble floor and a counter full of eager check in staff, but this as not to be. After going up the few steps to the hotel lobby walking on some red carpet that needs a clean I entered the lobby with my partner. The lobby was dark with lights which were dim, like you were taken back to the old days. On my right was a small desk for the concierge. After about 20 seconds, Roland the concierge emerged. He directed us to my left to another room where there was a desk where two ladies were sat â€“ this was check in. Roland supervised our check and advised us that we had been upgraded to a four poster room. He also advised us that he had prepared our tours and everything was ready. I had prearranged the tours with the concierge via e-mail from England as we only had two nights in Amsterdam. Roland took us to our room through the â€œschoolâ€� like corridors and up in a vintage elevator to the first floor where we were given a lovely 4 poster bedroom with a very nice bath room. My only negative comment about the bathroom would be that the shower door and tolilet were too close too each other as the door could not open fully as the toilet was opposite. In my e-mails I had asked Roland to arrange for a fresh cream sponge cake with fruit to be provided on arrival for our anniversary. It was in the room on arrival but turned out to be a fruit tart. I did comment on this the next day â€“ feeling very guilty about doing so as Roland had been brilliant. Roland noted our comments. About two hours later, a knock at the door said â€œroom serviceâ€�, I opened the door to find that Otto, the other concierge had bought a fantastic chocolate mouse cake to compensate for our disappointment. The bed was the most comfortable bed I have ever slept in, in any hotel. The concierge service was very caring and attentive. Breakfast was expensive at 25 Euros each. Dinner at the Seven Seas was lovely. I still maintain that the hotel is a bit dark overall and the doors are very heavy. I donâ€™t think this hotel is suited to wheelchair users due to the heavy doors. Whether you like this hotel or not will depend on your taste, I like glamorous, bright and luxurious. This hotel is luxurious in its own way. As much as I want to give it five stars, I can only give it four, but I have to add a caveat; you wont be disappointed with this hotel. Your eyes just need to get accustomed to it.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel, but a little bit expensive”
