Reviews.Author: breeze1024
Reviews.Content: The hotel rate was a little bit high for us and breakfast was not included. But after surveying a lot of hotels in Amsterdam, I still chose this hotel because: (1) I love the photos on their official website. (2) there is free internet connection (3) it's close to central station (4) the mini bar is free (with specific room rates). I'm happy with the room and the canal view thouth it was on the first floor. I booked a room with a canal view and thought it would be on higher floors. So when I was lead to the room on the first floor I was a little bit shocked. But it turned out to be fine. I like the bathroom and the design of the closet. The service was great. The mini bar and the coffee machine were excellent!! Why not every hotel provide inclusive mini bar? (Customers love all-you-can-eat styles after all. You don't have to pay attention to or worry about the extra bills after you pay big money for the hotel room. :P)

Reviews.Title: “A World Class Hotel, simply fantastic”
Reviews.Author: nathanlaw
Reviews.Content: Was in Amsterdam for three days, stayed at the Amrath for two nights while completing a work project. Could not have wished for a better hotel... immaculate, clean, sophisticated, comfortable. It's the little touches that makes the Amrath special. The welcome note from the manager, the welcome gift- a nice delftesque till of waffles, umbrella in the room, the complimentary mini-bar, the egyptian superb cotton for the bed sheets, the big windows looking over the harbour from your room, getting BBC World and Sky News in the room, the bathrobes, feather pillows of top quality. A hotel truly home from home when you want to go away, have work things to sort. Pure class. They had made a minor mistake on my bill, where I had been charged for breakfast when it was included in my booking this was swiftly dealt with. This was probably down to me forgetting my room number at breakfast as I memorised how to get to my room by route rather than number probably because I had a lot on my mind with work. The staff are friendly, approachable and knowledgeable. You are left in peace to go about your business but when you do need to ask or query something it is sorted right away. The bathroom was great, the Lanvin toiletries came in handy as I forgot to pack some. The bath was big and drench shower very refreshing. Plenty of towels all decent size, nice material and fresh. I forgot my security code for my in room safe, and one quick call to reception and a manager came up with a sophisticated PDA to reset the same. I nearly could not fly home as had locked my passport in safe! The internet connection in the room was tricky to set up but that was down to Windows 7 default settings not being geared to logon to their system. Not the Amrath's fault simply needed a tweak in System Settings on Encryption. If there had to be one negative it would be that no fresh real milk was in the room to go with the Nespresso machine and nearby shops do not seem to stock real milk. I only say this as normally UHT is common in all hotels, but when you have a fresh coffee machine in your room it would have just made all the difference to have real milk not the artificial stuff. Though this is not a criticism, simply this hotel is par excellence on everything and no other hotel in amsterdam can even come close. The perfect destination for business travellers, social travellers anyone who is coming to Amsterdam and is willing to pay that little bit extra for a truly sublime stay. Memorable and idyllic.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful hotel in great location”
Reviews.Author: OntravelsfromNorfolk
Reviews.Content: The Amrath did not disappoint. It is a magnificent building both inside and out. The rooms have high, high ceilings and are immaculately clean and well-decorated. We stayed in a Junior Suite which had 4 enormous windows which overlooked the city canal and was just a perfect base for our anniversary trip. The staff were really friendly and helpful (our daughter had arranged a surprise bottle of champagne in our room with them and they made sure that it was chilled and ready when we arrived). We didn't bother with the breakfast as it was expensive, but did eat in the restaurant for dinner one night and the food was very good. The bar had a lovely welcoming dark interior with an enormous bowl of snacks to nibble after a day wandering the canals of the city. The free mini-bar was a real bonus and meant that we had champagne as an aperitif in our room every evening! Then there was the Espresso machine, the free wi-fi, the large comfortable and clean bathroom with large bath, shower and double sinks...and the evening service to your room to replenish any coffees/teas... Could not find fault (apart from the positioning of a socket near a mirror to make hairdrying easier!!!) The location really is only a 5 minute walk from the station so saved money by getting the train from Schiphol, and on the days we travelled the fare was only 2.80 Euros each... Didn't go to the Well-Being Centre, but it did look very inviting. If we ever return to Amsterdam then this would be my first choice of hotel.

Reviews.Title: “The perfect choice”
Reviews.Author: CambridgeExplorer
Reviews.Content: The hotel is in a great location: we arrived by train at night and it was a relief that the hotel was a very short and direct stroll away. The main attractions including the art museums and Concertgebouw are perfectly walkable. The building was impressive (check out the old fashioned lift - no longer in use) and vast, the staff incredibly helpful and friendly, proving city maps etc. The room was perfect... great facilities (mini bar and coffee etc included in the room price), fabulous view over the canal, very clean...very comfortable pillows and bath robes all added to the experience. There's not much the hotel hasn't thought of. We didn't eat in the restaurant but our one evening meal in the bar was very enjoyable: a good range of food/prices from great quality burgers and salads to delicious sea bream (expensive but worth it for a treat). The trip was a birthday treat and we were looked after very well... but do remember there'll be an additional city tax to pay when you check out.

Reviews.Title: “What a great find”
Reviews.Author: gailj402
Reviews.Content: I decided to book this Hotel after reading the many reviews on Trip Advisor. This was our 4th trip to Amsterdam and we normally stay at the Barbazon Palace however this year there room rate was higher than I wanted to pay and anybody that reads my reviews will realise I like Luxury type Hotels but at bargain prices and again we hit on a winner. I booked this room as a secret hotel on a well known web site and with a bit of research it was not difficult for me to work out that the secret Hotel was the Amrath. So not such a secret for me when I booked it for Â£100 per night Great check in and the lady advised us that she had upgraded us. We got a superb room, huge comfy bed and pillows. There was a huge bathroom with great wet room area for the shower. Very clean hotel and the room was very well serviced daily. Now this is a Luxury Hotel and the prices in the restaurant reflect this 30 euroâ€™s each for breakfast. Now this is where the Hotel comes into its own, you get a free mini bar, restocked daily and also a Nespresso coffee maker. Forget your 30 euro per person breakfast we would call to the bakery the evening before and buy some croissants and breakfast in the room with a great coffee and brandy (the Spanish way) free of charge. The mini bar saves a fortune for us Brits as the pound is so weak against the euro. If you are thinking of going to Amsterdam stay at this Hotel you will not regret it, the hotel is very close to the station and the Red Light District so every thing you want to see is close by. Great fun City

Reviews.Title: “Great, but could be better”
Reviews.Author: UrbanNomad7
Reviews.Content: I stayed in the Amarth Amsterdam about 5 times, last of which in Jan 2010. I believe this is one of the best hotels in Amsterdam and located very conviniently close to the station but also close to the touristic points of interet and lots of bars and restaurants. They have some very small rooms, but also some big once in the same price range, so my advice is to try change your room if it's really small. If your room is on the busy street side, that could be a bit noisy. It's suppose to be a 5 star hotel but i would give it 4 "real" stars. Breakfast is very generous, fresh and good, but pricy (25 euro). The serving staff at breakfast has the unpleasant habit to stand in the middle of the area and speak loudly. Apparently the restaurant management haven't noticed in the last 2 years since my first stay in the Amrath. The hotel staff, except the receptionists seems to be lacking training about simple things. For instance, I was taking a shower when someone entered the room and started refilling the minibar despite the fact that the shower door was open and he could clearly hear the shower running i.e. someone was in the room. In my experience in other hotels in Amsterdam, service level is generally low and the Amrath is deffinitely not making an exception. If you really look for a high end 5 star hotel in Holland, try Karel V in Utrecht, miles away in service, great rooms and breakfast served in a ballroom type of setting. The Amrath is great for Amsterdam standards, one of the best, but don't expect too much.

Reviews.Title: “Amazing Plush Rooms, Incredible Pool”
Reviews.Author: jolispapillons
Reviews.Content: Overall Very impressed with Grand Amrath. Did have one incident with the next room smoking cigarettes (in a NON smoking hotel) Outstanding Beds, Bathrooms and Pool! Already booked return visit

Reviews.Title: “Hated to leave”
Reviews.Author: Trojan88
Reviews.Content: The sign of a great hotel is "when you hate to leave" and this place is in that category. It's not in a "traditional" hotel building, so don't go if you expect an American type 5 star hotel. But do go for an Amsterdam type 5 star place. The building has a lot of charme and they did a great job changing the place to a 5 star hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel in superb location”
Reviews.Author: DelTraveller
Reviews.Content: This beautiful old hotel is conveniently located close to the station which makes travel from the airport very easy. When we arrived we were greeted warmly by the staff. Our rooms were spacious with very high ceilings and huge windows. The bathroom was well laid out with a large shower. My only complaint would be although the mini bar was free and had every type of alcoholic and non alcoholic drinks with a few types of snacks the breakfast was not and was a very expensive 25 euros. The hotel was in a very good location to see the sights with the river cruise station just down the road on the way to the station. We didn't eat in the hotel but would certainly recommend the Sea Palace across the river from the hotel where the food was excellent and good value.

Reviews.Title: “How about a closet?”
Reviews.Author: Sid47
Reviews.Content: We booked a room on sale that said it was not a city view. Little did we expect that meant looking at an interior court and another room twenty feet away. But what really got us was that in this room there was a closet above the mini bar and it had the safe in it as well. At best you could hang up one shirt. There are no shelves or drawers to put any clothing. For a luxury hotel not to have any closet space and expect a guest to live out of a suitcase. With several calls the manager came up and before taking me up to the forth floor said, "You Americans you travel with so much luggage." Insulting, but pithy. We were travelling for two weeks and each had medium size bag, but that he felt he had to be insulting was quite surprising. We did get a better room and it worked out in the end, but I wouldn't recommend it.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect Long weekend”
Reviews.Author: c12hamilton
Reviews.Content: I took my fiancÃ©e on this trip in order to propose to her, I booked it months in advance and rang ahead to arrange a few special things such as a bottle of champagne and a red rose waiting for her when we got there, and I was worried that after all the planning to make it as perfect as possible maybe the hotel had forgotten or there was something wrong with the room or bad location, etc, etc. Well I was wrong to worry, the hotel had remembered everything and it was perfect in every possible way. The room was beautiful, a massive bed with tv and nespresso machine and curtains that open and close with a remote control, the minibar was fully stocked every day, and we made sure that we got the most out of it! Then the bathroom was a masterpiece, a giant wet room in the middle of the second room surrounded by glass, a massive bath, his and her sinks and a shower that has so many shower heads it would have covered a family! The building is a listed building and so the hotel couldnt change the actual rooms so this was the best idea possible given the circumstances, absolutely awesome! We then went to discover the hotel after checking in and the scenery was beautiful, lovely stained glass windows on the roof, old lifts and a massive wine cellar at the bottom, we even saw where the people used to get there boat tickets back in the day when it was a shipping house, all in the hotel in between the rooms. We then went to discover the spa facilities, and wrapped up in our complimentary bath robe and slippers we went heading down. When we arrived we had to take a quick tour there was so much, so we booked ourselves in for a few massages and went and sat in the jacuzzi for a good half an hour (tip: go after most people have had dinner and it is empty, the whole place to your selves, shuts at 11pm, beautiful.) After this we went for a sauna in a special 2 person sauna and after rinsing ourselves off we went for a swim in the pool, absolutely perfect. The massages were an hour long and certainly did the trick, i felt like i was floating afterwards. Finding the hotel was simple, you can pretty much see it from the central train station, but at the same time it was no where near close enough to be bothered by any trains or noise at all. The location was just right, close to everything so you can walk anywhere in 10 minutes, but as i said before not close enough to be bothered by crowds of people going about their day and noise from trains, cars and trams. All in all, this was probably the best trip I have ever had, and the most part is thanks to the hotel who didnt bother us at all while we were there, apart from to make sure that we had everything we needed, and of course making all the arrangements necessary for the proposal (champagne and roses). The rest of the perfect trip was made by Amsterdam being a wonderful city, and the fact she said yes! I would go back to this hotel any day, and I would recommend it to anyone. Simple.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent hotel, can't wait to go back.”
Reviews.Author: glasgowgirl67
Reviews.Content: The Amrath Grand Hotel is an excellent hotel with great facilities, good location and excellent staff. We had arrived very early from Canada and they were so accomodating in helping us to our room upon arrival. The pool, sauna, steam room ect. are very nice and are quite a rarity in Amsterdam. Our room was lovely, most beautiful canal view to wake up too and the bed was sooo comfy. The included mini-bar was such a bonus. I am staying here again next year. Can't wait. I almost didn't want to write this review because the more nice things we say about The Amrath the more people may stay there and then it might be sold out when I want a room. LOL. Great hotel all around.

Reviews.Title: “As grand as it says”
Reviews.Author: tripsrme
Reviews.Content: Lovely period hotel which was the old shipping house. Many replicas of its former use still apparent. Well situated for those arriving from Schipol via train. About five minutes walk from station. Easy to walk from hotel to main sights of Amsterdam, Had a twin room on third floor, very comfortable and well appointed though staff have a tendency to turn radiators off, which are essential in winter months. Tea and coffee making facilities in room. Also free mini bar....not just soft drinks but spirits, wine and beer! Replenished every morning. Good leisure facilities...pool, sauna, steam room and small gym. Also massages and treatments available. Breakfast included in room rate. Plentiful buffet and quiet attentive service. Overall couldn't fault hotel and would recommend. Only downside of our short trip was the Church in the Attic located a few streets from hotel. This is currently being refurbished, which they do tell you when you enter, however the staff neglect to tell you the church had been stripped bare and all that could be seen were pews and bare brick walls. No reduction in entrance fee which would make visit slightly more acceptable, then they have the cheek to ask for a donation towards restoration! Avoid until 2010 when restoration should be completed....sadly we'll have to look it up on internet to see what we missed. Would strongly recommend visit to Anne Frank House, very moving experience and history in action.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic service, large rooms, great gym, pool, sauna, and what a breakfast”
Reviews.Author: Marksman007
Reviews.Content: This hotel just ticks every box, with no faults. Just a short walk from the station, booking in was speedy and polite, cases taken to the room without prompting. Back down for a trip out, concierge provided bicycles from the hotel, small charge, and great advice incl restaurant bookings. The room was large with great coffee machine, remote control curtains, and oppulant decor. Down to the gym, ok not the largest, but agreat suana, jaccuzi and small but nice pool. Very relaxing. The hotel is enormous as the old HQ of a shipping empire where tours of the building are provided. It has a nautical 1920's feel with great staircases and very high ceilings. The buffet breakfast inlcuded was exceptional. Overall great service topped the stay.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful!”
Reviews.Author: Kadymar
Reviews.Content: We checked in and had a pleasant surprise at how nice our room was! Very roomy, super bathroom, very comfortable bed. Great location. Staff was friendly and efficient. We didn't try the restaurant but heard it was very good. I would definitely stay here again and recommend it. We took a chance booking this hotel off the Internet by reading reviews and we can honestly say we were genuinely pleased! So I hope this helps someone else and that you have the same experience we did. Loved Amsterdam, had a great time!

Reviews.Title: “Interesting, convenient, comfortable, and affordable.”
Reviews.Author: paulinemkam
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this hotel for about 8 nights and I'm so glad that we did. The staff is very friendly and the hotel is located only 5 minutes from Central Station. What's interesting about the layout is that it is in an old shipping building that was gutted and remodeled. The decor is lavish (altho if you look closely u can tell some things are old and should be replaced). The hallways are red and winding, reminding me of that movie, The Shining. Anywho, the best things about the hotel: 1. Free mini bar - restocked daily 2. High ceilings in the rooms 3. The coffee maker is similar to the Keurig ones 4. It has a pool (one of the few hotels in AMS that have it and I somehow managed to NOT use it. Regret) 5. The room is non-smoking, but they provide an ashtray. I think when they say non-smoking, they only mean cigarettes.... Cons: 1. Cannot open windows by urself, must call and have someone do it with a long stick. (the windows are very high) 2. Could use more or newer elevators. Luckily we werent on a very high floor

Reviews.Title: “excellent stay”
Reviews.Author: jymmm
Reviews.Content: we had an excellent time staying at the hotel,,great service friendly people great room,,great location,,,excellent bellman service,,totally enjoyed it and would return in a heartbeat jymm braun

Reviews.Title: “Elegant comfort”
Reviews.Author: georgiaokeefe
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed at the Grand Hotel Amrath for 5 nights in October. The hotel itself is beautiful, with dark woodwork and art deco lighting and furniture throughout. Our room was small but impeccably clean and comfortable, with a king-size bed, nice seating area, and, best of all, a large, comfortable soaking tub. They provided Lanvin toiletries (soap, shampoo, lotion, and even a fizzy bath cube) and plenty of soft towels. In addition, there was a great Nespresso coffee maker that made rich, flavorful espresso--and the mini bar was fully stocked and included in the price of the room. The weather was cold and rainy for most of our stay, so it was always a relief to return to our warm, comfortable room. Centrally located right by the train station, with friendly, helpful staff. We had a drink in the restaurant overlooking the canal--this is a very elegant, classy, well-run establishment.

Reviews.Title: “Historic and wonderful hotel! Great location, great service.”
Reviews.Author: JShooman
Reviews.Content: My husband and I just returned from a trip to Amsterdam. We stayed at the Grand Amrath for 3 nights. The hotel is an old shipping house and has so many historic charms throughout. The bellman took us on a "tour" on the way to our room. We appreciated the information, he told us some great tidbits about the building. Our room was amazing! The highest ceilings I have seen in a hotel! European bathroom, updated but small. The free mini bar was great, especially since bottled water is so expensive. The only complaint about the room was that the coffee maker was filthy! Other than that the accomadations were very comfortable and really very nice. The service overall was great, except one night we decided to order room service about 1/2 hour after they switched to their "late night" menu. We ordered a hamburger, which was on the menu, but were told that they only had pasta bolognase. The next night we tried again and were told they only had pizza. Why have a menu if you are only going to have one item a night? Otherwise, room service was not bad and pretty timely. Overall, our stay here was very pleasent. The service was great and the unique building was a nice surprise.

Reviews.Title: “nice but some missing things!!!”
Reviews.Author: adventurerjose
Reviews.Content: the location and the spa was perfect , but the only missing thing is the walls of the rooms were so tasteless that we couldn't feel comfortable and couldn't breathe. Except the rooms everything was wonderful especially the staff was incredibly helpful and friendly...

Reviews.Title: “Astonishing views from huge room window!”
Reviews.Author: FlandersCitytripper
Reviews.Content: The hotel an old transformed boathouse, has a great interior architecture... So are the rooms as well! You sometimes forget you're walking through a hotel, it offers an unusual atmosphere which you hardly find in other hotels. Breakfast was really, really nice! Minibar was free of charge! Even if you are in the city center, the hotel has a relaxing atmosphere!

Reviews.Title: “One of the best I have ever stayed in...........”
Reviews.Author: kedzierskaster
Reviews.Content: Myself and my husband came back from a weekend in freezing and pouring rain Amsterdam just yesterday. Nevertheless I feel it is my pleasure and obligation to rate this stunning hotel that we have had a chance to stay at. Personay, I rely on opinions that I find on this website greatly, therefore I thought it would be in good manner to spare a few minutes on writing this review. The hotel both from the outside and the very inside has a great deal of character, the rooms are justr incredible, I would even say very luxorious as per my standarts. In the 4m tall room we were surprised to have found this hig tech espresso machine, automatic courtains, both shower and bath, and many others. Fair enough the hotel is not in the Dam Square, the main square, but that is because the hotel is simply too vast in size, on top it is minutes away from the Central Station, which takes you straight to the airport. I really dont know what to say other that I would definitely go back and I promise you, there is no way you will be disappointed. And believe me, I am a very fussy traveller. As per Amsterdam , I was slightly disappointed as it turned out to be another big metropoly!!! Fair enough, there are some interesting aspects to it! Coffee shops and sex shows etc, which I both tried and attended. Not so keen on the Amsterdam, still would go back just to stay in Amrath Hotel Also, I cam asure you that photos of the rooms that I ve found on both Expedfia and the website genuinely reflect the rooms...that s always a good thing

Reviews.Title: “Amazing value for money”
Reviews.Author: NYTraveller2009
Reviews.Content: Absolute pleasure to stay in. The best value for money I have ever paid in Europe. All the following was included in the hotel rate: -Free Internet -Free Minibar!! (restocked daily with 2 of each: beer, bacardi, scotch, coca cola, sparkling and regular water, coffee, chocolate and lots more). This was a first for me. -Health club and pool. I wont be staying anywhere else in Amsterdam. Large rooms too.

Reviews.Title: “couldn't ask for better, great location, great rooms”
Reviews.Author: abiStirling_Scotland
Reviews.Content: Only minutes from the trains station, you can walk it easily. free mini bar was a great bonus,room good and spacious, pool area great for a relax after a day touring round, would definitly stay here again. No noise from street, staff very pleasant

Reviews.Title: “EUROPEAN”
Reviews.Author: KERRZY38
Reviews.Content: Close to central station for the traveler. Comfy beds free minibar and close to nightlife

Reviews.Title: “The most perfect hotel in Amsterdam”
Reviews.Author: Hans55
Reviews.Content: Stayed for five days with my family in late October. Everything was perfect, from the kindly and cunning staff, to the dinner, the room and the relax area. Close to Nemo, shopping, trams, canal buses, breakfast places, and et cetera. Would absolutely stay there if going back to Holland.

Reviews.Title: “Worth every cent and a great location”
Reviews.Author: iminireland
Reviews.Content: This was our fist time to Amsterdam and we chose this hotel because of other peoples reviews on this site. The location is excellent, less than a five minute walk from the train station so no need for a taxi and It is only a short stroll to the red light district. The hotel staff were excellent and the hotel has real character. Our room was on the ground floor, which concerned us a little but when we got to it we were impressed. The room was huge, we has a jacuzzi bath and shower in ours. The minibar was great, no bill for it is a real bonus. We booked it with Expedia as they had the best rate, if this hotel is going to cost you â‚¬30 or â‚¬40 more per night than another hotel your considering book here, its well worth it.

Reviews.Title: “Stay if you get the right deal.”
Reviews.Author: shiteyditey
Reviews.Content: As you arrive at central station Amsterdam this hotel could hardly be more convienient its a short walk abliet through a dizzying concotion of Trams Bikes and Cars. Very nice grand building though decor inside the lobby and cooridors was a bit "Hollywood Tower of Terror" art deco like. Nice though if you like that sort of thing. Room we got at an excellent rate for a Euro 5 star hotel. I have stayed at many 5 Star hotels and they usually give you sub standard rooms if you are not paying full rate. The room on this ocaasion was very comfortable with a very nioce bathroom. Electric curtains flat scree tv nespresso coffee maker. The mini bar was complimentyr (unusual) for our trip and was well stocked everyday. No ironing board in the room which is really somyhing all travellers need so asking is a bug bear and as it turns out where thin hotel starts to let itslefg down. We called for an Iron and proceeded to get tready which took over an hour. The Iron nrvere arrived in well over an hour but was in the room for our return. Too late for the shirt I was earing though. We asked for additional milk for coffee it never arrived at all. I asked for assistance on the complimentry wifi connection. It never came. We ordered room service which was scandeloussly priced but went for two burgers as they were about affordable if a long way from value. The result was terrible. Buns soggy on the bottom stale on the top and the burgers were cold. They were removed off the bill to hotels credit. The spa was niice and averagluy priced. We both had a massage spent time in the pool etc. Nice for a day that was raining. The location is great but its hard to avoid the red light district as you walk to any of the cities other attractions. The hotel is situated right on the edge of the area far enough away to keep you away from the husstle bustle but as I say you will have to go through it almost every time you go out or put up with a detour around it. Most peopel who travel to the city visist there atleatst once for the curiosity but it gets a bit tedious and the city has soooo much more to offer. I would howbver stay here again if I got the same deal, but I'd be much more dem,anding of the staff and managment to get what I want and pay for.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect experience - except the issues with the minibar”
Reviews.Author: Spanish_Matador
Reviews.Content: Was here for a conference for one night only. The hotel, very nice, very old yet the rooms are very modern and do have all you need to make a business stay easy. The Spa with indoor swimming pool looked great, would have been nice if I had more time... Very good located (a mere 800m from Amsterdam Centraal - the main train station) and also a few steps away from the main night tourist attractions.

Reviews.Title: “Very agreeable!”
Reviews.Author: Molek
Reviews.Content: The Grand Amrath is very easy to get to from the airport. Just a short train ride (15min) and a 3 min walk from the Central Station. The staff are very helpful and always on hand. The room was spacious and tastefully decorated. The bed was large and comfortable. Mini Bar and Internet are included in the price of the room. However, the latter is extremely slow and youâ€™d be better off using their business room. The bathroom was large with two basins, tub and a separate shower. However, we only had face cloths on the first night (stayed 3) and the bath towels were only slightly bigger than the hand towels. The restaurant and bar are very quiet. The food however, was good. We would stay again but think it is 4star rather than 5.

Reviews.Title: “Too many aspects of criticism for a 5-star-hotel”
Reviews.Author: NinaR4
Reviews.Content: following aspects weren`t the way I expected them to be: - found 2 long, dark hair in the bathroom (which is simply unhygienic) - had no shower-sandals and didn`t even get ones when I had ordered them - concierge was not able to make a reservation in a restaurant - so I had to make it myself - skills in speaking english are poor - closed breakfast at 10 o`clock and nearly kicked us out (which is fairly impertinent) For all these negative things a payment of â‚¬400.- per night is simply not appropriate!

Reviews.Title: “Good hotel but not the best location for a holiday”
Reviews.Author: sdrb
Reviews.Content: We stayed for four nights in October. Overall, I'd describe the hotel as good value and deserves its five star rating. The food was good - especially the breakfasts. The rooms were large and well fitted out. The bathrooms were very modern and there's a lovely pool in the basement (albeit very small). Drawbacks - it's rather gloomy and dark, but I guess that's a feature of the architecture. Rooms on the left hand side of the hotel (as you face the entrance) are on a very busy road, so ask for the right hand side which are on a quiet canal. And I think it's in the wrong place for a holiday hotel. It's kind of out of the heart of old Amsterdam and opposite a lot of development work going on in the harbour. I'd certainly stay there again on a business trip but I'd probably go for a more centrally located hotel further away from the main road and the station if I was going again on holiday.

Reviews.Title: “Okay for a 5-star hotel”
Reviews.Author: BrusselsSprouter
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for 4 nights in October for business, halfway joined by partner. Overall, staff is friendly and helpful but you have to be used to the direct Dutch way of communicating to not interpret it as otherwise. They were not helpful at all at first when I wanted to change my room facing another building which was very claustrophobic. Only when I insisted hard the next day did they move me to another room on the ground floor. It was facing the street and tram stop so not a great view but it was better than the view of the 1st room. I hated the bed(s). It was basically 2 single beds pushed together to be a double bed - common in Europe but they were not stable - as we shifted in our sleep one of us always ended up slipping down the split. There were tons of pillows but found none of them comfortable. Housekeeping visited 2x per day. The free minibar and Nespresso machine were fun. The bathroom is a good comfortable size and I loved the deep tub. Overall charming hotel that used to be hq for shipping company, but somehow I never felt totally comfortable and did not always feel refreshed in the a.m. Breakfast was disappointing at 25 euros. You're better off spending this amount eating at a nice cafe outside. The business center has 2 computers connected to a printer which was convenient. Free wifi internet from rooms which was also convenient although the signal was not very strong. Wellness center was okay - sauna was way too hot, but steam room and jacuzzi way too cold. Location is very convenient since it's within 10 mins walk to the central station and easy distance to shops. Parking was at 40 euros per day but the staff will tell you it's a great deal compared to having to meter your car constantly (or parking close to the canal to risk having it fall in...). If you stay here take the time to walk around the hotel to appreciate the architecture and charm of an era passed.

Reviews.Title: “A wonderful weekend at the Amrath!”
Reviews.Author: MrsSym
Reviews.Content: A big thank you to the lovely staff at the Amrath, who made our anniversary-stay truly memorable. The hotel is lovely, unique in design and in quality of stay. On arrival we were upgraded to a canal view room which was perfect, the hotel team had really gone the extra mile - leaving us a welcome gift and card on the side! The staff were polite, attentive and happy to help with any queries we had about Amsterdam (restaurants, bike hire etc). Well done hotel Amrath - other hotels can learn a lot from you!

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic Hotel in a great location”
Reviews.Author: Abdn-Kel
Reviews.Content: We stayed in this hotel for our anniversary for 4 nights in October. We paid for a Junior Suite (approx Â£250 per night). We arrived at the hotel after flying into Schipol. The train from the airport to Central Station is really easy, 13 Euros for 2 and takes about 10 minutes. It's then litterally a 5 minute walk from the station to the hotel. You can't miss the hotel, it's so grand and right on the corner of the road. We got checked in really quickly and were told we were upgraded to a City View Junior Suite (I double checked and these rooms were more expensive, just for the view). Staff were really friendly and the guy that took our bags to our room was really nice, told us about the hotel and where things were. The room was one of the biggest we have stayed in! The ceilings were almost the height of our house! So big that there is electric curtains in the rooms. We were right on a cornder so had large windows (that open) to the front and to the side of the hotel. An extremely comfy bed. Probably a little lacking in storage space, there was one cupboard but not much hangers, but it was fine. Large TV with various channels including BB1 and BB2. Free wireless internet, which could be quite slow at times. Nespresso coffee machine and kettle. I have to say, the free mini bar was great and it was re-stocked every day. Being in a Junior Suite you also get a half bottle of champagne to. Red and white wine, couple of chocolate bars, peanuts and pringles, plus beer, vodka, whiskey, bacardi, brandy & gin, fresh orange, water, coka/diet coke, tonic and red bull. This made up for the expensive drinks in the hotel bar. We had a vodka and lemonade and a jack daniels and coke and it was 19,50! Breakfast wasn't included in our room rate and one night we opted to get it delivered the next morning. Went for the full fry up and it cost 27,50 EACH plus a 7,50 tray charge. I think that's the most expensive breakfast we have ate and to be honest, it wasn't all that great. The hotel restaurant did always look quite and probably because of the price, but with so many options so close to the hotel there wasn't a need to eat there. You are just 5 minutes away from Chinatown/Red light area that is stacked full of bars/restaurants. Although we did get room service a couple of times, it's 24 hours with 2 different menus for the time of day and the food was really nice. The local bitterballen shrimp or veal are really tasty. The hotel's spa area is great. We went down 3 times, twice we were on the only ones there but on our last night it was a bit busier. The pool is quite small but nice for a relaxing swim, there's a jacuzzi, a steam room and 3 saunas - all great. There is also sun loungers for you just to relax and read a book. We didn't get any treatments but there are a lot of options, although quite expensive. There is also a gym that looked good. Apart from the breakfast cost, there is nothing I could say badly about this hotel, it really was great and worth paying the money for. Note that you have to pay a City tax charge when you depart, 5% I think it is. Amsterdam itself is a great place with so many things to do and see and the hotel is positioned really well for walking everywhere. It's a 15 minute walk to the Artis zoo which we went to and was really good.

Reviews.Title: “Best 5 star in Amsterdam”
Reviews.Author: cpsclancy
Reviews.Content: If you want to stay in the best hotel in msterdam you must try the Grand Hotel Amrath. My wife and I just got back from a six night stay in a city view superior room, which by far was one of the best rooms we have ever stayed in while visiting Europe. The rooms are huge, high ceilings, terrific beds, great free minibar and well appointed bathrooms. They even arranged for flowers to be in our room for our stay at a cheap cost of only 25 Euros. The staff will do most anyithng to make sure your stay is wonderful. Thaks Mr. Bosman, the hotel's director, and to you staff for one of the better hotel stays we have ever had.

Reviews.Title: “Absolutely beautiful hotel!”
Reviews.Author: 80datsun210
Reviews.Content: This old hotel was absolutely beautiful and within walking distance to the train station. If you like history and modern quarters, this is the place to stay. The elevator is all wood inside and creaks...quite nostalgic!

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful!”
Reviews.Author: AlanColumbus_OH_USA
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Amrath Hotel for a whole week in early July 2009. I chose the Amrath because it was within walking distance of the Central Station (5 minutes at most!) and our conference venue across the harbor at the music conservatory. It is also very close to many other central city locations (5 min. to St. Nicolas church for Sunday Mass, 20 min. to Dam Square). The view on the harbor side is pleasant, although there is considerable street noise from the busy roadway with the windows open. However, the double pane glass windows and air conditioning make it comfortable and quiet. The free minibar was stocked every day, except once I did have to call for restocking. The restaurant is clearly one of the best in Amsterdam--we ate there three evenings, and everyone was very pleased. The breakfast buffet was excellent, but rather expensive. The hotel has wonderful architecture, especially the central stairway area, lobby, and the hotel exterior. I will definitely stay at the Amrath again if I return to Amsterdam.

Reviews.Title: “Best Accommodations in Amsterdam”
Reviews.Author: BettyH2
Reviews.Content: Gorgeous old building recently converted (2005-2007) into a world-class hotel. All the old, wonderful features were maintained. Room had soaring ceilings, flat-screen T.V., draperies with remote control, expresso machine, FREE mini-bar, tea maker, down pillows & comforters and VERY comfortable beds. Room was extremely quiet. Location was within walking distance to most Amsterdam city sites; essentially across the street from the train station and a 5-minute walk to the Red Light District. Our room had a view of a canal across the street. Staff was very accommodating. Don't bother staying elsewhere!

Reviews.Title: “OUTSTANDING SERVICE, FACILITIES AND LOCATION”
Reviews.Author: FussyJohannesburg
Reviews.Content: The hotel is very different from the norm in terms of its origins - being converted from a shipping house - this in itsself is a very refreshing change from the normal 5 star hotel. The rooms overlooking the city are a delight, extremely comfortable with every faciilty you may require. A modern lovely bathroom with bath and shower, an extremely comfortable bed with top class linen and in all our travels we have never had a minibar that is complimentary and restocked every day. This small innovation - the cost of which may be hidden in the tariff is a marvelous innovation which makes one feel so much at home. The location of the hotel couldnt be better. It is a stones throw away from Central station, the hop on hop off canal boat, the commercial sector and the famous red light district. Everything of interest is within walking distance or public convenience to get you from point A to point B. The in-house restaurant offers outstanding food and is good value for money. Our meal there has to be one of the best meals we have had for a while. We have travelled widely and we have no hesitation in recommending this hotel to anyone coming to Amsterdam. If we have to make any criticism, with difficulty - we would recommend that the dark wall colours in the passageways makes it appear a little oppressive and maybe should be a lighter colour, however this is really scratching the barrell for criticism. Excellent value for money - a truly good find!! Anthony & Evadne Quinn Johannesburg

Reviews.Title: “Maybe the best of my travels”
Reviews.Author: Calsac
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Amrath for the first part of a two city European honeymoon for 4 nights. Considering we used a website called hotmwire where you pick your stars and location and they pick a hotel for you we REALLY lucked out. We arrived at 7 in the morning and were promptly shown to our room with no delay eventhough we were so early. Our roo #100 was beautiful.....the bathroom was spectacular....everything was big, clean, and comfy. The complementary minibar was sooooo nice and was restocked like clockwork. The concierge was more than helpful with advice and directions on multiple daily excursions......and the hotel even brought up a complimentary bottle of champagne as it was our honeymoom.....all in all this is a must stay.....the nicest hotel I have stayed in I think......try your luck with hotwire.com we got the room for 1/4 of the listed price.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic Stay.”
Reviews.Author: emjaca
Reviews.Content: My second trip to Amsterdam in less then a month love the place! Stayed with my sister in Amrath in the most basic room a 'Delux Room' not that it's at all basic. Room was a nice size for the cheapest room. Â£300pp inc flights (BA) for four nights (booked through Expedia) over the August Bank Holiday sounds pretty good to me, especially with the free mini bar, snacks, and wifi, and coffee machine!' Saved us a fortune - and its great just to be able to grab a coke and not have that annoying feeling that you are being totally ripped off. Same with the coffee. That in its self just makes you feel so much more relaxed :) Bed really was the most comfortable bed I have ever slept in. Mini Bar was restocked daily - without fail, as was the Nespresso Coffee machine and the shampoo etc in the bathroom. Um water pressure in the shower wasnt that great for me - but other reviews have said otherwise so, probably just me. Oh and just a note the mini fridge is big enough to keep food in (ham, cheese, mayo or whatever) and leave a note and a couple of euros and the fridge will be stocked how you like :) Staff were super friendly (I find the Dutch the friendliest people I have met on my travels) and always greeted us with a smile. Our room was kept spottless, and at around 7pm there was a knock at the door to see if you wanted any refills or milk for the coffee machine (I don't think you can have your bar restocked again without paying). Or if they could do anything for you. If you don't want to be disturbed - just leave the 'do not disturb' sign out and you won't hear a peep. TV - for the English reading this then you have BBC1 and 2 (great for Match of the day) BBC World News, CNN, there were some film channels that had English movies on and MTV Germany the only music channel - I think. Hotel is about 5 walk from Centraal Station and all the Trams. You can walk everywhere in Amsterdam, but trams are just a stone throw away. Overall great hotel and great staff - In my experience. Am returning in January to spend a week and my 25th Birthday at the Amrath in a Junior Suite with friends ( student friends they gonna love that free mini bar!). The Netherlands is a fantasic country, Amsterdam is my favourite European City and Amrath is the cherry on the cake :o) PS You pay your city tax when you check out!

Reviews.Title: “Unique and luxurious”
Reviews.Author: earthintruder
Reviews.Content: This really is a jewel of a hotel, and we felt very lucky to stay there. As other reviewers have said, the little extras such as the free mini-bar and wifi were the icing on the cake, but the whole experience was pretty damn wonderful! Very convenient for the central station and main tram routes, so a good base for tourists. Staff are extremely charming and at pains to ensure you enjoy your stay to the full. Our room was a good size, with the softest pillows we have ever encountered! Also the temperature was exactly right - something very rare in hotels! All the original features of the old shipping offices transport you back to a different, more opulent time. Would definitely want to stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel - but housekeeping can't keep up”
Reviews.Author: LovesTravel88
Reviews.Content: We stayed in the Amrath for 3 days around our wedding day, as we gave the use of our apartment to our family. The customer service was incredible, absolutely 5 star and on par with US 5 star hotels (Dutch customer service is horrendous at best, so never a base for comparison). For my grand entrance as a bride the concierge even vacated the lobby! Unfortunately, housekeeping does not keep up. I had forgotten to request synthetic bedding (I am allergic to down), and requested synthetic pillows and a duvet at 11pm when we got to the room. It took the front desk a while to locate them, which didn't bother me at all since it was 11pm and I knew nobody from housekeeping would be present at this time. Unfortunately no duvet covers could be located. The next day we got married and got back to our hotel room at 1.30am. What a surprise to see that the room was cleaned very carelessly, and there were still NO duvet covers! Now THAT I did mind! A lot. Interestingly enough, this time it took the front desk only 5 min. to locate duvet covers (where were they last night then?!?!?!). The next day I mentioned this to the front office manager who was extremely apologetic, and gave us a wonderful gesture of a bottle of prosecco, a fruit plate and a hand written note. Now that's great customer service! Unfortunately, housekeeping managed to screw up once again (by this time it was just plain funny) as they had taken my wet robe and hung it up in such a way that it was still wet the next morning (I had put it in the bath with the used towels to be changed for a fresh one. Apparantly I didn't deserve one!!!!). This is pretty incredible if you are a customer who had made a point of asking if the room could be cleaned with extreme care that day. Lastly, we had a connecting door (locked of course) and because of that we could hear the conversation of our next door neighbours literally. As we were on a late schedule and they on an early one, that was quite inconvenient. I want to finish with saying that I'd recommend the Amrath to anybody looking for a great experience and appreciates customer service and that we are already planning our return trip! It's just sad that housekeeping is making easily avoidable mistakes that does affect one's stay in such a great hotel.

Reviews.Title: “great choice”
Reviews.Author: shonm
Reviews.Content: An excellent hotel Very clean very helpful.staff great location The complimentary mini-bar and the coffe machine are fabulous

Reviews.Title: “Hotel with unique art deco atmosphere”
Reviews.Author: plainsman66
Reviews.Content: This hotel is a very short walk from Amsterdam Centraal train station. The only hotel closer is the Ibis. Walk out of the station immediately turn left and follow the path to the hotel. It is about 250 yards away across the street. You can see it easily it is the building with the flags on the top, perhaps 5 stories. Check in was very easy and all of the staff speak excellent English. The room was nice but small, however the bathroom was very big. Also the shower door actually closes so unlike many European hotel rooms you don''t to mop the floor when you finish showering. The hotel offers free internet service and (can you believe this) a free mini bar which contained several beers, vodka, gin, whiskey, wine and sodas. I have never seen this offered! This is a very nice touch! As for drawbacks (everyplace has a few) there is no ATM on the property. As usual in Europe there is no top sheet, just a duvet. This keeps you warm but there is no happy medium, you are either hot and throw it off or cold. Note to self: wise up and bring a top sheet on next trip. The breakfast buffet was 50 euros for two people. Entrance requires navigating about 6 stairs so it might be difficult for some people.

Reviews.Title: “Perfecto!”
Reviews.Author: mamuci
Reviews.Content: Stayed for two nights, perfect location, amazing facitilies, great view, restaurant and bar fab!. For any negative reviews about this hotel you come accross my advice ignore them! they must need there head feeling. Had an amazing massage in the wellness centre, room was huge with electric curtains!. As everyone says mini bar was fab! proper drinks stocked daily with a nice nespresso coffee machine. The perfect break, Not cheap so if you get an amazing deal online this is probably for the lower floors or poorer view, remember in life you get what you pay for!

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful Hotel (Great Location)”
Reviews.Author: DadTraveler1
Reviews.Content: My wife and I spent 7 days at the hotel. Very classy and a great location. First, the hotel's proximity to Central Station - a 5-minute - is a huge plus. You can take the train from the airport and save a lot of money upfront.. Every Tram (trolley car) and inter-city bus we wanted starts at Central Station. Second, the staff was consistently very friendly and very helpful. Third, we loved our canal-side room. It put the beautiful Waals/Eilandsgracht Canal right outside our window. Our room, with high ceilings, was very comfortable with the climate control. Fourth, the free mini-bar was kept well stocked and is a great money-saving extra that we've not seen elsewhere. Two caveats. During our stay outdoor temperatures did not go above the mid-80's (F). We don't know how comfortable the climate control would have made our room had it been really hot outside; it's not the air conditioning that Americans used to. Second, I found the mattresses very comfortable and slept very well. But my wife would have done better with a firmer mattress, which the hotel does not provide. Breakfast at the hotel is indeed expensive, but there are plenty of nearby alternatives that are reasonably priced. Things to Do: Get a 24-hour or multi-day tram/bus pass - great savings and gives you flexibility in seeing a great city. The Tourist Information Office (one is right across the street from Central Station) is a great source of information, suggestions and time-saving tickets; we thought the wait of 10 minutes or more to be serviced was worthwhile. Great , convenient day trips outside Amsterdam: Bus ride to Edam/Vollendam/Marken Island (rent a bike in Edam and pedal to the harbor (North Sea) and dike. Train ride to Delft/Haarlem - great plazas, churches, and architecture (you can add The Hague on the same trip.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location and sense of luxury”
Reviews.Author: Topsy39
Reviews.Content: We would like to recommend this hotel. The staff, even before we arrived were helpful...knowing we would get into Amsterdam by 10.30am and not wanting to carry our cases all day we contacted them to see if we could leave the bags at the hotel. They were very accommodating and were able to allow us to our room by 10.30am, even though check in at 2.00pm. When we were leaving we also appreciated the booking out time of 12 noon. We were again able to leave our bags all day with them until our evening flight. Both these accommodations made our 5 day trip full and unhindered. Location is great â€“ 5 minutesâ€™ walk from the central station. Train ride was 13 minutes and only 3.80 euro....why take a taxi? Although on a main road in front of the port it was not noisy, and as you exit the entrance and turn left you are in a small road along a canal, great bar just over a bridge and in 3 minutes you are in the main canals/ shopping. There were simple touches in the hotel such as the free mini bar, free rental of DVDâ€™s, the complimentary slippers and robes and the nepresso machine rather than sachets of coffee which made staying a pleasure. The staff were very friendly and helpful. The rooms very clean, the bathroom sparkled. A nice touch was that there was a second knock on the door in the evening to enquire if you needed anything, like extra coffee and we found that when we weren't in at that point we would return to a tidied room. The spa and pool is beautiful and allow a sense of luxury. The pool has a power jet (I had not experienced this in any other hotel pool). It is a great addition to a small pool where most people are just relaxing. It allows you to have a swim if the pool is busy with guests or children playing, but also allows you to swim constantly rather than continuously turning even when alone in the pool. The gym is not big, but adequately equipped. The minibar was well stocked â€“ 5 small bottles (gin, vodka, whiskey, brandy and Bacardi) 2 fat cokes, 2 thin cokes, 2 beers, 2 sparkling and 2 still water, 2 orange juice, and 2 tonic water. The breakfasts were too expensive for our wallets (25 euroâ€™s) but to have coffee, orange juice and buying a croissant earlier was fine, or going out to the many places to eat for breakfast was easy. We found a good place â€“ the Pancake Bakery at Prinsenstraat, Along the Canal Belt, not far....doesnâ€™t look anything from the outside but they are busy. And the pancakes are good! We took the cokes out with us and enjoyed sitting in Dam Square with them rather than paying 5 euroâ€™s for a coke at one of the bars! We have put great value for money because we were able to book as a Top Secret hotel...so it was great value for money. The going room rate for superior deluxe is 450 euro's....out of our price bracket...but that was what they displayed in the room, Iâ€™m sure many people donâ€™t pay that. The Â£400 we paid for 4 nights we thought was great value. Car parking was secure, cost 40 euro's for a 24hour period.

Reviews.Title: “Highly recommended, brilliant facilities, location and staff”
Reviews.Author: razorfight
Reviews.Content: Lovely Hotel and atmosphere within. Staff very helpful and friendly. Room good size, mini bar complimentary ( value of which is â‚¬90 at hotel prices). Spa facilities (jacuzzi, sauna, steamroom, fitness machines and pool included) Massage and other treatments at cost. Breakfast very ample. Restaurant and bar menu cost reasonable. Bikes available for hire from hotel to get round Amsterdam easier. Close to station but far enough not to be disturbed, 5 mins walk. Only downfall was our room located close to delivery access for hotel, resulting in a disturbed morning at early o'clock. Definately would go back however.

Reviews.Title: “Loved the Amrath - luxury!”
Reviews.Author: sammywammy
Reviews.Content: The Amrath is a very beautiful hotel with gorgeous period features. The reception with its delightful stained glass windows was home to the concierge, who were very helpful during our stay, giving is umbrellas, calling us taxis and recommending restaurants et cetera. Curiously there is a working, but not in service, 'pater noster' in the hotel. A patern noster lift is a passenger elevator which consists of a chain of open compartments (each usually designed for two persons) that move slowly in a loop up and down inside a building without stopping. Passengers can step on or off at any floor they like. Downstairs there is a compact but superb pool with jacuzzis, saunas and steam rooms, plus a spa and hair dresser. We felt very spoiled! Perhaps the only drawbacks were that the hotel's restaurant was always empty and it was too quiet for us to consider staying. The hotel's location also had its ups and downs: walking distance from the train station and Red Light Distrcit but it could have been more central. Despite this, I would definitely recommend the Grand Amrath!

Reviews.Title: “so relaxed”
Reviews.Author: armanilil
Reviews.Content: this hotel really hit the spot. the building was beautiful with all the original features still in place it had a feeling of an old black and white film set. they had a very well equipped wellness centre with all sorts of pampering packages or you could go for swim in the pool or work out in the gym if you were feeling energetic. the staff were very nice and friendly. this is not one of those hotels were the staff are in your face about services if you want something ring reception and they are very helpful. the room was lovely with a bed fit for a princess. didnt think much of the minibar though as my husband and i dont drink alcohol that often there were only a few soft drinks if you wanted to change this then it was charged as extras. the bathroom was great too. the bath was amazing and the bath products were a nice touch.

Reviews.Title: “worth every penny”
Reviews.Author: wannabcrtic
Reviews.Content: Just checked out today. What can i say about this hotel? If you visit amsterdam then this is the place to stay. Great service, great staff, nothing was a problem. We were constantly asked if we needed anything, would we like help with anything? loved it. The mini bar was a real treat. Only negative was the price of the food, we never ate anything in the hotel and noticed the restaurant was always empty. we would have tried it but the cost was what put us off there were lots of great restaurants in Amsterdam anyway. Did notice on Sunday that they served afternoon tea, looked lovely and would have given that a go if we had known about it. otherwise this was a great experience and would def go here again. Beds were awesome!

Reviews.Title: “Unique, modern and beautiful”
Reviews.Author: sy1234
Reviews.Content: We loved this hotel. We had a deluxe double - one level up from basic, can't remember exactly what it was called. Our room was totally beautiful with a great view of the canal. We didn't bring our toddler but if we had, the room had a nice feature of a wooden door between us and the large hallway to the bathroom. So, we would have put his crib in that hallway and it would have provided us with almost a suite with two rooms so we could put him to bed before us. Another small note to those sharing rooms - at least in our room there was that wooden door but the door to the bathroom itself was a very stylish frosted glass door that didn't seal. The bathroom was quite long so it may not be an issue, but if you are very uncomfortable with the potential of bathroom noises, you might want to ask whether your room will have a partition door between the bathroom and the bed section. I was traveling for business but brought my husband for some QT as well, and it fit the bill perfectly on both counts. Free wireless worked great in the room and the business center let me print something without a problem. Free minibar was a nice perk with plenty of water, chocolate bar etc. The hotel is unique - absolutely incredible architecture and rooms were very stylishly appointed. We agreed this was probably the most beautiful hotel we have ever stayed in, and we've stayed in some really nice ones around the world. It doesn't have the wonderful but bland look of a starwood, rather its the same modern style but using really interesting wall and curtain fabrics, very high ceilings, etc. The hotel is not for those who want the four seasons style hotel with a huge, elegant marble lobby, 7 high speed elevators and all that. Rather, it is luxury in a very special, boutique hotel style with a very small but personal lobby, one quaint yet very functional elevator, etc. The breakfast was wonderful with a nice assortment of pastries, cold cuts, eggs, cereals, juices, etc. Everything has wonderful style at this hotel, down to the modern nouveau white china. We even saw a celeb at breakfast! The location is good, with plenty of nice restaurants in easy walking distance. It is a bit across town from some of the museums but not too far, and the trams at the central station are very close so these make getting anywhere easy (they are located across a bridge so are just a touch far if you are handicapped or have trouble walking). Also if you take any day trips out of the city, which we did, this was very convenient. And I highly recommend taking the train from the airport to central station, which saves you about $75 in cab fare. When you walk to the hotel, take a left out of the train station, staying on that side of the street and then cross a later bridge, I think its the third bridge - don't cross the first bridge right away and then walk left because it is a longer diagonal. With suitcases this was a bit annoying. Overall, I highly recommend this hotel and we can't wait to go back!

Reviews.Title: “Really the perfect hotel in Amsterdam!”
Reviews.Author: ALCOBAR1977
Reviews.Content: I've been at the Amrath Hotel in Amsterdam for the first time in May attending a big event. I know the city very well and I've been in many 5 star Hotel. For the first time I choosed the Amrath in Amsterdam. My stay was simply perfect. The location is very convenient between the city center and the main station. The rooms are really very clean and provide all possible amenities. The staff is very familiar and the Breakfast complete. For sure I will choose this Hotel again by my next trip to Amsterdam.

Reviews.Title: “great,wondurful”
Reviews.Author: volev
Reviews.Content: i have been staying in this hotel several times already.excelent staff and helpful.very good location.the bed rooms are very nice.defenatly i will recomend this hotel for any one who goes to Amsterdam.especially for bisiness people,the hotel offers great value.i will stay for sure there any time i go back to Amsterdam.

Reviews.Title: “Huge comfortable room in central art-deco hotel”
Reviews.Author: elliebea
Reviews.Content: I stayed with my mum in the Grand Hotel Amrath for 3 nights. We couldn't have enjoyed our stay more!! The beds and feather duvets are so comfortable (which is great after walking round Amsterdam all day!) with 3 pillows to choose from. Mini-bar re-stocked every day which was very useful and contained red&white wine, X2 diet&normal coke, X2 sprite, X2 still&fizzy water, tonic water, chocolate bar, plus vodka/gin/wisky minis. We could also use the fridge for our own food/drink as it is fairly big. The wardrobe is quite small and the hanging area is not long enough for full-length dresses or even long skirts. The hotel is maze-like but lots of signs so you don't get too lost! The staff were so helpful with our questions about the attractions in Amsterdam and checked opening times etc. for us. In the room they also supply a pop-up map to take with you, which was invaluable to us as it shows were the hotel is in comparison to everything else! The hotel location is close to the central train station (about 2 mins walk) which is were all the trams can be caught from; and the Dam square is about 7 mins walking distance away - and probably about the same time if you wait and catch a tram. If you have time - I would strongly advise to take an hour train journey (costs about 17 euros return) to the Hauge (Haag) to visit the Mauritshuis - This is the BEST gallery I have been to, and it is so much quieter than the Galleries in Amsterdam. It holds works such as Vermeer's - 'Girl with the pearl earring' and 'Delft Landscape' ; plus Rembrant's - 'self portrait' (believed to be his last before his death)

Reviews.Title: “arriving and departing less than desirable.”
Reviews.Author: tina_ten
Reviews.Content: The best part of the hotel is definitely the size of the rooms, the high high ceilings, the canal view and central location. I was lucky enough to get the good concierge (tall man, dark hair) who spent extra time to jokingly show me around the facilities. Unfortunately, the situation with doormen was very substandard. Arriving one had to enter the hotel looking for someone to assist with baggage, with parking, everything along those lines. The hotel itself also doesnt really have a lobby to meet people in, so we had to use the bar. Its a bit of a noncentralised maze in there which is part of the character of the old building, but things would have been so much better if there were attentive, always at hand doormen .. AT THE DOOR. Or even keeping an eye on it. I couldnt even find them when I went inside and had to inquire at reception, and even then we were waiting ten minutes. More staff needed in that area for certain, it would have made the entire stay much smoother. The high speed internet was really not high speed at all, it went at a snails pace! Everything else was fantastic, they brought us a dvd player, ironing board, etc as soon as we asked. Really stellar location to explore from but very awkward to arrive and leave especially if you needed a hand with your luggage. I loved the hotel but for convenience's sake, I am picking a different one next time, but part of that is a desire to have a slightly more modern one.

Reviews.Title: “better than most 5 stars in America and less expensive...can't wait to return”
Reviews.Author: lrm52282
Reviews.Content: Ok...I know some of you have issues with the lack of AC, I thought I would too because I am very hot natured, but in late July it was very comfortable as long as you keep your windows open. One day it was down right cold. No screens on the window shouldn't stop you because I believe there has never been a bug in Amsterdam. In fact it is hard to find a negative thing to say about the city at all. As for comments on a rude staff; you must have been in a bad mood and projecting, because the Dutch are the nicest and most accommodating people on Earth. We didn't have any problems to complain about but we did have them find us new reservations on short notice (1 day) and cancel our old ones. We'd ask for help on routes through the city, purchasing tickets for several things, and their personal suggestions just about everyday and were always happy with the service. The free minibar was restocked fully everyday, no delays in cleaning or restocking. Housekeeping accidentally took the insurance card we used to keep the master suite power on (your power goes off when you take your rm key out of a holder, but any card will prevent this), but before we could call too complain,there was a knock and a very apologetic maid. I hate room service prices and theirs are on par for Europe, but the portion of the hamburger was huge and it was more like a large steak on a wonderful bun. Loved the espresso machine! The room was just the feeling we wanted to accompany our stay, and the hotel is a bit spooky in the best of ways. We stayed on the top floor canal side and it was the least spectacular room offered. It is hard for me to write that because it was very spectacular. The room, although one of their smallest, was huge and felt like a suit with sitting area that was never used because we had two large window ledges that became the preferred seating due to the beautiful view. We stayed at the Omni Chicago in a corner suite on the way home and payed more , but it felt no bigger and was much less attractive. Not to mention they left some of our luggage in a taxi and argued with us about our reservations. Comparing the two,the omni in chicago looks like a motel 6 and The Grand Amrath is in a class all it's own. I believe they live up to their name because everything was truly grand, much like the city itself. If you don't know, Amsterdam has so much culture and art to offer (Rembrandt and Van Gough's collections, Anne Frank and Rembrandt's homes, and Holland itself has a very rich and interesting history, not to mention I am a fan of the naughtier sides of the city ). In fact it is our favorite European city. We prefer the views, the people, and the art. It is much nicer to visit the personal collections of different artists than to try and cram the Louvre into a schedule. And, the smells are much more pleasant! I don't mean the smoke, which btw is not in your face and neither is the sex. If you aren't into those things, don't let their existence stop you from visiting. You can avoid those aspects easily as long as you don't go looking for them. Anyway, the city smells nice, unlike Paris. We find Amsterdam ridiculously superior to Paris!

Reviews.Title: “Luxurious Accommodations at a Value Price”
Reviews.Author: Fussy-and-Finicky
Reviews.Content: The designers of Grand Hotel Amrath Amsterdam largely succeeded in the conversion of an Art Deco Office building to a modern hotel. It has pretty much everything you could want, including relatively spacious rooms with 18 ft ceilings, super comfortable beds, and modern bathrooms with great sunken tubs. Extras include a 32" flat screen TV and a free minibar. (Most of the english language TV channels were British, not American.) Amenities are wide-ranging, including business center and a free wellness center with gym, pool, sauna, and whirlpool. The staff was highly attentive, befitting a 5 star rating. Best of all, the room was completely quiet, despite the hotel being "close to the action". There are only 2 slight issues: Location is good, but a decent walk from some popular tourist areas (Leidseplein, Museumplein, etc.). It is however very convenient to Central Station and the red light district. We loved walking everywhere in this gorgeous city, so we didn't mind the slightly off-center location. Also, because of the historic nature of the building, there is no duct work, which means no air conditioning. This is not a horrible failing as it usually cool at night, but guests should be aware before choosing this hotel. All in all - highly recommended

Reviews.Title: “Great Customer Service, Good Locatin and Comfortable Rooms”
Reviews.Author: krmik
Reviews.Content: The Amrath is about a 5-10 minute walk from Central Station. It's very easy to take the train to and from the airport and then walk to the hotel if you don't have a lot of luggage (we only had one rolling suitcase). The hotel is also near the tram line and canal boat tour stops. There's also several dozen restaurants within a 5-15 minute walk of the hotel- a wide variety from fast food to high end Dutch cuisine. The location of this hotel is very convenient. The hotel itself is a converted old building. The lobby is small and not very impressive, but the rest of the hotel is great. The halls are long and winding, so it's easy to get lost. The rooms are comfortable, modern, well-kept, and for the most part clean. The pillows and beds were the most comfortable that I've used in a hotel. The mini-bar is complimentary, which was very convenient after a day of walking or biking around the city. The only negative things were the towels were stained, the robes were threadbare and stained, and the bathroom vanity didn't look clean. Otherwise, the room was fine. This hotel also had the best customer service I've experienced in a Eurpoean hotel. Everyone was helpful, polite, and really went out of their way to help us.

Reviews.Title: “Worth another star ..or two!”
Reviews.Author: elizabethdavies40
Reviews.Content: If there is a better hotel in Amsterdam then I would be surprised. This hotel ticks every box and a few more! The room was large, elegant, comfortable, well equipped, quiet and oh! so welcoming. I simply can not remember staying in a better hotel anywhere - ever. Absolutely loved our five days here - don't hesitate - book it.!!!

Reviews.Title: “Absolutely amazing hotel - don't get lost!”
Reviews.Author: jvachon
Reviews.Content: The Grand Hotel Amrath is visually astounding. It is an old shipping terminal converted into a hotel and they've tried to keep as many original features as possible. To be honest, when entering the first time I was a bit worried as it's not immediately obvious that this is a 5 star hotel in 100 year old furnishings. But once you meet the staff and get to your room you'll realise just how great this place is. There is a great spa and pool in the basement for relaxing and getting away from the Amsterdam madness. Word of warning - you WILL get lost getting back to your room inside the hotel! But that's part of the fun here. The rooms are incredibly comfortable and quiet and the location is in one of the best possible locations. Book it!

Reviews.Title: “Amazing Amrath!”
Reviews.Author: Medgyesi
Reviews.Content: The hotel is perfectly located just near the central station with cafÃ©s and restaurants nearby. The staff is very helpfull and welcoming. Our room was cleaned twice a day and the mini bar re-filled every day (free minibar!). Smoking rooms are available.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel in a Great Location”
Reviews.Author: Brent_Small
Reviews.Content: This is a great hotel in a very central location of Amsterdam. Being near to the train station is perfect for taking the train to and from the airport, as well as being near all of the public transportation. Interestingly, the think that I liked most was the free minibar. It was nice to be able to take a soda or a water without paying 5 euros. Great hotel and one that I would definitely stay in next time.

Reviews.Title: “Great location!!”
Reviews.Author: TheBigelows
Reviews.Content: Beautiful hotel in a great location just 2 blocks from the red light district. Best hotel in the area. Beautiful pool and spa. The food in the bar was wonderful. Beautiful place to walk around also. One of the best things about this hotel is the free minibar that is restocked daily!! Enough alcohol for 2 people!

Reviews.Title: “We loved this hotel!”
Reviews.Author: jsdKewGardens_NY
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed in Amsterdam during Easter week. We chose the Amrath based on the mainly excellent reviews on Trip Advisor. We wanted a really nice hotel, centrally located, with a swimming pool. The Amrath met all these requirements. We arrived from the U.S. in the morning, about 9 a.m. We were taken care of immediately. We were offered a room on the canal side but were told it wouldn't be available until later in the afternoon, so we opted instead for a room facing the front of the hotel. We were on the top floor, and noise was not a problem at all, either from the street or from the corridor. In fact, this hotel was the quietest we have ever stayed in. We never heard any noise whatsoever from the hallways. Any problems we had were immediately taken care of. On Easter Sunday, for example, the room hadn't been cleaned when we returned at 5 p.m. We called to let them know, and the maid came up in about ten minutes, whereupon we went down to the pool and relaxed for about an hour or so. When we returned to the room, it had been cleaned. I'm writing this letter now, because I'm shocked at the negative reviews of this hotel. We loved the expresso coffee maker, the free mini bar, the pool and spa, and unlimited towels. The hotel is across the road from the Central Station and all the trams begin and end there, making it very easy to get around and find your way back later. We loved Amsterdam, and if we ever return, we would definitely stay at the Amrath.

Reviews.Title: “wow! What a fabulous surprise!”
Reviews.Author: HipAndsavvy
Reviews.Content: We ended up booking this hotel on hotwire the night before our trip. I was so nervous as I have had bad hotwire experiences. 5 Star for $126 a night. WOW! We were so thrilled with the results! This hotel was great! The room was very sexy with 18 foot ceiling, an incredible bed, awesome bathroom with a bath big enough for two and...a FREE minibar! After a late night in Amsterdam we could not wait to get back to the room!!!! The only problem...and someone else had mentioned this in their review...you can hear through the doors. So in the morning, I was disturbed numerous times by the sound of the housekeeping staff chatting and cleaning. It was very annoying. But for $126 and such a fabulous room...I could not bring myself to complain to the management! The free minibar kept me satisfied!

Reviews.Title: “Amazing Experience”
Reviews.Author: bailiejmLosAngeles
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this hotel for one â€œspecialâ€� night for our anniversary during a tour of the Netherlands. My wife and I could not have been happier with our luck. The view of the city and canal was priceless and really gave us a better appreciation of Amsterdam as a whole. The service was also 5-star. We got room service which was excellent in quality and reasonable in price. That is coupled with an outstanding complimentary full mini-bar which we enjoyed to our hearts content. The only problem came with our room temperature. We stayed on a relatively hot day and our room's air conditioner was not working well. After merely voicing a concern to a random stafff member (I refrain from calling it a complaint because I literally only said "it is hot in my room") we were upgraded to a juinor suite. The move reflected the managers concern as well as their attention to the needs of their guests. We secured the room at a discount rate which made the value much greater but even at the hotels standard rate, it would have been a wonderful hotel experience.

Reviews.Title: “Nice Hotel, but not really 5 star service”
Reviews.Author: SDT
