Reviews.Content: Just finished 4 nights and the hotel is very nice. In a great building with many lovely details. The room was very nice. Good size with oversized bathroom, full bath and shower. Very high ceilings and a wall of windows. If you pay extra for a city view, be sure to ask for a room facing the canal. The view is much nicer rather then the rooms facing the busy street. One issue was the service was not up to the 5 star rating. While the staff was friendly and accomodating, there seemed to only be a few on call and if it is busy, you will not be helped. I also ordered room service one evening, and the next day, the tray was never removed from the room, even after cleaning and a turn down service, the tray was still on the floor in the corner of the room. I got a great rate, so this was no problem and I do highly recommend the hotel. I think, however, I would not have been so happy if I was paying the advertised rack rate of 400 Euro plus per night. My rate was less then half of this.

Reviews.Title: “Not a true 5 star”
Reviews.Author: SIAMM
Reviews.Content: I stayed at this hotel for 3 nights in June. Let me start by the good things about this hotel and I will then indicate why I feel this is not a 5 star hotel. First, they have the most comfortable beds. The hotel is near major sites (Ann Frank house, red light district, china town, etc..). The hotel has a lot of character to it and is one of the stays that will stay in your memory. The hotel looks and feels like a war castle. The rooms are very huge and almost feels like staying at a small apartment. The room has a huge walk in area with the bathroom door access and another door that leads in the room. And there is a complemetery mini bar in the room (soda, juice, alcohol). We did not use the pool/spa, but walked in and it really looks nice. Now, let me talk about the bad things and why I think this is not a 5 star hotel. This not a luxery hotel. The chair in the lobby are very old, doors, windows are old with no screens. It was really hot when we stayed there and the hotel does not have air conditioning. They brough us a small old fan in the room, but what kind of 5 star hotel does not have air conditioning? So, be prepared if you stay there in summer time. The other disapointing thing was the staff. Maybe this is a dutch culture, here is how I would describe them: they are nice to you, but not very friendly. They defenitly do not cater to you like 5 star hotels in U.S. Other dissapoinments, NO pay per view movies, you can get a DVD player for free at the lobby, but you have to bring your own movies :). I was also disapointed in the room service, I called around 9 PM and they had run out on all the 4 food items on the menu. I could only order salad. I was not impressed by the cleanliness of the hotel either. Lots of stains in the bathroom and furnuture in the room. Overall, I do not give them 5 stars for the negetive reasons I mentioned. I would stay in this hotel again for a good price and NOT in summer.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful Hotel but skip Breakfast”
Reviews.Author: Ron-from-NY
Reviews.Content: The look of this hotel's public spaces are beautiful inside and out. The rooms are very good as well. The location of the hotel was not as good as I thought it would be, but it was not bad either. It is across from Central Station but far off to the left. It is a bout a 8 minute walk from the station even though it appears to be right across from the street. It took about 15 minutes to walk to Dam Square. It is a very long 25-30 minutes to walk to the Liedsplein. There definitely are plenty of hotels that are better located then this one. Overall the hotel itself was great. No problems with the room or the public spaces, however there are a couple of things to point out. Breakfast was ridiculously expensive. Check in and Check out were very slow, and I arrived from NYC on an overnight flight at 8:00AM, and I could not get a room until 3:00PM. I don't fault them for this, but anyone coming on an overnight flight, don't plan to get any rest until the afternoon. I would definitely recommend this hotel if the price is reasonable like mine was.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful building, wonderful staff”
Reviews.Author: MissF7
Reviews.Content: The building looks somewhat foreboding from the outside but the staff couldn't have offered a warmer welcome. The corridors are indeed warren-like but the rooms are gorgeous with incredibly high ceilings, comfortable beds and good wireless internet connection. It's worth exploring the building and finding the beautiful glass atrium and worth eating in the restaurant too. The bar is light and cheerful and does nice snacks and the location can't be beaten. I can't wait to return!

Reviews.Title: “Not so nice”
Reviews.Author: muddywatersuk
Reviews.Content: At best the staff were disinterested. In fact they were arrogant. The room was ok, the restaurant was not great. It is very central but I would give it 3 out of 5 max.

Reviews.Title: “Loved the high ceilings”
Reviews.Author: FussyGlobeTrotter
Reviews.Content: I really liked this place. The basic room we were in felt so spacious, the ceilings were like 16 feet high! The bathroom was new and everything felt modern, which I like in Europe. I don't do shabby chic, which can make things hard. But this hotel ticked all my boxes. The corridors were a bit of a rabbit warren, but the place is historical, so it was actually quite a fun aspect. Got a good deal on expedia too, so payed half price wich is great.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel Experience”
Reviews.Author: PVDVermont
Reviews.Content: We were upgraded upon check-in which was very pleasant after a rough trip to Amsterdam. The room was lovely and the lack of storage space for clothes was easily forgiven by the great beds, bathroom with two sinks, and free mini bar. The spa was also a treat. Staff was very helpful and if we could get the same deal which we got throught Expedia, we would stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Wouldn't hesitate to return!”
Reviews.Author: unclescooby
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for a bank holiday weekend break and I could not fault the hotel at all. The location of the hotel is excellent - 5 mins walk from central station and 10-15 minutes walk from the livelier areas of Rembrandtplein, Red Light District and Dam Square. We hired bikes from near the central station (which you must do to get a flavour of the real Amsterdam!) and this made the main locations seem even nearer. We had a room on the 4th floor overlooking the harbour and there was always something to watch. The bed was the most comfortable bed I have ever slept in and it was actually difficult to get up in the mornings. The room came with a complimentary minibar which was a brilliant touch considering the average glass of coke in the city costs 5 euros! There were also complimentary lanvin toiletries and an espresso machine which I have never seen in any hotel before! Of particular note was the excellent service we received from the Concierge (both of them) - we asked for restaurant reservations on both nights and they went out of their way to ring around several places to get us in at no moment's notice. They then drew the walking/cycling route on a map for us both times which was excellent service. All in all an excellent weekend and i wouldn't hesitate to return!

Reviews.Title: “Excellent hotel with great facilities”
Reviews.Author: UKJosie
Reviews.Content: We stayed as a family of 4 in two rooms booked through Expedia. For some unknown reason (we never got to the bottom of it) we were upgraded into a junior suite for one of the rooms - this was an unexpected luxury. However, we were not complaining as it was fabulous. I echo all the comments made about the architecture. It is a fascinating building and worth a wander round just to appreciate the surroundings - look for the paternoster lifts. Within easy walking distance of the city and also the train station which is handy if you arrive early/late and wish to leave your luggage in the hotel. We ate in the restaurant for one evening meal which was excellent. There was a deal on with a fixed rate for 2/3/4 courses. We didn't eat breakfast as we really could not justify 100euros for the four of us. The swimming pool was always empty when went and very relaxing. All the staff we met were pleasant and helpful. Would I recommend it - yes definitely.

Reviews.Title: “One of the best place to stay in Amsterdam”
Reviews.Author: svino
Reviews.Content: I visited lots of time Amsterdam in different horels, but this one was really good. The hotel is in fact an old office building of Dutch maritim companies. The building is maintained in his original style (art deco), and is quite unique. When you enter into the hotel, you are not in a common big hall with a large concierge / reception desk because the architecture of the house has not been modified, and is in its original state. The rooms have been furnished in accordance with the original style of the building. Ceiling are at around 4 meters heigh! It's very confortable, spacious and clean. The minibar was free, and a nespresso coffee machine with free caps available in the room (Georges Clooney is not included in the fee :o). There are rooms with view of the ancient city. Try to book those. Others have view to the port, between the train centraal station and the scheepvaart museum. Rooms with view to the interior of the building will probably be disapointing (i didn't saw them so i cannot juge). The hotel include a free pool/sauna/hammam which is very nice. The breakfast is quite expensive (25â‚¬, it's a five star hotel) but you have a correct choice of food and beverage (you can even order an extra food like an omelette for example). The fruit juices are really made with fresh fruit, as the smoothie. I dind't try the restaurant. Situation of the hotel is also quite perfect, close to the central station, and close to the centrum of the city (the niewmarkt, chineese corner, red light district and damrak are close) Access to the rest of the city is easy as all the tram are available at the centraal station. It's also well situated if you like to walk. If you come by car, let it in a 'park and ride' parking outside the city, where you get free tram tickets to come inside the city.(unless of course you prefer to pay more than 30â‚¬ per day of parking fee) In conclusion, we had a very nice city trip in that hotel. For architecture lovers, it's a must. I definitly recommend that hotel and for sure i will come back there. I have already send friends there, and they had also a very good feedback.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent hotel, great location.”
Reviews.Author: bloozzz
Reviews.Content: I have stayed in those hotel a couple of times on a business trip and I really enjoyed it. It is located inside a beautifully renovated art nouveau building (The Scheepsvaarthuis). This is certainly a plus for everyone with more then a passing interest in architecture, as it is probably the most important art nouveau building in Amsterdam (a city which is not know for it's art nouveau, I have to admit). This means that all rooms are different. Some have great views over the Amsterdam skyline, others don't have a great view. It's a bit hit and miss. The rooms itself are big (for Amsterdam at least), clean and have great beds. And they are very clean. Another plus: the minibar is included in the room price, as is a free newspaper in the morning. The breakfast may not be as copious as in other 5 star hotels in Amsterdam, but it's good nonetheless. Another plus is the free spa and swimming pool. It's not that big, but I have never seen it crowded. And there is free internet as well. The location is excellent, close to the Central Station and the Center (5 min walks) in a safe and quiet part of town (no street noise!). The advertised rate is quite high (too high probably, last time I checked it was about 450 euro) but if you get a discount it's certainly the better choice in the 150-200 euro price range. Conclusion: highly recommended, provided you don't have to pay the full fare. My hotel of choice if I have to stay in Amsterdam (for business).

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel”
Reviews.Author: alfred02
Reviews.Content: I spent two nights at the Amrath. The hotel is great, the staff is friendly & helpful. Since the hotel is located just beside a noisy street, I would recommend to ask for a room at the fifth floor or at least one at the back of the building. I can highly recommend the hotel and will be pleased to stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Fabulous - it made our holiday!”
Reviews.Author: MisterHobbs
Reviews.Content: We obtained a decent rate, about 50% below the published, and that included an extra bed for our 12yo child. Proper 5* service from beginning to end. Great facilities although the leisure centre could have been better supervised to stop one group bringing in a bottle of champagne into the pool area one evening. Complimentary mini-bar, restocked daily. Fabulous building - I've never wandered around a hotel taking photos of it before. We didn't eat in at all - not even breakfast- so can't comment on the food I'm afraid - we ate breakfast every day in a smashing cafe just round the corner - the Euro/pound didn't make hotel breakfast at 20 euros pp for a croissant and coffee a viable proposition. Would definitely stay again.

Reviews.Title: “Avoid rooms on the street”
Reviews.Author: colin414
Reviews.Content: An interesting building, well located, with very nice staff. Room was small, but well appointed, with an excellent bathroom, but traffic noise was really bad. Avoid street-side rooms, especially on the ground floor.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location”
Reviews.Author: McJanie
Reviews.Content: We enjoyed our stay here, our room was huge but a little dark with and only had view of a high rise building outside, the spa wasn't quite open when we went down around 10am the next morning the Jacuzzi was cold and the steam room hadn't been turned on...food and service in the bar was terrible..but overall an enjoyable stay in my favourite city but I think I'd try somewhere else to stay next time.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent location and Spa”
Reviews.Author: JenVAyr
Reviews.Content: Arrived on an early flight, knowing that we would need to wait until 2pm check-in. My booking could not be found, when it was it was for the following day! This was not the fault of the hotel, but my own. The girl on reception was extremely helpful and within 15 minutes, my mistake had been fixed and a room allocated. This could all have gone so wrong, but the hotel were nothing but helpful. The room had a city view, was clean, bright and airy. It is worth taking the stairs on occasion to see the marverllous glass work and ceiling. Less than 1 minute walk from the hotel is a lovely square with cafe bars and restaurants, a few seconds further is the infamous red light area. The location is excellent, particularly for sightseeing as most trams/buses end up at central station, from here you can also get the train to the airport. One thing to watch out for at the airport is that the train ticket machine defaults to the most expensive ticket. A standard ticket only costs â‚¬3.20, somewhat cheaper than the ticket on the first screen (just chose other tickets). The pool is one of the best hotel pools I have used, ok it is small but there was rarely anyone in it. We made sure we used this after a days pounding the streets sightseeing. We bought the Amsterdam card, which we made full use of and this comes with a ticket for the trams/bus.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel but ...”
Reviews.Author: UkLili
Reviews.Content: The hotel is in an amazing building in a fantastic location. It is a great base to see the city. The staff are friendly. The room was ok but for a 5 star hotel you wouldn't expect the sinks to be blocked and dirty! Having stayed in some fantastic 3/4 stars hotels I was expecting a bit more. Having said that the spa was great and if there was another offer on the price to stay at this hotel I would stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful room, spectacular hotel - amazing architectural details”
Reviews.Author: karenr2009
Reviews.Content: Very accommodating staff. The room was incredible - they upgraded us because our daughter was joining us for part of the time we were there. Free mini bar & espresso maker added to the overall pleasant experience. Make sure you check out the building itself - it is easy to miss some of the great details (i.e. the ends of the banisters are carved like whales to fit in with the whole nautical theme.) Would highly recommend.

Reviews.Title: “Arrived on Queens Day 2009”
Reviews.Author: chickeedee
Reviews.Content: Great location to arrive on such a busy day! Close to Centraal Station and was easy to walk through the crowd of people. Wonderful staff and room ammenities.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic building and nice hotel. Still room for improvement though...”
Reviews.Author: LondonCC
Reviews.Content: The first thing to say is that this is without doubt the most beautiful hotel in Amsterdam. The building is fantastic and stuffed full of history. We ended up with a great room - spacious with a lovely view over the canal. Beware though as there is a lot of variation in rooms in the same categories - the first room we were given was a poky attic room with windows too high to see out of. The reception staff were wonderful when we asked if there was a different room we could move to. We loved using the pool and sauna after a busy day of walking and cycling around Amsterdam. Try to go early as it gets very crowded down there though. My only real complaint was the service we received from the concierge who was indifferent verging on rude, didn't order taxis when asked (politely), was lazy and unimaginative about restaurant recommendations and worst of all when we needed (urgently to get to a pharmacy on a Sunday) simply lied and made up the location of an open pharmacy. All he needed to do was download the pharmacy rota, but he couldn't be bothered. Laziness about taxis and restaurants is one thing, but about medical emergencies it is something else. I would definitely recommend this hotel, but don't bother dealing with the concierge.

Reviews.Title: “The best service ever encountered!”
Reviews.Author: jdauris
Reviews.Content: Everything in the hotel was pretty much perfect (we didnâ€™t eat in the restaurant, so we cannot comment on that). The room was large and well furnished (colour scheme, a little unusual), with a very comfortable bed (great pillows), free well-stocked mini-bar, large TV (with BBC channels), good bathroom (with jacuzzi), etc, etc. The most impressive aspect of all was the quality of service from all staff we encountered -the best we have known from any hotel anywhere in the world! Very conveniently close to Centraal railway station.

Reviews.Title: “Magnificent!”
Reviews.Author: wisewoman15
Reviews.Content: Amstel and Pulitzer move over. The Amrath will soon be known as the most luxurious, coolest hotel in Amsterdam. This historic achitectual gem across from Centraal Station has 20 foot ceilings and huge windows, modern bathrooms, comfy linens and lots of extras. There are so many "trainees" on staff, you can always get what you need. The location is perfect for tourists. Complimentary mini-bar includes hard and soft drinks, and a few snacks...a wonderful touch. Wellness center is beautiful and clean. Didn't try the restaurant, but it looks lovely. We booked this hotel because we got a great deal, but I'd choose it over the other Amsterdam "greats" any day.

Reviews.Title: “Grand Amrath - A Wonderful Hotel”
Reviews.Author: nutz4travel
Reviews.Content: My husband and I loved this hotel and we wouldn't dream of staying anywhere else when in Amsterdam. Excellent service provided by a courteous and very helpful staff. We stayed for 8 days, our room was very quiet, spacious (for Amsterdam) and had a very comfy king bed. It was located on the 4th floor on the Binneykant side.which overlooked a canal. Rooms have flat screen tv, free internet, a small wet bar that is restocked daily free of charge and a newspaper deliverd to your room each morning. The room was spotless and cleaned every day. Hotel has an indoor swimming pool, jacuzzi and sauna. You can get massage if you desire. Hotel has a breakfast room and a restaurant with superb food, The hotel is in an excellent location. A short walk to anywhere you wanna go and about a 2 minuute walk to Centraal Station. I can't say enough good things about The Grand Amrath ... it is a 5 star hotell and like the old saying goes, "ya get whatcha pay for" and if you stay here, you won't regret it.

Reviews.Title: “Great location”
Reviews.Author: Travelbugsince2004
Reviews.Content: Easy walking distance to the Red Light District, the train station, multiple museums, and restaurants. The mini bar is complimentary and is stocked daily with a variey of nuts, beer, liquor, wine, chocolate, and sparkling water. The downside is that A/C only comes on if it's above a certan temperature outside (>73 degrees F I think).

Reviews.Title: “Can't wait to go back”
Reviews.Author: turnleftonplane
Reviews.Content: Had a great stay - helpful staff, lovely room, free minibar and great expresso machine in room. Spacious tasteful room, nice breakfast. 5 mins walk from station, 5 mins to red light district and bars etc. If you get a good rate go for it. I am checking it out already for next stay.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel with great local”
Reviews.Author: shackelton
Reviews.Content: This is a first class hotel, located just a few blocks from the train station (which has a good connection to the airport). The building is quite distinctive and historical. The rooms are beautiful, with a full bathroom with shower and big tub. Free minibar and internet were nices plusses. Try to get a deal on the internet. We paid about $225 per night, which was a great value for this hotel. Breakfast is not included, and the restaurant is pricey, but there are great alternatives nearby and you are within walking distance of the city center. I will definitely stay here again if I get back to Amsterdam.

Reviews.Title: “Very Nice Stay”
Reviews.Author: susieQ49
Reviews.Content: My husband and I chose this hotel primarily for its location. It turned out to be an excellent choice. The room was large and well appointed. The building itself is really interesting and beautiful. We found the staff to be very accommodating. We did not eat there, but did have cocktails in the bar which was fine.

Reviews.Title: “50/50, but Disappointment”
Reviews.Author: JOHAN446
Reviews.Content: We choose this hotell because is located really close to the mainline train and old town, BUT: very cold room (especially bathroom), rooms on street side are noisy, not enough electric light, bad system of ventilation, feel like in crypt. I fall ill when stay in this hotell. Never stay again.

Reviews.Title: “Very Nice hotel in a perfect location”
Reviews.Author: Dee_202
Reviews.Content: Really enjoyed my stay here. Got a really good rate so was very happy with what I got for the price paid. Very good location, amsterdam is really easy to get around by foot but also has a good transport system. The hotel is about 5 mins walk from Centraal Station (meaning you can get the train from the airport saving yourself â‚¬50 for a taxi). . If I was going back to Amsterdam I would definiately stay in this part of town again, I thought it would be a bit far out but having been to the city I really like this location.You can walk to Leidseplein in around 10 or 15 mins - it's a nice walk. If you need to get the tram or bus to anywhere they all stop outside or nearby Centraal Station. The hotel itself is lovely - old style and maybe a bit quirky and different. I really liked it. The rooms were nice - plenty of room except for the bathroom being smaller than I would expect. Very nicely decorated though and I liked the high ceilings. The complimentary mini bar was also a nice touch!. I used the pool and leisure facilities and they were really nice. Pool is small enough but fine. The staff in the hotel were always very nice and accomodating. The concierges were really useful to have and recommended some really good things for us to do. Despite one or two minor mishaps they were very helpful. . I think there are probably better higher quality 5 star hotels in the city if you have more money to spend but if you get a good rate I would recommend staying here - I wouldn't pay much more than the â‚¬150 per night I paid.

Reviews.Title: “Nice Hotel Central Location.”
Reviews.Author: KateGilroy
Reviews.Content: Hotel Decor is cool, fabulous building really loved the interior very impressive architecture while old style clean and fresh. Now for the downfall, felt the reception was very unwelcoming.. the reception is in a room off the main lobby, I was standng at the porter desk for a min or two.. before I realised, while the very aloof receptions sat at their desks, I thought it was the accountants office or something until I poked my noise in. I dealt with a few laddies in reception none of them made me feel welcomed.. very aloof, very of annoying. BTW avoid the room service pizza- worse ever. But if you can get over that.. its a lovely 5 star hotel. Hopefully the hotel management will read this review and teach there lady receptionists to lighten up and smile and take that frozen crap pizza off the room service menu.

Reviews.Title: “They Cancelled my booking the day before I was due to travel!”
Reviews.Author: harrisment
Reviews.Content: I would have loved to stay at this hotel but they rang me the day before I was due to travel to say they did not have a room for me, although they had e mailed me to confirm in December. They offered me another hotel which they said was 5 star and said I could have the complimentary mini bar. I queried price and was told it would be the same. I agreed because I was at work and worried about having nowhere to stay. When I got home I didn't like the hotel they had offered and the price quoted was more than 70 euros extra. I cancelled the hotel and made other arrangements. I was very annoyed about being 'bumped' I had made the booking over two months before and to be cancelled the day before was very bad management, the alternative hotel did not have a pool so it was not 'like for like'. All in all for a hotel that supposedly prides itself on customer service I was definately short changed.

Reviews.Title: “Loved the Amrath - great central location but quiet and peaceful”
Reviews.Author: highfly
Reviews.Content: Just back from 3 nights. Really loved the hotel. 5 mins walk from Central Station, 5 mins from red light district and millions of bars/restaurants but a real oasis of calm. We have stayed in lots of A'dam hotels but this was one of the few with no noise from sirens/trams or street cleaners late at night/early am. Renovation has been thoughtfully done and preserves real 1910 type feel. Lovely stained glass, marble,ironwork. Loved the quirky preserved and working "paternoster" lift. The thought of jumping on and off a lift which is on a continuous loop and never stops and has no doors is a bit scary - good job it now only operates for show! Rooms have printed 1910 deco like wallpaper and curtains. Curtains were electric - ceilings very high so I presume that if you had to pull curtains by hand you would have wrecked them in no time. Bed very comfy. Great nespresso machine and well stocked free mini bar with good mix of wine/beer/spirits and loads of soft drinks and nuts and a choc bar. Flat screen TV with plenty of channels and 2 free (rather raunchy) porn channels. Bathroom nice with lovely Lanvin toiletries and good quality tissues and loo roll. Dressing gowns and slippers, sewing kit, postcards, writing paper, umbella, magazines etc. Brekky included and was nice but wouldn't pay the 25E each if it was an extra charge. Pool/sauna/jacuzzi area great, although quite small - although there was only one other couple there when we were there. Very helpful and friendly concierge who gave us an umbrella on the one day it was raining and we hadn't brought one down from the room.. We had no trouble checking in and getting our room at 13.00 - we were given an upgrade of room category, which was much appreciated especially as we had booked with another agent (1800 hotels) I take the point a previous reviewer made about the small check in setup - basically 1 or 2 people who check you in at a small ante room off the lobby. Later on Sat night there seemed to be a big influx of guests and quite a queue ( the key cards weren't working on the day we arrived so we had to be escorted to the room so this might have been resource intensive for the staff - we had been to the pool and I was in dressing gown and slippers and had to get through the queue to get someone to escort me to the room and open our door - felt a bit of a prat! ) Overall great stay and would go back and recommend to others.We did get a great rate which helped!

Reviews.Title: “Not bad”
Reviews.Author: JuliePie
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed at the Grand Amrath for 3 nights last week. Overall the hotel was nice, and we were happy with it. We like having the free Internet and the free mini-bar in the room was a nice perk, it had mostly beverages in it: orange juice, water, sprite, coke, beer and some nips of liquior. As others have pointed out, my husband also totally liked the automatic curtains that have a remote control. Very close to the train station, one reason why we pick staying here over other places. We took the train in from Brussels and literally walked about 5 minutes to the hotel. Also took a daytrip to Delft by train and also the train to the airport, so in that sense the location was very convient for us. Also the area was nice, close enough that you could walk to the Red Light District, but not be staying directly in it, close to restaurants, for the price we were pretty happy. Room was rather large, had a cool coffee/espresso/tea maker, and the bathroom was a decent size, and also the bath tub, very large for Europe, although the shower was this strange little glass cube that we had never seen before. Overall good hotel

Reviews.Title: “Dissapointed, didn't feel 5 star”
Reviews.Author: Roaders
Reviews.Content: My partner and I went to this hotel on Honeymoon. The website promises "light spacious rooms". Whilst the bathroom was very spacious the bedroom was not. The bedroom was also dark even with all the lights on. In fact to read my wife had to leave the curtains open and sit next to the window to avoid straining her eyes. The bathroom was fantastic with a lovely walk in shower. The level of service was probably the most disappointing. Whilst no one was rude no one was particularly welcoming or friendly. Whilst we were checking in the receptionist answered 3 or 4 telephone calls and left us waiting. We took our car to the Amrath and they did offer valet parking but no where to actually unload your car whilst you got out. When we arrived we had to park in a busy bus lane with the hazard lights on whilst we unloaded. When we were loading the car to leave the car was completely blocking a side street with a police car waiting to get past! The room did have a complimentary mini bar which was great. One night we had already drank our free drinks so went to the bar for a relaxing drink before going to bed. There was no barman there and we had to wait 10 minutes whilst there were 3 members of staff within view of us chatting in the deserted restaurant. When the barman did arrive there was no apology for the wait. I ordered a Gin and Tonic and was told that there was no Gin. I find it hard to believe and laughable that a 5 star hotel had no bottles of Gin that he could have opened. I had a barcardi instead, didn't enjoy and left most of it un-drunk.

Reviews.Title: “Quirky excellence”
Reviews.Author: London_Travel_Bugs
Reviews.Content: I've stayed in a fair few 5 star hotels, costing around Â£80 - Â£200 / night. This was one of my favourites. Given the Â£ to Euro exchange rate it was towards the top of my budget but was worth it. Will try to avoid what others have covered but cannot resist saying how interesting the building is, inside and out. Enjoyed the very personal check in service. Hotel seemed quiet but maybe you don't see many people due to the maze of corridors. Free wireless internet is always handy and the free minibar was excellent. 2x wine, 2x beer, 5x shots, various mixers and water. Not sure why people did not get their's stocked up every night, we were told on arrival (without asking) that it is restocked fully every day and it was (around noon). If it is not restocked then just tell them. I found the staff excellent, they seemed rightly proud of the building and pleased to be working there. Wellness centre is very pleasant and was quiet whenever I used it. Pool is small, steam room was out of order, 3 good saunas and an OK hot tub. Had a decent sports massage. Bar / Restuarant / Breakfast all fairly quiet but I never normally use these facilities anyway. Had breakfast one morning out of laziness, E25 is not cheap but it was very pleasant. Was surprised the hot food in particular was of high quality given that it was quiet. Hotel allowed me a 1pm checkout at no extra charge, this was much appreciated.

Reviews.Title: “Overpriced”
Reviews.Author: discosturules
Reviews.Content: Took my partner here for a long weekend birthday break. I chose this hotel for the fact it was in a good location, close to the train station and old town. Also because it has it's own spa in the basement and because of the interesting decor. First disapointment was having to wait so long to check in. They try to make it a 'personal experience' in a private office, but if there are other people checking in at the same time it just means you have to stand around in the entrance hall. Room was clean, with a lovely view over the port, but very small. The inclusive minibar was small and never re-stocked to the required level. We enjoyed the spa, but it didn't feel as clean as it could have, especially as there was nobody to stop people walking in and along the poolside with their shoes on. Hot tub was cold. This hotel was VERY expensive and I would have expected alot more from it.

Reviews.Title: “Art Deco palace”
Reviews.Author: Ray07
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this beautiful hotel as a Pre-Christmas long weekend special treat. We were lucky to book the room with Expedia as special package rate before the British Pounds deplete next to nothing against Euro. Still it made the trip a bit more expensive than before. The hotel was the old Port Authority Head Quarters building & they manage to preserve a lot of the historical details. So it was like entering a subterranean treasure cave with loads of marine symbols & swirling motifs everywhere. The Art Deco central roof light is the jewel in the crown literately & brought natural light down the grand stairway, which leads up to the club lounge on the top floor. The Dining Room looked very festive & retained much of the original architecture features. The other great feature is the hotel pool & health club. It was located deep in the basement but was fully modernised with good size swimming pools, 2 dry saunas & 2 steam rooms as well as a large chill out area. Being Dutch they are quite relaxed with the dress code & quite a few German couples were wondering around in their birthday suits. Itâ€™s a pity the gym facilities were rather poor, but there were plenty of towels & staff on hand to help with your every needs. The refurbished rooms are all very modern with latest high tech gadgets (wifi, flat screen + cable TV, power shower & remote control curtains!) The room was very spacious with tall ceilings courtesy of the converted old offices; it made a change from the usual pokey bedrooms you find in the standard modern hotels. We particularly enjoyed the free mini bar that came with the room. We helped ourselves every night before going out on the town. Our only complaint would be on the last night they decided not to refill the bar. Not sure if thatâ€™s because they had early Christmas break or the fact that we were drinking their bar dry. Still it was nice while it lasted. The hotel is located really close to the mainline train station. But that means it was slightly out of the city centre. We still managed to walk easily everywhere & can catch the tram from the station to places further out. But we enjoyed the peaceful surrounding & liked looking out onto the little canal with barges & boats mooted in front of the hotel. Overall we would love to come back again to this lovely hotel. However we may have to wait till the Pounds crawl back enough to make the exchange rate worth its while.

Reviews.Title: “Good location, nice Spa and comfortable rooms”
Reviews.Author: Worldwide_travel00
Reviews.Content: Stayed at this hotel for 1 night. Our room was clean and spacious, with a comfortable large bed in the middle. It was a deluxe room with city view on the 4th floor. The bathroom was clean, very modern and included a bathtub and a stand alone shower with rain shower. Service was friendly and helpful. A very nice touch is the free minibar as well as the Nespresso machine in the room and the free internet. The hotels spa is free for every guest and offers a small pool, Sauna, steam bath and whirlpool. The Spa is not big but maintained very well and we certainly enjoyed it. The only food we consumed at the hotel was breakfast from the room service menu. It was an average breakfast but nothing to complain at 20 Euros per person. One problem the hotel has is the small reception area. A maximum of 2 guests can check in at a time and thus it can take a while until you checked in. The location of the hotel is central, about 5-10 min walk from central station. Overall this is a very nice hotel, maybe not 5 stars according to US standards, but at least 4.5 stars.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful hotel with luxurious and modern facilities”
Reviews.Author: Renzz
Reviews.Content: In January we stayed in this beautiful five-star hotel in the centre of Amsterdam. The building is an old heritage with high ceilings and antique furniture,it almost looks if you go back in time with the luxury of todayâ€™s life. The facilities are really luxurious and very modern. A spacious room with a wonderful bathroom, a Nespresso machine, pants press, flatscreen television and so on. The bed was really amazing! With the hearth of Amsterdam city on walking distance and the friendly helpful staff we have nothing to complain about and will come back for certain!

Reviews.Title: “Awesome Hotel!”
Reviews.Author: mishuggina
Reviews.Content: My wife and I recently stayed at the Amrath and loved every minute of it. The bed was so comfortable it was hard to get out of. The bathroom was luxurious! Loved the free mini-bar and the Nespresso machine (my wife now wants one of these). Staff was extremely friendly. There really wasn't anything I found less than excellent. WELL WORTH staying here.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic Hotel”
Reviews.Author: TheEll
Reviews.Content: My boyfriend and I decided to go on a weekend break to Amsterdam and wanted to stay in a luxurious hotel. We arrived at the Amrath and the building was absolutely amazing - as was inside. It had very modern decor and the Check-In staff were very friendly as was the Doorman! Our room was non-smoking and we must have been upgraded as it was very large and roomy. The bathroom and everything was spotless, all of the fixtures were brand new and it was really impressive. The curtains were remote control (my boyfriend loved this) andthere were lots of little mod-cons that really added to the room. The rom was decorated modernly but with a European style so it was a nice contrast and really worked as you were in luxury but also had a bit of tradition in your surroundings. We didnt get round to breakfast (Amsterdam really is a lively city) but the Amrath is really near lots of restaraunts and also the Red Light District so everything is in walking distance! The hotel was so nice i'd definately go back!! The only thing that i could complain about was that we were promised that the spa and pool would be open for us going however due to delays it wasnt open but it'd not really the hotels fault so i cant really complain too much!!

Reviews.Title: “A Very Unique Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Ambielf
Reviews.Content: We stayed at Hotel Amrath from January 3-5 2009. The building itself is beautiful inside and out. Be sure to take a walk up the lobby stairs to discover the stained glass dome ceiling among other details along the way. The layout is sort of like a maze, but I enjoyed it and had it figured out pretty quick. The room was larger than the 5 star I stayed at in Paris, and the bathroom was really big. The tub is very deep and had a seperate shower, double sinks, lit mirror, etc. Room had high ceilings, a VERY comfortable bed, free mini bar (nice feature), an espresso machine, pants press, etc. The only thing weird was the placement of the TV. We had to move it around or lay the other way on the bed if we wanted to relax and watch. The restaurant had an okay buffet breakfast, but it was sort of pricey. I think it was 25 euros a person. The dinner there for me, being vegetarian, wasn't anything exciting. But my friends had rack of lamb and seabass and loved it. The employees were very helpful and kind to us. They also provided plug adapters free of charge (on loan) which was nice. The pool, sauna, and steam room were great. The hot tub was the same temp as the pool, so not really a hot tub. Maybe a two minute walk to the train station and the tram. Very close to the downtown area and red light district. I would recommend this hotel to others for sure. The building is just so neat and it's in a central area.

Reviews.Title: “Chic Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Globetrotter1973
Reviews.Content: My partner and I spent four nights in October at the Amrath and loved it. We stayed in a junior suite with a canal view and were really gobsmacked by the dramatically high vaulted ceiling, the wall of huge windows, and the beautifully appointed furnishings. The bathroom was awesome and the free mini-bar was a definite plus. Breakfast was excellent. The spa was nice, though could use more fitness equipment. My one gripe is that the front desk and concierge staff is aloof if not altogether useless. The concierge was clueless. He unwisely advised us against purchasing the â€œI AMsterdamâ€� card (which would have saved us serious money); gave us completely wrong information about the cityâ€™s major museum and the canal cruises; and, most annoyingly, didnâ€™t even know that there is a historic windmill within walking distance of the hotel. In fact, he insisted we were wrong! (We werenâ€™t.) A 5-star hotel really needs a 5-star staff.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, room and service - minutes from train station”
Reviews.Author: Denver_Mullican
Reviews.Content: This is a hotel I wish I could have stayed longer in. From check in to check out the service was impeccable and the room excellent. The location, a five-minute walk from the train station and right next to the historic area of Amsterdam, was outstanding. The room was very large with a desk, flat screen TV and free mini-bar. The architectural details of the building were also impressive â€“ the lobby area is worth a visit. Denver Mullican, New Orleans

Reviews.Title: “Loved the Amrath!”
Reviews.Author: carolc
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed at the Amrath hotel for 4 nights and we loved it. We found the concierge and the staff to be extremely helpful, friendly and pleasant. The service was quick. We ordered ice for the room and it was delivered in less than 5 minutes. The beds were very comfortable with great bedding. Loved the free mini bar. The bathroom was very unique. The only improvement I could add is that the extra toilet paper should be moved. It is right in front of the shower (which has no door) and we soaked it every day. I would definitely stay there again. It is within walking distance of many of the sites. There was a restaurant right around the corner called Looks that I would recommend.

Reviews.Title: “a relaxing time at the Amrath”
Reviews.Author: wmtdp01
Reviews.Content: I'd classify this as a 3/4 star hotel as opposed to a 5*, but nevertheless we enjoyed our stay. Location is good as it's close to Central station. We didn't eat there so can't comment on the food. Staff were friendly. Facilities - only experienced the gym and pool which was ok (when we found them) Room - ok, but view was rubbish as our window overlooked the building next door which looked like a hospital stair case!

Reviews.Title: “amazing hotel in amsterdam”
Reviews.Author: drhenry
Reviews.Content: This hotel is simply the very best hotel in Amsterdam. Its interior is breathtaking, excellent fresh breakfast (with very friendly staff) and you just sense in all details (tiles in the bathroom, original elevators etc) that this hotel is run with loving care. In the same week, I stayed in the Eden Hotel near the Rembrandt Square. Did not sleep at all. Too noisy, and towels just a tad flimsy. Just spend the extra 50-100 Euros or dollars and relax in this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Immaculate art deco experience”
Reviews.Author: Mikemanchester
Reviews.Content: The Grand Amrath is a stunning building that has had no expense spared on it. Silk wallpaper in rooms, luxury bathrooms and very comfortable beds. Staff on the whole were very good - especially concierge who coped well with requests and were very helpful. Things got a little manic at busy breakfasts but overall the customer service was very good indeed. The location is perfect for a short walk to the station as it is midway between the central station and landmark Nemo Science Museum at Oosterdok. Be seduced by the quality of the building - you do get a free minibar which is well stocked but rooms are expensive even by Amsterdam standards. I would wholly recommend this hotel for a stay in Amsterdam which is a splurge or something special. The staff are very helpful on the whole and it is well located for most of the sights you would want to see if you are going for more than voyeurism in a certain area of the centre...

Reviews.Title: “More like 3* service”
Reviews.Author: Alphatraveller
Reviews.Content: Nowhere near a 5 star. Service was poor. Having a cute building isnt enough. Was there for business meeting in Hotel and they obviously dont major in that either.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful, classic, historic hotel with exceptional service”
Reviews.Author: dmsmith411
Reviews.Content: It was very difficult to find a room in Amsterdam during the dates we would be in the city. We found a room at this hotel and I have to say I was a little afraid that it would not be fun, in a good location, etc. As a wonderful surprise when it was pointed out to us as we got off of the train, we were excited to walk up to it. It is absolutely beautiful in design (a historic shipping building), the staff was more than helpful. Our room was absolutely stunning and the mini bar was inclusive!!!! It was I feel a more than fantastic value for our money and the location couldn't be better. We walked the entire city (centre) for 2 days and couldn't be more pleased than to come back to the water and away from the seedy downtown part. It was perfectly located to the train station and the conceirge and staff could have not made better recommendations. I would return in a heatbeat.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent hotel”
Reviews.Author: fostex
Reviews.Content: Travelling on business in the busiest week for Amsterdam hotels (International Broadcasting Conference) My co workers and I had to vacate an awful hotel a mere 200 meters from The Grand Amrath. Walking in off the street, I approached the very helpful staff who managed to accommodate my entire party in what proved to be a very pleasant, well run and excellent value hotel. Lives up to its star rating and I cannot commend the helpful and welcoming staff highly enough. Centrally located and well designed. I would certainly recommend this hotel for a business or pleasure stay.

Reviews.Title: “Great Time”
Reviews.Author: Squirrels236
Reviews.Content: Weâ€™ve just come back from a lovely long weekend in Amsterdam at the Grand Hotel Amrath and we cant wait to go back. Upon arrival we were met by a lovely team of helpful staff. The room was great and the free mini bar a novel idea. My girlfriend loved the automatic curtains, guess what my next DIY project isâ€¦.The Hotel was clean throughout and the Wellness centre a great feature, we had the whole thing to ourselves for a couple of hours. The interior of the hotel is quite dark and dÃ©cor a bit heavy but this added to the overall style of the hotel. Location is great with good links to all parts of the city. Would recommend a bike tour of the city if you have chance. Had a great meal at Looks restaurant, just 5 minutes walk. Will definitely be back soon.

Reviews.Title: “Gorgeous hotel, the service was the downfall.”
Reviews.Author: bex9993
Reviews.Content: Firstly the hotel itself was in a great building and the room was fantastic and it was pretty central. However, I didn't find the service to be that great considering how much it had cost and although we booked a double room it was two single beds pushed together. However, what really worried me is they took my card for city tax and any room service that I may use and said that would be it. On check it I had a receipt for the city tax and that was it, but they had taken 400 euros out of my account without notifying me at all, which was quite worrying as I had already fully paid. If you go I would personally not give over my card or clarify everything first.

Reviews.Title: “Fabulous location, fabulous hotel”
Reviews.Author: S3CPO
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Grand Hotel Amrath over the Bank Holiday weekend in August. It's in a fabulous location (just 5 minutes walk from the Central Station) and is in the most amazing Art Deco building. the staff couldn't be more friendly and helpful (the porter even gave us a little talk on the history of the hotel whilst carrying our bags to our room). We had a superior deluxe room on the 4th floor, which was huge with the most enormous bath and a separate shower cubicle, as well as a free minibar and bathrobes. The "Wellness" suite in the basement (gym, pool, sauna, jacuzzi) is a fabulous place to relax after a hard day's sightseeing. the hotel restaurant isn't cheap, but the food was excellent and you couldn't complain about the service either. There are loads of other places to eat, too, if you want something less fancy. We got a fantastic deal on the hotel through Expedia, and would definitely go back!

Reviews.Title: “Stylish hotel, great rooms, one small issue”
Reviews.Author: Tiggette
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed at the Amrath for 2 nights in July for his 45th birthday. We booked through Expedia and were very pleased with our room. It was spacious and clean and the complimentary mini bar was a unique selling point which I have not come across in other hotels and was a real plus. We loved the fact that the hotel has retained so many original features. The paternoster was particularly impressive and the fact they have kept it running for all to see how it would have been used was a lovely touch. The staff are noticeably proud of what they have achieved in their first year of opening and rightly so. The hotel's location was excellent, walking distance to the red light disitrict and the station but distant enough to avoid any noise and hustle. We ate in the bar twice and the food was excellent, the coffees were also nicely served with home made biscuits. The Wellness centre was a real plus point, lovely large sauna, a jacuzzi and a lovely pool and we used it both days. Our only concern was that some businessmen decided to take a couple of "ladies of leisure" into the wellness centre for some "frolicking" on our last day and the staff member manning the centre was slow to do anything about it. We brought this to the attention of the managment but had to chase to see if anything had been done. We were concerned about this as a couple with a small child went to use the centre not long after we made the complaint so we would have liked the managment to be more proactive. However, this was a minor concern in what was otherwise a lovely stay and we would definitely stay at the Amrath again.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful Hotel and Stay”
Reviews.Author: BernieandSarah
Reviews.Content: Only stayed for one night, however was so tempted to extend our stay once we arrived. Check in was really friendly and efficient. Escorted to our room (16) which was beautiful. Furnished and decorated to compliment the deco style of the hotel, this is no mass market dull room. This is a beautiful room that is a delight with all the mod cons; complimentary mini bar, nespresso machine, great bath and shower, huge plasma TV, an amazing comfy bed (yes the kings are 2 singles pushed together, but they are so comfy and sturdy that they put up with our bedroom olympics ;-)) All the staff were friendly, the breakfast buffet was very good and all the facilities top noch. This is money well spent.

Reviews.Title: “Rooms beautifully renovated along with modern bathrooms”
Reviews.Author: klipkovi
Reviews.Content: We booked 3 rooms at this hotel to accommodate 2 families (with 4 adults and 4 kids). We got two adjoining rooms and one large suite. There was a problem at check-in with the adjoining rooms (they are not guaranteed), but they worked with us to resolve it. The large suite had a separate sitting room and bedroom. It was beautifully decorated in dark wood paneling with huge windows overlooking the dam. While at the same time, it had modern features such as a large flat screen TV, free wireless internet access, and a modern bathroom with a large tub and separate shower. The two adjoining rooms did not have the beautiful wood paneling, but it was well decorated and had the same modern features. Coming from the US, you come to expect a 5 star hotel to have a grand spacious lobby. In Amsterdam, because the buildings are very narrower, the lobby/reception area is very small. Also, the hallways don't look spectacular and there are many doors to pass through to get to the elevator. These are not negative remarks about the hotel. It's just different and something to appreciate because it was once a Shipping House. The advantage of this Shipping House is that the walls are VERY well insulated. You won't hear your neighbor above, below or beside you. Some final points about the hotel: - Breakfast is 25 euros, but well worth it. They have a large selection of quality food - meats, cheeses, fruits, breads of different grains, hot and cold foods. - Wellness center is well equipped with everything you would expect. You have thick robes and slippers in every room. - Bathroom is spotless. The most spotless I have seen at any hotel. No signs of aging and not a trace of mold anywhere. - They use 4-ply toilet paper! I have to mention this because I have never seen it at any 5-star hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Loved the Amrath hotel”
Reviews.Author: Kazm77
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the Amrath from the 15th-18th August. Although our room was not available until 4pm (the bar was open so it was not all bad)when we did check in we were offered a free upgrade to a superior deluxe room. The room we had was fantastic, best hotel room I have ever stayed in. Loved the way that they kept as many of the original features (tiles, doors, windows etc) from its shipping house days. Beds were very comfortable, flat screen TV and free minibar - yes free minibar! View was good of the city and canal. The pool and spa area was really lovely, so unusual for a city hotel. The staff were all friendly and helpful, particularly the guy on the concierge desk - he was a credit to the Amrath - very professional and knowledgable. Impressed that the housekeeping manager went round to each room to enquire whether everything was okay with the room. And very unusual for a five star hotel was that although it was obvious it was of this standard the staff were not stuffy - this I thought was quite refreshing to find! Location was good, right near the centraal station where you can pick up trams to all the attractions. Will defintely be coming back to this hotel, hopefully in the near future!

Reviews.Title: “Amrath A Nice Surprise”
Reviews.Author: NYVacationer
Reviews.Content: Beautiful hotel. Took pictures of the hotel which we never did before. Free minibar was a very welcome amenity. Staff was friendly, helpful and polished in all our interactions. Amsterdam has much to see and much to do. We were there for a Wedding and stayed 7 days for a vacation. Only downside to our visit to Amsterdam was the Taxi service. WE WERE overcharged twice. From that point on, we walked whenever and wherever we could - very doable in Amsterdam.

Reviews.Title: “Loved the location and hotel”
Reviews.Author: EnglandNE_Traveller
Reviews.Content: Received an upgrade to a deluxe room overlooking the canal, room was excellent, staff very helpful. I judge a good room on the bathroom and this was very good standard. Would recommend and would go back. Location was 5 minutes from the central station but quiet enough not to be disturbed.

Reviews.Title: “Disappointed - overpriced and NOT 5 star”
Reviews.Author: Pia66
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed at the hotel Amrath for a weekend break from July 31 to Aug 3 ,2008. We arrived late due to flight delays and check in at the hotel went fine, the staff seemed very friendly and efficient. We were offered a free newspaper to be hung on our door every morning, and were also informed that the minbar was free and would be stocked daily. Room was a bit cramped, but a very spacious bathroom. Large TV which didn't work until numerous complaints, and was finally fixed on day 2. Nice large windows that opened to a view of other of the hotels rooms a few meters away, had to strain to see if it was a cloudy day or not. The minibar was not restocked until we complained about it, neither was the coffee. We didn't recieve a newspaper a single day even though we informed the concierge and reception daily that it was not delivered. The wellness senter was very nice, but never staffed the 3 seperate times we used it. We didn't eat at the restaurants in the hotel. To top it all off, upon check out we were presented with a bill of 30 euros even though everything was prepaid - we were informed that this was the "city tax" of course... even though they gave us no information of this at check in and no information on thier website about it either. All in all, we departed disappointed, irritated, and with a vow never to stay at this hotel again, even though the location, architecture, and wellness senter is very nice - the price and lack of service really ruins it.

Reviews.Title: “Very Nice”
Reviews.Author: JODIFELL
Reviews.Content: The hotel staff was incredibly helpful and nice. The rooms were spacious and comfy. The only issue we did have was that the hotel has no airconditioning (which is common in Amsterdam). They have a cooling system which definately does work but we were there in a heatwave so the room could have been colder.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely hotel, but just fell a little short for us!”
Reviews.Author: JollyHolidayer
Reviews.Content: This is quite a special hotel which could be truly exceptional but sadly, for us, just fell short of the five star rating. If I could have given this hotel 4 1/2 stars, that's what I'd have done! It fell short for us on the service. The staff are extremely friendly, but for a five star hotel there didn't seem to be many of them in evidence. Also, our free minibar which is supposed to be restocked every day was only half stocked on a couple of occassions. The red wine wasn't replaced at all during our three night stay, and on questioning this on the third night when they didn't replace the white wine or the water either, we were told that they'd run out. Mmmm, not quite a five star hotel in my book. Having said that, the hotel is visually stunning inside and out, and we were very pleased with our "superior delux city view" room (room 206) which was enormous and so light and airy because of the floor to ceiling windows and the very high ceilings. The beds were a dream, the most comfortable I've ever slept in in a hotel, and everywhere in the hotel was spotless. The location was perfect for us too - five minutes from the red light district with lots of lovely places nearby to eat and drink. We didn't eat in the hotel restaurant or have a drink in the hotel bar as both seemed very quiet and lacking atmosphere. On returning to Amsterdam I would definitely book to stay at this hotel again. I found the price to be very reasonable (I was very happy with what we received for what we'd paid), and the location was quiet enough to be away from the madness without being too far away.

Reviews.Title: “Amrath was awesome”
Reviews.Author: cdog423
Reviews.Content: I decided to take a personal vacation to Amsterdam after I finished the spring semester of school. I stayed at the Grand Amrath after scoring a sweet deal on Expedia. Checking in was very quick, less than 5 minutes. The entire staff was awesome and willing to help out with anything I needed. The room was spacious with windows on an entire wall. The mini-bar was complimentary as well as the espresso machine. The curtains were electric and the bathroom modern (jacuzzi separate from rainfall shower). There were only a couple problems. First, instead of getting a king bed, I was given a room with 2 twin beds pushed together. Also, my room was only about 10 feet above the sidewalk, and with people walking by at all hours of the night being loud, it got a little annoying. Overall I would definitely recommend the hotel. It was a great place to stay, right on the edge of the Red Light District, and only about 800 meters from Central Station.

Reviews.Title: “NOT up to 5 star standards”
Reviews.Author: locarnelo
Reviews.Content: unfortunately my company booked a room in this hotel, i guess because of a lower price than you would pay for a proper 5 star. Privately we visit Amsterdam every two months and stay (depending on budget) at either The Grand or The Amstel....next time im in Amsterdam for business i will pay the price difference myself ;-) The dislikes: -dark and attic like room with a cheap finish, supposedly everybody loves the free minbar but i dislike the lack of quality items in there, like a nice champagne and chocolates... -the very Dutch and unfriendly, unwelcoming staff -the dark and dingy restaurant with poor quality breakfast, scrambled eggs in hot plates etc...brrrrr -location is very noisy and unpleasant views -the hotelbar which is definetely not a 5 star lounge but more a pub -no taxis at hand -front office staff The likes: -the sauna and poolroom are very pretty -the big staircase in the middle of the building will not recommend or return

Reviews.Title: “Stunning accomodations”
Reviews.Author: BornForTravel
Reviews.Content: My friend and I stayed in a Deluxe Room, which had a bed that could be pulled apart into two beds. The room was clean. The beds were like sleeping in a cloud - they were that comfy. The decor of the room and hotel were stunning and unique. Exploration of the hotel is a must-see. Mini bar in the room and internet access in the very nicely done business room is complimentary. In the bathroom, there is a full deep tub and a separate stall shower with both a waterfall showerhead and a hand shower piece. The windows are enormous and offer great light. There is a remote to close the curtains. The hotel location was phenomenal. Just a short walk from Centraal Station for trains and trams, the Red Light District and other areas of interest. The rooms at this 5 star that opened last summer in this former shipping company building were fairly priced. The only reason I did not give this hotel a rating of excellent is that the service was a bit disappointing at times for a 5 star. The response time for my requests was slow, which made me call a couple times about the same request because the time lag had me doubt whether they'd remember I made a request. They did all that I asked in the end. Regardless, this was quite a minor disappointment compared to the rest of the wonderful experience there. I would definitely stay again without hesitation.

Reviews.Title: “not quite 5star but good hotel”
Reviews.Author: chrisp1946
Reviews.Content: stayed for 2 nights for a mid week break . Hotel stuunning architecturally both inside and out . This has caused some problems inside such as small reception area.and a very restrained atmosphere. The room we had was overlooking the roof tops of the old town and quiet . i would avoid the rooms by the main road. It was very well appointed with excellent beds, sheets etc and great toiletries . It also was very well equipped with tea making and expresso coffee machine . The free mini bar was a big plus but sadly not for us as we didnt drink in the room . Breakfast was good but not 5 star (the cooked food was limited , of not great quality and had been sitting around for a while . We were not yold that they would cook eggs to order but i think they wil if asked } Also the breakfast room was did not have windows and was not hugely attractive. The wellbeing area was excellent with spotless but small pool sauna, steam room and jacuzzi. However on the 2 mornings we used it there were no staff and no other guests . The hotle felt quiet and not very busy. Also our room did not have an opening window . However the aiur conditioning was extrenely quiet . all in all a positive stay but not 5 star. Given the price of hotels in Amsterdam though neither is the cost at about Â£200.

Reviews.Title: “We said nightmare !!!”
Reviews.Author: Moume
Reviews.Content: Damned, such a bad experience !!! Once ! never twice. 1 - Check in : problem with our reservation. A good idea, I brought my printing reservation. It takes a too long time. 2 - At the reception, during the check in details such a noisy vaccum cleaner in the entrance, going and coming members of the hotel staff but nobody with 'a hello for us' or a little smile. 3- The bathroom was dirty, we asked for a cleaning. They did it. The windows were also dirty. 4- We also found a slipper for the last guest under the bed. 5 - The carpet and the walls in the corridor were also dirty ..... May be they fished the five stars in the canal !!!

Reviews.Title: “Maybe not a 5 Star but a good 4”
Reviews.Author: obrienmfg
Reviews.Content: Great Location Good Hotel Nice rooms and friendly Staff. maybe not a 5 Star IMO though. Avoid Breakfast itâ€™s a rip off at â‚¬25 per person and the Restaurant was very quiet so never ate there. Lots of good places around the area for Breakfast and Dinner, at far better prices and choices. Also charged â‚¬27 for two slices of plain apple tart and 2 coffees, crazy prices.!!!!! Very large rooms and very heavy and warm bed quilts Air con not the best even when turned up full. Only one of the windows opens marked with a sticker to let some fresh air in. Had requested a high quiet room when booking but one was not available until the 2nd Night of our stay moved at no extra charge and had a lovely view of the canals and city. Nice but quiet bar with very friendly Greek bar man called Laki, good character, ask him to recommend a restaurant for you (Greek) ; - ) Amsterdam is a great city and I would love to go back, would I go back to this hotel? Yes

Reviews.Title: “Average Amrath”
Reviews.Author: frankyboy800
Reviews.Content: Stayed in Grand Hotel Amrath for mid week break recently. I was attracted to the hotel because of the many positive reviews on the website. My overall experience was positive, rooms are large and well furnished. The staff are very helpful and friendly. The wellness area is a bonus for a city hotel. the minibar was an excellent touch! I did have some negative comments however. On one evening i noticed a mouse scurrying around the bar! Quite a surprise, and ensured i did not return there for the rest of the stay. The hotel is quite dark, and the decor is similar, would benefit greatly from some flowers, paintings etc. The breakfast was pretty poor, and expensive, sub par for a 5* hotel. Overall i would rate this hotel as an improving 4* hotel

Reviews.Title: “A warm welcome and a bed fit for a King.”
Reviews.Author: David A
Reviews.Content: The location, 5 star standard and opinions from other travellers were the reasons for choosing this hotel. This being our first trip to Amsterdam choosing accommodation was a bit like sticking a tail on the donkey, but overall I felt pleased that we had decided to stay at the Grand Amrath. The booking was made through last minute .com. The whole reservation process was smooth and easy, payment made prior to arrival. There is a quirky reception room to check in on arrival, the staff were very cheerful friendly and helpful.I paid an extra Â£25 per night for a room upgrade; this gave us a queen size bed and a huge, fabulous bathroom. A priority for me when staying away from home is to equal the home comforts or better them if possible. Next on the list is to have peace and quiet and undisturbed sleep. The bed was the most comfortable hotel bed that I have ever slept in. The room was immaculately cleaned and the maid service first class. One of the pleasures of staying was to have full use of the contents of the mini bar included, replenished each day free of charge.Use of the substantial room safe was also complimentary. We stayed on a room only basis leaving the hotel in the morning returning later in the evening. Breakfast is 25 euros each, an evening meal looked to be around the 40 euro each. Walk until you are opposite the railway station, staying on the same side of the road as the hotel and you come to an excellent breakfast bar. Double egg on toast with all the trimmings costs 7 euro. The only disappointment I had with the hotel was the actual location of the room. It was situated on the first floor in the middle of the building; the view from the window was of a wall and a flat roof with sky lights. Daylight entering the room was limited. I did request a high floor; quiet room with a view when booking with last minute.com. I also asked at reception if we could be moved to a room on a high floor with a canal view, only to be told that would only be possible after the first nights stay and if we chose to move rooms there would be an extra charge of 40 euros. I felt this was sharp practice and as we were only staying three nights using the hotel purely for a base it was not worth the hassle. Hence my rating of four stars not five. Viewing the exterior of the Hotel canal view rooms are obviously at a premium. There are a vast amount of rooms facing a busy main road, something to consider when making a reservation. We thoroughly enjoyed our stay in Amsterdam. A fascinating city. Plenty to see and do, warm, well mannered friendly people. Watch out for the cyclists, they appear at break neck speed from every direction.

Reviews.Title: “Amazing”
Reviews.Author: cookiejar28
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the Amrath for weekend with my husband. The hotel is great, We had a free upgrade (dont know why). The room was beautiful with lcd tv...FREE MINIBAR the was restacked daily at no extra cost....... Breakfast was really good too, everything you can want, Great location near all the restaurants and coffee shops etc. Bar staff really slow but apart from that it was a great stay.

Reviews.Title: “I loved everything”
Reviews.Author: enricobx
Reviews.Content: The building is fantastic, the hotel is wonderful, true luxury at affordable prices (I looked for, and found, a special offer on the hotel website). The bed is awfully confortable, you have complimentary bar, full of refreshments and some snacks, the toiletries are by Lanvin. The staff is very polite. The location is in front of the railway station, and short walking distance from the Dam.

Reviews.Title: “Fabulous hotel on all fronts!”
Reviews.Author: twiebe
Reviews.Content: THe hotel is fantastic....service and staff were 5 star all the way. Great new spa and pool area. We stayed March 25th, with our 3 kids ages 6, 15, 17. Teens had there own room. We were in rm 419 (14ft ceilings plus) was really nice and large; they added a great little bed for our son with robe and slippers. We missed Easter while in Morocco, so asked staff to boil up 5 eggs for a surprise the next morning. They prepared a gorgeous platter, with fresh daffodills, quail and regular eggs, all nestled in the great easter straw...it was so beautifu! We decided to stay in for dinner after being on the road for 3 wks. Dinner was first class, and delicious. Attention to detail by all the staff was great. Highly recommend this property. Large rooms and washrooms (unsual for Europe). Loved the Lanvine Products.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic”
Reviews.Author: a_fielding121
Reviews.Content: Fantastic Hotel, 1st Class nearly opposite Grand Central Station so right in the heart of things. Staff were polite and so helpful. Rooms well what can i say 7ft Bed, Bath big enough for 2, Fully stocked bar free which is re-stocked every day. room clean fresh towels and new tolietries ( which are good quality) etc renewed everday. Free use of Dressing gown and slippers, Trouser Press, Hair Dryer. I have stayed in a few 5 star hotels in my time but this one is one of the best. All i can say is if you can afford it (or get a good deal like i did) try different websites it is well worth staying in this Hotel

Reviews.Title: “The hotel staff is Grand, for sure.”
Reviews.Author: edinburghedge
Reviews.Content: The Grand Hotel Amrath is within easy walking distance of Central Station. I arrived at the hotel for our four night stay, (a reunion with an old American friend), on March 19 and was greeted by a welcoming reception staff. I was guided to our room by a bellman who gave me a history of the building, formerly offices for a shipping company, it's an unusual piece of architecture both inside and out. The first thing I noticed about our room, #109, was the dramatically high ceiling and wonderfully large windows with long, extraordinarily long, floor length drapes. Unfortunately our view from these terrific windows, (which could have done with a good clean), looked out onto the back of the hotel and the rubbish bins. The room was stylishly decorated but unfortunately there was very little floor space. They managed to squeeze in a small table and two chairs along with the King-size bed but the room felt cramped. There was space to move about, but just. Even thought the room was small it was packed with lots of fun extras. The 'complimentary mini-bar' was a first for me. They restock it daily so we emptied it nightly. We stashed stuff away just so they would replenish the entire thing. Sounds cheeky, I know, but when we moved to a different hotel for the last three days of our holiday we had a boatload of complimentary supplies to take with us. The closet/wardrobe contained a safe, coffeemaker, kettle, plenty of glassware, cups and saucers, and an umbrella, (really useful, it rained or snowed every day we were there). The coffeemaker with its selection of espressos, cappuccinos and teas, also restocked daily, was a real treat. The bathroom was large with a ginormous tub and separate shower stall. There was ample counter space and dual sinks. The bathroom amenities were of good quality/assortment and the towels were large but unfortunately not very soft. The bathrobes are a nice touch, but again, not really comfortable... maybe it's the detergent they use. The service, across the board, was top notch... everyone was smiling and friendly at all times. The staff is the very best thing about this hotel. There was a superior level of service throughout the property. It may be the best hotel staff I've ever encountered. I can't comment on the food service because we didn't eat in the hotel, (nor did we drink at the bar), although there is a substantial room service menu available 24 hours. Breakfast was not included in our room rate and at $40/Â£20 per person we couldn't be bothered trying it. The hotel offers a gym and a pool. The pool is quite small and when we visited it was filled with children so I decided against swimming... I have a thing about kids and public pools, I mean, might as well just pee directly on me. I'm confident that room #109 is not the best accommodation at the Amrath but it was still an enjoyable stay all the same. Thumbs Up.

Reviews.Title: “Fab Hotel”
Reviews.Author: quitwhenurahead
Reviews.Content: Just back from a wet and windy amsterdam, lovely city and fab hotel. as mentioned before 5 mins from central station, excellent rooms, free mini bar :-), friendly and helpful staff. please note gym is very small and fitted with limited equipment (difficult to use as mentioned elsewhere). pool is also very small. hotel is excellent base to explore amsterdam and will definitely return (in the summer when weather might be a bit kinder) worth emailing hotel for better rates! enjoy

Reviews.Title: “Lovely Stay”
Reviews.Author: Travelesquire
Reviews.Content: Had high expectations based on TripAdvisor reviews. Very pleased with our stay. Beautiful old building yet all the right touches in halls, lobby, rooms, service. Truly was that rare combination of up-to-date, luxurious and beautiful decor while also unique with old-world charm. Rooms were modern yet warm, immaculate, with beautiful bedding, wall covering, drapes. First-rate. Beds were firm, not squishy, and very comfortable. Vaulted ceilings, large windows that both opened and kept out noise, drapes with remote opener. Good light in the bathroom, goodsize tub. Room was not large, but enough space for 2 for a few days. So peaceful and quiet (vis-a-vis hallway and other rooms) -- a huge concern at so many hotels. A bit of street noise if on a lower floor and facing the city. Had to ask to move from ground floor (which was quite noisy and had two twins put together). Don't know why they put us through that, but were accommodating once we asked (5 minutes after getting that first room). Pool/fitness area likewise immaculate and so inviting. Very limited (and difficult to use) equipment in fitness room. Did not eat at the Amrath, so no comments there. Inviting dining/bar areas though. Kudos to the staff for terrific service. Overall, a memorable and extremely pleasant stay.

Reviews.Title: “Fabulous 5 Star hotel”
Reviews.Author: TheGupsters
Reviews.Content: We have just returned from a 4 night stay in Amsterdam. The weather was terrible (windy and raining and cold) but the hotel was amazing! It was in a great location, just 5 mintues from Central Station and opposite the canal. Despite the ongoing building work going on nearby at the station the hotel is a fabulous monumental building, we almost walked past it as it doesn;t look like a hotel! The staff were very kind and friendly and extremely helpful. Every single member of staff that walked past greeted you. We initially had a city view room (overlooking the canal) although I am a terrible sleeper so we asked to switch to a backroom and ended up with a lovely room on the 4th floor which was even bigger than the first choice!
