A free mini bar stocked daily, the room was always kept superbly clean, the sheets were clean and crisp on the bed daily. You get 3 pillows in 3 different sizes, unheard of from European hotels! The bed was so comfy, you'd lose your other half in it! There were so many nice touches that made this special, we had free slippers and robes. They leave you an umbrella in your room (obviously used to the weather!), loads of towels, not just the obligatory 2 you usually get (and big bath towels). They even have BBC 1 and BBC 2 for all you Eastenders fans out there! Free internet access. There is a great 'floating' Chinese restaurant opposite called the Sea Palace that is well worth a visit. The hotel is close to the Red light district, which isn't the nicest area of Amsterdam, although its worth a mooch around. I wouldn't go back to Amsterdam again unless it was summer as the weather was pretty bad, it put us off hiring bikes. We did a canal cruise which was ok, only 9 euros for about an hours trip. If I did visit I would certainly stay at this hotel. We got a fantastic deal from Expedia otherwise we would never have afforded it. Just to let you know, the hotel do add an additional 5% tax on the room each night, although I don;t remember reading this in the small print from Expedia.

Reviews.Title: “late bookings”
Reviews.Author: troutmoon
Reviews.Content: At the suggestion of Dutch in-laws, we checked the late bookings office just up the straat from the train station. Our rate was half price for 2 nights at The Grand. My then 8 year old daughter was enamoured with the bathroom's square toilet seat. The indoor pool/spa was beautiful and inviting. The bed luxurious. Walking distance close to the town center, canal boats and trolley we happily explored the beautiful old city. Definitely a splurge, even at half price.

Reviews.Title: “AMAZING”
Reviews.Author: alicat28
Reviews.Content: This is the best hotel I have ever stayed in and is infact a 5-STAR hotel. The rooms were large and the bathroom had a huge tub and a great shower also. Beds were so comfy and its seems they have remebered every little detail of anything you could possibly need. Free mini bar (5 x spirits, 2 x beers, 8x soft drinks, 2 x orange juice, 4 x waters all in bottles as well as chocolate and nuts oh and red and white wine) this is refilled everyday. This was a great bonus for our 2 night stay!! Staff are lovely, barman gave us free drinks as it was my dad's birthday and joined us in a toast. Decor amazing - marble staircases and beautiful designs on the glass. A truely memorable hotel - book early at booking.com for a great deal. Our room was superior deluxe. Enjoy!!

Reviews.Title: “Warm and kind service”
Reviews.Author: Carstenjr
Reviews.Content: My wife, my two children and I have just returned from a very nice weekend at the Amrath - which is excellent located in the center of Amsterdam. Although not my personal style, the room was great; Superb beds!, electric curtains, nice bathroom, big TV and a nespresso machine. Our room was also very quiet - face towards the canal. We loved the swimming pool and the SPA area, which was very tidy and clean. The hotel itself, I would rate to between 4 and 5. The reason for our 5 was the very kind and warm service we recieved by the staff. Will definetly be our choice the next time we visit Amsterdam as well.

Reviews.Title: “Very nice hotel”
Reviews.Author: Lisa73
Reviews.Content: Stayed here the weekend after Valentines day with my Husband. The location is great for the train station. The hotel was beautiful and the room was very comfortable and luxurious. The staff were very friendly. We ate in the restaurant on the Saturday evening and the food and service was lovely. Had a great stay and would not hesitate to book again.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Red-Breast-69
Reviews.Content: This is a fantastic hotel, real 5 star luxury. My partner and I stayed here in February 2008 on a 3 day city break. The hotel is in a great location for the city centre and only a few minutes walk from Central Station. The unusal building is interesting and very well renovated. Our room was on the ground floor overlooking the harbour and despite a main road outstide it was very quite. The rooms are lovely with beds to die for. Very large and comfortable. We had the free mini bar option which was very welcome. We tried the resturant one night and the food was excellent if a little expensive. The one thing that made this hotel so great was the friendliness of the staff. Nothing was too much trouble. This is what a 5 star hotel should be like.

Reviews.Title: “Unusual and interesting hotel”
Reviews.Author: MacD_of_Perth
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this hotel for a weekend family break (two adults, two teenagers). Nice welcome. Clean. Well-maintained. Complimentary minibar. Free Internet. No problems at all. If you're looking for a hotel that you can tell your friends about then stay here. Walking distance to the city centre (well, a bit of a long walk, but interesting all the same).

Reviews.Title: “Great place for romantic weekend”
Reviews.Author: sjwest
Reviews.Content: My husband and I have just returned from a 2 night stay at the Amrath Hotel in Amsterdam. Everything about the hotel was fantastic, it oozed understated glamour. I was the old shipping house and a lot of the original features are still there today. When we found the hotel, (5 mins from Centraal Station) we were very impressed, it's an impending building with flags flying! It has one of the revolving doors and as soon as you walk in the porter takes your bag and directs you to the reception room. I loved reception, you are asked to take a seat and it's very relaxing. We were then shown to our room which was totally sumptuous and gorgeous. I have stayed at the Barbizon Palace (just around the corner and also 5*) I have to say they have now got serious competition on their hands. It's the small touches that make all the difference. They have a modern Nespresso coffee machine which is so much better than the granulated stuff in other hotels. The mini-bar is complementary, its well stocked with 4 different spirits, a small bottle of red and white wine, plenty of soft drinks and water, a toblerone and a box of peanuts. The turn-down service is great, the maid restocks the coffee and any products from the bathroom and also delivers a weather report for the following day. It has a lovely looking restaurant which we never made because there are so many nice places to go in Amsterdam. We didn't try breakfast either as it seemed a bit pricey for what you got. I will definately book this hotel the next time we stop in Amsterdam.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic location, beatiful rooms, perfect for a long weekend”
Reviews.Author: Crispo1974
Reviews.Content: I travelled with my girlfriend for my birthday on October 24th and had a great stay. I paid Euros 290 per night which was reasonable for a 5* - and it definately qualfies as a 5*. We walked from the Central station which took 10 mins you can see it as you exit to the left (flags flying on the roof) but watch out for the trams ! We were met by the concierge who imediately took our bags and the check-in was quick and easy. We stayed in room 408 which has a great view of the city. The room was stunning - king size bed, great bathroom, wireless, flat screen tv, english plug , free minibar, robes etc. Bed turned down at night with tomorrows weather report. The Spa part of the hotel was not open (Due Dec 07) but didn't notice any noise. Use the concierge service, they were very helpful and expect nothing in return ( they booked a river cruise, a restaurant and a taxi for us) (Taxi was Euro 55 to the airport - trains cancelled on our return date !!!) The main part of Amsterdam is no more than a 10 min walk and its a pleasant walk back after a long day wandering. They have a nice restaurant (we didn't eat in) and a good bar (lots of smokey wood) the only negative and i'm being picky here.. the waiter 'topped up' my girlfriends wine glass and we got charged for 2 glasses, like I said i'm being picky. Would definately return.

Reviews.Title: “Absolutely wonderful a great reason to vist Amsterdam”
Reviews.Author: OHMSS
Reviews.Content: Yes, at last. Its good to find a hotel that lives up to its rating and goes even further on charm and service. I will stay at this hotel each time i visit Amsterdam. It is perfectly located for Vacation or Business trips. Just across from the central station. Food great in the restaurant and fantastic room service menu. Don't hang about listening to me just go and enjoy relax in this great Hotel before they put the prices up!

Reviews.Title: “The most beautiful building in Amsterdam”
Reviews.Author: mimschat
Reviews.Content: We stayed 10 days in this hotel (we returned yesterday), and it was a truly exceptional experience. It was head and shoulders above any other hotel in Amsterdam (we visited quite a few of them, and have previously stayed in the Radisson). Even though we were, according to the hotel map, one of the smallest rooms, the room was beautiful, similar to the one shown in the picture on their website. There were large windows and very good quality fixtures and fittings, and floor to ceiling curtains that totally blacked out the light and meant the room was also nice and quiet, especially for a hotel situated within walking distance of everything in the city centre. The bed was particularly large and comfortable, with lots of pillows and crisp white linen replaced every day, and turned down in the evening, with a weather report. Everything else from wallpaper to curtains to stationary, used the same art nouveau design on subtle colours of gold and slate blue. The bathroom was modern and spacious, with white fittings, a white frosted glass door, black marble surfaces, and stylish red and gold mosaic panel in the wall. The building is utterly glorious, in the arts and crafts or art nouveau style, with amazing stairways with wrought ironwork, stained glass panels, marble, carved stone and bespoke period furniture. They also have the most amazing floral arrangements in all public areas, which are replaced 2 or 3 times per week (amarylis, protea, gladioli, orchids). The meeting rooms looked great also, with fully restored period grandeur. It says somethin that half of the 80 photographs we took during our trip were of aspects of the hotel! In terms of service, we didn't try the food, but the staff couldn't have been more pleasant and helpful (for example, they looked up a restaurant for us, to give us directions from the museum we were visiting before it). The porter insisted on taking our cases to the room for us, and they greeted us every time we came or left the building, and were keen for feedback about what we had enjoyed. They left fruit and fresh flowers in the room on arrival, and every day refreshed the (free of charge) mini-bar with 2 bottles each of: still and sparkling mineral water, coke and diet coke, lemonade, orange juice, beer, tonic water, and a bottle each of red wine, white wine, 5 types of miniature spirits, peanuts, toblerone, good quality tea and expresso/coffee. A few days we also got (free) a small bottle of champagne, fresh fruit and a snickers bar. They also provided good quality standard items like slippers, robes, umbrellas and lovely subtle scented bath products including a rather nice 'sparkling bath sugar'. In contrast to the previous reviewer, in the entire stay we never had a member of staff enter the room without knocking and waiting, even with no sign on the door (when the privacy sign was there we never heard even a single knock, even if we left it on all day). The one day the hot water was problematic, it was cooler for two hours in the middle of the day, yet they gave a bottle of nice French red wine to each room to apologise for this minor inconvenience. They also allowed us a free late checkout (6pm) because they were concerned that they wanted to give us great service (there was nothing special about us in this, as we hadn't spent any money in the hotel apart from the amount we paid inadvance for the room and the city tax). In terms of the building works, they laid a new wood floor in the dining room the day we arrived, and worked on the office adjacent to our room later in our stay. At no point was there any inconvenience and the noise was minor and after 10am only (and I had a few lie-ins after that time without interruption!) The bathroom was very comfortable (I'm 5 foot 2 and my husband is 6 foot 3 and neither of us found the layout or height of anything awkward at all). We always had plenty of towels of all sizes and the room was kept spotlessly clean; every glass, cup and surface sparkled. Zero noise from airconditioning. So, either we (and every other customer we spoke to) were lucky, or the other reviewer was either very very unlucky or very very hard to please! I could only think of two minor suggestions for improvement: a bathmat and an environmental policy card to ensure all those mini-bar bottles get recycled and the bath products not disposed of until empty (even if they wish to provide more each day). Location wise, the hotel is on the road along the harbour, with a canal/city view from the other side. It is an easy walk from the central station, even pulling a case, and within walking distance of a good variety of restaurants, cafes, shops, museums, the zoo and botanical gardens, canal boat tours, trams, and the nightlife and red light district, so you can see the breadth of what Amsterdam has to offer. Once they complete the swimming pool and spa, this hotel will be perfect. By comparison everywhere else looked either run down, like a cheap commercial clone hotel, or bland and boxy. We took a walking tour of the other hotels in case we should ever return, so for info: The Okura hotel staff were terribly rude after a long queue to even speak to reception, the Hilton was pleasant but like an office building in the suburbs, the Raddisson dark and compact, and nowhere else had the facilities that the Amrath will have when complete. In summary, if we go back to Amsterdam, we won't stay anywhere else.

Reviews.Title: “Really nice hotel...will be in future”
Reviews.Author: euine
Reviews.Content: As in my previous reports of Amsterdam's hotels I haven't stayed there myself but booked for other people. The positive of hotel are really nice rooms with high ceilings, nespresso in every room. If you take care in advance you can get a nice view on channel otherwise you risk having no view at all. It was just 2 weeks of hotel's operation and service was not good as for 5 star hotel. When we arrived there was no one who could take our luggage to the reception and to the room. So we had to carry it for quite a long time as hotel is quite huge. I cannot give 5 now but if service is better, all repairs will finish in time (currently only a part of the hotel is available) and prices will be on the same level (we had 230 Euro per night per double superior room) it'll be a really nice place to stay in Amsterdam, just 5 minutes from Central station and main attractions.

Reviews.Title: “Charmed by the Amrath”
Reviews.Author: ahr
Reviews.Content: We have just returned from a weekend stay at the Amrath. We booked through the hotel website and enjoyed three nights including full breakfast and one three course dinner for a very competitive rate (better than other internet sites). On arrival we were upgraded to a superior room with city view. The building has been recently restored and is fascinating. Many original features have been kept including some beautiful stained glass. Our bedroom had an extremely high ceiling and full length electrically operated curtains. The bathroom was what you would expect from a new 5 star hotel. The mini bar is complimentary up to a daily quota i.e not bottomless! The bed was probably the most comfortable ever experienced with crisp white linen and marshmallow-like pillows! The decor will not be to everyone's taste (including mine) rather sobre and heavy but I imagine it has historic integrity. The artwork however, is truly awful (jellyfish on speed) and is the stuff of nightmares! Please comment I would love to know if I'm alone in that view. All the staff ,without exception, were charming and very friendly. Obviously proud of their hotel and well briefed on the building's historic importance. The dinner we had was from a set daily menu and was excellent. A la carte is also available. Breakfast was also without fault and served until 11am on Saturday and 12 mid day on Sunday. A real treat for a lazy weekend break. The location is good for most things but especially the station and the canal bus which are both minutes away. The new concert hall is also close by. There are many local restaurants and one night we went to a restaurant called 'Hemelse Modder' on Oud Waal which we thoroughly recommend for local interesting food in a crisp, clean unpretentious setting. Excellent service. The hotel has only been open a few weeks and is obviously still having teething problems but these did not in any affect our stay which was really very enjoyable. Go soon while the rates are so good!

Reviews.Title: “Pure Heaven”
Reviews.Author: kinv3
Reviews.Content: OK this hotel really is 5 star, the overall hotel is stunning and quirky. On our stay we never saw another person other than the fantastic hotel staff. Any problems sorted in seconds (tv wouldn,t work). A great location, very close to central station and other areas of interest. The bed couldn't have been anymore comfy and the bath, well all i can say is you get lost in it. the free mini bar consists of: barcade, vodka, gin, brandy, coke, diet coke, orange juice, 7up water (both still and fizzy) tonic, white and red wine, nuts and chocolate. Two of each and a very nice coffee tea facilities. Would recomend to any couple who want a real haven. Only downside our room 115 was a little small due to the postion of the room.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Abc155
Reviews.Content: Fantastic hotel, best in amsterdam Had a great weekend, hotel in a great location, quiet area but close to lots of attractions. One of the best hotel rooms we have stayed in, the bed was so comfortable, really luxurious throughout, every last detail is just right.
